Review_Date: Francesco C wrote a review Yesterday
Review_Title: A nice weekend for my birthday
Review_Text: One of the best hotel that I see. The staff was perfect and the rooms very nice and comfortable. We used also the spa and was all perfect. Nice breakfast .Thank you an I hope to come back as soon as possible

Review_Date: Chris S wrote a review Mar 19
Review_Text: Every single member of staff could not have been more helpful. For example for dinner we were given the choice of by the pool in the garden area by the pool in a secluded area.    The building is magnificent in the local tradition and so memorable that on one occasion people came in to look around.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful hotel excellently rebuilt. Consisting of 5 Riads with a luxurious decoration.  Great location for those who want to "live" Medina.  Very professional employees friendly and ready to solve everything we request. Special thanks to Saida Anas and Risana who were tireless. Breakfast of excellent quality and with a very good service.  There's a good SPA.  I strongly recommend.  Thank La Sultana
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dana N wrote a review Mar 15
Review_Text: Our stay 5-day stay at La Sultana was absolutely delightful in every way. The hotel is beautiful historic and absolutely elegant. The staff were friendly welcoming polite and extremely helpful. The rooms feel very private as the hotel has many separate areas. Our room was just the basic rate room but is was spacious and comfortable with a gorgeous bath and shower area. When we arrived in our room there were fruits traditional Moroccan pastries and dates waiting for us as a snack. The concierge and staff expertly arranged all of our requested dining reservations and activities before we had arrived. We tried both the rooftop restaurant for lunch and the main restaurant in the central courtyard for dinner. The food was excellent. We had our best dinner in Marrakech there. Would definitely highly recommend this as a great place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dieter P wrote a review Mar 14
Review_Text: We choose the La Sultana for a one week holiday with our son. Everything was to our full satisfaction. The whole staff was extemly friendly and helpful. All our wishes were handled with high efficiency and accuracy. The roof top restaurant and bar was wonderful. We leiked it very much. As well all the disehs at La Table. We can highly recommend La Sultana.

Review_Date: Caroline P wrote a review Mar 13
Review_Text: My husband and I could not have enjoyed our stay at La Sultana more! The rooms are absolutely stunning the service and staff are incredible and the spa treatments are wonderful. My husband got a four hands massage and I got the hammam + massage. The rooftop is gorgeous and we loved that the location was in the older part of the city giving us more of an immersive experience. We highly recommend La Sultana!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tracy C wrote a review Mar 8
Review_Text: Lovely hotel. Great convenient location. Friendly helpful staff. We enjoyed the hotel restaurant and spa.  They were very accommodating which made our stay most enjoyable.  We would highly recommend La Sultana and look forward to a return visit.

Review_Date: Holly L wrote a review Mar 7
Review_Title: Amazing retreat to explore and restore !
Review_Text: Everyone has their way of vacationing I mostly enjoy fly fishing adventure travel I was last in the African bush Eastern Tanzania but itâ€™s not a vacation or very relaxing. When I am not working or in the bush/amazon jungles of Bolivia and Brazil I need to relax and restore - La Sultana has made it to the top of my list. The staff are excellent making me feel welcome and accommodating and the food was exceptional. I have had basteeya at Mourad in San Francisco and even his 5star dining while amazing couldnâ€™t touch this or the orange blossom dessert with the traditional live music playing softly in the background. The rooms and spa were also fantastic and when I wasntâ€™ wandering around Marrakech - I found respite in the quiet roof call to pray with lunch then a late afternoon tea/cookies on the sun beds. I am not a big shopper and donâ€™t need house things - so I arranged to be in the desert for 4 days and also loved that - Scarabea camp. La Sultana coordinated with their transportation and the end-end was very seamless for a week/two weekends as the perfect restorative vacation. As a single woman traveling alone - I loved it I was not remotely bothered when out in the city (I did cover my tattoos and wasnâ€™t out at night) and believe as usual the internet exaggerates or perhaps the concerns are outdated. This is a great time to visit Marrakech the King has been amazing and the country is alive and welcoming - I had visited Tangiers last year and felt the same. Saida the concierge and generally awesome human being is the star of the show for La Sultana - she gave great advice and again helped end-end with everything. And the chef/food are not to be missed - even if youâ€™re not staying at La Sultana - the roof deck during the day and the courtyard at night are not to be missed.

Had the most amazing stay . Tucked away in the back streets this really is a 5 star experience . We were luck enough to have one of the suites . Quite simply amazing  one of the best rooms I have every stayed in .  The staff and facilities were super and everyone couldn't be more helpful.  It is also very convenient for exploring Marrakech  you really can walk right into gteh heart of the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: One of the most beautiful hotels Iâ€™ve ever stayed in.
Review_Text: As an avid traveler and lover of luxury hotels this place went above and beyond. What hides behind the walls of the exterior is so magical and beautiful. The intricacies of the tile design and wood is just incredible. The staff food and location was perfect. If you happen to stumble across this hotel and my review itâ€™s a sign you should stay here. I canâ€™t speak higher about it just go see for yourself.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kirsten V wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: This hotel is the most wonderful place we have stayed! The location is great for walking everywhere in the Medina. The architecture is stunning every raid is unique and different but each one is equally as elegant. We did the architectural tour of the hotel and loved it. The roof top is spectacular we went everyday sometimes twice a day for drinks or their delicious homemade ice cream. We did the sweets cooking class which was great fun. We booked all our excursions through the hotel and they were amazing their drivers and guides are first rate!! Our room was spacious enough for two with a large bathroom and beautifully decorated in fact it was perfect in every way. We ate at the hotel twice and enjoyed everything the food was delicious the atmosphere is very elegant and intimate. The absolute best part of our stay was the staff I donâ€™t think I can convey the level of service at this hotel nothing is too much trouble the staff is always smiling and friendly we never encountered one staff member whoâ€™s service was not perfection. The staff make the hotel even more beautiful than it already is. Thank you Abdula for all your assistance and your warm smile everyday!! I would go back in an instant and recommend this amazing hotel to anyone
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: It was my first visit to Marrakech and it was always in my mind to have an experience at Riad concept so I have stayed at dozen of hotels in many countries.This was on the top of the list of best stays experiences ever. Staff was very hospitable and there for every need of mine. I definitely will come back to La sultana hotel. Thank you so much.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Marianne V wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: La Sultana was more then we expected. The service from the moment we sat our feet inside impressed us.    Exceptional interior beautiful details in all the surrondings delicious food and all the employees made us feel very well taken care of. The butler service was so superb and very helpful and for us it was that little extra during our stay.    We canâ€™t wait to come back to La Sultana Marrakech    Marianne & Daniel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tim F wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Everything was perfect and the staff very friendly. Located in the medina but accessible via car (they valet so no hassle) or taxi. Everything walkable. Hotel is a seamless combination of a few luxury riads with fantastic roof deck. Among the many highlights we really enjoyed have drinks while watching the sunset on the roof.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed at La Sultana alone and had an amazing stay. The personal was really helpful and nice and the hotel utterly gorgeous. Wonderful healthy food option and really nice suites. Will definitely be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Lola V wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: We spent 4 nights in this absolutely perfect boutique hotel.  Everyone was very friendly and helpful and the place was perfect to explore  the old city of Marrakech. We are sure we love to come back some time!

I have travelled the world over and this is a gem and now my favorite hotel! The hotel is fun to explore and there are so many different spaces to sit where you can read play a game have tea etc. - each with a different feel - be it a garden cozy corner water feature (pool fountain hot tub) room with a fireplace roof top garden and restaurant with an amazing view. Even if the hotel is full you will find your own private space. The service is excellent and the rooms very well appointed. The 5 Riads all have their own character and all beautiful. Very good location close to everything yet very quiet. I will be going back for sure just to enjoy the spaces spa and food!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Clare M wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Oasis of luxury and kindness in the Medina
Review_Text: Our family stay (a couple 2 teens and an 11 year old) was simply outstanding. From the moment we call to enquire we know we were in the right place and we booked two fabulous suites. Stunning place fabulous food and the kindest team. We love luxury but donâ€™t like unnecessary fussiness. This is is authentic and simply beautiful. The experience in the Agafay desert was worth every penny (it wasnâ€™t cheap and it could not be cheap). We also did the cooking courses and what a fabulous experience. Thank you we will be back!

Review_Date: Monika s wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay . Everything was just perfect for us . The room  the location and the excellent spa . Especially the staff en the food deserve 5 Star . We really looking forward to come back very soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a gem in Marrakech. We found this hotel by chance as we were walking through the Kasbah in Marrakech. We ate breakfast for 5 days consecutively there dinner 3 times and spent time in the rooftop at least 5 days. The food was out of this world!!!! The atmosphere in the restaurant is superb they even have entertainment (oud player-singer). The staff were very professional and always ready to serve you. We fell in love with the facility and have decided to stay at this hotel on our next trip. We will be staying in the best overall hotel in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Will M wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: An oasis of calm and beauty
Review_Text: What an amazing place everything about it breathtaking. A small alleyway leads off a typical manic Marakesh street to an oasis of beauty and calm.  We visited on a recommendation from a fellow guest at our hotel to have a Hammam and I'm so glad we went. The Hammam was amazing the staff fantastic.  We coupled this with a lunch in the restaurant which again I'd highly recommend. The rooftop is the place to be but even if it's not available the dining area is beautiful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Amazing stay. They took care of every detail to make our stay wonderful.  It's luxurious and cool!  We loved how they made us feel welcome by checking in drinking something in the terrace.  Great breakfast and beautiful setting of the restaurant by the pool for dinner with a live musician.  Loved the spa... Hammam and massage totally worth!

Review_Date: Chandni G wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Perfect, personalized, luxury experience walking distance from Medina
Review_Text: Top 3 best experiences Iâ€™ve ever had at a hotel. Luxurious impeccably restored riads centrally located in Marrakech. The staff are incredibly warm and conscientious. Personalized service in a stunning location. Food was excellent rooftop bar is an incredible place to relax after a long day wandering the Medina. Recommend highly. No need to think about it - just book!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: we had an amazing experience.  staff are very friendly.  great hospitality.  more than expected.  rooms were super clean.  the location was good  we would definitely recommend it if youâ€™re looking for a nice place in the heart of Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Margita - Glee of Life wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: Tucked away at the heart of the Kasbah
Review_Text: We chose to stay in La Sultana for 3 nights while exploring Marrakech due to its perfect location tucked away at the heart of the Kasbah close to some incredible restaurants cafes and famous attractions (it is literally next to the historic sites of the Saadian Tombs and Jamaa El Fna Square is a 10-minute walk away).    Near the Royal Palaces La Sultana is a combination of 5 riads. A mixture of elegant and antique modern and old-fashioned. Our room had a very outdated feel to it we did not like the decor but I guess that is the style of that Riad - antique? The complimentary sweet treats made me actually sick I do not know what was in them so would not recommend eating them.    We enjoyed our traditional Moroccan mint tea by the pool on arrival very much!    The rooftop bar is excellent The cocktails were a highlight as the sunsets from the roof were beautiful. A place to escape for a drink or a few and soak in the ancient city views of Marrakech and the Atlas Mountains. The rooftop turns into a fairy tale of 1001 nights when the sun sets and the lanterns light up the terrace. The food selection was cosmopolitan and of high quality.    Sadly we didnâ€™t have a chance to try their famous spa.    The check-out experience was not a nice experience but overall the staff were friendly and professional especially the porters!    A real hideaway right in the centre of busy Marrakech.

Review_Date: Kathy D wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: La Sultana was a definite highlight of our trip to Morocco.
Review_Text: My friends and I absolutely loved our trip to Morocco and our stay at La Sultana was a definite highlight. The rooms were incredible super comfortable spacious the most wonderful touches by housekeeping (snacks sweets rose petals) and the service overall was a 10. The cocktails on the roof were a highlight daily as the sunsets from the roof were beautiful. The staff from the roof restaurant spa housekeeping and front desk were all so welcoming and attentive. The bellmen were also so lovely. Always welcoming us with a smile opening doors and leading us to our driver who wasn't necessarily parked right out front. A 10 all around.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Aileen M wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Beautiful stay at the Sultana. A real hideaway right in the centre of Marrakesh with gorgeous rooms  delicious food & excellent service. I canâ€™t wait to return for another visit to this special place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Wolfgang Doelger wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: An unforgettable time and worthy to be revisited
Review_Text: From the moment of entering this marvelleous Riad we felt at home extremely well looked after and with an eye for detailed attention from all envolved.  The team around XavierSaida Ghizlane (hammam-)Sekia and the Massage parlour team must stand out by comparison to many vacations we have had in the past. We were celelbrating our 50th wedding anniversary and both my wife and Ä° congratulated ourselves for having made a perfect choice for the occasion.

Review_Date: Moises G wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: The most beautiful riad (hotel) that I have been in my life.
Review_Text: This is the most beautiful riad (hotel) that I have been in my life. I am 80 yours old and have been in beautiful and expensive hotels like George V in Paris The Dorchester in London the Excelsior in Florence an so on. It is a small hotel I think 27 rooms. Mine was a suite. It was extremely clean the lancer included the pillows was prime quality. The food was superb. The personel behave excellent. One day I came at 7:30pm and wanted a massage. The person in charge told me that the room for massage was closed. I spoke with the manager and they opened the room for me. Walking through the hotel was an experience with antiques all over. In conclusion this is a marvelous hotel. I will go back 100% and will recommended to my friends.

Review_Date: Frank A wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: This is a beautiful riad located right near the medina. Really gives you the full experience. Highly recommend. Great service. Great food. I would definitely come back again. Thank you for making me feel welcomed
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: An absolute Gem in the heart of Marrakech!
Review_Text: An absolute gem in the heart of Marrakech! We travelled throughout Morocco for a couple weeks this past November and our stay at La Sultana Marrakech was among the very best Riads that we had experienced during our travels. Definitely worthy of your short list when planning your next adventure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Magic in the heart of the Medina
Review_Text: Our stay at La Sultana was a truly magical experience. Saida and Abdulla and the rest of the staff were absolutely world class and made us feel right at home. Located in the heart of the old city La Sultana is perfect for those looking for both luxury and an authentic Marrakech experience. The rooftop garden was overwhelmingly beautiful and riad itself felt like one giant expensive antique (in the best way possible!). We would stay here again and would like to thank the staff again for a lovely stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: La Sultana is an amazing oasis. The interior is beautiful rooftop a great place to relax and have a drink and service top-notch.  The employees at La Sultana are all eager to help with Anas above and beyond. Anas was seemingly everywhere always quick to find a solution and just a great person. He made our stay!

Review_Date: Gloriane A wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: We enjoyed the location along with being greeted right from entry way. The staff was very accommodating. I sustained an injury and they supplied ice packs for my entire stay as well as one for the car. If you go to Marrakech take a look at La Sultana Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Lori Bert wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Spent a week here and did enjoy the hotel but the swimming pool is on the ground floor and mostly in the shade the area also doubles up as a dining area for breakfast and dinner .    The large roof terrace is lovely to sunbathe on but thereâ€™s only a tiny plunge pool so not possible to have a swim in  which we sorely missed as it was often over 30 degrees.    Also this hotel is located inside the Kasbah area which is very crowded noisy and in the heart of a local market. Whilst you hear very little noise inside the hotel itâ€™s full on the minute you step out of the entrance.    Service whilst charming is erratic and needs real improvement. Same for the food sometimes great and then more often very mediocre. To be honest the staff are well meaning but the management really does lack direction and training and this can only be down to the owners.    There is stiff competition in Marrakech with so many great places to stay and unfortunately this one doesnâ€™t quite meet the mark .

Review_Title: A luxurious oasis in the Medina
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed for 4 days. Beautiful hotel amazing service great roof top sunbathing area. Although in the heart of the Medina the hotel felt like as oasis of calm and luxury. We loved every minute of our stay. We ate out twice - once at Le Palace and once at Le Barometre. Both were absolutely first class for quality of food service and ambience. Altogether a fantastic few days in Marrakech and woukd definitely go back. La Sultana staff made us feel so welcome and. I thing too much trouble so will definitely recommend this hotel and destination for some Winter sun and relaxation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We visited La Sultan Hotel Cooking School which was recommended by our hotel Four Seasonâ€™s Marrakech concierge. It is located on the rooftop of this beautiful boutique hotel and the morning lesson was led by 2 excellent staff. Abbas greeted us and worked with the 4 of during this wonderful experience. We cooked eggplant salad & chicken tagine and each of us had a well stocked area with all the necessary utensils raw materials and spices!! Abbas also served us the lunch we created along with tea ceremony drinks & dessert. It was a great morning and a lot of fun!! We went home with La Sultana aprons and a cook book which we will definitely use in the future. Highly recommend this fun activity while in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rosilyn H wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: A magical Riad in the Medina
Review_Text: An authentic experience in the ancient Medina in Marrakesh is what attracted me to this property. The description and the pics didnâ€™t do La Saltana Justice. The properly is beautiful and magical!    The friendly and warm welcome by the staff the personal visit from the concierge and the extraordinary efforts the restaurant staff exhibited every day toward our family made us feel like we were among relatives and friends. Every staff member we encountered greeted us with a smile and warm greeting.    My son celebrated a birthday during our stay. Without us even mentioning it they went above and beyond to arrange a special Moroccan baked cake and surprised him at lunch seating.    I enjoyed every square meter of this property. There are so many special places to retreat on property to include the spa the rooftop and the pool just to name a few.    This is an ancient property yet extremely well maintained to preserve the authenticity of the Sultanâ€™s Palace.    Canâ€™t wait the return and bring a few friends!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A wonderful calm location in the heart of the busy Medina
Review_Text: Luxury rooms within fascinating courts. Fascinating views from the terrace overlooking the old part of Marrakesch. Well trained and friendly and helpful staff. In case we come again the Marrakesch Al Sultana wqould be our Riad.

Fantastic surroundings decoration atmosphere.  There are several little areas and terraces. The rooftop is simply amazing. We went for lunch but Iâ€™m sure it must be even nicer at night with the candles etc. The food was very good too. The service was friendly. Obviously it is not cheap. But worth it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Claudia S wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: A location like in an arabian fairy tale gordeous patios many nice details fresh flowers attentive staff giving us hints great breakfast and excellent dinner with local musical accompaniment. We are sure to come back

The hotel rooms the food the location and especially the staff were absolutely spectacular. I would like to congratulate the entire team at Sultana particularly Saida for having made my stay so marvelous.  Aside from staying at the hotel I took a Moroccan cooking class that I highly recommend.  There is no doubt that I will be returning to this hotel.  A hug for everyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: Arriving at the La Sultana from 2 nights in The Atlas mountain meant the Hotel had an act to follow - such a contrast arriving Marrakech but the Hotel and Team delivered . Fabulous 5 star Riad offered a luxury Haven to see the sites of the city - our room with central court yard was fantastic which was a perfect place to stay . Staff were so friendly and food in the restaurant top class ! Roof top bar - a perfect. Place to escape for a drink and enjoy the views of the city . Great place to stay and see what this lively city has to offer . Would definitely recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Antoine H wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: We go to Marrakech for vacation every year since 2006.  Since we went for the first time at La Sultana in 2010 we would never stay anywhere else.  Every time we go at La Sultana it's always for the best.

Our heartfelt gratitude goes to the Manager Khalid Dady and his staff whose passion for -- and excellence in â€“ customer service set the tone for our stay. The entire staff is made up of the most gracious hosts who treated us like family and offered extraordinary service!    We enjoyed the roof top bar and the restaurants had outstanding food.    This is a wonderful boutique hotel located inside the walls of the Medina within walking distance to the souks and main square. This luxury hotel is beautifully decorated and appointed in the Moroccan design with nice touches throughout the Riad.    We also enjoyed our couples Hammam and massage experience. A shout out to these ladies that made this a wonderful experience Smahome Kadutare Zakia and Aziza.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We arrived in Marrakech and it was raining. It rained all day and was still raining when we arrived by taxi from our hotel the Four Seasons. A quick toot on the car horn and this chap appeared as if out of nowhere umbrella in hand and escorted us down this dark alley to a red door at the end. After passing through I must admit a quite ordinary reception area our breaths were taken away by the sheer beauty of the place.    We were seated by the pool wine chosen with the help of the very informed and helpful sommelier. We ordered ravioli risotto and an orange flower water dessert. All absolutely delicious. We had a chap across the water playing the sitar (?).    The setting was absolutely stunning. We will definitely be back sometime for dinner and hopefully be able to make use of the rooftop terrace!    Thankyou so much for a lovely evening.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Riad in the heart of the medina
Review_Text: Exquisite design and beautiful traditional styled rooms. Every corner of the Riad was picture perfect. Great location situated near the Bahia Palace and Saadian tombs. Highly recommend if you are looking for a place to stay in the old town.

Review_Date: Laura B wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: A wonderful stay at La Sultana! The thing that stood out most was the quality of service which I couldn't fault. The rooms and suites are beautiful. Don't miss lunch at the rooftop terrace restaurant.

Review_Date: MagnÃºs Orri wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: This hotel is just amazing. We had the trip of a lifetime. The staff and their service was simply amazing. So helpful in arranging things inside and outside of the hotel. The food was out of this world. We had such a great time and we are coming back

Review_Date: Nils V wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Title: Wonderful Hotel; Great food and service; Terrace - bar a delight
Review_Text: Stayed in August - very hot but room - (junior suite) - was cool and spacious. The restaurant downstairs has great Moroccan cuisine; the spa (and small swimming pool) is great - had some massages and hamamm. At night the large rooftop terrace (a football field in size) was cooled by the wind and we had cocktails / champagne whilst listening to the sounds around us (respectful of the mosques calling for prayer).    Staff are really generous with their advice and help. The hotel is well located and even in the heat we were able to get around.    We also went to another hotel on the trip. Said to be a 5 star hotel. Well this hotel - the La Sultana - is (as well). Part of the SLH group of hotels.    Will definitely come back here again.

Review_Date: Claudia S wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: A location like in an arabian fairy tale gordeous patios many nice details fresh flowers attentive staff giving us hints great breakfast and excellent dinner with local musical accompaniment. We are sure to come back

The hotel rooms the food the location and especially the staff were absolutely spectacular. I would like to congratulate the entire team at Sultana particularly Saida for having made my stay so marvelous.  Aside from staying at the hotel I took a Moroccan cooking class that I highly recommend.  There is no doubt that I will be returning to this hotel.  A hug for everyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Wonderful Hotel; Great food and service; Terrace - bar a delight
Review_Text: Stayed in August - very hot but room - (junior suite) - was cool and spacious. The restaurant downstairs has great Moroccan cuisine; the spa (and small swimming pool) is great - had some massages and hamamm. At night the large rooftop terrace (a football field in size) was cooled by the wind and we had cocktails / champagne whilst listening to the sounds around us (respectful of the mosques calling for prayer).    Staff are really generous with their advice and help. The hotel is well located and even in the heat we were able to get around.    We also went to another hotel on the trip. Said to be a 5 star hotel. Well this hotel - the La Sultana - is (as well). Part of the SLH group of hotels.    Will definitely come back here again.

Review_Date: Paris Traveller wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Ultimate comfort and luxury in this gem of a hotel/Ryad. Small enough to receive truly personalised service from an engaged and happy staff but large enough to benefit from all amenities you would expect. A particular note relating to the food - it is truly exceptional. Simple delicious varied we were not expecting this standard of cooking. Finally the staff (many of whom have been at the hotel for over a decade) are uniformly engaged professional attentive and warm. We loved our stay and in particular the fact that you receive premium service in a beautiful environment without the standardised approach of the large ultra luxury chains. So in summary a gem and well worth the visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent decoration Excellent and warm staff. Special thanks to Anas who made our stay outstanding!  Beautifully appointed suites.  Excellent food and service in both restaurants with live music.  Very well located. All the staff was really amazing.  Be sure donâ€™t to miss the spa.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This stunning luxury Riad was located close to the Medina. The Riad is magical and pristine. The fine details are everywhere. Take your breath away beautiful. I found the entire staff to be warm friendly and extremely professional and attentive. Our room on the first floor was spacious and well decorated. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The bathroom area was large and the robe was wonderful. Water and a lot of delicious cookies and fruit were complementary in the room. I was taken aback that they charge a nominal fee for coffee capsules in the room however I am guessing they take it off the bill if one complains. I was also surprised that breakfast was not included as every other luxury place that we stayed in during our 14 day trip had breakfast included. It was also very expensive for breakfast. I realized after that they did advertise that breakfast was not included however I am mentioning it so that other travelers take this into consideration. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful but so breakfast at every Riad we stayed at in Morocco. We ate dinner one night at the Riad. It was delicious but also extremely expensive-like NYC fine dining restaurant expensive. The pool was gorgeous and located in the center of the Riad. It was not small but not huge either. Unfortunately there were not a sufficient amount of lounge chairs and loung seating by the pool. That being said we enjoyed the pool each day and again the helpful staff made things perfect. We really enjoyed the hamam and the massage at the Riad. Both were teriffic! The staff at the spa are also great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The best food, experience and night of my life.
Review_Text: My fiancÃ© and I were in marrakech for just over a week. We did camel riding quad biking went to Azar restaurant went to the mountains etc. but this experience topped the lot.    We only visited the restaurant (not the hotel itself) and it was hands down the best restaurant my partner and I have ever been to.    I booked a private dinner on the rooftop as I wanted to surprise my then girlfriend with a proposal so I emailed the restaurant and they were super helpful. I was liaising with a fabulous man named Anas the whole time and he was so patient and kind. I was even fortunate enough to meet him at the end of the day. He booked a private area for me on the day and even allowed the external photographer to come and visit beforehand so she would know where she can hide to take pictures for the big moment.    The food was frighteningly good yet somehow the service was even better. Hamza served us all night and was just so professional and welcoming. Both him and Anas I can sing their praises enough. Together they made the night the best night of mine and most importantly my fiancÃ©s life.    Donâ€™t get me wrong it was expensive but it was genuine worth every penny.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mihaela D wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Title: Beautiful oasis in the heart of the city
Review_Text: We stayed at La Sultana for a birthday celebration that brought together friends and family from all the corners of the world. Every room was different and beautifully detailed the food service spa and just overall feel of the riad were aimed at making us happy and comfortable. We loved the staff they really are so accommodating and try to get ahead of your requests. I would highly recommend this to anyone travelling to Marrakesh.

Review_Title: So nice that you might forget to leave the Riad!
Review_Text: An amazing Riad! Wonderful rooms friendly staff delicious dinning and great location - all the ingredients for an unforgettable holiday! You can dine next to the pool or on the roof top terrace and enjoy the best ginger margaritas and camel burgers in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: What a wonderful find! The staff was spectacular. So helpful and pleasant. Excellent breakfast. We enjoyed a dinner by the pool one evening. Its very conveniently located in the medina. We really enjoyed our stay and will certainly be back

Review_Date: Susie K wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Title: Beauty, hospitality, comfort at their finest
Review_Text: After a busy culinary adventure I stayed at La Sultana to relax write and enjoy the beauty and architecture of one of the loveliest hotels in Marrakech. Everything about my stay was superb. I especially enjoyed breakfasts by the beautiful pool and dining on the rooftop for lunches or evening meals. The staff at the hotel are gracious friendly and very helpful. It was a warm hospitable and comfortable environment. I would return there in an instant.

We had a lovely time at a beautiful and centrally located property near the Medina in Marrakech. Ms. Saida Loutou Head Concierge amazing and took care of us in more ways that you can hope for. Breakfast and dinner poolside was perfect way to start and end the day.

Review_Date: William M wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: For seaside towns everyone goes to Essaouira and nobody goes to Oualidia. You get beautiful beaches to yourself.    La Sultana is its own tropical botanic gardens. The facility is beautifully designed. You have the calm inlet of water that is in front of you. Take a little boat across hike 15 minutes and you are at the ocean with deserted beaches. It is a beautiful paradise.    I booked two nights but the moment I arrived I added a night. I was a little concerned about the cancellation fee when I booked. Don't worry too much. You will be glad you are there. I would definitely return to this place.    If you like lobster or crab they have a hallway of tanks keeping live ones. You pick the one you want.

Excellent service beautiful area lovely athmosphere great mechoui and virgin mojito sorbet not a single complaint. We found the place by chance as it is hidden away great discovery would 100% recommend and return on a latter date.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: V M wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: Great place with great food and service  We had a really pleasant stay with my wife and kid  The design is outstanding everywhere you look itâ€™s harmony and style  The restaurant by the pool at night is magical food is delicious  I will return

Review_Date: Mo I wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: Outstanding service quality and all round experience. Food in the restaurants is superb location is perfect and the staff are simply the best.    Can't recommend enough the Spa is worth the stay alone.    Special thanks to Anas and Sayeeda for their warm and impeccable hospitality.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stephen Westwell wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: Great hotel super people first class food. Great service. Gin and tonic a bit pricey but I will definitely be back to stay again. Thanks Steve and Susan good luck with the new baby Miriam. Also just to add great location easy for everything taxi available 24/7.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Andrew R wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: A wonderful luxury hotel tucked away inside the Medina. The staff (especially the concierge) were all extremely helpful before and after arrival. They organised a tour guide and booked restaurants - although the food on offer at the Hotel is of exceptional quality (especially the seafood lunch on Sunday).

Review_Title: Fabulous Birthday trip filled with culture and a little Lux too
Review_Text: Had the most amazing stay at la sultana. It was a big birthday celebration and we traveled with old friends which made the trip even more special.  From the moment of booking the preparations begin. From booking special birthday dinners at hard to get into restaurants to day excursionsâ€¦ down to special pillows and unique mini bar requirements; the staff at La Sultana could not have been more helpful!  From the moment we arrived the attention to detail was always apparent. With suite upgrades and delicious treats in our rooms.    The first day lunch at the hotels restaurant La Table du Souk did not disappointâ€¦ it was the start of what ended up being a fabulous holiday!    If your looking for brilliantly located a small but not to small hotel with bags of facilities you wonâ€™t go far wrong at La Sultana. With a spa multiple pools a mega cool bar with awesome music down to 3 options for foodâ€¦ frankly you donâ€™t really ever need to leave the Riad! Thatâ€™s certainly not to suggest you shouldnâ€™t; Marrakesh is an amazing place! 3 and a bit hrs from home you find another world. Go and explore it and the hotel will help you make that easy.    Enjoy the right amount of luxury mixed with just the right amount of culture and adventure!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Afshan B wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Title: Wonderful experience at a world class hotel.
Review_Text: Beautiful accommodations in a Riyadh.Representative of Moroccan architectural details. Very hospitable and caring staff. We were there for three nights the staff in the restaurant remembered our preferences and attended to the needs of my husband who has mobility issues.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Heaven really exits ! Now we know !
Review_Text: We have visited the last years a lot of Small Luxury Hotel locations. And every time we are really impressed by the hotels. But here in La Sultana we were overwhelmed by the friendliness the service the location the atmosphere the rooms the spa the restaurant(s) and bar..  A warm thanks to all people involved in La Sultana and especially to Anas who prepared our stay in a perfect way !  For sure we will be back (very) soon !

Review_Date: Yael P wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: Just came back from a week in Marrakesh during which we spent three nights at the amazing La Sultana. From the moment we left the bustling main road and walked into the quiet alley through the warm welcome (and welcome drink) to the moment we walked into our home for the next few days the gorgeous elephant Suite everything was perfect!. The staff was attentive and helpful the property is beautiful and carefully maintained the food is delicious and the spa is pampering. Overall we felt we had moved into a palace in the magical city of Marrakech. Whether traveling as a couple or as a family ( we were 2 adults and two teenagers) La Sultana is a fantastic choice to stay at the medina.

I went for lunch in this little  Paradise was hard to find as I was walking through the market.  I was speechless when I went inside and enjoyed the lunch there. Peaceful and the staff very kind and patient. Always available. Amazing lunch and great view.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Lynn M wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Title: Best experience in Marrakech or anywhere
Review_Text: My husband and I have traveled to at least 30 different countries and we can say without a doubt if you are looking for the best possible experience La Sultana is it. It may be may be on the expensive side but every coin is worth spending here. The staff were the most hospitable anywhere we have been. We were cold- they got us a blanket and heating lamp. We couldnâ€™t see our menus well on the rooftop at night-they brought us flashlights. The breakfast by the pool was so wonderful. You can choose from so many selections! They even remembered our order from the previous day. The front desk was super helpful as well-with COVID test locations luggage storage until our flight and transportation. I canâ€™t say enough-they have thought of everything to make you feel comfortable and special!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The rooms are beautiful but i personal need a room with window .We had fruits and sweets in our room when arriving and this was very nice.  Very clean and high maintenance.The staff was very nice and tried to give the best service.

Review_Date: Marta R wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: my experience at La Sultana was just perfect the place exceeeded my expectations. It has charm style privacy comfort. The rooms are spacious and elegantly decorated the restaurant offers excellent quality food and the spa is not to be missed!

Review_Title: HIDDEN GEM! Great location, rooftop - very exclusive feeling. Loved it! Great scenery too!
Review_Text: â€¢ Warm welcome  â€¢ Ushered in the elevator  â€¢ Welcome complimentary bread and one of the best Gazpacho iâ€™ve had  â€¢ Attentive staff  â€¢ beautiful riyad  â€¢ amazing food FRESH!  â€¢ rooftop views are stunning  â€¢ Photos of the riyad swimming pool and the rooftop cannot do justice to how beautiful this place is!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Amy G wrote a review Feb 2022
Review_Text: I felt like it was a true Moroccan experience with each room uniquely designed and laid out. In Moroccan style. The service was fantastic. We enjoyed the rooftop deck where we ate had drinks and did a cooking class. The breakfast was delicious with so much food that I didnâ€™t order anything other than fruit and coffee. So glad we stayed there!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: CloÃ© L wrote a review Dec 2021
Review_Title: Home away from home, UNMISSABLE PLACE
Review_Text: Xavier and his team welcomed us as usual in a royal way the most exclusive and perfect welcome you can have in Marrakech.  The service is fabulous everyone is attentive and carrying for everyone.  The cuisine is just delicious adapting to your wishes.  With my family (3 adults) we always stay at la Sultana when going to Marrakech.  When you arrive there it's like "un palais de mille et une nuit".  The team is at the image of the manager Xavier very professional impeccable cleanliness. They are there to make you feel home away from home and for you to pass the best moment ever.    Don't miss the chance to stay at la Sultana

Review_Date: Michael H wrote a review Dec 2021
Review_Text: Wonderful room in traditional riad with spectacular roof top scenery. Great service from the whole staff. Hotel conveniently located in walking distance to the places to go in Marrakech. Unforgetable experience.

Stunning hotel - every room is gorgeous and the service is wonderful. The food is delicious as well and it is especially fun to sit on the rooftop and enjoy the beautiful views. I will be recommending La Sultana to everyone I know!

My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our five night stay at La Sultana. The property was fabulous and the service from the entire staff was excellent in every way. I highly recommend La Sultana for anyone considering a stay in Marrakech.

What a great place to eat or have a drink. Fabulous food and service. Great cocktails and wine list. Location in the kasbah is great. Make sure you get a taxi there and back as difficult to find at night. Definitely shouldnâ€™t miss as long as you have deep pockets.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Cristina Leitao wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: What we loved the most at Sultana marrakech was the seriously nice & young team at the hotel they took great care of us always a smile and a pleasure to stay at the hotel. The food is absolutely wonderful and the rooftop and pool area is very beautiful. The bedroom decoration is quite overwhelming but showing true Moroccan craftsmanship in all its forms. An excellent stay

Review_Date: James A wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed at La Sultana for the first half of our honeymoon and it was by far the best part of our experience in Marrakech. The staff is incredibly hospitable knowledgeable and prompt in responding to inquiries. Honestly itâ€™s the best service I may have ever received even at other expensive/high end hotels. They really did go above and beyond for us in many different ways. It didnâ€™t hurt either that the hotel itself is absurdly stunning and the dining experience next to the picturesque pool with mood lighting and music felt magical. Highly recommended to any couples or frankly anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A luxury oasis in midst of the bustle
Review_Text: I can strongly recommend this hotel even to the pickiest of travelers (like me). A beautifully decorated small five-star hotel (smallest in Morocco I believe) with only 28 rooms created by combining five separate riads (courtyard houses) into one. Each room is individually decorated according to the theme of an African animal. As is common with Riad hotels most rooms have little light from the outside and only get their light from the courtyard. Toiletries are from Clarins and are of high quality. The hotel also provides anti-viral disinfectants and custom facemasks in the room during Covid. The rooms have Nespresso machines with cartridges refilled when needed as well as complimentary traditional sweets and nuts.    My room was facing the main courtyard (Giraffe room) with the pool and restaurant. Each evening I enjoyed a sundowner on my balcony while listening to the local "troubadour" playing a Gimbri (?) and only interrupted by evening prayers.    The service in the hotel is impeccable. At check in you get assigned your personal concierge with Whatsapp number. You can then text any needs or questions to him/her. In my case I was assigned Abdellah who promptly reacted to everyone of my requests and also provided excellent guidance to the city and restaurants. He did a phenomenal job (as did his colleagues across the hotel).    The spa is small but functional with sauna hammam massages. Pool is too small to swim in it's more for chilling your feet. The massage was priced as it would be in any 5-star hotel in a major European city...but was excellent (compliments to Jamal for one of the best massages ever).    The rooftop is an excellent area to relax and has a well-equipped bar. Bartender Najib makes an excellent Negroni. The rooftop is also good for catching some sun but unfortunately doesn't have any showers in which to wash off some of the sweat/clean up.    Breakfast in the courtyard is worth experiencing. The breakfast is served in a serene and calm courtyard by the pool. It's reasonably (flat) priced and one can pick freely from an a la carte menu of western and Moroccan dishes. Service is very attentive and they are happy to customize any wishes.    Unfortunately I was disappointed with the food at the hotel. Both the rooftop menu and the main restaurant menu were short and the meals I was served were substandard for a hotel of this category and price (in one instance I had to send the meal back to the kitchen). Expected better. With so many excellent restaurants within walking distance (or short taxi ride) it's worth exploring elsewhere.    Tip: for first time travelers don't pay more than 100 Dirhams to/from airport. That's the generally accepted fee. The hotel provides private transport for 450 Dirhams each way.    In short I will definitely be back and enjoyed my stay very much !

Review_Date: Danielle C wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Title: Beautiful Resort in the Middle of the Medina
Review_Text: La Sultana Marrakech was the most beautiful hotel I have ever been to. I loved how authentic to Morocco the Riads were and all of the detailing was unique and beautiful. Our room was absolutely spectacular and had all of the intricate details you would find throughout the city. The service was excellent and the staff went above and beyond. We were staying there for our honeymoon and they added so many special honeymoon amenities to make our honeymoon truly special. I adored this resort!

Review_Date: Alexander H wrote a review Sep 2021
Review_Title: Excellent dinner, but even better service
Review_Text: We had dinner here tonight by the pool. We were served by Ayoub who was absolutely excellent. Very attentive and could not do enough for us. The food was delicious but the night was topped off by Ayoubâ€™s impeccable service. Would definitely return and hope to be served by him again. Rooftop for drinks first is also a must!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: a magic place in the center of marrakesh the room was an oasis of style and elegance. the view from the balcony just amazing. we had the best and healthy breakfast every morning close to the pool  while taking a drink on the rooftop in the evening overlooking the medina topped everything. great staff and exclusive service ! the spa treatment was another amazing experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: It was one of the greatest stay we had in Marrakech all the staff are very charming very attentive to the details full of kindness and professionalism.  Sultana is really majestic combining history great architecture and colorful designâ€¦ a peace of art in the heart of Marrakech.  Suits are very comfy and spacious restaurants and cuisine are one of the best in Morocco with cosy ambiance and high level services. Nice terrace with nice view on the old town.  Many thanks to all the teams for bringing us a unforgettable experience for our stay.  Wish to see you again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wonderful place phenomenal staff great restaurant we cannot find any negative thing about this hotel. We couldnâ€™t recommend it more and will definitely be back!!!!  Location is perfect close to everything but away from the crowds
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Justin Huff wrote a review Jul 2021
Review_Title: Sublime Boutique Luxury in the Heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: The staff at La Sultana are to be commended. Not only is the property stunning from an architectural and interior design perspective but the staff goes above and beyond expectations. Their efforts and genuine gentle presence were superb. Additionally the food was to die for especially on the rooftop terrace at twilights overlooking the Koutoubia Mosque.    I would recommend this property for couples and families alike. Some of the separate riads can be combined on a fully-exclusive private basis which is perfect for multigenerational families or a group of friends.    The location is unbeatable! Just steps away from the Djmaa El Fnaa Square and some of the most sought-after shops in the iconic souqs of Marrakech La Sultana offers convenience as well as phenomenal accommodation experience.    10/10 recommend!

Review_Date: Ann K wrote a review Jul 2021
Review_Title: La Sultana - an oasis in Marrakech
Review_Text: La Sultana is a beautiful boutique hotel located in the Medina.  The staff were amazing and attentive. They even arrange our Covid tests prior to leaving Morocco.  The entire hotel is furnished in a traditional Moroccan style Riad. The lobby was a peaceful garden where we were greeted with tea and cookies.  Our room was gorgeous - the bed was comfortable and room was quiet. We had a small terrace overlooking the pool/dining area where there was a gentleman who played the Oud nightly.  The spa services were lovely. We indulged in a hammam treatment as well as a massage and enjoyed both.  The rooftop lounge was a great modern addition to the hotel. It was great to be able to grab a drink there at the end of the night.  We enjoyed our stay very much and would definitely return to La Sultana!

Review_Date: Cristina Leitao wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: What we loved the most at Sultana marrakech was the seriously nice & young team at the hotel they took great care of us always a smile and a pleasure to stay at the hotel. The food is absolutely wonderful and the rooftop and pool area is very beautiful. The bedroom decoration is quite overwhelming but showing true Moroccan craftsmanship in all its forms. An excellent stay

The staff is incredibly hospitable knowledgeable and prompt in responding to inquiries. Honestly itâ€™s the best service I may have ever received even at other expensive/high end hotels. They really did go above and beyond for us in many different ways. Review_Text: We stayed at La Sultana for 3 nights including our wedding anniversary night over a 10-day trip in Morocco. Really beautiful complex of riads with nice pool and pool service as well as a beautiful roof deck. We had a Deluxe Suite which we highly recommend if you want private outdoor space.

Review_Date: Chris K wrote a review Aug 2020
Review_Text: Only one Word â€žawesomeâ€œ very friendly staff....beautyful Location. Spa area Looks nice relaxing pur up- to down Stairs. Approx 15 min to the Giant maket 10 min from Airport. We will Go back soonest
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Moli Y wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Title: Absolutely gorgeous luxury riad experience with amazing service!!!
Review_Text: My husband and I booked this for 3 nights as part of our 11-day honeymoon trip to Morocco. This was the last portion of our trip but even if we hadn't been exhausted and ready for pampering we would have absolutely loved this place. It's gorgeous - every turn led to another courtyard or pool or lounging area that was decked out in colorful tiles tropical plants and stunning views. It's made up of separate riads all connected together and each had their own unique but beautiful decor. The rooftop deck had amazing views of the Kotoubia mosque and the Saadian tombs in addition to a pool lots of lounging space dining space and a really nice kitchen for cooking classes that we were very sad to have missed. The service is exceptional - they decorated our room and gave us champagne since it was our honeymoon and the concierge was sincerely excited to show us the room. They anticipated our every need and gave great recommendations on where to visit how to not get scammed and save money. When you check in they give you a list of daily hotel-sponsored activities which included everything from a group run through the medina to happy hour at a rooftop bar. Dinner by the larger pool was accompanied by live music beautiful view and was very very delicious. As opposed to some of the other (also luxury) riads we stayed at it truly felt like we had all the amenities we would in a luxury hotel in the US. With some of the other riads it was helpful to read other reviews about which rooms were best but I agree with many of the posts here about La Sultana - I'm sure there is no room that isn't exceptional. We were in the leopard room which was enormous with sitting space a desk a bathroom separated by an ornate door with a giant closet tub shower etc. We also had a hammam and massage which were absolutely amazing - highly recommend. This place is perfect and I could have stayed there for another week and I can't recommend it more if it fits in your budget!

Review_Date: HÃ¥kan K wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Lovely place with so many nice details as you explore the hotel and what has to offer. Top notch style. Perfect location a real oasis next to busy streets. Great roof top relax and eating very very friendly staff. Excellent service and great advise where to go and what to see in Marrakech and around. The food was excellent. As I write this I get the feeling of wanting to go back there again. The one and only negative was that I think think breakfast should have been included wiith that hight price for the room.

What a hidden gem in the middle of Marrakech! What a treat to escape the hustle of the medina at this beautiful tranquil oasis. Gorgeous hotel! Courteous and helpful staff. I had an amazing visit and have told friends about my wonderful experience. I highly recommend visiting!

Review_Date: Jacquie P wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: The most stunning calm oasis of a riad in the middle of the city just a few paces from the main square. Each part of the riad is a joy with exquisite decoration and colour schemes. Impeccable service lovely food. Faultless.

Review_Date: Nick Gignac wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: This hotel was one of the most amazing I have been to in my life anywhere in the world. Located right in the cultural heart of Marrakech. The service was above and beyond - the rooms were super clean super comfortable - Food was incredible -highly recommended.

Review_Date: Carlos C wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: The hotel is amazing and it is a more authentic way to stay in Marrakech  Everything was perfect great and super clean rooms excelent food and services.  It is very well located also and easy to grab a taxi right in front of the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Carolyn A wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Title: Not Far from the madding crowd
Review_Text: Great location decor rooftop and food .....and fabulous staff. If you want to stay somewhere tranquil and unique but a walk from everywhere I can highly recommend this hotel. The staff were very very helpful and attentive.
Reviewer_Location: Richmond upon Thames, England, United Kingdom

Review_Date: lydie l wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: We absolutely loved our stay at La Sultana a beautiful Riad in the old part of Marrakech. The staff the rooftop terrace the rooms the gardens the food everything was just a delight. We will certainly be back.

Review_Date: Primo M wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: When I decided to book an Hotel my first idea was to be inside Marrakech and the Riad I think it's the best way. I booked a "Jaguar" Suite one of the best that I saw! It's very characteristic that immerses you in the Arab world. A Jacuzzi positioned in a natural niche.  The SPA is incredible I take an HAMMAM and several massage.  A roof Bar is very nice in the night you can spend time just looking the stars.  Poolside restaurant with extraordinary cuisine.

Review_Date: Amy W wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: Gorgeous hotel, great location, lovely staff
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay at La Sultana. It has a very authentic Moroccan feel and we absolutely loved the rooftop with views over the city. The food wine and service was also fantastic. I'd advise staying in one of the bigger rooms as the smaller ones were quite dark due to the hotel being a combination of riads.

Review_Date: Chad K wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: Impeccable service & a hellova camel burger
Review_Text: No need to go dromedary on the terrace restoâ€™s eclectic menu; everything is fab. Elite cocktails & eye-opening wine list. Server Ayoub is a genuine pro (and a dead ringer for Ronaldo). Zacharia rocks 2
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful property, central location, great staff
Review_Text: This riad actually connects five smaller riads into a beautiful and full-service property. It's also very central to the main market square within a 15 minute walk. The interiors are maintained based on the original design with separate courtyards for restaurant seating areas and a rooftop terrace and dining area. Thank you to the warm staff who provided great service including Anas from front desk who was very helpful throughout our stay and Abedella from the restaurant who was very sincere and Bouhra from housekeeping who was very kind.

Review_Date: Francesca R wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: You must governo there and try their hammam it Is amazing 5 stars are not enough! It Is a little Bit more exoebsive than other hammam in the city but it is worth it! You can use the swimmingpool then you get washe with soap they leave you on very hot marble tables and they scrub and massage you.  They wash your hair and they put a mask on Your Body.  At the End you drink tea!  You don the need to worry about anything they will do everything for you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This riad is conveniently located near a main street outside the medina. The room is comfortable but dark as our room had no outside window. The top deck is nice for a drink but doesn't have much of a view. The hotel restaurant is just OK. After one dinner we went out to other restaurants. Like most riads this one doesn't have an elevator that serves all the rooms.

Review_Title: An oasis in the middle of the city
Review_Text: That was an amazing stay. We enjoyed every bit of it - the service the quality of the room the nice rooftop bar the great food at the restaurant... The staff really went out of their way to create a pleasant experience. I donâ€™t think we will come back to Marrakech - a weekend is for sure enough time to experience the city. But if we would La Sultana would be a first pick for sure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: William S wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: After traveling 121 countries and more hotels than I can recall I will tell you that La Sultana will be remembered forever and I will return often.  Every employee was Good and caring. The front desk concierges/manager made me feel so well taken care of each day. Loved her!  The rooms and property are unique and beautifully furnished with Themes. I LOVED the African animal Riad.  The daily breakfast was so fresh and delicious - I cannot recall a better tasting breakfast. The breakfast staff made it even better with their service. I looked forward to breakfast daily.  The location is in the center of things it and is easy to walk everywhere.  I HIGHLY recommend the La Sultana. I know quality and Found everything I wanted with this property.  Thank you to this wonderful place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: We absolutely loved our stay at Sultana. It was beautiful. We stayed 2 days then went into the desert and then another day upon return so we had the opportunity to stay in two rooms. The service was excellent and the rooms were simply stunning. The location is so convenient as there were always taxis out front. The staff will also inform you how much the taxis should cost so you never have to worry about being overcharged.    We made sure to book the hamman massage and facial combo after the desert experience. The staff the food the attention to detail was remarkable and I would 100% stay here again next time we visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: An oasis inside the old medina
Review_Text: We had been recommended this hotel by friends and were not disappointed. From the moment we got there to the moment we left.  La Sultana is definitely one of the best boutique hotels I've ever stayed an authentic Moroccan palace in the middle of Marrakech walking distance from the main square. From the beautifully decorated and comfortable rooms to the amazing swimming pool and incredible rooftop with views to the city everything was perfect. The staff was incredible.    We had a very nice diner by the pool and the service was impeccable we have been served by a very professional nice Abdelthere was not a moment that our table was empty of food or our glasses were empty of wine/water. He came to check on how everything was going many times during the night.  The food was absolutely delicious and you are full by the end of the meal. The price is a bit expensive if you are on a budget but the atmosphere food quality and service level makes it worth every penny of it. The pool where you are seated around is absolutely lovely and the music during dinner is a great added touch.  I would come here again in a heartbeat and would also recommend to friends
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The place is magnificent. A silent luxurious riad in the middle of an ever rumbling and running Medina.  Located right next to Saadi Tomb so you can take advantage of an early visit.  The staff is amazingly helpful and nice. They helped me to organize a surprise birthday party for my wife over the phone.  Also spa is certainly worth visiting though not cheap.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a fabulous hotel - total oasis of peace in the middle of the medina. After a day riding horses in the mountains it was a huge treat to stay here. Very grown up and sophisticated hotel - smart and discrete. Service is impeccible and although the hotel was relatively busy it felt that we had the place to ourselves and we felt looked after. Even when we dropped some money on the roof terrace one of the waiters handed it in and the team made an effort to contact all teh guests (including us) who were seen up there that morning. If we are back in Marrakech we will definitely be back.

I brought a group to Morocco for 11 days and we stayed 4 nights at La Sultana. From the moment we arrived and were welcomed by the staff with drinks I knew we were going to love this property which is right in the middle of the Medina. The rooms were all different shapes and sizes with good beds and wonderful bathrooms. We felt like we were in another time period but with all modern amenities. The breakfast which was included is plentiful as you have both buffet and menu options. I highly recommend La Sultana!

Review_Title: Gastronomic Dinner at The Odette Rooftop Restaurant
Review_Text: Celebrated my 40th birthday recently at The Odette and the food was phenomenal. For the quality of food and services received; we feel that the price is pretty reasonable. It is after all a luxury boutique hotel so u must expect to pay a slightly premium price than other restaurants in town.    The ambiance of the rooftop is simply romantic and suitable for intimate family dinners. We actually informed them in advanced that it is a birthday dinner and that we would like to request for a slice of cake with candles and ended up receiving a full sized cake (on the house!). It was an awesome birthday dinner in Marrakesh and i cant thank the hotel staff enough for their awesome hospitality.

Review_Date: Romain W wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: We had a very pleasant stay at La Sultanat. Our room was little dark but this is because of a riad with no windows on the outside. Dinner and breakfasts were perfect and very tasty with high quality products.  I do recommend La Sultanat for a warm & sweet moment.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Beatrice L wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: I will start this review telling you that is a place  of luxury is not so cheap but you get what you pay for. The location is breathless: a complex of 8 riads richly decorated. The food is really good and the terrace has a beautiful view of the Saudieen Tombeaux. The staff was really kind and a young waiter proposed us to do a tour of the building which I totally suggest you to do because it is an unique experience. At the end I can state that it is a jewel of Moorish luxury architecture you eat really well and the price is worth the lunch.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is such a gorgeous space. I mean who doesnâ€™t love a beautiful aesthetic. The detail in every corner of this place is breathtaking. The hotel is a former wealthy familyâ€™s residence so made up of adjoining riads. 3 of them I think each with a different look and feel. A heated indoor pool can be used heat round. There is a small gym which I was excited about as itâ€™s been difficult to work out while in the country. I enjoyed the breakfast and had dinner here one evening which was lovely. Lunch was a different story. I was seated then 15min later I had to flag someone down for a menu. Lunch options read like a dinner menu so I decided to leave to find a lighter meal.      The service here is wonderful. Such a great team who are all so friendly and helpful. I loved my room 127 with a king bed a seating area and the bathroom was so unique. The detailed carved ceiling & chandelier were stunning. Just a note like all riads in the country inside noise is an issue. You can hear whatâ€™s happening in the courtyard from inside your room so just be prepared as you wonâ€™t escape it as itâ€™s just how they are built. The hotel is located about a 10min walk from the souks of the MÃ©dina which I preferred for a touch of serenity.  The Sultana is in my top 3 places Iâ€™ve stayed in the country. Loved it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Disappointing, very rough round the edges
Review_Text: We had great expectations but the hotel disappointed in the most obvious and predictable ways: WiFi not working; being logged off every time we closed a browser; smoke and smell from the street made the roof top experience unpleasant; the hotel felt just like in many other places in Marrakech where the staff just want your money. The pool was a major issue. It is only decorative and looks good on photos. It is arranged in a way that does not encourage guests to use it it has freezing water not heated which for 500 usd + per night is an issue. You basically end up in a hotel without being able to dip in a pool. We stayed at similar category hotels such as Fasano in Rio which all have a usable and heated pool! The decor is fading and the hotel needs a serious face lift. See photos of two broken door handles in our room. The check out was the most traumatic with a horde of staff being rushed to our room to check it. Not sure if this we to check if we had a drink from the mini bar (non drinkers here!) or if the door handles were still broken....but it was embarrassing!

Review_Title: Excellent Dinner Service, Excellent Wait Staff
Review_Text: Sorry for the late review!    Back in August a friend and I dined at the hotel for dinner. We were not guests but heard the restaurant was great so we made a reservation (do this it gets busy). We loved all of our food; exquisite! Get the filet of beef trust me. Our service was also excellent. Our server Hamza was so attentive polite and had great recommendations for food and wine. He should work the front desk; what a lovely first impression of the hotel! Next time I'll stay there too.
This was one of the best hotel we have ever stayed at (and we've stayed all over the world). The staff rooms food wine and ambience were perfect. Central location and authentic. Highly recommended!

Review_Title: a perfect stay in Marrakech at La Sultana
Review_Text: Spent three night and wished it was more. The hotel was beautiful and immaculately clean. It is about a ten minute walk to the most busy part of the city but there is plenty to do see eat and BUY at your front door. From the landscaping to the pool to the rooftop everything was clearly designed with care. As an interior design fan I took a lot of pictures! We took advantage of dining by the indoor pool the rooftop for food/drinks and the spa amenities including massages We walked everywhere in the city from La Sultana and never found anything too far.  We stayed in the Autruche (or Ostrich suite) and it was perfect - beautiful pink walls comfy bed gorgeous bath. The hotel has lovely little sitting areas to relax after a long hectic day both inside and on the rooftop. The spa was clean and smelled amazing and my massage was just what I needed to relax. The food was great breakfast was tasty and the dinners were fantastic all using fresh and local ingredients.  I could go on and on about the decor and such but what this place is really about is the people. I have yet to find a more gracious and happy to help staff. The entire team always met us with a smile and a conversation. A special thank you to Mohammed the waiter on the rooftop. His service was impeccable and he was so warm and friendly to us answering all of our silly tourist questions remembering what we like to drink teaching us Arabic phrases etc. He made our three days even more special!  All in all La Sultana gets a perfect score from me. I did not want to leave at check out. Book here and you will not be disappointed. I hope to return one day.

Review_Date: Richard D wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: Gorgeous Riad hotel close (but not too close) to the Medina
Review_Text: Stunning collection of riads form this smaller hotel within ten minutes walk of the Medina. Our room was quiet beautiful and super clean (as was the whole property). The staff are very friendly and helpful. The roof terrace is a really lovely spot to sit and have a drink read a book or just daydream. Breakfast by the pool in the morning was a great way to start the day and the scrambled eggs are amongst the best weâ€™ve had. Special mention to the concierge Saida who was really helpful with everything from restaurant reservations to tickets avoiding the lines at Jardin Majorelle.

Hidden in a small alley there is this lovely small high end hotel. You really have to know where it is otherwise you will not find it. And that is a beautifull surprising start from our stay. Walking through this riad is like walking in a fairy tale. All the details and the herritage is so unique. The restaurant is romantic located around the pool in a small in-house garden. Really special. The roof terrace is the place to be for a cocktail or bite. Love it!!

Review_Date: Najlaa K wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: This hotel is located in the kasbah in a very special location  the hotel decor is amazing and rooms are beautifully designed. With an amazing roof top cafe .  The service is simply perfect all hosts are friendly and willing to help at any time . Food are tasty except that breakfast is very limited.  A special thanks to the best smiling face lady Saida  from the reception we really miss her smile every morning we wish to thank her for all the help she gave to us to make this stay unforgettable.  I highly recommend people who wants to stay in a beautiful riad in Marrakesh to choose this hotel with no doubt.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: T W wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Incredible atmosphere with really helpful and kind staff-- such a 1st rate experience- Beautiful rooms and public spaces-- loved the rooftop bar and restaurant  the pool and spa--The food was great- we had breakfast and 1 lunch and one dinner-- It is such a gem with a great central location.

La Sultana is very nice and cool place in Medina. The staffs are very helpful and friendly. The scenery is amazing from roof area. You can enjoy there so much. I liked our room too. Room is large clean and fresh.I recommend this place to anyone
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: An urban oasis fit for a sultan and ideally located
Review_Text: A truly once-in-a-lifetime type of property. Just a 10 minute walk from the medina markets and nestled in a kasbah district of its own next to the Saadian tombs you enter this hotel off a busy street full of shops vendors pushcarts donkeys locals tourists...you name it. Taxis can pull up to within 20 feet of the entrance so arriving with luggage is easy. Despite the bustle of the colorful street scene as you step into the courtyard of the hotel off the street the sound instantly retreats and what is essentially a palace reveals itself.    Every inch of this hotel is photo-worthy. Gorgeous tiles carvings art are everywhere. The rooms are arranged around a series of different courtyards with each one having its own unique design. The rooftop is spectacular for gazing over the parapet at the street below sipping a cocktail in the afternoon sun or sunbathing if some relaxation time is in order.    The staff is top-drawer from the moment you enter. Friendly accommodating charming beyond measure they represent the very best of hospitality.
