Their recommendations for us were spot on each time and they provided outstanding advice about sites directions etc. Similarly housekeeping was outstanding in every way twice a day. The restaurant is pleasant and beautiful in a covered courtyard with tables surrounding a pool. Food is well prepared if not especially memorable although the lamb tagine was a standout. Breakfast buffet with its attendant "a la carte" menu you could also order from was quite good.    The room had every amenity imaginable plus offerings for things like locally produced bath products if you prefer them over the Clarins (which were also great) and a long list of items you could simply request if needed from extra toothbrushes to other toiletries you may have run out of or forgotten. The edible welcome treats were very appreciated. All was immaculately maintained.    We looked at the Royal Mansour and the Mamounia and honestly we were very happy we chose La Sultana. It is smaller and more intimate than the other two which are huge compounds. The other two are also on a non-descript huge boulevard removed from the vibrance of the Sultana's street setting. For some seeking a hotel with gardens grounds and more of a resort feel these other two may be excellent choices--how could you really go wrong at this level of luxury right? But for us La Sultana was exactly what we imagined when we envisioned a trip to Marrakech--a palace nestled off the inner city streets. And the walk to the medina from La Sultana--whether via the larger main streets or by the side streets (which you will learn your way around soon enough if staying for 2-3 days!) is like an immersion in the local urban street life that would be missing to an extent if staying at the other two properties given their relative locations.

Review_Date: Tom H wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: perfect, felt like a dream come true
Review_Text: incredibly and detailed Setup and atmosphere spectacular view from the rooftop perfect bed sensational hammam-treatment. We couldnÂ´t find any mistake except the missing window in our room.  very attentive and friendly stuff no matter what time of the day

La Sultana was fantastic! We had a very short trip but the staff and hotel made it feel much longer because we were able to completely unwind. The riad was beautiful and we enjoyed exploring every detail of it. The staff were absolutely wonderful and the food delicious. Best buffet breakfast ever! We hope to go back soon and I highly recommend it to others.

What a fantastic place to stay. Just inside the Medina and a short walk from  Jemma El Fna square and all of the souks. This hotel is an oasis in the madness of Marrakech. The staff are wonderful especially on reception nothing is too much trouble.The food is wonderful and served around the indoor pool. The rooftop restaurant / bar has wonderful views of the city and Atlas Mountains. I honestly can't recommend this hotel enough. We then moved to their sister hotel on the coast in Oualidia also a fantastic hotel.

The restaurant is set in the heart of the hotel. The food is a mixture of French and Moroccan cuisine. I had foie gras to start and a fish tagine both were superb. Well worth a visit to the roof terrace before dinner and a wander round the hotel as it is exceptional. Thank you for a lovely evening.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I absolutely loved this hotel. The check in was so easy - they have you sit on the roof and have a snack of almond milk and dates as you check in. The staff is very helpful and available at any time. The property is stunning and the food in the restaurant was also great. Highly recommend!

La Sultana is beyond fabulous!! The staff is dedicated helpful and perfect in every way. The architecture is absolutely stunning - every detail is beautiful. Lanterns columns plantings furnishings are all lovely Moroccan statements. The street markets and mosque are right next door. We had wonderful food on the exquisite rooftop  and in the inside dining area by the pool. The Moroccan tagine cooking class was great fun followed by a wonderful  traditional tea ceremony. The hotel booked us on an adventure into the Atlas Mountains and the Berber villages  which was a real treat. Don't hesitate to stay in this amazing small caring lovely property.

A stunning hotel that is right in the middle of the amazing Marrakech Medina. The 5 Riad's have been brought together to form a beautiful oasis of calm amazing historic design with luxury touches. We stayed for 2 nights and were upgraded to the Lion Suite which had a wonderful terrace seating area where we could relax in the calm. The roof terrace is one of the best out there great design super service and a chance to see the Medina from above! We had an afternoon in the spa and were thoroughly spoilt by the team there. All of the staff including our butler Ahmad were so friendly and helpful. Ahmad arranged for a guide to take us on a 3 hours walking tour of the Medina which was a super experience. When you step outside of the hotel you are immersed straight into the medina experience if you need a break you step right back in and can indulge in the relaxed luxury of the hotel. Would highly recommend.

This is now one of my favourite hotels. The public rooms and spaces are very beautiful with swimming pools gardenslounges and a rooftop terrace. The bedrooms are fabulous. The food is excellent. Most of all the staff are brilliant very friendly and helpful and give great service at all times.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is exactly what I always thought Marrakech would look like in my dreams. It's a stunning compilation of 5 riads that is decorated in very traditional luxe Moroccan style. I was choosing between this hotel and La Mamounia. We had a drink at La Mamounia and while it was nice it felt like a large soul-less hotel compared to La Sultana which is boutique luxury and gives you the feeling of staying in a traditional riad. Also from La Mamounia you have to taxi everywhere whereas from La Sultana we walked to all the sights in the Medina. The staff was excellent and accommodating. We loved having drinks on the rooftop at the end of the day. We stayed for 5 nights and felt sad upon leaving!

Review_Date: Peter K wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: This hotel is superb in every way. Itâ€™s location is a walking distance from the kasba and historic buildings. There is a rooftop bar and restaurant from which you can look upon the thriving streets below and hear the call to prayer from nearby mosques. There are spacious rooms with courtyards. The decor is reminiscent of a palace. The staff are very attentive and helpful. It was a great place to start a Moroccan journey.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in - not only because every cup of coffee worth drinking! The atmosphere is delightful - cool classy romantic and the building interesting at every turn. The service is all you want and delivered with a mix of grace and humour which added to the quality of food and comfort of the room made our stay very special.  We will be back!

Review_Date: Jamin J wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: My family stayed at La Sultana for a few days this past spring and had a wonderful time. The hotel has charm and set the tone for our vacation. The staff was very kind and made our young children feel very welcome.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Good location right inside the Medina easy walk to the main square. Reasonable service. Food is good not fantastic. Strange floorplan for the rooms most rooms have no outside windows. So no fresh air....that was a big minus for us.

Review_Date: Laura C wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: Jewel in the Crown absolutely stunning!
Review_Text: Great location set right inside the Medina easy walk to the main square - fantastic service always with a smile - delicious food incredible spa LOVED it! - All the rooms are different and very interesting

Loved our 4 night stay here. The staff are so kind professional and accommodating. Very large family suite was grand and beautifully appointed. Terrace bar restaurant pool and spa were all great. Many quaint places to hang out.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfection - in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: A truly beautiful and authentic riad in the heart of the Media a delight to explore the many hidden treasures within. Excellent service always with a smile. Some problems with our room on the first night of our trip this was quickly resolved by the manager changing our room the next day. Sumptuous Spaand spectacular view from rooftop restaurant.    A true oasis of luxury within the heart of Marrakech.

Review_Date: mark k wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: Enchanting oasis with an amazing concierge!
Review_Text: We absolutely loved La Sultana Marrakech! The interiors were stunning and authentic our room was a true oasis in the old city not far from the bustling Medina. The atmosphere and view from the rooftop is breathtaking. What made our trip really spectacular with working with Hassan. He found us a fantastic guide for the old city and medina great restaurant recommendations (and reservations at this busy time of year) his recommendation for our camel trip and lunch in the Agafay dessert was magical - such a special experience for us and our kids. He suggested the excellent Henna Cafe and assisted us in finding a tween friendly hammam. He has fantastic resources but gave us honest feedback on the suggestions we had from friends and crafted a perfect itinerary for us. We would do the same trip exactly the same again - including the festive New Years Eve celebration. Our kids also loved the cooking class making tagine in the beautiful open air kitchen. I won't look to stay anywhere else in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Jiji Senpai wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: From the Riad to the people in charge of it everything was perfect... They made our stay unforgettable!  Definitely coming back... I found my new favourite spot!    The highlights are mostly the beautiful pool the great service at the restaurant and that great view at night from the terasse... A must visit for anyone looking for unforgettable stay!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Marija K wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Very very friendly staff and beautiful hotel my room was nice and original riad you fell it.Marrakesh is not for everybody I loved and I will come again.You fell safe in the dirty streets of the city but it is full of sarm with beautiful art everywhere N
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rosa E wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: After an other sweltering day in Marrakech it was wonderful to sit down somewhere quiet for drinks. Stunning rooftop bar excellent service and friendly staff. Well worth a visit also make sure that you walk around the beautiful interior before you leave.

Review_Title: Great location, great staff, perfect visit!
Review_Text: Highly recommend. Great location (walk to Medina) great and helpful staff amazing rooftop bar / area and all around a great hotel. the hotel has so many rooms and areas - make sure you explore! We would stay here again and recommend to others.

Review_Date: Kim G wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: La Sultana is certainly a beautiful 5 star Riad. The hotel staff mekr you feel most welcome and are very helpful. The rooms and facilities are exceptional and the location superb. We would love to return one day and will certainly recommend La Sultana to our friends

Review_Date: Angela Pryce wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Title: It is known as a â€˜Jewel in the City; I call it the 'Beautiful La Sultana'
Review_Text: This Beautiful small boutique Riad offering outstanding and first class service and beautifully decorated rooms with their own individual names and perfect decor.    The beautiful La Sultana is set in peaceful and tranquil settings the Management and staff -are outstanding and they are always available to help accommodate with any request.    On the roof top of the Riad you can enjoy a peaceful setting with one of the Bar Managers own speciality drinks or Cocktails sit back and relax enjoy the sunshine and witness the most amazing Sunset; look down from the roof top and you will see the local markets and part of the busy streets. And just walk to another corner of the Roof top and you can look down and see the historic Royal Palaces.    The beautiful 'La Sultana' is in the perfect location in the Medina you are spoilt from being a short walk away to the historical sites such as the Royal Palaces Souks (Markets) and 10 minutes from Jemaa El Fna Place.    This hotel is perfect for privacy peace and tranquillity yet just a step away from the busy bustling exiting City of Marrakesh.    The beautiful â€˜La Sultanaâ€™ is the perfect place to stay on holiday or a short break for any special occasion whether it is a birthday anniversary wedding or just a break from home the beautiful 'La Sultana' is definitely the type of break you will love enjoy and return to on any given opportunity offering a very personal service for all their guests.    Truly a 'Jewel in the City.'

Review_Title: Stunning Spa, Beautiful Property, and Excellent Location
Review_Text: Truly beautiful property with generally excellent service. The spa is incredible. Our room was well appointed. Most of the staff were super friendly except for a few but overall we enjoyed every aspect of our stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Do not blink or you may miss the best and most beautiful Riad in Marrakech!
Review_Text: La Sultana Marrakech is a perfect little diamond in a city of so much!!! From the moment of our arrival until the last morning of our stay this beautiful Riad was our respite from the bustling and exciting city of Marrakech. We knew we wanted a very special place to end our journey in Morocco... but we could have never known how special it would be until we experienced the exceptional service from all of the staff the beautiful accommodations and common spaces as well as the delicious meals served in the restaurant. This is an exceptional place with the highest of standards and we could not have ended our trip in a better place.It is in the perfect location to explore the old medina enjoy the hustle bustle of the Jemaa El Fina Square and the surrounding little passageways that make this area so special and is that private quiet beautiful interesting and luxurious place to rest and relax when needed. It really is a prefect 10!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jane B wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Title: Perfect, luxury Riad in every way
Review_Text: I write this as I sadly drive away from La Sultana. Honestly there are no perfect words to describe the Riad because from booking to leaving at 5am it was magical. I researched many riads and hotels in the MÃ©dina and surrounding areas but other reviewers pictures and words made me chose wisely. When I say they go above and beyond they truly do. Yes this Riad is one of the most expensive in Marrakech but worth every penny and more. It is low season so they upgraded us from the a suite to the Jaguar suite- stunning! You will be assigned a concierge and given a cell phone to keep in touch (thank you Anas!). They handled almost every aspect of our 4 nights and I felt trusting of the vendors they set us up with- from service to excursions. Every employee of the hotel is there to serve you to the highest extent without feeling up tight or snobbish. You will always have a relaxed feeling while on the grounds even though youâ€™re steps away from the hustle and bustle. And the Riad itself is breathtaking in every way! Itâ€™s in a good neighborhood of the MÃ©dina and walking distance to many highlights. If you want a large style hotel with amazing service La Mamounia was beautiful as well. We had drinks there one night and would go back but you have more of a grand scale Royal feeling versus quaint and laid back luxury if La Sultana.    Donâ€™t hesitate to reach out if you have any questions! Iâ€™d say this was the most magical and beautiful hotel Iâ€™ve ever stayed at.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mariska R wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: This review is way overdue but itâ€™s proof for how great La Sultana is. My love for this place is endless. This is hands down the most beautiful hotel Iâ€™ve stayed in. There have been some that came close (a recent trip to Cartagena put Hotel Casa San Agustin close to a tie) but none that surpassed it. I should note that on our trip to Marrakech we stayed at both La Sultana and La Mamounia and while the latter was certainly gorgeous La Sultana was a way more intimate less commercial kind of beauty. I did not want to leave. The riads are stunningly beautiful and each courtyard is a delight. The staff is always ready to help. The rooms (we stayed in the elephant suite) are gorgeous and smell divine. The location makes it a perfect oasis within the old city. Stay here - you wonâ€™t regret it. I still miss it to this day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing place in the middle of busy city
Review_Text: Very quiet comfort clear and lovely place in a busy city. Nice staff is ready to help you with everything. Servis on the high level. Typical Moroccan style you can feel like in a fairytale. Only the pool is not enough long to swim but you can have a drink and relax by the it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Adam B wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Title: Most beautiful hotel I've ever stayed
Review_Text: This riad is an oasis in the middle of crazy Marrakech. We stayed in the Lion room which I believe is the penthouse of the riad. The service and attention to detail was incredible the room felt like a palace with our own private terrace overlooking one of the hotels small plunge pools. The staff was unbelievable attentive even giving us our own private cell phone for the duration of our stay.    The grounds of the hotel are gorgeous and the rooftop provides incredible views of the city and is the perfect place for a pre-dinner drink. Dinner in the main courtyard is romantic and perfect. I wouldn't change anything about our stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The folks at La Sultana provided us with great hospitality during our recent stay in Marrakech. We met Anas upon check-in and he not only made himself available for any and all needs he gave us a smartphone to get in touch with him at any time. The property has great character and everyone employed there seems well versed in the art of hospitality - the very opposite of one might find in a chain hotel experience. The feel of the environment is a respite from the busy Medina. We dined at both the upstairs restaurant for lunch and downstairs poolside for breakfast and dinners. Highly recommend at least dining once with them for dinner good live music a great menu and Abbas will see that you're taken great care of. A well earned 5 star experience for sure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jennifer L wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Title: Exceptional Service in the heart of the Kasbah
Review_Text: What do you do when you leave your wallet in the gift shop of La Sultana. Nothing because the exceptional concierge Saida finds you on WhatsApp and facilitates its return to you in New York City. Exceptional service in a gorgeous hotel what more can you ask for?

Review_Date: Patrick P wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: There are hotel experiences that stays with you ones that you easily remember. For me stayong at La Sultana was one of those times.  I stayed there 17th to 19th of June and loved every minute. One moment you're on the bustling main street the next you're in opulence and tranquility. It's my first time in Morocco also on the African continent.    Even with 28 suites and at full occupancy there's the constant feeling that you're sharing the Riad with only a few more individual.  The always ready to assist staff manage to stay just out of the way but seem to read your mind and turn up when you need assistance.  The place is quiet relaxing cool and is everything you're likely to want from a hotel.  I'm already making plans for my next visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Blair Senesi wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Our experience at La Sultana exceeded our wildest expectations and I highly recommend staying here if you want the very best of a five star resort with the authenticity of staying in a exclusive luxurious riad within the medina along with the best concierge who can handle everything from airport taxis to tour guides to reservations.    Property: The property is absolutely beautiful no detail is missed from the intricate tile to the stunning chandeliers. Our prestige room was private quiet and had plenty of space a comfortable king size bed and a gorgeous bathroom. There are two pools the main one is surrounded by pillars and its heated so you never want to get out (I sure didn't!). The second one is on the roof where you can sunbathe and enjoy the views. La Sultana is walking distance to Jemaa el-fnaa which is wonderful but it is also so peaceful you feel like you're miles away which is so a pleasure to come home to after being out and about.    Dining: We ate breakfast everyday by the pool which had a good variety and delicious pastries. Lunch and cocktails on the rooftop were a highlight. We felt like we were in paradise peering over the medina and watching the sunset. Dinner was fabulous as well with excellent service and a romantic setting by the pool with a live musician. The service quality and taste of the food matched up to the best we had in all of Marrakesh.    Service: We were so happy with the service we received at La Sultana. The hotel arranged a tour guide for us to take us around the medina managed our dinner reservations for us and even booked us a day trip into the Agafay desert for a VIP camel ride and private lunch in a tent overlooking the desert. They went above and beyond taking care of ironing my dress and my husband's suit for the wedding we were attending.    Spa: The spa is wonderful with a stunning photo worthy pool. We did a hammam and massage and both were exceptional.    I would highly recommend staying here and we can't wait to come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gayle W wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: La Sultana is old time Moroccan warmth elegance and charm. The staff are very gracious and helpful. There is a lovely courtyard for dining. (They serve a wonderful  breakfast buffet! ) Our stay couldn't have been more perfect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Amazing hotel .. love each details of it ... staff are really professional ... roof is amazing and has nice sitting areas .. refreshments .. each Reyad differ s fr the over one â¤ï¸ l recommend it for couples so romantic
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Daniel K wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Title: An oasis of beauty and calm
Review_Text: La Sultana is a small intimate hotel that is architecturally beautiful  And well positioned within the Medina of Marrakech. The location enables you to  Walk to almost all of the main attractions in the city. When you leave the hotel you are immediately in the  Hustle and bustle of the city and yet the hotel is perfectly quiet and relaxing.  The staff always try to ensure that the guests are well looked after ........ the service levels are excellent.  Morning Miriam Evening Miriam and Abdullah are worthy of special mention fr ensuring that our stay  Was fabulous.  If you want Glitz and a Scene then opt for Le Mimounia but if you like understated luxury intimacy  And quiet then La Sultana is the place.

Review_Date: Jan K wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Absolut perfect hotel in a perfect location with very friendly staff. They really make you feel at home. The five differnt riads a very well combined and there are a lot perfect spots to relax. The roof terrace has a beautiful view over Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Magic and amazing stay really the most spectacular Riad luxurious and understated beautiful Moroccan style - best service ever from Ghislaine and the other staff. Breakfast indescribably delicious ðŸ™ƒ  110% recommendable !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Douglas S wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: La Sultana is the perfect Hotel. An excellent location a wonderful Roof Top Terrace Bar a great Pool for relaxing and evening dining with excellent food.  The Riads within La Sultana provide beautiful authentic rooms. The staff are so friendly helpful and courteous. I would have no hesitation in recommending La Sultana. This is the place to stay!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Vicky Critchley wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Title: Blown away by the beauty of this place.
Review_Text: Absolutely stunning. Slice of heaven in the hectic medina. Traditional Riad. Itâ€™s like staying in a palace. Forget the big hotels. This is the real Marrakech.    Perfect location. Staff couldnâ€™t do enough for you. Food was excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My friends and I spent several enjoyable days at this well located Riad hotel in Marrakech. The hotel is a small collection of Riads combined into one seamless hotel experience. Staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Nice secluded heated courtyard pool including a couple of small spa pools in other locations including the rooftop terrace. Rooms were individual and well appointed with all typical amenities including a bath. The hotels secluded entry and Riad design made a welcome sanctuary when returning from the dayâ€™s activities. Well catered buffet breakfast with an excellent range of local foods plus some western offerings. Particularly nice Berber omelettes. Also enjoyed a dinner with a nice selection of Moroccan and International dishes across the menu. The traditional harira soup a highlight but we also ate some great tagines. Again my party of six had an excellent meal accompanied by some quality local wines. My friends and I would definitely stay here again if in Marrakech without hesitation and would recommend it as a base for exploring the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Rich H wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: La Sultana staff first greet you on their magnificent terrace with some mint tea and dates. Then you are escorted to your room in one of the 4 riads that constitute the hotel. Over time you will get used to navigating your way to the terrace at dusk poolside for breakfast and dinner. Marrakech seems very chaotic once you leave the carpeted entrance but the delightful staff do everything they can to make the stay enjoyable. There are some really nice restaurants in the immediate vicinity and the Saadian tombs worth a visit. I cannot recommend this hotel enough they were world class.

Review_Date: John H wrote a review May 2019
Review_Title: Another outstanding experience at La Sultana
Review_Text: My second stay at La Sultana certainly did not disappoint. The five star reviews that I read here are appropriate as literally everything at this hotel including the service is the best possible. If you have the chance to stay here do it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Penny H wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: One is assured in Morocco that your hotel is your home. La Sultana certainly follow that through. Fabulous hotel fantastic staff amazing experience. The rooftop terrace is a really lovely spot after a day in busy Marrakech. Dinner in the restaurant is pricey but there are many places to eat very close that are more reasonable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: One of the best places to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed at La Sultana for two days and it was wonderful. The staff is lovely the food delicious and you must visit the roof top bar as the day ends. The rooms are spacious and clean. Plenty of room to hang clothing and shelves to store non-hanging items. We especially enjoyed sitting out in the courtyard during the hot afternoon. Be sure to make dinner reservations as their restaurant is very popular. Sitting by the pool listening to music while you eat is heaven.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Todd T wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: The location and ambiance of the ryad was absolutely amazing. The only thing that was better than the location and ambiance of the hotel was the service that was provided to my wife and I. From Myriam who greeted and serviced us Breakfast with her wonderful smiling face to Abbas who we believe is the best waiter in Morocco and Saida who made my wifeâ€™s 50th birthday an amazing and unforgettable experience and last but not least to Anas who was so helpful and attended to our every need and want. I can not say thank you enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect example of fine Moroccan hospitality
Review_Text: Stunning property atmospheric beautiful romantic artistic meticulously crafted.  Cuisine excellent do try the dining - can't beat it in Marrakesh.  Service and staff were excellent the right balance of relaxed but formal helpful and genuine.  Room was large beautifully appointed comfortable clean and the bathrooms had everything.  Hotel is fascinating. It's a myriad of Moroccan splendour and the perfect sanctuary for calm away from the busy streets of the city.  You won't be disappointed with La Sultana.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Walt D wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Outside its gorgeous door is the medina loaded with shops markets ancient gates and mosques. But the median==na is also a living place with alleys leading to homes. One day we wandered down a lane to a school and watched moms and grandmothers pick up their children.  But inside the hotel all is calm. The owners have done a wonderful job of combining several Riads and yet each retains its original flavor. Each has its own courtyard. Be sure to ask for a tour! Our room had a deck looking out to a reflecting pool. -- the perfect place to recharge.  Meals are delicious. Besides breakfasts (anything you could desire) we had two dinners there. Try the Tangia!  Service is outstanding. Staff soon get to know you and treat you like a friend. Lots of smiles.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: We'll Be Back! A Slice of Heaven.
Review_Text: We spent 5 nights at La Sultana and will surely return. The hotel is beautiful -- a series of Riads joined together. The rooms are large and simply gorgeous. Every attention to detail is there. You'll find pitted dates stuffed with walnuts in your room every day. When you check in you are greeted with Moroccan mint tea and a delicious traditional Moroccan pastry that translates in English to "gazelles legs". The customer service is exceptional. No request is too small and is taken care of immediately. I wanted a henna tattoo at a particular place they tried for hours but were getting no answer so they booked me at a comparable place. They could've given up but they got me a henna tattoo. Special commendations go to Anas at Reception and Abbas in the Restaurant. They both made us and our 10 year old son feel very special -- like VIPs!  I should add that while we received great recommendations from the staff about restaurants outside of the hotel the hotel restaurant should be considered a destination restaurant. It's pricier than some other places but worth it. In fact we cancelled booked reservations for other places in the Medina just so we could eat at the hotel. We took advantage of their cooking class and made a incredible tagine and salad with the help of the restaurant's head chef who has been there for almost 20 years. While you are in the heart of the city La Sultana is a sublime oasis. You never want to leave but you probably should do some sightseeing. They scheduled a wonderful trip where we rode quad bikes in the Agafay Desert a private tour guide for our first day in the city they'll tell you what to pay for a taxi so you don't get ripped off (no more than 50-60 MAD) and booked spa treatments for us in their beautiful spa. The 4 Hand Massage was amazing. All in all it's one of the best hotel experiences we've ever had. See you next time!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: a few heavenly days of luxury in Marrakech
Review_Text: This was our first stay at La Sultana and we loved it. The terrace is divine with plantings of palms and bouganvillia and views over the city including huge nest where a stork was feeding her young. Spectacular service lovely staff a peaceful oasis. The hamman is exceptional. Dinner delicious but a bit pricey.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mundana T wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: I couldnt believe the service of La Sultana believe me MINDBLOWING! They realized we were spanish speaking clients and they sent us the right waitress that spoke spanish as well as the daily newspaper in spanish! The bell boys receive you from the street and even carry your personal bags so that you walk flawless to the reception. Mustafa Abdullah and Abbas were so gentiles and so nice to us that we felt so special for them. I am a Travel designer and I rate la Sultana with 100!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Rupert Sheldon wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: La Sultana is wonderful place to stay brimming with authentic moroccan charm. Occupying an extremely convenient but discrete location in the middle of the old town and next to the Kasbah the hotel provides a quiet and luxurious sanctuary away from the noise colour and bustle of downtown Marrakech.    Made up of five interconnecting Riads La Sultana offers the last word in understated elegance but best of all is the wonderful and very personalised 'nothings too much trouble' service led by Rashid and his team on the front desk which proved to be the icing on the cake during our stay.    Marrakech is a wonderful place to visit at the end of March. Most importantly the weather was more than warm enough to make full use of the fantastic rooftop terrace which proved to be a real highlight with lots of unexpected pleasures including a quiet and secluded sun lounger area with plunge pool and numerous discrete and shaded spots to chill out. To cap it all the roof top restaurant is an absolute gem with first rate food and a relaxing vibe - the perfect place to lose a few sun filled hours in the middle of the day whilst enjoying the local rose gris!  All in all La Sultana provided the perfect tonic at the end of a British winter - a very special place to stay. We spent four nights there and really couldn't find fault in anything; quite the opposite in fact. We returned home with batteries fully re-charged and counting down the days to our next trip to Marrakech for a little more rooftop chilling!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: La Sultana Marrakech is simply stunning. It is located just inside the Kasbah when our driver pulled up I thought we had made a big mistake with our choice. The hotel entrance is up an alleyway. We were greeted at our taxi by the doorman and taken into the hotel reception - calmness enveloped us immediately. We were taken straight up to the roof terrace and given chilled nut milk and a date followed by mint tea. The roof terrace was an explosion of flowers pretty bird song and tranquility yet look over the edge to the chaos and madness below it is quite unbelievable. On one side stands the majestic snow capped Atlas Mountains and on the other the mosque stands proud in the near distance in between a proud pair of storks are raising their chicks in a huge nest perched precariously on a ledge.    We had lunch on the roof terrace which was fresh and colourful and the staff were attentive and efficient.    After lunch we were shown to our room which was enclosed in a small courtyard. It was a good size with large comfy bed and everything else you would expect from such a sublime hotel.    Supper was relaxing set out around the pool with local music and the food was again fantastic and the portions are huge. Breakfast is also served around the pool with a small fresh buffet and eggs ordered from your table the Berber omelette is fantastic and very different.    La Sultana is magnificent consisting of five Riads it is huge. The art furnishings and architecture are simply stunning I would never tire of walking around this place it is a feast for your eyes and your soul.    We left for La Sultana Ouilidia for 4 nights before returning to the madness of Marrakech for one last night where we were rewarded by an upgrade to a beautiful room on the first floor which had windows into the courtyard. Windows to the outside are one thing that we miss in a Riad so this was a special treat.    I do not apolgise for using so many adjectives to describe this place but it really it stunning amazing beautiful fantastic sublime. Avoid the big hotels this is the jewel in Marrakech.    Finally I must praise each and every member of staff front desk managers waiters housekeepers doormen - they were all highly trained well presented and above all genuinely welcoming and friendly. They could not do enough to make you feel special without being disingenuous.    I really did not want to leave.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A unique place to stay in the heart of Marrakesh.  The facilities were of top quality. The staff very professional and friendly.  The rooms were wonderful. The hammam was also great.  They have thought of every single detail.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Our family of four stayed here in the Riad Bahia. The exquisite beauty of La Sultana is in the details. The place is a true treasure. The service is impeccable while still being warm and welcoming. The food is perhaps the best we had in Marrakech. Try the breakfast Tagine and also the variousâ€Moroccan Samosasâ€ by the pool. We loved swimming in the pool playing billiards in the clubhouse and just hanging out on the rooftop. The hotel is also perfectly located in the heart of everything. We walked easily through the Kasba to the Souk the tombs and Bahia palace were only steps away. Our thanks to Khalid and his excellent staff for THE PERFECT STAY!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We were served so well by all amazing. Restaurant staff Abbas was first class l his humour his attentiveness and professional well done our meal was the best our whole stay because of you love people.. Abbas you so a fine job. All of you do. Thank you for the huge cake and singing for my hubby's birthday
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stunning hotel - beautiful place in the heart of Marrakech which was a delight to come back to every time you left. The staff were wonderful and so friendly. Great food and the best bit is the incredible roof. Such a great place to relax but faintly hearing the hustle and bustle of the city. Also has a great spa (royal Hammam treatment is a must!) .The one slight negative is that even though they are all beautiful some rooms don't have windows which you would hope for at the price you are paying. But understand that is the nature of Riad's sometimes...We were lucky enough to get an upgrade when we asked if any rooms with more light were available Highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing property, impeccable service, just wonderful
Review_Text: The rooms are just beautiful. Fantastic bath products wonderful selection of sweets in the room along with a fruit bowl. Everything you could need is available for you. The staff are very friendly. Service and food is impeccable. Breakfast was a gourmet buffet and delicious. Comfortable bed and beautiful bath tub. The riad courtyards are so beautiful and there are so many areas to hide and have quiet time. The rooftop is possibly the best part of this place - the views are incredible.  Highly recommend. Favourite place in Marrakech.  Mamounia and Royal Monsour are too big and impersonal La Sultana has a character of it's own and is very charming.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Marja P wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: The hotel is located in the heart of the medina close to great sights and shopping.  The rooms are quiet and very comfortable and the staff is very friendly. From the moment you enter you feel that you travelled back in time to a Moroccan Palace. A truly memorable experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jennifer C wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: Lovely hotel and great location near the souks
Review_Text: This is not one of the grand hotels outside the medina but if you want to stay in/near the medina and its souks it is a gorgeous hotel with all kinds of interesting nooks and crannies each room is uniquely decorated with a subtle animal theme and the public spaces are what you likely think of when you think of sumptuous Moroccan-themed luxury.    The location is perfect it is on a paved road so taxis can take you right to the entryway but is right next to the tombs five minutes from the palace and a quick 15 minute walk to the main square by which you enter the souks.    Rooms were lovely again this is an old riad so it's not ultra modern I had some issues with my AC which were promptly dealt with. I appreciated the Clarins toiletries. Loved that they had adapters for US electronics already in some of the outlets.    Service is amazing they will help you with anything.    We didn't eat any meals except breakfast which was good but would have been better if included in the rate.    Never took more than a few second to secure taxis.    They can also arrange airport transfers for 480dm and a guide for a day for 800dm which I highly recommend to get oriented.    I couldn't get the elevator working but I am sure there was something I needed to push that I didn't know. Took me a day or two to be able to find my room through the winding hallways which was kind of cool actually.    Highly recommend but don't expect the luxe (or the pricetag) of the Royal Mansour Mandarin Oriental etc.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Absolutely stunning Riad and wonderful place to have lunch on the terrace  drink a margarita and enjoy the peace in this place  You should go !!!!  Charming location and lovely staff    In love with you ... la sultana

Review_Date: Conny S wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: A stay in La Sultana Marrakech will stay in your mind forever! Everything is just perfect very friendly staff fantastic rooms and suites delicious food very relaxing massages and an outstanding roof terrace!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Francesco E wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Hassan and all the concierge team provided an amazing support to us during the organisation of our holiday and during our stay!  Great hotel amazing service and incredible interior design: a museum!  Best boutique hotel ever!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Never ever will I forget the people at La Sultana. We stayed there for 3 nights celebrating my motherâ€™s 75th birthday. Beautiful Riad lacking nothing. Amazingly friendly so so kind very helpful. They helped us with everything and nothing absolutely nothing was too much for them. Thank you so much for an amazing stay. I will definitely return! A big hug from Lela Carla ðŸŒ¸ðŸŒ¸
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Colin Passmore wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: We went in late Jan - off season but great temperatures for those of us coming from a chilly UK; and because it was off season we had great personal service from Hassan. Terrific room - the Zebra room - spacious facing the heated pool and the main dining area. We had our own balcony. The Riad is a fascinating conglomerate of buildings  beautifully decorated with a lot of nooks and crannies - very tastefully furnished and topped off by a wonderful roof top bar area. Within easy walking distance of the main square and souks. A great stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We decided to treat ourselves to a wonderful 5 star family breakfast!....Khalid took the telephone booking who was very helpful indeed (having been treated very rudely by staff at the La mamounia on the telephone)  We had a warm welcome from Zechariah who was super efficient and sincere...our breakfast was superb...great selection of breakfast buffet and hot menu options...the eggs benedict was very much perfect! The poached eggs were cooked to perfection...beautiful surroundings...table near the pool and incredible service from Zechariah who also gave us a tour of the hotel which is wow! Would love to return and definitely stay at La Sultana
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Canâ€™t dispute that the hotel is nice. Very quaint. Small but well formed shall we say. However I was disappointed that everything appeared to be extra.    Given itâ€™s a spa to be told that we had to pay 150 MAD to go in the sauna was hugely irritating. Bottle of wine to room was > Â£45 which is obviously ridiculous.    Breakfast ...obvs not included. Overall not for me.    Itâ€™s a good way from the more modern side of the city so get ready to cab it and of course go through the usual bartering madness on the way.    Wont be returning if Iâ€™m honest.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stumbled upon this place whilst looking for the palace. We had been looking for a riad to take a break from the hustle and bustle of the city and we found this one! Its absolutely beautiful inside and not too pricey. We experienced the traditional moroccan hammam and you are supplied with slippers a dressing gown treatment tea and some biscuits. Its all very relaxing and you can rest as long as you want. I wish we had have been guests at the hotel to experience everything it had to offer! Maybe next time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: La Sultana is probably one of the most iconic hotels of Marrakech. What's unique about this hotel is that it is a collection of five original different and elegantly decorated riads just in the real heart of the Kasbah...only a few meters from the royal palaces museums and Jemaa el Fna square. The calm atmosphere and all the different tastefully decorated settings are the perfect backgrounds for some epic pictures. The rooftop bar (open also to non-guests) is an amazing spot to catch the sunset and relax after a day spent wandering around the souks. My room was in the mosaic decorated Riad Bahia a very intimate part of the hotel. This is the Riad with the deluxe prestige suites. My guest suite was actually a very large room called "autrucheâ€ (ostrich) (all rooms are named after African birds and animals). During my stay (Januray/winter season) breakfast and dinner were served in the Riad Almohade. This is the largest courtyards where a tropical garden and the swimming pool are also located. Unfortunately the pool is open for guest only after breakfast.  A special thanks and mention must go to the Spa: I had a fantastic relaxing massage and a body scrubs. In addition the pool and relaxation area offer a real â€œArabian Nightsâ€ atmosphere. La Sultana is definitely a magical place where you can find a restful spot to unwind away from the noise and bustle of the city of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: An utterly marvellous and gracious property. It has style character and finesse worthy of praise. Despite being in the middle of town inside the hotel was a haven of peace and tranquillity.    The decor and style is authentic and the personal service received by each staff member was very professional yet friendly and courteous. The attentiveness and attention to detail was much appreciated.    We had the pleasure of being guided with suggestions by the Head Concierge - Clefs dâ€™or Saida.    She was quick to understand your â€œtasteâ€and made suitable recommendations ie restaurants tours etc. All of which was 100% perfect.    This is a property we will definitely return to and HIGHLY recommend!    KK
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My time at La Sultana was wonderful. The exceptional service given to my sister and I by Hassan at La Sultana was unbelievable. Not only did he escort us to our riad gave us an exceptional tour of the hotel/rooftop but also called a taxi that went into the MÃ©dina to pick us up after dinner to bring us back to the hotel. The level of dedication and attention Hassan put into our stay at La Sultana was something I had never witnessed before. Five star customer service at La Sultana.    The pool and hammam at La Sultana are also gorgeous and you can see the Atlas Mountains as well as the Saadian tombs. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a 5 star riad experience and close proximity to Fna and the MÃ©dina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Lenka F wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: We had amazing time in La Sultana whole hotel has a special atmosphere. Exactly how i imagine Marrakesh. Housekeepers maybe should check minibar more often few times they didnt add the bottles of water. Room was big and clean bed very comfy.  Staff was very friendly and helpfull.  Rooftop of the hotel was my favourite place for drink or just for relax on the sun.  La Sultana Spa is beautifull and relaxing  just be carfull with royal hammam if you have soft skin like me it was quite hard peeling but massage after was amazing.  Thank you so much for our amazing time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ash T wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Fabulous hotel hidden down an alleyway in the market. The location is amazing and the staff are insanely attentive. They make you feel that there's no ask too big or small. Our personal concierge Hassan was particularly stellar. He made sure our 4 day visit was packed with the best of Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emina S wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: This hotel is amazingly beautiful we enjoyed every minute of staying here! Their staff is super kind and helpful  our flight was in the evening and we were allowed to stay in the hotel after our check out since I was not feeling very well that day I was brought a blanket  water and laid down to relax before our flight with staff coming in to check how I was feeling. If we ever come back to Marrakech this is the only place I want to stay in ! Highly recommend .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed at the Sultana the first time. it was such a pleasure to stay at that beautifully Hotel. it was such a warm welcome and the staff was so friendly and courteous. The rooms are spacious and very tasteful set up and the whole hotel is perfectly clean and calm. The rooftop is really the icing on te cake!! Such a great terrasse to sit in the sun and watch the Atlas Mountains on the edge of the city. So all around the perfect stay in Marrakech. Thank you La Sultana.

Review_Date: Kamila M wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: I stayed in LaSultana for second time. Arriving was like returning home. They make us feel so cared for and welcomed like old friends. Especially concierge Saida! She is like mother. Caring and totally knowledgable dedicated to make you feel special addresses all your needs.  She recommended program booked us into the best restaurants massages suggested where to go and what to see. No need for any guide. Just speak to Saida and you all set.  Not to mention the fabulous place itself. Rich but tastefull decore every detail thought through. Fabulous corners to sit and sip wine or cofee delicious breakfast taken at the roof top with breath taking views or around the pool. Definitelly the MUST to see the sun set from the roof top.. Always attentive stuff to provide best service. I just loooove this place they spoil you rotten. Than it is problem to stay elsewhere:-). Coming back again soon guys keep doing what you do best.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Lynn K wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: This hotel was so lovely! I traveled with my adult daughter to Marrakech. La Sultana was recommended by a co-worker of hers and It was a great choice! Great service at the hotel a special shout out to ANES at reception. He was super helpful and always had a smile on his face! We stayed in the â€œgiraffe roomâ€ all of the rooms are named after animals. It was so charming and comfortable. Daily breakfast was delicious and the service was superb. I highly recommend the Hammam and massages at the hotel. It was a wonderful experience. We went to a hammam in town for massages only. The massages were very goodbut the experience did not compare to our experience at la sultana.  It think it is a must even though it is pricier than a hammam in town. **Les Bains de Marrakech Morocco is supposed to be amazing. Plan in advance- we could not get in.  Enjoy this treasure of a hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Luxury in the heart of the Medina
Review_Text: We loved every minute of our stay at La Sultana. The architecture around every turn is mesmerizing. There are so many interesting places to explore in the hotel itself. My husband actually got lost once or twice trying to find the way back to our room. The staff are unparalleled in their attention. We came for our honeymoon and are already making plans to come back. We were greeted with some almond milk and the most delicious stuffed dates. The upstairs bar is great with views of the Atlas Mountains. We were able to walk anywhere we wanted from the hotel which we loved. We did a hammam and massage at the spa and it was great. I get massages often and was worried it would not be deep enough for me but it was perfect. The hammam was a good experience made even better by the fact that my husband and I were able to enjoy it together. I cannot say enough good things about La Sultana the staff the decor the food the spa all superb.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A real 5 star Hotel if not more tour Guide view
Review_Text: I have only praise for this incredible gem of a Hotel . From the moment I entered I felt I had found paradise . Anas greeted us with charm poise and a big smile gave us a phone so he could tend to any and every question and or request . The rooms where beyond perfection true luxury and Romantic combined . The spa was beautiful with its own Hamman I not only had a massage I had two with a gentleman Jamel he was perfection I am a tour guide and have many massages to help with my stress from Travel and work and he new exactly how to help me work out the many knots my body had . The spa was beautiful and perfect . My partner and I will never forget the beauty and perfection.I want to also mention a beautiful lady that greeted us every morning at breakfast pure elegance and perfect service Mariane is her name . Thank you La Sultana you will only get the beat reviews from me .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bjorn P G wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Leaving the insane hustle and bustle of you enter a different world when you go through the golden door to La Sultana in Marrakech. The hotel is an oasis of calm and beauty in the midst of the hectic life on the streets outside. The staff are professional very helpful and polite. Our host provided us with a mobile phone for usage to contact the hotel staff whenever we needed service of any kind. What a great concept!  We had a great stay with excellent SPA treatment in MarrakechÂ´s most beautiful SPA and lots of cold Casablanca beers on the rooftop restaurant/bar. This is my forth time here and I will for sure come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John C. wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: This was truly the best hotel ever. We have stayed in fine hotels in many places and the visual delights the quality of the staff the large and elegant rooms and the outstanding food made this the best ever. We stayed in the 'Ibis' room but the other 3 couples in our group had similar rooms. We breakfasted in the hotel each morning from Oct. 13 to 17 and the food is superb. One night we had dinner on the roof-top restaurant and it was similarly perfect. It is an easy walk to the souk and you can do it by yourself and not get lost! We went through the more famous and expensive hotel La Mamounia and it was positively shabby by comparison. In La Sultana everyplace you turn is a beautiful example of Moorish architecture. The staff is world class.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: MAGICAL MARRAKESH  From the moment I set foot onto the candlelit path that leads to Hotel La Sultana I was swept away by its beauty and the excitement of what lay ahead â€” the rustic setting outstanding service graciousness and warmth of the talented and efficient team who greeted me as I entered the hotel made me feel immediately welcome and delighted about my first weekend in Morocco.    Upon arrival I was led to the gorgeous music-filled rooftop terrace to begin the check-in process where I was served almond milk fragrant mint tea sweet dates with almonds and a warm wet towel to refresh myself and ease into my weekend.    From the rooftop I got a better sense for the location of the hotel and the liveliness of the Kasbah a traditional district of Marrakesh located within historic Old Town Medina full of authentic markets bustling street life and local flavor. The Kasbah is a short walk or taxi ride to the crowded and vibrant Jemma El-fna square considered an important symbol of Marrakesh.    This historic hotel features several connecting ancient riads (traditional Morrocan palaces and homes each with its own open-air courtyard full of lush plants and enchanting water features). Guests are free to discover a labyrinth of handsomely decorated seating areas romantic-looking nooks rose-filled fountains and terraces through small doorways meandering staircases and connecting rooftop decks that lead to unexpected beauty everywhere.    When I walked into my room there were delicious local pastries a large bottle of water and fresh fruit waiting for me. Such a hospitable way to begin my stay.    As part of my research prior to arriving Iâ€™d read that the hotel had a top-ranked spaâ€”and it really was deliriously good. I booked a deep tissue massage with Jamal one of their warm and skilled massage therapists and it surpassed my expectations. The serene beauty and calm of the spa transported me to a magical place.    The colors scents and flavors of Marrakesh are intoxicatingâ€”one visit and it has stolen my heart.    The soulfulness of my experience at La Sultana coupled with the attentive service hospitality and sheer kindness of front desk manager Saida and the entire top-notch team made my experience a unique and memorable one.    I canâ€™t wait to go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: What an absolutely amazing hotel - one of the best if not THE best that we've ever stayed in. It is literally an oasis of calm in the middle of the Medina and it's location gives you the best of both worlds - you're perfectly located for exploring the slightly chaotic streets of Marrakech but with the option of retreating to the peace and serenity of the hotel at any time. It was our first visit to Marrakech and we wanted to immerse ourselves in it's culture so we booked a traditional hammam at the spa which was wonderfully cleansing (although be prepared to get naked!!). We also asked the hotel to arrange a local guide to show us around - I would thoroughly recommend this. Our guide was called Ali and he spent around 4.5 hours with us giving us an insight into the city and guiding us through the Souks and the main square. Without exception the staff at the hotel were brilliant (we'd had fabulous service from the concierge before we even arrived) - they made us feel welcome and special from the moment we walked through the door and nothing was too much trouble. The room was exquisite - very traditional with the most amazing bathroom in the world. We had breakfast in the hotel on both mornings and dinner once - the food was wonderful - traditional Moroccan dishes in a perfect setting. We also enjoyed cocktails on the roof terrace overlooking the hustle and bustle of the market below and with the Atlas Mountains looking beautiful in the far distance. We found this hotel by chance (largely thanks to Trip Advisor) but I cannot recommend it enough! If you're booking a short break in Marrakech book La Sultana - you won't be disappointed!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David H wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: La Sultana was a beautiful oasis virtually hidden within the hustle and bustle of the Medina in Marrakech. The interiors are lovely. It's amazingly quiet especially given it's location. The service was impeccable and the rooftop restaurant was a delight. I highly recommend this hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Thomas H wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: Peace, Comfort and Beauty Just Steps from the Busy Streets of Marrakesh
Review_Text: The streets of old Marrakesh can be dangerously chaotic but just a short walk down a side alley reveals this luxurious hotel.    There are elegant shops within its wall but what makes it truly lovely are the peaceful nooks and crannies in which to relax not to mention the rooms themselves that feel like they are in their own little villas within the hotel.    The restaurant which serves on the main level or on the expansive roof deck (when the weather is amenable) serves deliciously prepared traditional Moroccan fare but also items with a broader international preparation. The chef even put together a salad Nicoise on demand for my wife. Both nights we had dinner there there was also live music played subtly by a lure player. Very nice.    This is to say that the service is exceptional at La Sultana.    They also have an indoor pool which we took advantage of and enjoyed thoroughly.    But back to the roof deck. Not only does it have a full bar but it provides a wonderful view over the rooftops of the area and allows one to hear the call to prayer from multiple mosques in the area... part of the magical Moroccan experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anne S wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: Perfectly located, beautiful Riad in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: The welcoming staff was the first sign of the amazing few days at this beautiful Riad. A perfect location to explore the Medina. The pools spa food bar and rooms were all excellent. Can't wait to visit again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a place! From the beautiful decor  amazing rooms and the lovely staff this was perfect for a birthday treat. Once you walk off chaotic city streets this Riad is pure tranquility.  We were fortunate enough to be in the Leopard suite  a large room with amazing bathroom and terrace outside.  As it was November dining at night was around the pool with local music playing and beautifully lit. Lovely food and prices similar to a nice restaurant in the uk.  We also had lunch on the roof terrace overlooking the Saadian Toombs( personally not worth visiting only takes 10 mins to go round and you can see most from the hotel).  The spa is stunning we had a deep tissue massage while there when we arrived so a great way to start a break.  The Riad is great to explore numerous staircases courtyards all themed differently and exquisitely decorated.  Cannot recommend La Sultana enough its not cheap but its worth the extra and your right in the hub of the city when you want to go and explore.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent a week at La Sultana for our honeymoon (24th - 31st Oct). Wow! What a stunning serene opulent yet non pretentious retreat! The staff made us feel so welcome and went above and beyond to do so without being intrusive. The bedrooms are truly stunning and each Riad complements one another with unique pieces of art original architecture and a general sense of peace. Luxury in abundance without being over the top and immaculate is an understatement!    Breakfast lunch and dinner were all delicious with plenty of choice and authentic menu options. The spa is a must! We each had a Hammam and massage which was extremely relaxing and a real treat. We took the cookery class and it was the highlight of our week! Good fun and memorable (and tasty too).    La Sultana is situated close to everything without being interrupted by the busy pace of Marrakech. Stepping back into La Sultana from the bustling Souks and Medina really was heaven on earth! What an amazing Honeymoon thanks to La Sultana and staff particularly the concierge team who made our stay feel special and personal. We can't wait to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Incredible place to stay and experience Marrakech
Review_Text: Absolutely perfect Riad beautiful delicious food and drink friendly helpful staff. Luxurious rooms and pool setting. Relaxing and most importantly quiet and safe.    Would recommend staying here and would definitely stay again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I mean....whatâ€™s not to like. This hotel is sublime an absolute tranquil oasis in the bustling Kasbah. Staff superb. My daughter and I had a wonderful stay here. Itâ€™s very expensive but worth every dirham we loved it. â¤ï¸

Review_Date: Tara âœ¨ wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: What a Perfect Little Riad in the Heart of the Medina
Review_Text: I could not speak more highly of La Sultana. Having stayed at and visited several riads in Marrakech La Sultana is the most exquisite and opulent of them all. With five unique riads built into one mega palace La Sultana is the perfect place to relax and enjoy fine Moroccan luxury while being in the hustle and bustle of the Medina. I stayed here with friends and we had such a great time hanging out in the riad that we hardly wanted to leave to explore. There are 27 luxurious and unique rooms and several lounging areas that make you feel as if you are a guest at a Moroccan palace.    The Location:  The location couldn't be more perfect. Set on a quiet street steps from the main square in the medina there are many great restaurants around and everything you need just outside the doorstep. I appreciated being on a safe and quieter street and tucked away from the main touristy areas.    The Service;  Being part of the Small Luxury Hotels of the world they are certainly up to par with many major leading luxury hotels. Their service is genuine and impeccable. Everyone from the housekeeping staff to the dining staff to the front doormen were very pleasant and lovely to speak to. I only wish I spoke better French so I could converse with them better and enjoy learning more about life in Morocco. Our room was promptly cleaned each day with delicious fresh dates left on our pillow. Everyone was overly accommodating making you feel as if you were a prestigious guest in their palace. It was a warm and memorable experience.    The Pool:  The pool is immaculate. With only 27 rooms you can always find a spot to hang out in the sun. The pool chairs are always kept up with fresh towels and placed with the most adorable straw hats embroidered with La Sultana. My friends and I figured out the perfect balance of spending time at the riad and exploring Marrakech. We hung out by the pool until 4 pm before venturing into the medina for the evening for sunset and dinner. This ended up being the perfect balance for our stay as we were able to enjoy the amenities of the riad while also exploring the vibrancy of Marrakech.    The Rooms:  They have 27 exotic and unique rooms across their 5 charming riads. We stayed in the tropical courtyard of Riad Sheherazade in a premium suite aptly named 'Le Tigre'. Our room was ultra charming and decked out in African Tiger motif. It was quite large with a king bed seating area closet and expansive restroom. We were very pleased with our room and it was a very comfortable stay. I loved having no windows as we were able to sleep in past 7am for once!    Everything else!  La Sultana was just perfect. On top of everything else they have a perfect rooftop with lovely views over the pink city. The rooftop is home to one of the best restaurant/bars in the city and also has a perfect sunbathing area with plunge pool. In addition to the rooftop they also have an onsite spa. The spa is a traditional Moroccan Hamman with the most incredible plunge pool and lounging space. Last but not least the food at La Sultana is fantastic. The breakfast is plentify and hearty and their menus for lunch and dinner have many options. We opted to eat many meals here as the food was quite delicious.    I couldn't recommend La Sultana more for your stay in Marrakech. I have posted several pictures as well as a tour to my Instagram blog @luxe_tourista. I have also added some more information on my blog at www .luxetourista .com    I hope you choose La Sultana for your stay in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Wonderful and exotic short stay in the blissful Sultana!
Review_Text: My husband and i were lucky to be upgraded to what we think was the top suite in the Sultana. What a way to start our short stay in this luxurious oasis of calm. We loved everything about the hotel from drinks and dinner on the rooftop terrace breakfast every morning around the pool and wonderful massages in the spa. The location of La Sultana for us was perfect as we explored the Medina everyday on foot from the hotel and then could return in the afternoon to the oasis of calm offered by the hotel. The staff and in particular the concierge could not have been more helpful. We were given some great recommendations for lunches and spots to enjoy the sunset. Thank you for an excellent stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Garden of tranquility within the walls of the City
Review_Text: A magical place away from the noise and bustle of the city of Marrakech. The perfect place to unwind and relax. The food is wonderful though there are a few hidden extras on the food menus which should be clarified by staff before serving. The dining area up on the roof terrace is delightful and staff very attentive and friendly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: A beautiful setting tastefully decorated and carefully managed property. We felt like guests at someoneâ€™s home from the minute we stepped in and accepted the welcome mint tea. Zaida was lovely and so very helpful as was everyone on the staff breakfast is delicious with western and Moroccan options. Donâ€™t miss the terrace and sundown.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sing Hee L wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: It is combined from three Riad of different style - very beautiful detail and look authentic (restoration). Spa was very nice. Buffet and pool was lovely too.    Room was spacious and has different themes.    Highly recommended. Just got one night wish could stay more.

Review_Title: An oasis in the heart of the Medina
Review_Text: Known as the smallest five star hotel in Marrakech La Sultana comprises of 5 different riads and is a unique blend of authenticity and luxury right in the heart of the cultural part of the city yet away from the hustle and bustle of the medina. I was staying in one of the suite rooms- the Rhinoceros which is spacious and if you are in Marrakech and want a feel of the place there is no better location than La Sultana which is less than 15 minutes walking distance to Jemaa El Fna and to many of the local restaurants. From the time you are welcomed into the property with a warm cup of Moroccan tea the ambience of the property illustrates the warmth and hospitality with a blend of tranquility and local culture that this amazing city has to offer. Each guest is provided with a handy flyer titled "La Sultana's True Little Gems" - a great compilation of Marrakech's Genuine experiences including historical sites to visit tips for local shopping street food and fine dining restaurant. Not to be missed is the traditional Royal Hammam and Body Scrub at La Sultana so on check-in do fix an appointment to get the Hammam and body Scrub one of the highlights of your stay at La Sultana. If you book your stay through a Traveller Made Private designer such as Namaste Tourism you will also be entitled to unique value adds offered by this amazing SLH property.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: I really enjoy my stay in La Sultana Marrakech. It was a Great surprise! The room was very especial very large and the details were Just amazing my little balcony was sÃ³ charming that I could leave there! The staff are sÃ³ kind And they are always available to help you with a big smille. The SPA of La Sultana is another amazing highlight of the propertie.  The restaurant in the rooftop is very very amazing too. Staying in La Sultana makes you really feel like you are in Marrakech the hotel is very well located it is a Hidden gem in the Medina. I am glad I had the opportunity Of experiÃªncia this Great experiente.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Katherine K wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: My husband and I highly recommend La Sultana if youâ€™re looking for a luxury Riad within the Kasbah. We went for my birthday which was also our first time in Marrakech and in Morocco.    We arranged transfer service through the hotel and despite our delayed flight the driver was still waiting in a clean and air conditioned car. We arrived in the square of the MÃ©dina - it was alive with social life. The bellman led us into a lantern lined walkway to LaSultana. Itâ€™s an oasis of Moroccan design paintings furniture and sculpture as well as craftsmanship.    Our stay was full of lovely memories including sun bathing on the terrace with a plunge pool drinks on the roof terrace at sunset breakfast by the pool and after sightseeing and exploring an afternoon rest in our air conditioned room and comfortable bed.    Saida and Khalid were so helpful in securing taxis reservations and anything we needed. The restaurant team was polite helpful and service throughout the hotel exceeded our expectations. The room was well cleaned towels refreshed sometimes twice a day and the roses were lovely. The food we had was delicious.    Itâ€™s an understatement to say that we have never been so well looked after. Saida arranged for extra roses and rose petals in our room on my birthday and she arranged a delicious lunch at a nearby restaurant and a stroll in their gardens. She arranged dinner and a show and her efforts made the day was a magical memory.    Khalid has boundless energy and enthusiasm for his job and his guests. The bellmen were friendly but shrewd and advised us on the correct amount to pay a taxi for excursions. We canâ€™t thank be team enough for their hard work endless service and the shining memory they have provided. When we come back to Marrakech we will come back to La Sultana.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic stay like becoming a KING
Review_Text: We stayed "Lion" suite In August of 2018. The suites were so solem gorgeous quiet and comfortable. The meal of room service was delicious. We spent long time at the large and fantastic private terrace. The staff were polite elegant and friendly. Our stay was only one night but it was unforgettable experience. I was able to feel like becoming the king of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: A magical hotel attentive to the finest detail. This hotel and riad right in the Medina of Marrakech is one of the most stunningly Riads in Marrakech with an outstanding staff. The spa was Wow as was the staff . Probably the most romantic hotel i have visited.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sylvia K wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: The most spectacular lodging that makes the Moroccan experience a dream
Review_Text: I don't know where to begin with La Sultana. I guess from the beginning. We ordered car service as I heard you cab drivers can try to haggle you and we got in late. They promptly were ready to pick my husband and I up. We arrived and we were blown away by how pretty the riad was. I was just in awe. The butler brought our bags in our room and this palace of a suite was just jaw dropping. From their gold plated sinks to their marble floor and walls to the extremely private quarters you're immersed in we were in awe.    Moving onto the actual facility it was a dream. Every turn is a different room with different themes. Husband and I did a mini photoshoot with our camera because we had never seen such architecture. The rooftop is just as picture perfect as downstairs. Their pool is so pretty. The one at their spa is even more beautiful. Both restaurants have great food. It's quite apparent we maximized our stay here. It was to the point that we couldn't imagine Morocco without La Sultana. We dined at the restaurants and pool and we lounged at the rooftop at night with the cool breeze and live Moroccan weather.    The hospitality was phenomenal. Everyone is very polite. Most everyone can speak English French (main language) Spanish and Arabic. It made it very convenient for us. The spa is great as well. We got a massage here and hammam across the street from here. We hope to visit again and will be telling all our friends and family about this place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were planning on having dinner here but as it was we just enjoyed the cocktails ( no problems it was just more formal than we were looking for ).  Arrived by taxi to be greeted by a friendly doorman and shown through to the hotel entrance. This is up a quiet walkway on red carpet and light by beautiful Moroccan Lamps  Once inside we took the lift to the roof terrace. WOW.
