A stunning location with an open roof and views down to the pool area surrounding streets and other areas of the hotel.  Large intimate seating areas at one side and the restaurant to the other.  They had a great array of cocktails and drinks on offer all averagly priced for this style of establishment  I would definetly reccomend this restaurant ( although we didnt eat on this occassion ) but would definetly come back on another visit to this city
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I spent the first three days of our honeymoon at this lovely hotel. We had the Tigre room - a large quiet and restful haven to retreat to after spending time in the exuberant city. The room was set off an inner courtyard which was cool and peaceful. We enjoyed dinners up on the roof terrace appreciating the cooling wind and amazing specticle of the storks returning to the city to roost for the night. The food was excellent and we really enjoyed getting to know Moroccan food - of the finest quality. Breakfast around the pool was the perfect relaxing start to the day before heading out to explore. The staff were all friendly and attentive ensuring we had everything we needed. Thank you to all the staff who made our visit so wonderful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Brendan B wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: In a city of beautiful hotels this one reigns supreme.
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon in August and we both knew well before we checked out that this was probably the best hotel we've ever stayed in.  Upon arrival until check out and even beyond when we needed help with bookings or recommendations the staff at this hotel were nothing but friendly professional and extremely helpful.  A special thank you must go to Ghizlane who upgraded us for our honeymoon to the Jaguar Suite the nicest room we've ever stayed in. It was a perfect introduction to an amazing country and one that we won't ever forget.  We enjoyed the experience so much that we stayed at the hotel again briefly after we'd finished our road trip around Morocco. Upon arriving back into Marrakech we were quickly reminded just how great hotel service can be. At La Sultana we wanted for nothing. It was worth every penny.  The rest of the staff that we encountered were every bit as gracious and helpful.  Anas Hassan and Saida at the front desk with Ghizlane were amazing and only enhanced an already fantastic stay.  There were so many staff at the hotel that we didn't catch the names of but they all made it a truly beautiful stay.  The facilities are stunning; the breakfast pool rooftop terrace differently themed riads and courtyards room service. We sampled it all and could find fault with any of it.  It's in a great location a quick 10-15 minute walk to Jemma El Fna main square and medina but far enough away from the crowds and noise that it feels like it's only private world the moment you step through the doors.  La Sultana (like Morocco as a country) deserves repeat visits. I hope so get back there as soon as I can. And if you're looking for a hotel in Marrakech don't look any further. This is as good as it gets.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A Riad from a tale of 1001 Nights
Review_Text: The Hotel is located in the Kasba and is very quiet.  The rooms are quiet large and opulent decorated but dark as the only natural light comes from the patio. Take a room with a terrace or balcony on the upper floor as these are much lighter.  Breakfast is ok but not what you would expect from a 5 star.  the restaurant offers a small choice of good Maroccan and European food unfortunately overpriced.  The service is slow but friendly.  The rooftop terrace is lovely and perfect for a drink or lunch or dinner.  The pool is small but sufficient. There are no pool showers.  The Spa offers various treatments and have excellent masseurs. I highly recommend a massage.  On the whole a good stay but expensive.

Wonderful Riad hidden away inside the Medina. We had a wonderful dinner up on the terrace. Staff were extremely attentive friendly we felt very well taken care of throughout our stay. Great location able to walk outside right into the thick of things. Jim O'
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Vin C wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: La Sultana tucked away in one of the bustling streets inside the Medina is the ultimate Moroccan Oasis. We arrived at La Sultana to a smiling staff who welcomed our early arrival and promptly served us mint tea and biscuits. We were checked into the Rhinoceros room located in the decorated white-marbled riad portion of the property equipped with his and her vanities a large Jacuzzi and an over-sized king bed. The centerpiece of the property is the pool that is enclosed in lush greenery with a hanging banana tree. From the pool extend to any of the riads to enjoy different decorations and antiques.    Housekeeping and the maintenance does a wonderful job keeping up after the room and property. The bell hops make sure you know how to get around the city and are able to call taxis instantly.    The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to Jemaa el-Fnaa and the Souks a route my girlfriend and I did day and night with no problems. The new city is about a 10 minute taxi away.    The gym was quite small and the treadmill did not seem to be working. The hotel did provide a converter for our electrical needs. We did not eat at the property as restaurants that lined the streets offered competitive prices.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Spent several days at this splendid Riad close to all the action. Staff couldnâ€™t do enough to make us comfortable. Excellent restaurant with good choice of traditional Moroccan cuisine and wines. Very attentive service. Breakfasts were fabulous. Excellent pool to cool off after trudging the streets in the heat. Highly recommend the concierge. We had one of the suites which was spacious beautifully appointed clean and had everything we needed (even 2 bathrooms!)Couldnâ€™t fault this superb Riad. Will definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Everything was above imagination!! The hotel/riad is located in the middle of old Medina so When you arrive in front of the Entrance and then at the reception you are sceptic and wondering if you arrived in the correct place but after you pass the reception...it is unbelivable what is happening what you see what is hidden in the back of that Doors. In my opinion is the most â€œmorrocanâ€ place that Iâ€™ve seen in this country! At the check-in We were upgraded to a better room so right from the begining we were impresionate and warmly welcomed. In that crazyness and agitation and noises of the old Medina this place is a Oasis of quiet of beautiful of good tastes of traditional luxury. It deserves all the money they ask for the room! ðŸ‘ðŸ¼ðŸ‘ðŸ¼
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jackie B wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: My visit and stay at LaSultana was magical peaceful spiritual and gleefully overwhelming! Saida and all of the staff at the resort made us feel so welcomed and as if we were their personal guests. The resort location is perfect. This was a trip that was a birthday gift from my daughter who was with me on this trip. We plan on making more trips to stay at LaSultana. And would like to plan my daughter's 35th birthday celebration there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Matthew Clark W wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: My daughter and I had a incredible stay at La Sultana last week. The staff and accommodations were perfect and the location could not have been better. We also enjoyed the beautiful art that was all throughout the place. If we ever come back to Marrakesh we are staying at La Sultana!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Naaila G wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: La Sultana Marrakech is the cream of the crop. During my stay I felt like I was staying in a palace. Between the ornate yet subtle decor and details to the remarkable 5 star service from the staff my stay was by far the highlight of my entire vacation. The team is so accommodating and welcoming and goes beyond the extra mile to ensure guests have a memorable experience. Not only is the riad AMAZING but it has a rich history. Saida took my mother and I on a tour of the riad and gave a great history of the place and moroccan culture. This was my first stay at La Sultana but certainly not my last. I decided that I will be visiting Morocco once a year and La Sultana will be the place I call home during every visit. A huge THANK YOU to the entire La Sultana Marrakech team for making this one of the most magical vacations I've ever had.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: La Sultana is definitely one of the best boutique hotels I've ever stayed an authentic Moroccan palace in the middle of Marrakech walking distance from the main square. From the beautifully decorated and comfortable rooms to the amazing swimming pool and incredible rooftop with views to the city everything was perfect. The staff was incredible and surprised me in my Birthday with a celebration over dinner. 100% recommended and I want to go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It is by far the most beautiful hotel we have seen in a long time! Love all the details!Â´  It has 5 different riads and they are all amazing. We really enjoyed the pool and the restaurant was delicious. We will be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jennifer H wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Paradise in the Heart of the Medina!
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I can't say enough good things about our stay at La Sultana Marrakech! Below are some of the highlights from our stay:    The Staff: The staff was extremely friendly and helpful throughout our stay at the hotel. They provided us with maps of the medina and recommendations on stores and restaurants to visit. They were also very amenable to changes in our reservations for dinner and their cooking class. The night before we had made reservations for the cooking class we decided we wanted to spend more time shopping in the medina and cancelling our cooking class reservation at the last minute was no problem at all. We also worked with the hotel to schedule a car pick-up and drop-off to the airport which went very smoothly.    The Hotel: The interior of this hotel is gorgeous!! Each small riad inside has it's own theme and we probably took more pictures of the hotel than we did the medina- it was that beautiful! The pool was also amazing and we enjoyed spending some time poolside with a pot of mint tea each afternoon. The atmosphere throughout the hotel automatically relaxes you upon entry. It is refreshing to walk into such a quiet pristine atmosphere after exploring the hustle and bustle of the medina.    The Room: We stayed in the Gazelle room which was spacious and decorated nicely. The turndown service was appreciated and we loved coming back to the room to find a delicious candied fig on each of our pillows! Air conditioning was important to us in Morocco and our room was always nice and cold upon arrival back at the hotel.    The Spa: We booked the Beldi Signature for the two of us at the spa and enjoyed a traditional hammam 50 minute full-body massage and facial. The spa is beautiful and the hammam massage and facial were very relaxing.    The Rooftop Restaurant: We had dinner at the rooftop restaurant on our first night at the hotel and it was a perfect introduction to Marrakech. Watching the sunset over the medina from the rooftop was unforgettable. The food was delicious and looking back on it we wish we had made more reservations for dinner during our stay as nothing else we ate was as good as the food at the hotel!    The Location: The hotel is located right next to the Saadian Tombs and about a 10-minute walk from Jemaa El Fna and the Souk. It is a perfect jumping off point to exploring the medina by foot.    Overall staying at this hotel really made our experience in Marrakech memorable and we would highly recommend staying here if you are visiting this city!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Since it is located in the Medina it is an easy walk to the souk square and a variety of restaurants. Consider leaving the Medina to experience city life. The lower tier rooms are spacious and comparable to a 4+ star hotel by North American standards.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: alexandra h wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: I stayed at La Sultana in May. I thought.... I treat myself to a bit of luxury.  I should have known.. it started with the airport transfer. They asked 42 euros. I reserved a taxi privately for 10 euro instead. Itâ€™s a 7 min drive from the airport to the hotel.  I booked La Sultana for 1345 euro for 3 nights.  So you should think for that price you can expect a free transfer. (cheaper hotels do have free transfers)  I arrived at 11 at night and a got a dark room with no fresh air.  So I asked for an other room with daylight and windows which I could open for some air.  And noise free.  The manager told me there would be no noise in that room but this was unfortunately not true.  Light came in to the room very early as the curtains were to smallðŸ˜‚  Breakfast was good but Lots of bees on the food and dirty tablecloths.  I felt cheated and lied to; the opposite of what I had expected of my stay.  So  next visit in Marrakech... No Sultana.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Visited earlier this month and couldn't be more pleased with the experience. The hotel is beautiful and unique with a great rooftop bar and restaurant. The service was top notch and the staff was extremely attentive to our needs. The spa was also spectacular. I visited the spa twice and had incredible massages from Meriem. If you intend to get a massage you should request Meriem - you will not be disappointed!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Erin S wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: La Sultana was a wonderfully luxurious spot in the beautiful chaos of Marrakech. I felt like we were on a honeymoon! The pool was gorgeous the rooftop was sublime and our room was huge and so comfortable!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A definite must when in Marrakech
Review_Text: We had booked a table for the rooftop restaurant but it was a very windy evening so our reservation was changed to the ground floor restaurant - which was beautiful.    We got off to a bad start with a drink order mix up but an apology was immediately received by us and the order rectified straight away.    The tables are located around a small swimming pool in amongst beautiful architecture it is just stunning.    The staff were super friendly and efficient and the food was superb.    This Hotel/Restaurant is a hidden treasure and a must to see when in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Robert Gaxiola wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: This hotel was amazing. It was our first time in Marrakech. I booked this hotel after seeing it in a magazine for my honeymoon with my new wife months in advance. Even with all that lead time I still ended up booking the wrong month! That's right the wrong month. But when we showed up they welcomed us with open arms and provided us with a room immediately. They also only charged us for the days we spent there and didn't charge us for the week I had erroneously booked a month earlier by mistake. What a relief that was to me.    Now after our wedding in Bali the Sultana seemed like the perfect getaway and it was. The hotel is gorgeous. The interior design is fabulous and it feels like a true hidden gem inside a very ancient busy city. We hope to return one day. The staff and their attention to us were always friendly and helpful. The location was ideal as it's close enough to walk to the markets and enjoy the city. We will surely stay there again.    I suppose the only negative experience I liked the least was upon our last day the cleaning crew rushed in so fast to clean the room before my new wife physically stepped out of the door. It is never nice to rush a lady. Packing the last minute odds and ends is troublesome enough for anybody but to feel rushed after such a relaxing week was not a great way to send us off.    Aside from that I think anybody staying here will love the amazing rooms the location and the rooftop breakfasts and food.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Julie O wrote a review May 2018
Review_Title: Very nice riad in the medina
Review_Text: It is very peaceful in the middle of the chaos of the medina and well located. The + are the authenticity of the place with a traditional Moroccan architecture the swimming pool in the center of the riad the spa (my husband and I took the sultana signature massage which was amazing) the rooftop terrace which is very beautiful peaceful and relaxing the delicious food at the restaurants (through very pricey for Morocco so not very good value for money the food is excellent). The staff was very friendly and professional. In addition I got sick in the middle of the night and I appreciated the help of the receptionist who offered to send someone to go to get the medicine for me or to call a taxi to send me to a private clinic. The taxi arrived one minute later and I was at the clinic in less than 10min. This was much appreciated and makes the difference. The three minor things that could be improved are: at the reception you might have to wait for 10/15min before to be able to speak to the receptionist as there is only one person which I believe is too long for an hotel of this standing (I never had to do so in any other hotel of the same level) our bathroom smelled sewer during 1 day and the french pastries served at the breakfast are average.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Rooms were excellent with the rooms around a central patio or open area. Very well appointed. The food was very good. Service at all places in the hotel was top-notch. The restaurant situated around an indoor pool was very pleasant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Brittany C wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Everything is fantastic about this hotel! It is an oasis in the hectic city. The location is close to everything. I highly recommend hiring a guide through the hotel. Our guide was a large part of what made our trip so special. Definitely make an appointment with Saida the head concierge for when you arrive. She rearranged our trip for us to make everything work out with minimal stress and maximum relaxation. I also recommend the cooking class. They have a great set up and it doesn't take up a ton of time like other classes. Enjoy!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Ideal Riad-like Stay in Luxury Boutique Hotel
Review_Text: Absolutely great. The layout gives guests the feeling of being in a series of small palaces - really ideal for feeling an authentic medina experience while accessing all of the amenities of a glorious luxury hotel. The spa food and service is outstanding. I would easily stay here again and am eager to visit the seaside property as well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Expensive but its like staying in a renovated palace. Not glitzy and modern but an opulent way to top off the experience of the old city by staying in a hotel that looks like it belongs there. Excellent service good breakfast.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Ususally I do not go to a hotel twice. But LA SULTANA is just so special that I canâ€˜t resist. The adress my room the outstanding atmosphere and especially the wonderful concierge SAIDA! She takes care in such an individual way. I travel a lot all around the world and never had a concierge like her. And at the end the people make you feel good. All my appreciation to this great team at the LA SULTANA in Marrakesh! See you soon again. Marc
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: We just had the pleasure of staying at La Sultana. The riad is a stunning restoration combining several riads into one property. Though combined each riad keeps its own uniqueness. The service and friendliness of the staff enhances the experience. And enjoying breakfast in the courtyard sitting around the pool is a great way to start your day in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis of calm from the intense street life
Review_Text: La Sultana is located perfectly in the centre of the city. All around it is the hustle & bustle of what you would expect from the lively culture that is Moroccan. Once you step away from the street and into the instant quiet of the passage way that leads to the hotel 's front door you feel at once protected and taken care of in the midst of a place and people who's genuine aim is your confort & well being. This hotel has about 4 very distinctive"'Riads " the traditional name for a dwelling built around a central courtyard of peace & tranquility. They join to create a mysterious  intruiging hotel stay where you can feel at times that it's your private hotel so clever is the layout of this liitle gem of a hotel. I had my birthday dinner at the hotel and they created a tasting menu to delight the pallete and fill even the most ambitious of eaters ! The roof terrace deserves a special mention. It's a delight . The swimming pool and breakfast area are also unique with charm & delight. My only regret is that I spent so much time out in the city  away from the very special atmosphere of the hotel and the kind  care and attention of their delightful staff. A real human & touching experience. There are bigger hotels in this city but I would choose the personal & unique feel of "La Sultana" every time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel has one of the nicest rooftop restaurants and bars in Marrakech. The food was sublime and service attentive and friendly. We particularly enjoyed having pre and post dinner drinks out on the bar terrace. Whilst we didnâ€™t stay in the hotel it looked very impressive.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After a long flight from the US this was our first stop in Morocco. It is perfectly situated in Marrakech and immediately welcomed us into the lovely culture. Beautiful hotel â€“ so perfectly Moroccan in an elegant way â€“ gorgeous touches everywhere you look and the staff is so lovely.  Our room on the African floor was quite unique and so much fun â€“ we were immersed in the culture and loved it. We slept like crazy in such a comfortable room â€“ btw â€“ this was the only 5-star hotel we stayed that actually had working air conditioning. Anything you need â€“ a touch away and shows up in your room.  We had dinner the first night at the hotel - kids were fussy about the menu so the chef made whatever they wanted. Luckily we had our first tagine and other Moroccan dishes â€“ all perfectly delicious. It was hard to find another meal that matched the quality of La Sultana dinner.  The only miss-step was having drinks on the rooftop â€“ which by the way is a major highlight of the hotel â€“ overlooking the entire medina and a view of the moon. We found a lovely table and gave ourselves plenty of time to enjoy a cocktail on the roof before our dinner at an outside restaurant. There were only a couple of other people on the roof but the service was so incredibly slow that we were not able to stay and wait any longer for the drinks. We left 30 minutes after ordering with no service even after flagging down the bartender several times and were then yelled at by the waiter. We could have gone to a number of other rooftop bars to enjoy drinks and wish we had â€“ this was the only problem we had in an otherwise fabulous time at La Sultana.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: 5 star luxury, with magical roof terrace.
Review_Text: Impeccable service all staff most helpful whatever you ask! Food excellent but pricey. Beautifully furnished and decorated throughout but beware if you are not very nimble=- stairs are all marble or stone with insufficient handrails.

Review_Title: An oasis of calm in the middle of this atmospheric city
Review_Text: A fantastic stay in the La Sultana Marrakech in March 2018. This place is a luxurious oasis of calm right in the historic heart of the city. When you step outside the hotel itâ€™s like walking into a film set (with all the sights and sounds that Marrakech is famous for); back inside calm is restored.    We had particularly good service from Saida and the rest of the concierge team who were very attentive and helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: First visit here and what can I say the moment you enter you are made to feel special.  We went for lunch on the roof top it was stunning ambiance we had the vegetable club sandwiches and they were beautifully presented the wine was also lovely and the table service was outstanding they even brought us a chair for our handbags.  This place really has the wow factor we were treated so well and I really cant wait to return there. Perfect place for lunch and I guess dinner would be a nice experience also. If you want to be impressed it really is worth a visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Dick E wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: My wife daughter and son-in-law spent four nights at La Sultana in March - and left with a quite satisfied and favorable impression. The rooms were elaborately decorated but still comfortable and functional. The service from Hassan and other members of the team was probably the single most appreciated touch starting with email communications (promptly answered) several weeks in advance of the trip. The calm and smooth functioning of the hotel provides a nice balance with the colorful cacophony of the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My wife and I stayed at La Sultana at the end of a two week trip to Morocco having first visited Essouria on the coast and the mountains before ending up in Marrakesh. Put simply this is one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in. When you step out of your taxi on the busy main street and step into the small quiet lane which leads to the hotel front door it is like stepping into another world. The phrase 'Oasis of Calm' pretty much described the contrast between the busy hubbub of Marrakesh and the luxurious interior of the hotel.  The architecture is wonderful - originally several traditional buildings now merged into one - with exceptional interior decor and a very calm and relaxing atmosphere throughout. the hospitality is first rate and every member of the staff that we dealt with were outstanding. They couldn't do enough for you and any request was dealt with quickly and efficiently with courtesy and a smile. The hotel offers excellent food and wines as you would expect with a rooftop restaurant offering either traditional Moroccan or Modern French cuisine both of which were excellent. I have stayed at a lot of very good hotels. this one was exceptional and i couldn't recommend it highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing Stay at La Sultana Marrakech
Review_Text: La Sultan is a beautiful hotel in the perfect location of the Medina. The staff is warm & welcoming. The rooms are large and comfortable great bathroom as well. The rooftop lounge/bar is beautiful. The spa was incredible & the breakfast delicious!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: The place to be in Marrakech!!
Review_Text: Location: in the Unesco listed madina in Marrakech. A short walk to jemaa al fana square and Saadian tombs.  Facility: a hotel consisting of five chic and luxurious riads. A swimming pool a small gym a spa souvenir shop a restaurant on the swimming pool and another one on the roof top. and. Cooking classes are available at the roof top. Breakfast buffet is provided pool side up to 11 am. They provide local home made sweets for sale I bought some as gifts.  Check in: Saeeda gave a pleasant first impression thanks for a warm welcome.  Room: I checked into two different rooms the first one was too small dark clustered and kind of depressing. I asked for an upgrade and paid the difference to a bigger room with brighter colors in bahia riad.  Conciege: very attentive.  House keeping: consistent but not too generous.  Over all: a very nice authentic special hotel in the heart of old madina. Being there feels like being in a fairy tale house. However one thing that I thought the hotel lacked was generosity for example complimentary water is given only at check in and after you have to pay for it. I just canâ€™t remember the last time I paid for water in a hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Great 4 day stay with family (teenagers included). Food was fantastic and the service level was on par with the best. Location is great and in the middle of everything but quiet once you are inside. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Svetlana G wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: Palacial Luxury in the best areas of Marrakesh
Review_Text: Fantastic hotel more like staying in a palace. The ambiance of the place is unbelievable staff could not be more helpful. Great breakfasts and most romantic dinners around the beautiful pool area.  We will definitely stay there again if we come back to Marrakesh!    Thank you so much for making our stay so special!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gudmundur P wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: My wife and me stayed a week in February celebrating 20 years of our marriage.  We were a bit surprised entering a small lobby. We were met by people that greeted us most warmly. Since our room wasn't ready (we arrived at ten a.m.) they offered Hammam treatment free of charge.  The room was exceptionally beautiful with rose leaves on the bed and in the bathroom. We had dinner the first night. Service impeccable and the food fantastic.  Next day we made a trip to the Atlas mountains. On the third day we were offered a guide in Marrakesh the really showed us places that tourist don't know of. The same night we celebrated over a dinner at the hotel. All of the waiters gathered around us an sang a Moroccan melody.  We have traveled all over the world an often stayed at five star hotels. Never have been met in such a way as in La Sultana
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: La Sultana is wonderful - the dates and almond milk on arrival followed by mint tea on the terrace inspiring interior design the smell of orange blossom and fresh roses scattered in every riad the incredible location overlooking the Saadien tombs and the staff who couldn't have been more friendly or conscientious. It was so good that we didn't leave until dinner on the first day and spent three blissful hours in the spa. November was a lovely time to travel - we had bright skies and sunshine without it being too hot.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We really enjoyed our 4-night stay in this beautiful hotel very conveniently located in the old city. 1001-night dÃ©cor. Great staff. We had also an amazing dinner and lunch at the onsite restaurant. For another night they suggested we try restaurant Riad Monceau which was just pure bliss. Highly recommended too. All in all we had a fantastic stay in Marrakech and would love to come again asap.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Johanna B wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: The hotel atmosphere was exquisite the spa was blissful and SaÃ¯da at the front desk made sure we had the best experience possible in Marrakech and in the Atlas mountains according to our interests by giving us extra personal time and made sure we were as comfortable as could be. Our room could not have been more spacious and clean and attention was put on little details such as fresh fruit Moroccan pastries and rose petals in the bathroom and dates on the bed in the evening. However service in the restaurant could have been more efficient and other personnel at the front desk seemed less attentive to our needs and lacked knowledge of options of places to visit or to eat. All should follow Saida's example.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a review which has been due for some time. The memories of going there are still full of life after almost one year. There is no fault to this hotel. It is located within the walls of the ancient medina and you can have a direct look on the courtyard of one Marrakechâ€™s greatest attractions - the Saadian tombs (donâ€™t miss them if youâ€™re there they are fabulous).    Early April is an extraordinary time to visit. The weather is still pleasant during the day (30 degrees max) and is great during the morning. Staff told us that they had just opened the breakfast terrace as the week before the weather was still cold to eat outside.    Concierge are always ready to help. However for organised tours and airport transfers I think one may find much less expensive options if looking on the internet without necessarily losing on quality.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Tranquil luxury inthe heart of the medina
Review_Text: La Sultana is an oasis of peace and tranquillity located in the Medina and when you are inside it is easy to forget you are in heart of a vibrant working city. The property is made up of 5 riads all with their individual style and design so if you want something specific do check the hotel website and check the style which most suits your faste. The suites are fabulous all with their own theme and some stunning bathrooms. They are spacious and as well as the sitting area inside your suite there are sitting areas outside as well were you can utilise the in-room dining. The restaurant is either by the pool in the winter when we stayed or on the roof terrace. Round the pool is a great experience and the breakfast choices are good especially the various preserves on offer European and Moroccan. Dinner is also very special with a great menu. The pool is a good size and is very pretty in its design. The roof terrace is a must as you can sit in the sun watch the sunset over the roof of Marrakech and also peer over the balustrade and watch daily Marrakech life which is fascinating to see. We went for a special occasion and everythig was done to make our visit memorable. Overall a great location and a fabulous hotel we will definitely be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chris S wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Title: Making our first trip to Marrakech 5 star
Review_Text: This place truly is unique. My wife and I came here for our babymoon. Best decision we made. From the establishment itself to the staff everything felt magical. The rooms were amazing. The rooftop was incredible for sunrise and sunsets as well as afternoon lounging. We can't say enough about how accommodating polite and respectful the staff was. Coming back from the hustle and bustle of the city to a literal oasis made the trip. The detail of La Sultana is unlike anything I've ever seen. That goes for Morocco as a whole but they spared no expense making this place incredibly peaceful and relaxing. The food was incredible as well and didn't leave much to be desired. Every morning we sat by the pool and watched the birds chirp about while sipping tea and picking breakfast from a 5 star spread. My personal favorite as the steak and eggs tagine. I ate it every single morning :)    Thanks again to the staff. We can't wait to come back.    - Chris and Masha
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have been here twice once before child and now with our toddler. We love it! The riads are beautifully decorated each unique from the other and worth a tour in and of themselves. The staff is super attentive at breakfast and throughout the day. The spa provides wonderful treatments that I wish were available back home. For example the Royal Hammam treatment feels authentic and gives amazing results to your skin. This hotel is one of the main reasons we thought to return to Marrakech. We like Mamounia too but La Sultana is more private and intimate. We spent all day yesterday just sitting on the roof terasse in the sun (20 degrees) with no one else around but us. The main pool is heated so next time Iâ€™ll bring our bathing suits. We are definitely curious to try La Sultanaâ€™s beach hotel in Oualidia one day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Emma A wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: We booked La Sultana on a whim without really knowing the riad hotel. It was the best decision! The hotel is five riads together and the whole place is stunning. There were so many highlights. The food is wonderful the atmosphere is elegant and calm. We were upgraded to a deluxe suite and it was beyond words - just so beautiful. The pinnacle for us was the staff. Each and every one from the doormen to the concierge to the wait staff to the cleaners - every one had a genuine smile and they could not do enough for us. Every restaurant recommendation was spot on Special mention goes to Halid who was just the loveliest man who got to know each of his guests and made sure our stay was beyond anything we could have hoped for. Another highlight was the Oud player who entertained at dinner in the hotel. Sat across the well lit swimming pool he lulled us beautifully as we ate our way through the sublime menu. I cannot recommend this place highly enough. The weather was unseasonably cold and the hotel did everything they could to ensure it was warm and welcoming and not impacted at all by the weather. The view from the roof top terrace of the snow-capped Atlas mountains was awesome. La Sultana is literally a walk to the Jamar al Fnar and a little oasis of calm in a bustling vibrant extraordinary city. I now cannot imagine staying anywhere else when we return (again and again) to Marrakech. Thank you La Sultana!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Serene setting , unbelievable attention to detail , smiling faces . Marrakech at its best.
Review_Text: Beautifully decorated room  comfy bed  roses everywhere  exquisite meals  a great location in the Medina  most friendly and helpful staff and the poolside breakfast made my two-night stay at La Sultana an affair to remember.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Superb stay in quiet luxury in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: I spent a long weekend at La Sultana with a friend in January and loved every minute of it. The riads are beautiful each one with its specificities the huge rooftop terrasse offers superb views of the Altas and the Medina and overlooks the famous Saadian Tombs and the Spa is lovely and intimate.  Our Suite was great very spacious and confortable very quiet and the jacuzzi was a nice bonus.  Breakfast was really delicious very fresh organic and homemade perfect start for the day. Lunch and Dinner were very good too and what a nice setting around the swimming pool in the main Riad's courtyard! Charming at night.  We were treated like princesses from start to finish little attentions all along the staff is very kind helpful and discreet. The Concierge helped us get a last minute reservation at Comptoir Paris Marrakech which was fully booked.    To summarise : fantastic intimate palace in the Medina of Marrakech. Thanks again for this fantastic stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Rob F wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: I had a very comfortable two-night stay at La Sultana and the staff could not have been friendlier. Saida the head concierge is a treasure. She arranged for me to bypass the Majorelle Garden line even though I was checking out of the hotel and she can help with private access to other sights in town. She's super helpful and has a great sense of humor. I also had a lovely time dining by the pool and had a very relaxing treatment in the hammam. My room had a little wear in places but it barely mattered because the general setting was so lovely and the staff was so great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: This hotel must be the best hotel in Marrakesh by far. The decoration and layout makes you feel as if you are in another time and with the spa Adds such a luxurious touch. You are transported to another world and i recommend staying in the zebra room.  Book a massage at the hamman spa and dinner in the evening. Breakfast is stunning and skylight bring so much light to dinning area by the pool. You have to stay here if you visit Marrakesh.  Highly highly recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is very nice decorated the rooms are very clean and the staff is extremely helpful. It is for sure not cheap but it's worth the money. The location is close to the Medina. It's very quiet in the rooms.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Phil H wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Friendly helpful staff. Peaceful even though located in the heart of the kasbah. Great Moroccan food and wine. Beautiful views of the Atlas mountains from the roof terrace.The Hammam was a real experience and definitely not to be missed. Would happily return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Liz B wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Title: Beautiful and Unique Hotel with a Lovely Rooftop
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at La Sultana for three days in January 2018. The hotel itself is very interesting in that it is a combination of multiple riads that were melded together. Each section has been gorgeously decorated with various regional historical styles (Moroccan sub-Saharan African Moorish etc.). Each section has a well-decorated central courtyard and a sitting area.    Though we did not get to take much advantage of it due to the season a great feature of this hotel is the luxurious yet comfortable rooftop where you can take tea or have a cocktail in the evening. This area has nice sitting areas and a good view of the Atlas range and the Kasbah Mosque. We did get to take advantage of the spa and it was fantastic! I highly recommend the hammam treatment.    The room we had in the Moroccan wing (the Peacock) was comfortable and was beautifully decorated with the highlight being a stunning bathroom. We had dinner many of the nights by the central pool which dinner service was serenaded by a lute player and the wait staff was very attentive. The meal options were Moroccan and French so it was nice to be able to alternate.    The front desk staff were very pleasant and responsive and we felt they took good care of us.    All in all I would say that La Sultana is a visual delight and a comfortable place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great but not super luxe, we expected more personal touch.
Review_Text: Through a small alley you enter the hotel reception which is not so nicely designed. But entering the premises a labyrinth of beautiful spaces follows with as centerpiece the nice heated pool. We got a nice spacious room in the pool area but that also meant you had to close doors and windows to have privacy and therefore felt a bit 'locked-in' and dark. We used the pool that was nice and had breakfast that had some good eggs benedict on the menu. On departure we asked for a transfer that is normally included in 5 star hotel stays in Marrakech but we apparently asked for it too late and the price was 480 Dirham for a special car. By taxi it was 150 Dirham...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Outstanding family visit to beautiful hotel.
Review_Text: The hotel is located in the heart of the medina close to great sights and shopping. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated and our rooms were spacious and comfortable. We highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great experience in a great and historic city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The atmosphere of this riad is unique in the world. It feels like living in an ancient Sultan palace. Furthermore it is an oasi where you can rest from the caos of the city. Explore all its rooms will be very interesting. The hammam is the icing on the cake!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I stayed at La Sultana for our 25th wedding anniversary. The hotel is a beautiful calming oasis in the Medina. Great rooms food and most of all very helpful friendly staff. Can't say enough about how welcoming they made us feel. I recommend a guide if its your first visit. Ask the hotel to book Sami who studied history at university and is extremely knowledgable. We visited a few of the well known 5 star hotels and riads but concluded La Sultana was the right choice.  We are looking forward to our next stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: This hotel is one the very best I have ever stayed at
Review_Text: This Hotel is wonderful - the rooms are full of charmluxury and warmth - with lots of lovely little places to sit drink and chat- there is a great feeling of relaxation inside ...the decoration inside is so beautiful. The staff are all very friendly and helpful -... this is the second time I have stayed at this hotel & on this occasion I was given an unexpected upgrade - either because I was a returning customer or maybe because they simply had a spare upgrade room - I'm not sure why but I was exceptionally happy with my room - there was a fantastic wooden window over my large bath that opened out into a little cushioned seating area with massive beautiful wooden windows opposite - when they were all open you could lie in the bath and look out into the court yard and hear all the birds - it was wonderful... we even had Clarins minis for free toiletries.... The hotel is brilliantly located - near to all the shops and the big square but also hidden away down a side street so it's quiet & a great escape from the noise & franticness outside. My room was fantastic. the breakfast brilliant . the staff great - my only gripe was that the bar was not open - the last time I came there was a great little bar in the hotel but it was closed for refurbishment - it would also have been nice to have had tea and coffee making facilities in the room which they didn't have but it didn't really matter because they brought coffee to the room if you called the reception - I would totally totally recommend this place to anyone - it is wonderful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: manar s wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: I book this hotel by mistake and I'm glad I did this hotel probably has the best staff ever. they are extremely nice and friendly. and the roof top view is fantastic break fast is magical. and the location is perfect
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Patrick S wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Title: A dive in to a dream
Review_Text: The Hotel is actually a RIAD in within several Riads. The reception is rather small considering the size of the rest of the Hotel. The location is maybe a bit difficult to find and to get to but when it comes to be close to what is really worthy to be seen a top location. All rooms dining room and amenities are spectacular. The Hotel offers a dive into the oriental world at its best. The food is very good and alone spending a night at the dining hall is a worth wile experience. All the staff from the Director to the bell boy are very friendly and helpful. It is recommendable for all who want to experience a very luxurious and one of a kind stay. It comes though at a proud price.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Maxime D wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: An amazing 5 Stars Hotel with such a subtile elegant taste of decoration.  Spending time in this Hotel was a real moroccan cultural experience!  Located in a safe and very central part of Marrakech.  I highly recommand people it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: This is an extraordinary beautiful hotel with fantastic amenities and views. Every inch is visually unique. At all times you feel very safe and welcomed. The one downside is that every aspect of the service from the food to the drinks to the front desk is incredibly slow. Come equipped with patience. All and all very great. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful Riad in a convenient location
Review_Text: This is in a great location close to the Medina and Jemaa El Fna. The rooms are very quiet and comfortable and the staff is friendly. The spa offers good services. From the rooftop bar you can see into the Medina hear the calls to Mecca and enjoy traditional mint tea or a glass of wine. My only complaint would be that when at 11 on our last day there the housekeeping staff came in to our rooms starting to clean and prepare for the next guests without warning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My husband and I recently stayed at this amazing GEM of a hotel in Marrakech. Located inside the old town it is a perfect riad to have a holiday! Once inside the hotel you are mesmerized by the decor of the hotel and almost felt fairy tale like. Needless to say the service was excellent..everyone from the reception staff to the restaurant. We couldn't fault anything. We stayed in the pelican room which was beautiful and we used the spa facilities twice which was an amazing experience too. It is walking distance from the big market and you can get a taxi right outside the hotel to go out of the old city. Thank you wafa saida Xavier Khalid and everyone else. We will always remember this wonderful trip and all of you! And to all reading this review...we highly recommend this hotel...I promise you won't be disappointed ðŸ˜Š
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: emanuele c wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: A truly memorable experience. We have been pampered like Kings!  We warmly recommend the hotel and we will certainly go back.  The decoration and service are outstanding and the location is just spot on.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Cedric B wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Title: Paradise in the middle of Marrakech
Review_Text: Arriving at la sultana hotel was like a movie scene red carpet and well decorated entrance made me feel like being in Aladinâ€™s movie. The air was perfumed with some orange scents and the rich colourful interior projected me even further in my dreams of adventurer.  I love everything about the hotel the location was impressive in the heart of Marrakech and yet being in the hotel felt like being in the oasis of calm and peacefulness. The rich deco and the attention to details were breathtaking!  The only downside is that we did not stay there long enough ! I recommend this hotel to anyone and strongly recommend to stay as long as you can ! One day is not enough to see it all

Review_Title: In the midst of chaos is a hidden sanctuary
Review_Text: Fantastic boutique hotel the service was outstanding and the staff are amazing and attentive who are always ready willing and happy to help! Would happily recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a central base to explore the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: by OSQUARE wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: La Sultana Marrakech a great getaway is Marrakech. The moment you enter the hotel you will understand why we call it AMAZING. Especially the pool is breathtaking! We could lay down and chill on the sunbeds the whole day.. Sounds like a waist of a precious Marrakech day but when you are in such gorgeous surrounding where else would you rather be?! You can have lunch around the pool and just enjoy the sun. They also have the most gorgeous spa where you can enjoy a hamman treatment and a good massage. We had the signature treatment and it was definitely one of the best days ever! Definitely recommend that when visiting Marrakech. Plus all of that the food is also super good and tasty. So if you donâ€™t feel like leaving the hotel its totally fine! You will have the best time â¤
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Daniel E wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Title: Our stay at La Sultana Marrakech
Review_Text: La Sultana was recommended to us by friends and my wife & I were delighted we took their advice. The service was outstanding and the staff were welcoming friendly and couldn't do enough for us.  The accommodation was presented beautifully and the food was great. The location was perfect and within walking distance of all the main attractions.  Be sure to book a Royal Hammam in advance as the Spa and treatments are well worth taking advantage of.  We highly recommend La Sultana Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: La Sultana is really one of the most unique and most historical retreats we have ever been to. From the moment you are entering the small walkway to the entrance of the hotel we felt like being part of a fairytale of 1001 nights.    The stuff was very friendly and supported us in any kind of way. The welcome was warm and friendly. We had to wait a short while for our room but it didn't feel like a little while as we received a great cup of the Moroccan famous mint tea and we were discovering this amazing place all over.    Than our suite was ready and when we opened the door of our "Camel" suite we entered another world. This room is such an amazing experience. The passion for detail is amazing and we really haven't seen something similar before. It really blowed our minds away. The bathroom was like a secret treasure from another century (have a look at our pictures). We felt like an Arabian King and Queen during our stay with the "La Sultana".    In the evening we decided to have dinner on the beautiful rooftop terrace with outstanding views over the Medina. The food and service were exzeptionell as well and we really enjoyed our time up there.    After we had a wonderful breakfast in the Morning sun at another part of the rooftop terrace we booked a very famous treatment called "Royal Hamam" - Guys it was one of the most relaxing and purifying experience for our body and soul. The Spa stuff was super friendly are amazing in what they are doing. We can totally recommend this fantastic treatment and hope to get the next opportunity to find total tranquility at the Spa of "La Sultana" - Congratulations to this extraordinary job!    Overall we very much enjoyed our time in one of the most epic resorts we ever been to and would like to thank the whole team of La Sultana for their amiable nature and their unlimited kindness. We can TOTALLY recommend this place and hope to be back very soon!    Honestly if you need the pure Arabian luxury experience don't miss the chance to stay with them.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Terry M wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: La Sultana is by far and away one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. The great location within the city is one thing but the ambiance and the decor of the La Sultana is exceptional. As well the service was amazing. In particular Saida the manager was most engaging and very helpful with any inquiry or needs that we had and as well her staff were tremendous. Everyone went out of their way to make our stay as memorable as possible.The restaurants within the hotel were very good and again the service was both friendly and professional. The rooms were spacious and very well appointed. We would highly recommend the La Sultana to anyone and everyone who wants to stay in a great hotel in a great city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I knew Riads were beautiful but I didnâ€™t think they could be this beatiful. La Sultana is actually 5 different riads connected so you get to experience different decor and style..So if you are into Moroccon decor and want to get a sense for more than just your hotel this place is perfect! Plus the rooftop terrace has the perfect view of the city and the pool is refreshing clean and instagram worthy. On top of that the service was great (they greeted us with tea and sweets while we waited for our room!). Itâ€™s a bit pricey but totally worth it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: francisco s wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: This small hotel is located in the heart of the Kasbah. From the moment you enter you feel that you travelled back in time to a Morrocan Palace.  This hotel has a sister in Oualidia that is also fantastic.  The rooms are great service excellent perfect atmosphere.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Very pretty, peaceful, superb service and a really convenient spot.
Review_Text: I can be a tough customer from time to time because I love good customer service cleanliness and authenticity.    From the moment we arrived I can only say great things about this placeincluding but not exhaustive...    The reception concierge team especially Mr Morocca/Tunisia. Your initial welcome intelligence and customer service is sheer class (and we have travelled to many places) you are an enormous credit to the Riad. Your boss (lady) is also warm engaging and truly welcoming.    The views layout and decor of the roof terrace. Sublime place to relax sleep and eat. Really this terrace is a perfect spot. You can see the great mosque and marrakech sunset extraordinaire here.    Our suite - the Swan.  Deeply relaxing with every amenity you need spacious with an incredibly comfortable bed. Lovely bed linen and a truly wonderful bathroom... See photos of bath below...    Food though we only ate in the hotel once outside of breakfast it was magnificent. Really yummy and beautiful presentation.    Location wise it's right next door to the royal tombs a five minute walk to the markets...    I enjoyed this hotel immensely and will definitely come back when we visit Marrakech    Thanks for a lovely stay :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kamila M wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Stay in the La Sultana hotel made my trip to Marrakech even more special. The place is hidden treasure. The grande and luxurious decore is thought into the last detail. The place is beautiful and sitting at the roof top teracce for delicious breakfast watching the surrounding oriental buildings is just an experience on its own. But the most wonderfull is the devoted staff. They made us feel almost home with their friendly attentive helpfull attitude always ready to provide guest with top quality service. Above all the front desk manager/concierge Saida who recommended us all the marvelous places to visit and fabulous reastaurants to eat. I am coming back soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: KRISTIANA C wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Right in the heart of the city inside the walls there is a small opening which leads you to paradise.  As soon as we arrived we thought it must be wrong- our hotel cannot be here in the middle of these streets....but immediately the door boy came in his traditional costume and showed us the way to reception. Everything since then were magical.......top service- best breakfast-top food- spa - staff- details ðŸ‡²ðŸ‡¦- everything .  Will go back very soon!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I have travelled to some amazing places and am very grateful for that. What is superb about La Sultana are the teams of people that run this beautiful hotel. Every single person we came across were more than happy to help assist and advise. There is so much to do in Marrakech if you want to. Equally you can just do nothing but laze around. Once you enter the walls of the hotel you come across the peace all you can hear is trickling of the fountainsthe smell of rose water and the odd door shutting. So many corners to discover. Upstairs on the terrace you can catch some sunshine have a mint tea take a cooking class or just laze around reading a book.  What we liked to do was get a glass of something cold and wet and watch the sun go down. The hotel isnâ€™t really suitable for young children (ok for babies)  Dinner is served around the pool which is on the ground floor. This time of year it gets rather nippy in the evenings so I advise taking slightly warmer clothing for the evenings. The hotel do provide lovely warm blankets for you to wrap up warm. The food is both traditional Moroccan and also European. We found there to be a rather nice selection of wine including Moroccan which I have to say was rather nice.    I have visited Morocco many times including Marrakech. The people of Morocco are extremely friendly I have to say that the people at La Sultana were amazing. I can highly recommend this hotel and the people that run it.    Give it a try you wonâ€™t be disappointed .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: amazing stay in an amazing property with a lovely staff
Review_Text: Everything was top notch.. highly recomend staying here..Amazing property in the heart of the medina. Use the recommended guide... he will show you around the REAL Marrakech ! The manager was very helpful and makes things work. <3
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful dining terrace overlooking the medina
Review_Text: We had a premier deluxe room which is the smallest they have but was still very beautiful. It was a bit dark because of the lack of exterior windows but otherwise comfortable. The highlight of this hotel was the variety of public spaces for relaxing. This includes the pool area and various courtyards but especially the rooftop terrace. Breakfast and dinner are served here and it is beautifully lit at night. The staff are excellent and very friendly and helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed two nights. Our room was spacious & comfortable. Beautiful rooftop restaurant & bar overlooking the medina but felt like worlds away from the bustle. Lovely buffet breakfast. We had an excellent dinner in the restaurant although drink staff were slow. Check your account when you leave we were overcharged for a purchase & found it very difficult to rectify.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We were taken by wonderful friends for a 50th bday trip there was 10 of us. We all had gorgeous rooms  the hotel is beyond stunning and the staff and their service was of the highest level. Nothing was too much trouble. We have been to marrakesch 4 times before but had never had the privilege of staying there.... Now we will never be able to stay anywhere else. Ps Cocktails and canopies on the roof is a must do before dinner. You have to see it to believe it ! Just trust me and book you wonâ€™t be disappointed ðŸ˜Š
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Anton V wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: We only got to stay for 4 nights and I could have easily stayed a week. Two rooms one a suite and both were fantastic. We loved the hotel.    On arrival there were two bell hops/greeters out on the street and good thing. Our taxi driver was lost and we got lucky to drive past the greeters. They took care of us got our luggage out helped me figure out what to pay and whisked us up the walkway and into La Sultana. Yes I tipped them well on the spot.    Our room bath and the entire property was just exquisite. Quiet beautifully decorated and refined. Easy to find a private nook to read a book or daydream.    The breakfast presentation was a highlight of the day. Great food and really great coffee.    We leaned on the front desk staff for dining and tour recommendations. They helped us with some outstanding evenings at a Riad style restaurant.    We'll be back. La Sultana is worth a return trip just to relax inside the quiet walls.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ed S wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: This is one of the top properties I've stayed at in my lifetime of travel. The property itself is stunning. There are 4 riads that make up La Sultana. Each decorated in a unique motif. The property also has stunning common areas from the spa to the pool to our favorite the roof top bar restaurant and lounge area. Have drinks and dinner here. Then in the morning as the sun comes up you will have breakfast in a separate roof top area looking out across the minarets of the city.My favorite part of this lovely property is the staff. From the conceirge(s) who were so helpful especially Hussan and Saida to the omnipresent bell staff to the breakfast servers who remember your menu preferences from the day before. We especially loved Miriam who could not have been more helpful. Do yourself a favor and stay at this unique lovely property.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Diti F wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: We stay at La Sultana hotel and spa. Its clean and uniq hotel to stay...feel like home..the staff really friendly and polite. The spa is good and cozy. The lighting in every room is not bright...u will feel like in the middle of century...mysterius...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We stayed one night at La Sultana. It was one of the best experience for me. The hotel is very beautiful peaceful and luxurious. The room is decorated nicely. Amazing! In the morning breakfast served on the terrace with a nice view. There is everything in the room you need when you go to the hotel from A to Z. The hotel has thought of everything for you. Also location is very good and easy to reach everywhere. We had an amazing stay in La Sultana and we were very satisfied. I highly recommend here to everyone who loves the luxury concept.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: One of the most stunning hotels I have ever stayed in
Review_Text: This is one of those places where as soon as you arrive you mentally start planning a return trip. I have no words for how beautiful the decor and design is. As you can see from the photos it's not done up in a typical "luxury" style but is traditional Moroccan with eclectic elements. Even the tiniest details are done to perfection. The hotel combines several riads each with its own personality. I can't remember the name of the riad we stayed in but I do remember the African riad (at least that's what I believe it's called) which is where I would want to stay next time. Those rooms have balconies and a hot tub in the central courtyard and in my opinion it is the most beautiful out of all the riads. The staff is friendly and helpful. The food is good but not spectacular...but then again I didn't stay here specifically for the dining. The location is close to all -- easily walkable to the Bahia Palace Djema al-Fna and Koutoubia mosque and next door to the Saadian tombs although you will need to take a cab to get to the Majorelle Gardens. We were originally going to stay in Selman Marrakech when this property had no availability for our dates but Selman cancelled on us at the last moment and an availability opened up in La Sultana and I am so glad it worked out that way. All in all a must-stay for anyone visiting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Miriam I wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Title: La Sultana Spa a Paradise in Marrakech
Review_Text: A royal experience that will make you feel so pampered and renewed. The staff and the facilities are outstanding. You can buy all the products that are used during your visit.  Do not miss it!    Srinivas and Miriam
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is one of the most beautiful hotels I have stayed in. It is full of art and antiques and the architecture is stunning. The service is top-notch. The breakfast is excellent and offered in a lovely rooftop setting. Despite this there are a few issues which warrant improvement in my opinion. The pool is situated in a courtyard. It is not a very large pool area and there is no air-flow yet smoking is allowed. One afternoon we tried to relax and were accosted with cigarette smoke from a group sitting at a table in the pool courtyard who must have chain-smoked the entire afternoon. It was so unpleasant. There is a spacious rooftop at La Sultana and I feel that smoking should be limited to the rooftop area. Also we had a suite with a third bed in a loft area. My daughter who lives in Marrakech wanted to stay with us for convenience. The hotel charged a whopping 90 Euro per night on top of our room price (almost $800 per night to begin with). Seemed a bit steep for a set of twin sheets and an extra towel. Overall though we had a wonderful stay at La Sultana.

Review_Date: Cynthia L wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Title: A wonderful GEM inside the Medina
Review_Text: I was beyond thrilled with my stay in this gorgeous friendly small luxury boutique hotel!  The staff are most gracious helpful and friendly! They will help in any way possible!    The rooms lovely the pool gorgeous and the spa beyond amazing! I had the most wonderful massage!!!  I would stay here again and was sad to leave!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: 6 Star Boutique Hotel! Magical and Spectacular!
Review_Text: We entered off a road of hustling vendors and excitement into the tranquility of La Sultana Marrakech. What a fabulous treat. We were greeted with such friendliness along with the most incredible fresh almond milk and the tastiest dates ever! We have traveled to many fine hotels around the world and La Sultana is at the top of the list. The quaint courtyards are circled with chaises to relax around a pool. We had two suites that were outstanding and side by side to make it easy for us traveling with a friend. We had cocktails dinner and breakfast on the rooftop and everything was outstanding. The greatest disappointment was we only had one night to stay because we were due back at our ship the following day. Our next visit will be much longer to enjoy every aspect of La Sultana. Our gratitude to all the wonderful staff at La Sultana for making our short 24 hour stay so memorable. Fabulous location!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I have travelled many places but this is not like anywhere I have ever stayed. It is NOT a hotel. It is a Riad (palace).  It is a magical place with all kinds of hidden rooms (all of which are unique).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We had one dinner at the restaurant on the rooftop and we really enjoied the food and the wine. The location is amazing: the hotel is wanderfull and all the details of the interior design are precious. TOP
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Best hotel on our 14 day trip
Review_Text: There are many fancy large hotels and high quality places to stay in Fes but if you want a great hotel in the old town this a a great choice. It is relatively small but the rooms and grounds of the hotel are great and the service is top notch.    Highly recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: John P wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: This is type best restaurant that I ate at during my visit to Marrakech. It is fine dining so the prices are not cheap but the food is quality at its very best. I had the tasting menu and a half bottle of wine and the bill came to 930 dirham but it was worth it for a treat. The restaurant itself is very tasteful and the staff were wonderful. If you can afford a special treat then I would highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Page J wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: Beautiful Property - spa and rooftop are a must!
Review_Text: This hotel has 3 different Riads each with their own special character. We came for a calming hammam and massage and ended up staying for a relaxing bottle of Moroccan wine on the rooftop terrace. Highly recommended for a relaxing day in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Basel A wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: The charm is in its people
Review_Text: I'm usual not a fan of funky or authentic places while on business however this places rally won over my heart. Saeeda and her staff members so much care of us to a point where I felt like I was in my own home. Their kindness left an impression on us that resonates.    Also one thing that really impressed me is the ambient music selection in the pool quarters. Wow!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful boutique hotel with a very nice and quiet atmosphere just a few minutes from the medina centre. Very very nice and helpful staff always committed to make our stay a very special one. Very spacious room properly cleaned. Restaurant and bars in the roof top offer memorable moments with nice view the sky above and very good service and food. I and my family are very happy with our choice and we suggest this hotel to those who look for special places. We shall came back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Egeli Gezgin Ege wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: We stayed for a night in La Sultana. The hotel is very beautiful and peaceful especially the pool area. The service was super I feel like a princess. A quiet and luxurious property where the staff and management are very attentive and kind. The room was vary enormously in size luxury and nicely decorated. I offered incredibly relaxing and comforting. The food was also excellent breakfast were delicious with nice view. Very good location easy to walk many main attractions. In my opinion this is an absolutely fantastic hotel.  I had the best hotel experience in La Sultana. I am really happy to choose La Sultana. Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The staff at la sultana went above and beyond to help make our vacation a success. They helped book reservations around town and were incredibly attentive. The location was also perfect super walkable. From the very beginning it was a dream we stayed in "puma" it was spacious and gorgeously decorated. The restaurant was delicious and the vibes of the rooftop dining experience made for a super romantic evening. We also really enjoyed the spa- go for the hammam to start your spa experience totally worth it!! 10/10 would stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful boutique hotel. The amenities were great and the staff were deeply committed to making every aspect of our stay wonderful.  The location was convenient to the square and other sites. We had a fantastic vacation in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Laila C wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: Little piece of paradise in Marrakech
Review_Text: Beautiful property with amazing art and amenities; including pools cooking classes & traditional hammam/spa. Property has a gorgeous rooftop where meals are served and a very accommodating staff- hope to be back soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Francisco AndrÃ© wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Being the first time in Marrakesh we wanted to stay at an authentic Riad within the Medina - the cityâ€™s old town. Soon enough we decided La Sultana was the appropriate hotel for us and even though we had very high expectations they were absolutely surpassed.    Down a very small alley near the busy market street you are greeted by a carpet and lantern lined entry. Impressive doors open to welcome you to the small reception where the staff is waiting to ensure every moment of your stay is faultless. And it was indeed.    Each room dÃ©cor reflects that of the Riad ours was an amazing suite called Buffalo. With a huge bed on a marble platform fireplace a loft seating area and not to forget the luxury bathroom with jacuzzi. Made-up of five separate Riads no detail is forgotten. On the top of that La Sultana is managed and taken care of by some exceptional staff that deliver amazing service.    At the gorgeous Sultana Spa we tried the Royal Hammam followed by 50-minute signature massage and it was an amazing experience. We also recommend trying the Moroccan tasting menu at the restaurant which during the summer has a very romantic setting at the terrace but doesnâ€™t keep up with the quality of the rest of the hotel in my honest opinion. On the other hand breakfast are varied and simply delicious.    Overall it was such a memorable stay at a top-notch hotel. Hopefully weâ€™ll be back very soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a stylish hotel with exceptional customer service great food and wonderful rooms. The five riads that make up the hotel contain 28 guest rooms a roof top terrace restaurant and bar and plenty of nooks and crannies to relax or meet with friends. The location via a short and private laneway is very central and entry from the circular road surrounding the medina is very easy. The heat of the Marrakech day is quickly swept aside when night falls but the close proximity of the rooms means that the open windows allow little privacy from the neighbours. You do of course have the option of bolting the door and closing the shutters with a vigorous air-conditioner to wash away the day's heat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I stayed at la Sultana with a tour group in May and it was absolutely spectacular. So stylish comfortable and spacious and the staff is incredible!!!!    I especially liked the pool and the rooftop.  Total perfection. Of course my room was really beautiful too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed in La Sultana Marrakech this summer 2017 and OMG it was impressive in all senses. It's a boutique hotel with 28 rooms or so (not quite sure) located in the heart of the old town so every thing is close by the souk Jamma'a Fenna Square restaurant and cafes. It was our first time experience Moroccan riyadh kind of hotels. It's beyond beautiful. Staff are so lovely professional helpful and kind. Hassan at reception was a great and very helpful guy.
