As for breakfast it's served at the rooftop where views are breathtaking. We also had the breakfast by the pool the first day because it was raining and it was just as beautiful experience. They also have a GYM that's small but has everything we needed. I would highly recommend it to any visitor who's interested in culture and history but wants to enjoy luxury at the same time.  Big thanks La Sultana you were amazing!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Carole Elizabet... B wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: My husband and I have been to Marrakech many times staying both in the new town and in a smaller riad in the old town. We visited with our 21 year old daughter and her friend and will now never stay anywhere other than La Sultana. The entrance is quite ordinary but what lies beyond is exceptional. The rooms are gorgeous ( we had Rhinoceros and Lion) the pool area is quite small but feels super special and the rooftop is the most beautiful spot for breakfast and drinks. It's hard to believe the chaos of the old town is right outside. We had a hammam and massage in the lovely spa and it was great with the friendliest team looking after us. What makes this hotel is the staff. Everyone smiles chats cannot do enough for you they even bring a chair for your handbag ! Whoever trains this team should be commended.  Thank you so much La Sultana a wonderful find in Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Stayed here for my best friend's 30th birthday as we wanted a girlie break and we weren't disappointed. The hotel itself is gorgeous with a beautiful rooftop and a number of pools and areas to sit/lounge. Breakfast and dinner (again served on the roof) were impressive and the staff were just lovely. Walking distance to the main square and surrounded by loads of interesting shops selling everything you could imagine. Staff were also really nice and couldn't do enough for you...definitely would like to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Hidden 5 star delight in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: Amazing People and attentive staff awesome food and amazing spar...  Walking distance to the center of the markets and the souks  Close to superb restaurants with an amazing restaurant in the hotel.  Perfect way to relax with your partner in a 5 star environment!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Very hard to get better than this!
Review_Text: Fantastic hotel service about the best we have had. Food and drink at hotel are reasonably priced I have no hesitation at ordering more drinks or food as you might at other 5 star hotels. Beautiful pools and rooftop restaurant. The cooking class that we had was superb and enjoyed the tagine we cooked for lunch.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I love everything about this hotel. The rooms (and hotel in general) are exquisite. The food is delicious. The spa treatments are luxurious. And the office staff is enthusiastically helpful and charming.  Staying at La Sultana is like sleeping in a Moroccan jewel box.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: JASON L wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: The Oasis in middle of hustle bustle of Marrakech
Review_Text: This hotel is truly live up to the name "The Oasis in middle of hustle bustle of Marrakech"    Once you pass the main big golden door u can feel the peace and tranquility inside of this hotel the big room with all marble bathroom very clean and the bed so comfy.  Hotel and rooms deco is like one of those Arabian nights movies or like your in a palace with royal treatment truly 5 star luxury service.  Rooftop bar is cool with selection of music daily having a drink watching sunset.  This hotel is inside the old Medina but yet sooo quiet very peaceful from the inside hotel is not far to main square Jemaa el-Fnaa and other tourists attractions.  Please note if its your first time in Morocco best to arrange your own airport pick up or get La Sultana to arrange a pick up as taxis in Marrakech is not meter and they try to make money on tourist so u have to ask and agree with a fee before u get on otherwise they will charge you lots ofðŸ’²ðŸ’²    Last but not least.. the staffs and the level  Of service at La Sultana was impeccable the lady at the front desk (sorry i couldn't remember her name) was so helpful and the staffs from bars rooftop was excellence.    Highly recommend this hotel and for sure will stay here again when back to Marrakech next time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: From the moment we stepped into this hotel we knew it was a dream come true. You truly feel as if you are in a Moroccan Palace and the staff make you feel like royalty.    Needless to say the service at a 5-star luxury hotel like La Sultana Marrakech was impeccable. From the moment I walked through the entrance I felt a warmth kindness and attentiveness which as the days went on we realized that despite being widely traveled we had never experienced before.    The staff quickly settled us in and welcomed us with traditional sweets and of course Moroccan mint tea. The whole team was genuinely so nice truly helpful and very professional.    One of the best parts of our trip was a breakfast on the rooftop. This was the best breakfast we had in Morocco by far. I loved it and it was worth waking up on time for which I donâ€™t usually say. Mostly I liked cheese and chia pudding for breakfast. The homemade pastries were great too.    The hotel itself is beautiful clean and well-located. And you get the authentic atmosphere that it's placed in the middle of the old town from Marrakech. It's a walking distance 15 min from the El fana square.    This enchanting place is full of ambiance and wonder. We were overwhelmed at how amazing every single detail was. Lots of nice little corners to hang out and great pools where we escaped the chaos of the Marrakech. It was so delightful in the heat of Morocco!    We were in the Tiger room. it is a great big room with a very nice bathroom. Turns out I actually like taking baths! I loved relaxing in the tub here after long days of shopping and haggling in the markets.    Our bedroom matched the historical design and architecture. It was aesthetically exquisite as well as spacious and comfortable. It was maintained to the highest standards of cleanliness.    All in all my visit to La Sultana opened my eyes and gave me a taster into a new world of design style and breathtaking luxury. If you are looking for a place to awaken the senses push boundaries and give you a true appreciation for design Marrakech has it all and La Sultana exhibits the very best of it. Frankly speaking I wish there was a chance to give the 6th star because this hotel deserves it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Michael H wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: An oasis in the middle of wonderful chaotic city.
Review_Text: Luxury and truly royal treatment are the hallmarks of La Sultana.  Staying at the La Sultana is an experience out of this world. It's like a dream something out of a novel so comfortable and quiet I could live there the rest of my life. The cooking lessons were fun and you get to eat the best food you've ever cooked.    Staff where exceptional in terms of professionalism service and friendliness. Special mention to Khalifa Asmaa Zakaria and Amine. We look forward to returning to this oasis again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ewa P wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: Calm Oasis in the bustling city
Review_Text: It is inside Medina of Marrakech yet relaxing pleasant place. We had a dinner at their tarrace yummy food accompanied with traditional moroccan music impeccable service and fast internet. We had really tasty rose wine and watched lovely sunset.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Its one of the most beautiful hotels that I have ever visited.
Review_Text: My family and I were super happy with the fantastic service that they provide.    I can tell you for sure that if I ever go back to Marrakech I will stay again at La Sultana.    They really take care of every single detail and most importantly they make you fill at home.    The food is excellent and the rooms as well as the good quality of the rooms.    A great place for relaxing!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: located at the entrance of medina 5 beautiful riads merged into one giant boutique hotel. impressive decoration of each room tons of artworks displaying along the hallways. staff are genuine with smile make good suggestion of restaurants/activities to cater all your needs.  different themes of deco on different sections. attention to details.  must try their rooftop restaurant with 360 degrees medina view tasting menu in moroccan food is a must-try :-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Kristen D wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: beautiful and restful in the medina
Review_Text: We spent our final two nights in Marrakech at La Sultana and appreciated the pool room food and overall beautiful and peaceful surroundings. Breakfast on the rooftop was an amazing way to start the day. Thank you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We wanted to book something special for our wedding anniversary. Marrakech delivered and La Sultana really was the icing on the cake. An exceptional hotel - almost hidden - notwithstanding the relative close proximity to the medina and market squares. Probably the friendliest (and most genuine) hotel staff we've ever come across from the bellboys to the general manager. They could't do enough to ensure our staff was magical - and it was ! Would recommend the hamman and spa massage as well as the taster menu on the rooftop terrace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A Stunning and Relaxing Oaisis in the busy Old World of Marrakech
Review_Text: From the moment you step out of your taxi a gentleman awaits ready to help dressed in a classic style bell captain uniform. Shortly he will become one of your good "local" friends. The Hotel is stunning truly an Oasis is in a town that is bustling with people cars and mopeds and the largest souk in Marrakech. The grounds are perfect and the hotel staff are all amazing. You truly feel as if you are in a Moroccan Palace and they make you feel like royalty. The Spa was a beautiful and peaceful place to relax after touring the insanely crazy souks I highly recommend booking the Royal Hammam. The Restaurant was truly special sitting atop the roof listening to the sounds of the city with a local musician playing a traditional oud (similar to a guitar). This was a very special place and thank you La Sultana for truly making our trip a vacation we will not forget.

People were so nice and the treatment was so wonderful that we felt like real Sultans! As an architect i can say that the design of the hotel amased us in every little detail. We visited the hotel for our honeymoon and the deal we took included a hammam and a spa massage which i can only recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful Riad tucked away in a bustling metropolis. Lovely helpful staff always willing to go the extra mile.Was there with 4 friends for a girlie weekend and we had a lovely time.  Great location and ambience. Definitely recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: MarcelaChavarri... C wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: The Ryad is beautiful full of character and friendly staff. Great location close to the square and a fantastic rooftop the pool area is just perfect for the hot summer days.  Breakfast menu is good food is not fantastic but good enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: On arrival we were warmly greeted by Saida (Front Desk Manager) and due to our late evening arrival at 9.45pm we were shown to our beautiful upgraded suite for a quick refresh before dinner - which was delicious. We had a hamman experience in the spa which was fun. All meals were served on the roof restaurant our second night we were surprised to receive a gourmet tasting menu free of charge which was amazing. Saida arranged for a half day walking tour of Marrakech with a guide which was excellent and a visit to Le Jardin Marjorelle YSL garden just outside the Medina  walls. The swimming pool and sunbeds were fabulous with plenty of room again with excellent service.  I recommend this hotel to anyone who likes luxury with authenticity!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ã‡iseren K wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: We wanted to spend a day in this tasteful hotel. We enjoyed the royal hammam followed by sultana massage. The kindness of the employees the quality of the service the luxurious details.. Everything is just perfect. After spa we also had a lunch by the pool it was quite enjoyable. Very calm place to have a great day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: 5 Star Service, Luxe Property and Amazing Staff
Review_Text: My friend and I spent out last night at this amazing hotel composed of multiple Riads. From the moment we walked in we were treated with impeccable service. We were upgraded to a gorgeous suite and the concierge was amazing. They were able to arrange last minute requests such as reservations tour guides and drivers. Can't wait to visit again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Gail G wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: What a super place lovely welcoming staff and fantastic food. Such a magical place great cocktails on the roof before we ate and the chocolate ravioli was fantastic would highly recommend this place right in the centre of the casbah but  so tranquil
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Can't say enough about the stunning building that is La Sultana. The roof terrace is something else undersold by the photos available. Dinner on the terrace with fantastic staff made for a memorable evening.  A Must visit hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: wow, right out of a movie set, very luxe
Review_Text: We spent our last night in Marrakech at La Sultana. We had been traveling on the coast for 9 days and wanted an over the top luxe experience to leave on. Yep-- we got that. It's like the Versaille of Morocco-- like a palace inside ornate spectacular and opulent. Service is 5 star in every sense of the word from the greeting when you arrive to arranging everything for us for easy delivery to the airport-- including early morning coffee personal wake-up call filling out our immigration forms and taxi waiting. This all before 6am. We have 3 teenage boys-- so staying one night was perfect for us-- got a lovely over the top experience but probably not a great spot for kids-- to fancy quiet for a long stay. But our kids will remember the bathtub in their room for the rest of their lives-- right out of a palace sunken marble extravaganza. Make sure to dine on the rooftop-- sunset is amazing with the sounds of the souk call to prayer and stars over the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: As part of our honeymoon we wanted to try a country and a city that none of us had visited before.  So after pro and cons we decided to visit Marrakech.  I looked through the different kind of hotels offers in the city and decided that we a stay in a classic Riyadh would be the perfect local experience    The choose came to La Sultana based on the location close to one of the city ports so that it would be easy to get in and out of the old city    At the same time La Sultana looked very authentic and beautiful.    We were not disappointed. From the first friendly welcome so the final goodbye we felt welcome at the hotel.    The terrace of the hotel to very nice and quiet when you come 'home' from a long day full of impressions.    We were in the Tiger room. it is a great big room with a very nice bathroom. But I was a bit challenged by the fact that you could not really open a window. this might be part of the Riyadh charm that all windows are facing the inner courtyard. But next time I am staying in a Riyadh I will ask for a room with windows closer to the 'real' air...  The other minor issue with the room was that the sent was a little stuffy    We had breakfast at the hotel every day during our 4 day stay. The breakfast is nice and the environment on the terrace is just perfect. The Ramadan started while we were visiting Morocco. But you are still able to get a cold glass of wine for your lunch and during the day if needed.    We had dinner once at the hotel. the day we arrived. Nice but not outstanding.    We tried a coupon massage at the hotel and that was a great experience.    The decor at the hotel is so beautiful the small gardens the hidden corners all the roses and so on. There is so much to see and explore at the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Darren Palmer wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel. An eclectic mix of architectural influences that transforms you back to the 1940s.  I almost expected to see Rick Blaine & Lisa Lund sharing a Gitane in one of the chic alcoves .  Just what you need to come back to after the madness of the Medina.  Excellent staff and delicious food. Try the Berber omelette at breakfast.

Review_Date: Chanda Chaudhary wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Title: A beautiful property and an excellent location : a real experience
Review_Text: Located inside the Imperial City's walls the first thing which one notices is la Sultana's sense of history . After a painstaking 3-year restoration which involved the Historical Monuments Association La Sultana has created an authentic luxury property with superb attention to authentic Moroccan design and architecture.    Its 28 rooms are quite dramatic and decorated in a Moroccan maximalist style. Personally I absolutely love the details - zellij-style courtyards carved cedar wood shutters and ceilings in the bathrooms delicate latticework in the garden to name only a few.    Spa is excellent - especially its bathing pools and water feature. I am not n expert of the Hammam treatments but I'd be pleasantly surprised if I anything would top-off my treatment here.    Staff is fabulous - friendly thoughtful and adjusting. I was at La Sultana over xmas which happens to be a super busy time but all my requests were handled with efficiency courtesy and warmth.    Opulent and exotic La Sultana is perhaps the next best thing to staying at the erstwhile Bahia Palace !

La Sultana is a beautiful peaceful oasis in the middle of a very busy medina & a 10 minute walk to Jemaa el Fna & the souk. We arrived at this riad exhausted from a long night of travel & without the suitcases for my 2 children. Saida & the rest of the crew were warm friendly patient & very helpful in getting us settled in & helping to communicate with the airport to find our bags.    The ambience in this hotel is unique & exceptional. Each room has a different theme. No 2 rooms are the same. The pool area is beautiful & serene. After a walk around the medina or the souk in 110 F returning to the hotel & a swim in the pool is glorious.  Breakfast on the roof top terrace is delicious. Dinner in the same spot is also fantastic.    One little amenity that we greatly appreciated is the never ending supply of bottled water. It is not safe to drink the tap water & in that heat water is essential. There are always bottles in the mini fridges & as you head out through the lobby they are happy to give you each a cold bottle of water for your walk in the heat.    Another small amenity that we greatly appreciated was the AC in each room. So fantastic to escape the heat & recharge with a cold room to sleep in.    I look forward to returning to La Sultana if I am lucky enough to visit Marrakech again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Pedro Leiria wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: Our stay at the La Sultana Marrakech was fantastic. The Reception staff was very friendly and let us feel just like home. After our registration we were delighted with a sweet mint tea and some Moroccan pastries (gazelle horns). Then we were given a fabulous suite on the first floor which its name was Puma. I let you discover now the photos that Iâ€™ve made during our stay as they are the most demonstrative example of how great this hotel a â€œSmall Luxury Hotels of the Worldâ€ property is. Oh! Last but not least the breakfast was also excellent and very yummy with a large choice of Moroccan and international foods. Finally this quick comment wouldn't be complete without congratulating the La Sultana Marrakech and all its staff as they definitely have made our stay an unforgettable one!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Ray K wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: If what u r looking for is to experience a few days in the heart of old Marrakech yet don't want to sacrifice your usual 5 star feel this is where u need to go.  Loved the flair and style.  A few downsides though to be picked up by the management :  1) aircons very dated difficult to get the right temperature in the room  2) some of furniture and curtains need urgent attention  3) tours and shuttles offered thru hotel are ridiculously expensive use Viator instead!    All in all a noteworthy experience worth the visit but given the above drawbacks pretty pricy.    Hence can't give it top notch rating.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: this is an incredible place I have been staying at. Decoration is beautiful crazy luxurious elaborated and particular in the same time. Rooms are amazingly and the whole place is quiete  Staff is very nice and kind and vienoiseries so good !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Pavel S wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: This was a gorgeous hotel connecting several riads - all with very unique styles. Attention to minute detail in selecting one of a kind furniture decorations and plants created a bespoke feel in each riad. The pool area and SPA were perhaps our favourite parts and they really stood out from various other riads we've seen. The staff were very kind and accommodated our requests beyond our expectations on our honeymoon. We stayed at the Crocodile Suite and it is a truly unique (as with each of the rooms) and extremely memorable place. The buffet breakfast is really worthwhile and was prepared on the rooftop terrace. The location is good in our view as it is in a relatively quieter area of the city which is about 15 minutes walking from the main strip that leads to the Jemaa El Fna.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Amazing food in a friendly and gorgeous environment. Roof top restaurant in the middle of the souk with tradition Marrocan architecture. It was 103 degrees and water mists made all the difference. Cheers to them! Definitely a come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I would say it's quite easy to write this review.    Everything I was expecting and much more I got.    Excellent location 500 meters or so from chatoic Alfeena plaza. Next door to famous tumbs.    The rooms swimming pools and restaurants I just as they show in pictures.    Personal very courteous!    It's a very quite and chilling place.    My only recommendation if you come with kids: feels like a hotel for grown ups not toddlers like my son. Still We loved it!

Best Riad hotel ever!  Wow everything was spot on. It's a magical place to stay and the staff members are really professional and extreme friendly. Very safe Riad to stay. And you get the authentic atmosphere that it's placed in the middle of the old town from Marrakech. It's on a walking distance 15 min from the El fana square.  Especially I want to say Thanks a million to management staff member Saida.  This beautiful classy lady will make sure that the guests are receiving the best from the best. The made my birthday really feel special:-) Everyday fresh Rose petals every where in the room and dates filled with almonds with fresh oranges camel milk infused with orange perfume the Moroccan cookies. The toiletries were from Clarins. And I highly recommend the spa and restaurant! Every evening on the magical rooftop live instrumental music. The menu from the restaurant is excellent and enough choice for every taste.  This Riad hotel offers also private cooking lessons. This is really a must to do!! Wow to learn to make you own tahine dish is wonderful.    We will definitely come back to this Riad hotel! Thanks a million especially to Saida!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: great staff very friendly and seemed to remember who you are from the minute they met you. spectacular room with columns in the bath tub. the haman was a great spot too.  rof top garden with best views and sun loungers was a regular hang out
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wonderful stay at this excellent hotel. Very serene and restful place. Service was the best we had experienced in a while. Every member of staff coul not do enough for you. Suite was great and we slept the best ever die to the dark cool room and quiet courtyard.  Pool great and rooftop bar and restaurant perfect.  If I had a comment would be maybe they need to change the menu more regularly or have a special every evening.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The hotel itself and the trip to the dessert.
Review_Text: We have traveled a lot but this experience was like 1001 night's fairy tale. The many ryads that were built together like a labyrinth all the time new wonderful eyesight was revealed. Also the staff was very skilled and handsome too :-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A sublime stay at the best hotel on planet Earth, La Sultana in Marrakech
Review_Text: I have no words profound enough to describe LA SULTANA.  It's a superbly gorgeous amazing treasure of a Hotel in the Kasbah in Marrakech. It's absolutely gorgeous. The Staff is topsthe best! the rooms so dreamy the poolthe rooftop the breakfastlunch and diner are the very best. I give them not a five star but a ten. They so deserve it. Oh! And it's the second time we are staying at La Sultana it's that fabulous!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Outstanding in every way. Beautiful rooms exemplary food but the Best is the people working here. Everyone so nice and helpful. Even the shop had beautiful items. The rooftop dining beautiful views. Our stay was perfect. Wonderful experience. Thank you all
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Christina K wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Love Love Love It!!!  My second time at this absolutely stunning Place in the Medina in Marrakech.  And will for sure come back for a third and a forth time to.  When you enter you get calm and relaxed right away. Wherever you look it's so beautiful and so many details. We spent many hours in the afternoons just chilling out up on the rooftop terrace.  The staff is really really nice and helped us out in different situations.  Highly recommend!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: SANA A wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: We flew to Marrakesh to celebrate one of my oldest and closest friends wedding. It was a beautiful wedding but will not be posting on it as it is a private affair BUT other than the highlight of the wedding and celebrations we were lucky to get a great authentic beautiful boutique hotel booking in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Kasbah which translateâ€™s too â€œThe domain of the Sultan/Rulerâ€.    Entering the hotel you will see beautiful doors surrounding it which happen to be peopleâ€™s homeâ€™s â€“ YES AT THE ENTRANCE! The hotel drop off you think â€œomg where am Iâ€ and our driver had to assure us that this was the hotel itâ€™s super traditional and donâ€™t worry about a thing.    You literally walk in and itâ€™s like your in a different world!    Stunning architecture super traditional kind of like a fancy home for someone super rich and famous.    This super boutique hotel is part of the â€œsmall luxury hotels of the worldâ€ â€“ you should check them out and register ASAP you will not be disappointed. Every booking offers a free upgrade upon availability and luxury amenities ours was Clarins.    Before going to our room we were led to the terrace a beautiful outdoor space to have some traditional Morrocan tea and sweets.    The room was beautiful there are only 2 floors to this hotel so expect a nice relaxing stay with impeccable service and cleanliness delectable food and wonderful spa.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
Reviewer_Location: Emirate of Dubai, United Arab Emirates

Review_Date: Christophe D wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: We spent 5 nights in La Sultana. We would recommend this hotel to everybody. Although it is located in the centre it is an oasis of rest. People are very kind. The breakfast is just perfect: everything you desire in the morning is available. The restaurant in the evening is also wonderfull. I definetely recommand the traditional couscous :-). One negative point/remark was the guide(for visiting purposes) they recommanded. He was very pushing on buying but we wanted to visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John H wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: This hotel has everything down perfectly. The rooms and outdoor spaces are remarkable and the staff probably the most gracious and helpful people I have ever encountered. After six days here I cannot say enough wonderful things about my stay. For a truly memorable Moroccan experience stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: We couldn't recommend this hotel more highly. The location is ideal with walking distance to the Medina and all the central places to visit. Yet it is a quiet and relaxing haven as soon as you enter.  The rooms and spaces are clean beautiful and have a Moroccan feel. Breakfast is delicious. The roof terraces are perfect to relax and enjoy the view. And we recommend the spa and cooking courses too.  What stood out most of all was the staff - truly the best customer service in a hotel. Everyone is friendly helpful very genuine and will go to any lengths to make your stay special - and name it they will endeavour to do it for you.  We will definitely be returning!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent three nights in late March and would recommend anyone visiting Marrakech to stay at La Sultana without hesitation. The hotel is absolutely beautiful a combination of 4 different riads that have been fully renovated and adapted to be a 5 star luxury boutique hotelalways maintaining the character and charm of the original buildings. The decoration just adds on to the whole magical experience once you walk in which feels like the perfect paradise to relax and unwind after spending the day out discovering buzzing Marrakech.  La Sultana is a hidden gem in the old part of the Medina which makes it ideal to enjoy a nice walk to the main attractions of the city. The hotel location is just next to the very famous Saadian Tombs (they offer guests fast track entry so you donÂ´t have to queue!) and only 10 min walk away from Jemaa El Fna square and the souks.  Even if you are just spending a couple of nights book a table in the Restaurant for dinner you wonÂ´t regret it! Food is delicious (the Tangia is a MUST try) service is top class romantic ambiance and live traditional music; it is the perfect way to end your day. The hotel has an amazing rooftop terrace with panoramic views of the city and is open all day from breakfast till dinner to enjoy a refreshing drink or a cocktail at night. On our last day we decided to take a Cooking Class in the morning (which also takes place in the rooftop terrace) and we absolutely loved it! It was a great experience and then you get to have for lunch the menu you have prepared together with the Chef!  We also booked their signature La Sultana Massage make sure you book in advance and arrive 30 mins before your appointment so you can get to relax in the Spa pool!  The one thing that really stands out at La Sultana is their fabulous staff from SaidaÂ´s team at the Reception & Concierge to the Spa and the Restaurant (breakfast lunch dinner they were all fantastic) they all make you feel so welcome and well looked after from the moment you step in. Staff approached us just to check on our stay and ask if we needed anything just making sure we were enjoying our time. They were discrete at all times but so caring that we didnÂ´t want to leave!  Thank you to all the Team at La Sultana for an unforgettable stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sonal P wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: Great Place in the Center of the old city
Review_Text: We stayed for two nights and loved it. The restaurant was romantic the bar on the terraces had great views & the spa was wonderful. The amenities are what you would expect for a 5 star hotel. The location was within the walls of the old town which made walking everywhere very easy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jennifer K wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: This hotel is a group of several riads and because of that it is a truly beautiful and unique property. Suites are really gorgeous. The food is delicious spa treatments were excellent. My only critique is that service can be inattentive when things get busy. We stayed here during high season and over Easter Sunday. All of the staff are incredibly warm and gracious but a few times when they got "in the weeds" in the bar and restaurant we didn't see or hear from people for a while. That said I wouldn't hesitate to come back here -- everyone we interacted with was wonderful and it's a great location and a truly beautiful property.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Malak B wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Amazing luxurious hotel!  This hotel is so beautiful i just love the decoration!!  Plus it is in the Medina so everything is near by you to buy all you want. Jamaa el fna Place is 20minutes by walk.  The staff is incredibly kind and welcoming.  The food is delicious !  I highly recommend. Worth the price.

Review_Date: lulu A wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: A gem in the middle of the old medina
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at La Sultana and I must say the hospitality and staff are beyond amazing; for the real value of this hotel is its people. The hotel gives you a "homey" feel and allows you to experience the real Moroccan way of living in their amazingly architected "Riyad." It was the perfect balance of an authentic luxurious stay. Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: susanne h wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: We are staying here now and it is simply just beautiful. Very cosy...feels like HOME. And the manager is the Best. The staff is so friendly and the Roff top and the view is spectaculaire ...very authentic.....try it
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Most Most Most beautiful place we visited on a beautiful sunny day and the Terrasse was simply amazing many area to enjoy a drink tea and pastries. Beautiful furniture Nothing was broken it was so well maintained and clean. The service was also top notch !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nichole V wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel with an authentic Moroccan feel and stunning architecture
Review_Text: We stayed in La Sultana for a week over Easter with our 4 kids. The hotel was in a great location and the service was first class. The rooms were great with very authentic touches that added the Moroccan experience. I would recommend the desert dinner under the stars and the guided tour of the central market. Our tour guide Ahmed was amazing and took us to some great stalls and restaurants. The spa was great and very authentic. The only improvements I would suggest is a wider range of options for lunch and more water in the rooms.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Fantastic, luxury hotel - calmness in a frenetic city!
Review_Text: Where do I start? You need someone to take you as it is very difficult to find next to the Saidian tombs an alley behind a shop leads to an unassuming doorway within nice architecture with an unassuming reception. Once behind reception wow! The place leads of into a series of small riads with rooms around each. The riads are luxurious and relaxing the rooms are very luxurious.    It is an oasis of luxury calm and peacefulness within a frenetic city. You can sit up on the rooftop where you can have a drink or meal and look down at the bustle or watch the nesting storks.    The rooms are luxurious all decorated slightly differently (we had the â€˜swans roomâ€™). Large bathrooms with big sunken baths his and hers washbasins a good power shower and niceties such as bath slippers and robes and leather bedroom slippers. Fruit dates nuts and cakes are waiting upon arrival in your room. The bedroom was aslo of a good size. The rooms have shutters and several layers of glazing making them pretty dark and quiet if you wish.    To while away the time you can sit in one of the luxurious courtyard riads or use the main swimming pool or the smaller warmer pool in the spa or indeed take one (or more) of the wonderful spa treatments.    All the staff were very friendly and attentive (without being obtrusive) and nothing was too much trouble.    Food was excellent (even for vegetarians) and the breakfast buffet was quite extensive (fresh and organic). A wonderful place to stay that couldnâ€™t be faulted in any way. Not the cheapest of places (by any means) but if you fancy a bit of pampering and luxury then this is the place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steven H wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: Like many places in morocco the entrance off the street is unimpressive. Once you walk up the ally to the door you are in a true gem. This hotel has opulent sitting areas and a garden on the 1st floor. The rooms are large with all the amenities. The service was excellent. Any request was quickly satisfied.The buffet breakfast is either served in the dining room or on the roof if the weather permits.  In Marrakech there are many famous and very expensive hotels. This is worth a liok

Situated rue de la kasbah in centre of old town.Must be the most beautiful hotel in Marrakech. Everything here is breathtakingthe decorthe servicethe sheer kindness of the personnel and....the cuisine. A haven of peace sprinkled by the fountains in the backgroundsomewhere amidst the lush vegetation.Nothing is impossible for the staff.  Thank you a thousand times! Absolutely unique.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Richard P wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Title: Great small luxury hotel in Marrakesh
Review_Text: Amazing and characterful small luxury hotel - a collection of 5 connected Riads in the centre of Marrakesh.  Of note the concierge was incredibly attentive and helpful. A fabulous few days away.  Great cookery school too!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis of tranquility and comfort
Review_Text: La Sultana was an oasis of tranquility and comfort on our recent trip to Marrakech. Our family stayed in the luxurious Apartment suite which was plenty roomy for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. The staff was extremely friendly helpful and attentive while giving us of space to relax. Little touches like mint tea to greet us and an assortment of Moroccan treats in our room made us feel welcomed and pampered. The concierge gave us useful tips for what to see and do during our stay (and what to avoid) and also arranged a day trip to Essaouira. The building with its maze of riads in different styles is beautiful and fun to explore and the huge roof-top terrace has fantastic views of the surrounding medina and the Atlas mountains. The food at the hotel was excellent both at the delicious breakfast buffet and at dinner in the hotel restaurant. La Sultana was the perfect place to come "home" to after wandering the hectic streets of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Boris V wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Title: TV host and travel journalist Boris Velican fall in love with "La Sultana"
Review_Text: Traveling over 18 years worldwide I saw many hotels lodges riads palais... I learned that oasis is not only the place full of greens and water but the place where you meet nice and honest people. "La Sultana" has it both - the look and one of the most helpful stuff I met on the road. If some place I will go again "La Sultana" in Marrakech is the one!  Boris Velican TV host and travel journalist
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Great and interesting hotel... needs a little attention
Review_Text: Wow what a fantastic building  a labyrinth of amazing courtyards pools and interesting corners and cubby holes. The hotel is full of African artwork and at times feels more llke a museum.  The roof terrace is a perfect spot to unwind with large sunny spacious seating and great views. The service was also excellent.  The only downside might be that the rooms themselves are very dark. Even withthe lights on it still seemed dark and therefore lacked a feeling of space.  Although the rooms was well decorated some of the sockets didnt work and the electrics were in need of updating.  The other noticeable thing was that for some reason the towels were old and a bit threadbare. Its such a simple thing to fix. The pool towels were much nicer than the small towels in our room.  Breakfast was pretty good and had lots of choices..I really liked the coffee.  We did not eat dinner here it always looked a little formal and quiet.  When its hot enough I presume people choose to eat on the roof and that looked like it would be very good.  The spa was OK but small and the main pool is fine.  The staff were excellent  Its a short walk to town and we had no problems at all with the location.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Had a wonderful dinner here on our last night in marrakech and we were pleasantly surprised! The outside didnt look like much-we would have walked past it if our taxi driver hadn't stopped us!    It has the most beautiful interior with traditional Moroccan decor. The tables by the pool are a nice touch and the dim lighting create a very romantic setting.    Our waiter was attentive and had a sense of humour! We had a full 3 course meal which was brilliant from start to finish! Oh and the cauliflower soup was probably the best soup I have ever had!    We finished off the evening with tour of the hotel and it was absolutely beautiful! Made us wish we had opted for a traditional Riad as opposed to a hotel!    La Sultana is worth every penny and definitely worth a visit!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: One of the best boutique hotels i have ever visitedluxurious standardsbeautiful roomsdivine spa ( one of the best in Marrakech ) . Excellent diningand most of all a royal service. You enter this place and its heavenly atmosphere will take you on a 1001night trip.  A must to see.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Superb beautiful very hospitable and helpful. Don't let the first impressions fool you on arrival. It's a hidden gem. Would highly recommend staying here. The coffee is to die for. It's in an ideal location if you have booked any tours and an interesting walk to the Souk.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: The Midnight Blue Elephant wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: The La Sultana in Marrakech is a rather special place and made me feel like a proper princess. Everything is incredibly ornate and beautiful. Our room the zebra room was incredibly spacious and elegant and came with an enormous marble bath tub (too big to fill in fact).  One of the best features is the lovely pool and the roof top which allows you a stunning view over the medina.  We didn't eat at the hotel but the breakfast choices were great as was the service throughout.  My favorite part? Roses everywhere and the leather slippers that you get to keep!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Anna Y wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: Everything was amazing from welcome to departure. The hotel is close to Medina and other tourist points. The service is impeccable with a wonderful Moroccan restaurant. Thank you for the free SLH club member upgrade we loved the Giraffe suit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Luxury hotel, but very relaxed and homely
Review_Text: Right from the beggining the moment we walked into La Sultana Xavier Saida and Hassam made us feel at home. Took care of every detail to make our stay memorable.  The rooms are spacious and have every comfort detail you may need. A great 5 star hotel but with very personalized attention. We certainly enjoyed the pool and the terrace after our long daily walks. The terrace was one of my favourite places for drinks and tea after dinner. Thank you all! Hope to be back very soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed in La Sultana for one night in January as a free reward from the Small Luxury Hotels club. It was my first time in Marrakech and I loved the experience.    La Sultana is everything you can expect from a luxury Riad: gorgeous exclusive and yet traditional at the same time. It has a fabulous spa with a heated pool fireplace beautiful covered outside patio for dinners in wintertime as well as very helpful and friendly staff.    I was given an upgrade to the â€œDromadaireâ€ room which had a palatial bathroom fit for kings and queens (see photo) and plenty of space and luxury amenities. The only thing that puzzled me a bit was the towels which were not the luxurious fluffy type usually found in such high-end accommodation.    I had dinner at the hotel and was pleasantly surprised with the vegetarian options available. Everything from the soup Moroccan salads to the mushroom risotto was absolutely delicious. The beautiful poolside surroundings and soft music played by a local musician completed the romantic atmosphere.    I would not hesitate to return to La Sultana particularly in the warmer months to enjoy the rooftop terrace which was (understandably) closed in January.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Simone M wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: We stayed 3 days in La Sultana. A place of rare beauty the staff is very friendly and helpfull and the service is perfect.  It was our first stay in La Saltuna but we are sure we will return there soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hubby and I weren't staying at he Sultana but we're so very glad we called in for lunch during our trip an oasis of class and calm  Location on the rooftop was perhaps the best we had during our visit and the contrast to Marrakech was noticeable  Staff were fantasic and kindly showed us around each Riad  Food was fabulous  couldn't fault a thing
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tugba H wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: We have stayed 5 days in Marrakesh in La Sultana Hotel  this place is treating you like a Sultan ...    Nice staff  welcoming  always helpful and kind    I have looked several hotels before choosing La Sultana  i think its like a secret garden that you can not find easly...    Thank you La Sultana ...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ola E wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: We stay 3 nights. It was an amazing experience. The staff and service is just perfect. they feel all your wishes.  The place and design is fabulous. It's like to be in fairytale.  The roof space an amazing with Atlas mountain view.  I will Defiantly come back here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Florence Z wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: la sultana is an absultutely beautiful and luxurious riad perfectly situated in the old city of Marrakesh. From the rooftop terrace you have a beautiful view on a market and just a wonderful view in the atlas mountains  Its our second stay at la sultana marrakech and we are just overwhelmed! The service and friendlieness of the whole la sultana team is amazing!  when you enter la sultana you feel like being at home in your own oriental oase  during our stay at la sultana we got every luxury we could imagine  It was a perfect stay and we are looking forward to staying at la sultana next year again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Alex K wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: We had a 4-nights stay. It is a very beautiful and peaceful hotel. Although it is located in a very busy area it's very quiet inside the hotel. The decoration is stunning it feels like you are in a small palace. The staff is very friendly pleasant and helpful. Everything was clean and tidy. There is also a nice roof garden where you can relax and have your drink. However I believe the breakfast seemed a little poor for this kind of hotel. There should be more options for breakfast. Despite that it is highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Located in the medina of Marrakech this fabulous property and their service team pay attention to every detail. The result is a beautiful and relaxing experience that reflects the history and culture that surrounds it and does so at the highest end of artistry architecture and experience. We found ourselves torn between enjoying the property and exploring the city around us. Being someone who loves being on the go and exploring the idea of hanging out at the hotel has never crossed my mind in all my years of travel until here.    This is my first review on trip advisor or anywhere and I would highly recommend this location. Please note that they are a little slow on email responses submitted via their website which made me wonder what to expect prior to my trip. However what we experienced there was a 5 star location with 5 star service by friendly attentive and kind people who went out of their way to make sure everything was perfect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Fully deserving of its 5 stars this magnificent hotel lies in the centre of Marrakesh. The decor is quite breathtaking and the attention to detail exceptional.  On arrival a very warm welcome is guaranteed and any problems you may have during your stay will be dealt with very efficiently by the staff at reception. Nothing is too much trouble.  The bedrooms are outstanding with everything you could wish for. An upgrade to The Tiger Room would be a wonderful experience. It is the most beautiful bedroom I have ever seen....  The traffic can be quite daunting but after hiring a car we were escorted out of the city by a lovely gentleman from the hotel who led us on his motor cycle to a place where we could take the road up to the Atlas Mountains.  The rooftop terrace was just lovely. So relaxing and the calling to prayer from the mosque nearby proves very atmospheric.  The breakfast was superb although we did not eat here in the evening the food looked very inviting.  If you visit Marrakesh I highly recommend at least 1 night in La Sultana. It will be a night to remember......
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: La Sultana is a hidden gem of Marrakech. The location service the interior decoration the terrace restaurant everything was amazing. All the hotel stuff has been very helpful. Truly a relaxing and wonderful experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Stephanie F wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: I can't recommend La Sultana enough - it was the most tranquil beautiful setting right in the hustle & bustle of Marrakech. My husband and I visited for a long weekend and had the most wonderful time (I just wish we could have stayed longer!). The staff are incredible - friendly attentive and eager to help with any question or request. All the amenities are lovely but the spa is truly amazing.    I am already dreaming of my next trip back and I will absolutely stay at La Sultana again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This spa was really amazing. Its hard to find the entrance to the hotel in general but once you get in youll be led through the intricate labyrinth halls to the spa area. From there you are led into a huge jacuzzi. Around this room are doors that open into the massage rooms. After a relaxing soak (they provide trunks and robe) you go into your room. I got the leg massage as I had just come from skiing. Everything was well priced clean and professional. Def recommend! After I ate on the rooftop restaurant which had several Moroccan wines as well as the standard Moroccan food.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: One of my best travel experiences!
Review_Text: I went to Marrakech to celebrate my daughterÂ´s birthday we stayed at La Sultana thanks to a friends recommendation since I wanted the best place to celebrate the occation. Since we arrived we felt so warm and welcome!!  Saida upgraded us to a beautiful suite as a birthday present and the whole staff was just AMAZING providing a top quality service.    The hotel is just breath taking beautiful rooftop to watch the sunset beautiful SPA to swim in the most elegant marble jacuzzi beautiful restaurant by the pool with live music.    I consider myself so fortunate to have found La Sultana; theres no place better to have celebrated my daughter.  This hotel goes above and beyond!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Incredible hotel true Moroccan luxury in the middle of Marrakech. Lovely staff very hospitable and friendly. The decor is absolutely stunning - lots of little rooms off the courtyards gorgeous pool and delicious breakfast each day. Make sure you try the pigeon pie for dinner! Delicious.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Karl Heinz B wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Title: the place is best located, inside the medina near to the big place
Review_Text: We have been upgraded to a Junior Suite big surprise and really phantastique.  Service is very good  nice reception  Wonderfull hammam and massage  Last but not least really good kitchen as well local and international
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: alessandra a wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: My first journey in Morocco was really happy also thanks to the stay at the Sultana.  Marrakech is worth the trip and the hotel makes it very pleasant. The accueil is perfect the breakfast by the pool is lovely.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Thea S wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: Magic riad strategically located. Everything was really perfect: the room the spaces the terrace the food the service the spa and its massages the staff.Warmly recommended to any kind of visitors.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Umberto T wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: One of the most beautiful hotel I've ever seen. A luxury nest of quiet and beauty. Everything was OK: concierge room accueil hospitality If I had to return in Marrakesh I'd come back to "La Sultana" to feel myself a sultan again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My first trip to Morocco was a thrill. Everything was so outstanding that I will definitely will come back. The reason: LA SULTANA: The rooms the food the design the atmosphere and most of all the people at LA SULTANA made my stay unforgettable. From the doorman to the outstanding concierge SAIDA my guide MOULAY the management the spa crew the ladies and gentlemen from the restaurant with the incredible CHEF...and the musician who played every night local music with grace and style. I am so thankful that I found this place. I recommend it in every way. Marc Marshall
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Sharmmi J wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: Looks like an old palace. Good service. Nice big rooms. Food in the restaurant was great. Heated swimming pool available. They even filled my departure card ready for the return flight. Breakfast available.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Alex T wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Title: Honey moon week-end in East Side Fairytale
Review_Text: It was our perfect honey moon week-end In Sultana Marrakech. I wanted to make a surprise for my husband - very romantic trip - and the managers of the hotel did their best to come my dream true! It was really wonderful! La Sultana Marrakech is a small beautiful world in big Marocco with authentic style high level of service beautiful yard and excellent enterior. Strongly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Shahram R wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: Had an amazing experience at this hotel which is centrally located with amazingly beautiful architecture. The staff were friendly and accommodating and made our trip special.  The rooms are spacious beautifully decorated in Moroccan style. The restaurant space food and service was perfect. We enjoyed Moroccan music every night in the pool area.  Would go back again and again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sue C wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: Rooms are all unique the Riad is authentic and the staff are attentive and very friendly.  The location is perfect and the Hamann was like being reborn! The spa is tranquil as is most of the common areas of the Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: A five stars hotel with a five stars spa. The massages are more expensive than in other spas but you paid to spend a marevellous time. Pink stones soft towels delicious massages an a very attentive spa. A real oasis at the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights in March 2016.    We had dinner at the hotel on a previous trip to Marrakech in 2015 and we decided we would stay here on the next trip as it so lovely!    We had a lovely suite with a window in to a gorgeous white internal atrium.    The weather was a bit chilly in the evening so we had dinner by the indoor pool most nights. All the food tastes great and was presented beautifully - no complaints! Even when I misunderstood the menu and ordered "sweet breads" (I am a vegetarian) there was no issue and they quickly brought me a lovely soup!    The hotel is very calm and serene...very different from the streets of Marrakech!    We had a truly relaxing stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tom S wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel, below par experience and service
Review_Text: I booked a week here through Small Luxury Hotels for a relaxing break with my partner before Christmas. Highly recommend booking through Small Luxury Hotels because they will provide you with a free upgrade to a suite if one is available - we were given a Deluxe Suite.    The hotel is meticulously designed with an incredible standard of detail wherever you look. One of my favourite things is that the hotel has lots of spaces reading rooms and places to sit despite only having 27 rooms. This means you can always find somewhere secluded to sit in peace if you want to.    I often stay in 5* hotels for business and leisure and have experienced a variety of approaches and standards.    The service and stay here was not 5* to my mind for the following reasons:  - Wi-Fi was intermittent  - We found a large cockroach in the bathroom  - Our room backed on to a kitchen which was quite noisy  - Workmen were quite active around the hotel drilling and hammering fairly early in the morning  - The mini-bar included "complimentary" soft drinks and water but this was never refreshed.  - There was no iron or ironing board in the room - although I never asked for one to be brought over  - The pool table on the roof top is missing a ball and doesn't work correctly  - Prices for breakfast and drinks were excessive given the location - Â£18pp/day for breakfast Â£6 for a beer    Another issue that frustrated me was asking advice about some tours. I specifically wanted to visit some of the villages in the Atlas mountains for a hike but I was immediately shown an Â£800 half-day "Luxury VIP" trip into the desert at night. This was nothing like I asked for and it was obvious my request wasn't being listened to so I ended up booking an excursion online.    Overall the hotel is an amazing property and it's a great place to relax. It just isn't run to the same standard that most 5* properties adhere and as such can't justify it's price - I felt it was overpriced despite being given an upgrade.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful Riad in the heart of Marrakech's Old City
Review_Text: Had a lovely five night stay at the La Sultana Marrakech riad. Beautiful hotel all around and each room is unique; we stayed at a "Pur-Sang" horse themed room complete with a saddle and luxurious bathroom. It's also located very close to some popular tourist attractions and restaurants - within walking distance of the El Badi and Bahia palaces the Koutoubia mosque the Jemaa el-Fnaa as well as the Cafe Clock restaurant. We had a good experience with the staff and they were always very courteous.    The hotel's restaurant and spa were also amazing; even if you aren't staying here it's worth checking out the spa and eating at the restaurant.    The hotel itself is a little harder to find being located in a narrow street of the old city but they usually have a watchman outside for visitors and help direct taxi drivers.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Demet Z wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: We came here just for the restaurant it is a traditional restaurant with live music lovely and amazing atmosphere! Very delicious food and good service. All people can speak in English!! They have a vale service there is no parking problem. I strongly advice!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The ryad is amazingly beautiful.    People were very nice and the food of the restaurant is really good.    However I would expect more from the furniture of the roomit is a bit old and not very fashionable... and the spa is really small and the treatment was much shorter than advised.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chrystel T wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: We do a long road-trip departure from Casablanca and ending in Ouarzazate.  From all the luxury and charming properties we've visit all the family had only one Name : La Sultana Oualidia - nice place nice site extraordinary view perfect team ! One of our best remember and recommandation !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I visited Marrakech in November for work.    La Sultana was surprisingly good. Friendly and very helpful staff i felt i was at home. The food was good too.    Overall it was a very good stay. I highly recommend La Sultana.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: Being in Marrakech and walking into La Sultana we felt as if we were reincarnated back in time as royalty. The detail of the decor and layout of the entire riad was luxurious. We loved ending the night with mint tea on the roof. And the food was the best we had in Morocco. The seven salads have transformed our eating habits in the US. The service at the front desk in the restaurants and on the roof were unmatched. I have never met such friendly funny and accommodating staff. The spa was breath taking. My husband and I went for the hammam package and couldn't be more delighted. It's made him into a massage and spa-enthusiast.    On our last day we were overcome with such sadness that we had to leave the large comfortable bed and dreamy bathroom. We visited Morocco on our honeymoon and we wanted to travel around the country so we only stayed three nights. La Sultana remained on our minds throughout the rest of the trip and left as wanting more.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had lunch here on our last day in Marrakech. It was perfect sitting in the sunshine. I had the prawns on skewers and my partner a steak. Pudding was a treat. The staff were very good and the views of the Atlas Mountains from the terrace was beautiful. As we walked through the hotel to the terrace it looked charming and in a very good location. Well worth a visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Really nice and welcoming Riad which caters for different surroundings in different areas. Well located and with nice food a place worth staying in and enjoying. Staff was nice and service was outstanding
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great if you want to be ripped off
Review_Text: Having our jewelry and other items stolen from our room was the beginning of an awful experience that was exasperated by an insensitive and unresponsive staff. Not even a "sorry" was expressed for what was an obvious housekeeping theft. All we ever heard from everyone from the concierge to the general manager was that we must have misplaced our belongings. We left and stayed at the beautiful El Fenn for the remainder of our trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife was lucky enough to win a 3 night stay at La Sultana from which we've just returned. I cannot be effusive enough in my praise for the place: all aspects of the stay far exceeded both our expectations.    The staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. No request was considered too small and they always ready with a smile.The room was very nicely appointed clean and comfortable and the hotel itself was a wonderful gem of a place you could quite literally get lost in! Around every corner there seemed to be a new room to relax in.    I have to mention the food which was absolutely first class. On two nights we had the Moroccan & Occidental taster menus which both delivered two of the best culinary experiences of my life (the Moroccan menu just edging it for me!). Although I must say my favourite dish of the stay was the local pigeon pie I had as a starter the first night there! Delicious!    Lastly the site of the hotel makes it an ideal location to explore the city and yet remain secluded from it's hustle & bustle. Probably about a 10/15 minute walk to the main Jemaa al Fna square and the souks next-door to the Saadian tombs and close to a couple of the palaces for those wishing to explore the historical sites.    All in all a great stay in a great hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A great location; hotel needs to up its game
Review_Text: Despite its great location a short walk from all the major sites of this fascinating city the place is DARK in every way. The dÃ©cor the ambiance even the setting. I do give some credit to the staff at the reception and in the dining room and roof (bar and so-called fitness room) but the overall experience left us feeling somewhat down. The food was awful and they could not even make a simple dry martini! I had to go behind the bar to show them what to do. Breakfasts at the hotel were OK; dinner? Go elsewhere. As for the "fitness room" that is a non-starter. The few pieces of equipment were ancient (except for the weights!) and the tv did not work. Need I say more. If Marrakech is for you (and it is worth a visit) find another place or be prepared to rough it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jean-Christophe P wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Title: Probably the best riad in town...
Review_Text: Spent 4 beautiful nights @LaSultana. Got upgraded into a Suite as a SLH member.  The place really deserves its 5 stars : different and luxurious common areas very nice rooms excellent location friendly and helpful staff pretty good restaurant excellent Spa.  Overall a great stay in a great place. Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: PrimaA B wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: La Sultana it's what you dream for !! romantic in every room the lunch ont the roof top was special and the breakfast around the swimingpool surrounding by antiquity was special....thank you very much
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Spent three nights at La Sultana. The place is amazingly beautiful. So much to explore. The service and the food is outstanding. Quiet but not stuffy. Location in the Casbah is convenient. Loved it. The rooms are opulent breakfast delicious. It is pretty expensive but just what you expect on a trip to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Just loved this hotel. Stayed for three nights during an 11 day private tour of Morocco. Loved the location about 15 minutes walk from the Souks and Main Square.    Once inside the front door you're amidst 3 Riads that have been connected... each different but beautiful: marble mosaic wood and stucco with great art throughout.    The room was fairly spacious bed comfortable. Breakfast was great served upstairs on the roof in a beautiful setting.    Had dinner one night in the restaurant... they locate it next to the pool in the main courtyard and there was a man singing and playing a Moroccan type guitar. Food was excellent though tasting menu had too much food!    Service throughout including front desk manager and wait staff was excellent.    Only one negative the gym. Nice to have one but needed some additional equipment such as heavier weights/dumbells an elliptical etc.    All in all a great place to stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An experience not to be missed
Review_Text: Wonderful location wonderful people and wonderful food and drink. The interior decor was breathtaking and the location of the bars and the restaurants outstanding. Also easy access to the main square and other major attractions. Everything we wanted to see in Marrakech was within walking distance. We will certainly be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rosemary S wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Title: Luxury in the heart of the Kasbah
Review_Text: This luxury hotel (or riad) is a haven of tranquillity in a very busy part of Marrakech. The roof gardens are beautiful and afford views of the Atlas Mountains the ancient Saadian Tombs and nesting storks. The dÃ©cor throughout is extremely decorative in the Moroccan style and there are nooks and crannies everywhere where one can escape fellow guests although with only 21 rooms there are not that many. Our suite was huge and ornate with a balcony overlooking the beautiful swimming pool which is kept at a comfortable temperature. Everything is provided for your comfort including sunhat beach bag beach towels bathrobes slippers toiletries kettle together with fruit sweetmeats and nuts. The bed was enormous and extremely comfortable the bath with jacuzzi was marble with pillars and there are his and hers washbasins as well as a shower. The breakfast is extensive offering all types of eggs cooked to order as well as the usual buffet items. The dinner menu is basically Moroccan. The staff are always helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Traditional yet luxurious experience in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed at La Sultana Marrakech in October 2016 and it was one of the best all-round hotels we stayed in during our full 3-week Moroccan trip.    One of the best thing about this hotel is the location. It's in the heart of Marrakech and everything is walking distance - Jemaa El Fna square with the traditional souks the Saadian Tombs the Royal Palaces and the Bahia Palace plus a ton of restaurants. The other thing that makes La Sultana special is the way it combines authentic Moroccan style with genuine luxury making it the perfect oasis to escape to after a busy day exploring the old town.    There are two pools here one on the main floor and another on the rooftop terrace. Both pools are serviced by the restaurant throughout the day and provide a gorgeous ambiance for vacation photos. The spa is also very popular here though we did not have a chance to try it ourselves. Make sure you try a few items from the restaurant on the terrace the food here is reasonably priced for a hotel and is as exceptional as the ambiance (we loved the lamb!).    We spent three nights in the Camel room and I'd recommend it as the perfect room for couples travelling together. It's on the second floor of the hotel and is very quiet with what felt like our own veranda facing inside the hotel looking upon African-themed sitting areas as well as a huge twinkling chandelier and lush plants below. We spent quite a bit of time on our laptops from this indoor veranda and I'm happy to report that the wifi was quite strong for us as well.    All-in-all La Sultana was one of the highlights of our trip and we would 100% recommend it to any couples or families looking to experience Marrakech while feeling right at home surrounded by true Moroccan luxuries.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: La Sultana is a beautiful luxurious Hotel and Riad set in the wonderfully bustling old town Medina. The decor and room was wonderful and you are greeted by the glorious smell of roses upon entering the hotel. The staff were absolutely amazing. They were extremely helpful and no ask was too much. The food in the restaurant was superb and the view from the rooftop area just tops it all off! If you are travelling to Marrakech make sure you book La Sultana.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Instantly upon arrival the staff could not do enough for us and this continued throughout our stay. Our room was exceptional spacious comfortable quiet beautiful bathroom and products and the balcony at the edge of the courtyard quiet cool and relaxing. The welcome food in room on arrival turn down service bed fresh flowers and cleanliness outstanding.  The food we had whether it was breakfast or dinner was enjoyable.  The spa was exceptional especially the traditional hammam.  Location is very convenient within walking distance of the main square and souks and with a view of the Saadian tombs.  There are lots of lovely areas in which to sun or relax in. The atmosphere and our accommodation were truly memorable.  If ever we have the ability to return we will definitely stay at La Sultana!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hospitality is the identity of hotel La Sultana. Excellent and professional service in the reception on the roofterrace and in the spa. Spacious rooms and we dreamed we were royalties. The hotel is conveniently located in the Kasbah and on walking distance of other tourist spots in Marrakech. Thank you very much ; we enjoyed our stay and we hope to be back soon.  Arie van Dijk and Gerry van Beek.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A beautiful property with a wonderful atmosphere & lovely staff. Great attention to detail with fresh flowers every day complementary cool drinks on the sunbathing terrace & excellent service. We loved the soft dates on our pillows every night! Good food & relaxed dining whether on the roof terrace or around the pool.    The roof terrace is stunning with an unheated plunge pool for cooling off & the heated pool in the main courtyard is beautiful.    The location is great - an oasis of calm in the madness of the kasbah. Only a 10 minute stroll to the main square & close to the palaces & Saadian tombs.    All in all a lovely relaxing week in beautiful surroundings.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Its like a fairy tale 1001 nights
Review_Text: have been here now already for the second time. Its a pearl of a Hotel. Small personal luxurious and very central. the food is brilliant and it is a great surprise every time you are put in a room. they are all different and so special
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I have seen and stayed in many of the luxury hotels and riads in Marrakech and this is my absolute favourite. Great location in the Kasbah area of the medina right next to the Saadian Tombs and an easy walk to the Koutoubia Mosque and Djemma El Fna. This is a beautiful and romantic riad (actually 5 riads in one) with an amazing roof terrace that hosts a bar and restaurant - great place for dinner or just a sundowner. It also has one of the best spas in Morocco and service worthy of a 5 star hotel something not all riads can claim.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bianca R wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: The place is very beautiful everything detailed fresh flowers inside of the room big room spectacular decoration......the hotel staff are very kind they helped me with everything I asked great service room too. They are very attentive they welcome us with tea and local sweets...I really donÂ´t have any complaints everything perfect the hotel this wonderful!  But it is in the old part of Marrakech inside the medina so the location is not very pretty but if you want to know Marrakech as it is certainly you must stay there even been inside of the medina was very easy to get a taxi to the hotel the hotel is very easy access.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were thoroughly pleased with our stay at La Sultana Marrakech. From the rooftop breakfast poolside relaxing the amazing location (steps from the Saadian Tombs and a short walk to the exciting Jamaa el fna place) to the nightly (fresh!!) dates on our pillows it was the perfect visit. Very comfortable an clean rooms with all the amenities.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Danielle C wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: I stayed at La Sultana on sep2016 and I loved the location inside the Medina  has a nice rooftop where you can seta and have a drink inside the buzz of the city  the breakfast is nice in a peaceful area  the riad is very romantic!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were staying locally so visited La Sultana for drinks one night and dinner another - the staff are incredible they really go above and beyond to make you feel welcome and at ease.
