They are attentive without going overboard! My grandmother dining with us was struggling to read the menu so was quickly provided with a torch and some reading glasses!    I would highly recommend this hotel and hope to one day be able to stay here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Julia P wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Title: Authentic Riad in the heart of Medina
Review_Text: Stayed 1 week in a wonderful oasis at la Sultana. The staff make a fuss of each client especially Saida who is a gem. Many thanks for everything. La Sultana is definitely the best option in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed one night in La Sultana on my way back to Europe and it was the right choice. The location is great people are very friendly and the service is spot on they will go out of their way in making sure that your stay is perfect. I only had limited time and this was the first time in Marrakesh (and not the last time as i will come back) so i asked what was the best way to see the old city they recommended a guide and he was brilliant. Had dinner at the roof top restaurant and the food was excellent and what's most special is that the decoration in the hotel unique and room is like nothing else that i have stayed in. Overall Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: A wonderful oasis in the heart of the Marrakesh medina. Outstanding service and the staff were very attentive and nothing was too much trouble for them. The boutique individual rooms are very special with unique decor and a very welcoming feel. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dee H wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Title: A Totally Lovely Experience in Marrarkech!
Review_Text: A few weeks ago I had the pleasure of staying a week at La Sultana Marrakech. My stay was absolutely wonderful! It was truly an experience that I will never forget. The property is stunning and is in a great location within the Medina. From here you step out and immeditaly access the vibrant life of the old city. The service at La Sultana is outstanding! Saida and her team make everyone feel instantly at home and are there to help with anything one needs --- from arrival to departure. They become like family. I miss them! I must say my stay at La Sutlana was so much more than a just a stay; it was a warm and wonderful cultural experience!! SDH
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: This was my second time staying at La Sultana and I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. Saida and Khalid are always warm and welcoming. The entire staff is attentive accommodating and go out of their way to make you feel comfortable. The attention to detail is unmatched. I was touched when several staff members remembered me from my stay last year and made a point of welcoming me back. Location couldn't be more perfect. Great location in the Kasbah. The best terrace in the Medina!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I recently stayed at La Sultana in Marrakesh. It is such a stunning property in a great location within the old city. A boutique property with such interesting decor and such a homely warmth to it. The staff were amazing and very attentive. My only complaint was it could be a little noisy for some but we were there the day prior to a major festival so there was a lot of excitement out in the streets. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this property!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Mario L wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: I was 6 nights in the Hotel. From arrival to check out I am complete satisfied. Small things disturbed a bit but have not changed the overall impression.  I stay often in Marrakech included Mamounia. But I felt more comfortable in La Sultana.  I could without doubts recommend it to friends and all others.  I enjoyed my stay a lot.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: La Sultana was a gem we stumbled upon after visiting the Saadian Tombs which are just adjacent to the property. The place has an old world feel about it which was just mesmerizing. My wife and I felt like we had been magically transported back 50+ years to a Riad which was just dripping with opulence and over the top courteous service.    The food was impeccable I had camel kebabs which were delicious and my wife's Ceasar salad was equally good. Our server was perfectly courteous and professional without hovering.    We took a peek around the Riad before leaving and were just blown away by the attention to detail the beautiful artwork and the incredible craftsmanship throughout. Just a wonderful experience all around wish we had known about it prior and we would have stayed here for certain. Next time Inshallah.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: MattM M wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: A great property with staff willing to help at anytime. The room was a great size with a comfortable bed and the bathroom was huge. A very quiet and relaxing stay. I would recommend this hotel for couples not necessarily for young families.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Stunning rooms many different areas to relax and soak in the sun & luxury. Roof top terrace with a pool bigger pool downstairs. You must try the Spa! Attentive staff always there to help and assist you. Perfect place to stay for our Honeymoon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Found this hotel accidently. Near the Kasbah mosque.  Stunning Morroccon style architecture like a riad. You would not appreciate the beauty from outside.The terrace offers all kinds of cuisine. We had a club sandwich and mohitos as it was lunch time.  Excellent views of the Kasbah and the the souks. Enjoyed sitting under a covered canopy with Morroccon decor. Enjoyed the cool mist sprayed us periodically to keep us cool
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is situated right on the busy square it is beautifully decorated and for ladies the best part is the Spa on site it is such a treat after a long day to return to your hotel with the treatment of steam and good scrub the soap they use is so wonderful after that treatment my whole body is renewed room and service was great the only discomfort was during the time of our visit there were security and body check for all personnels enter into the premise but guess this was necessary security measurement...    A wonderful place definitely come again!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Aram Tavitian wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: Visited La Sultana for their hammam followed by dinner on their rooftop terrace. The hammam was very very good. Felt incredibly good and relaxed afterwards. Following the hammam we had dinner at the rooftop restaurant which was also great. Amazing service and great food. The restaurant serves Moroccan and European food. Both the hammam and the restaurant are worth visiting. La sultana is located in the medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: It's a beautiful property and the staff is eager to please but for a property charging premium prices it fell short in many important places.    The cooking class was a great example of this. Absolutely do not take their cooking class. There are many other places in Marrakech that offer cooking classes and I wished we had chosen one of them instead. The instructors were friendly but spoke limited English and didn't have answers to basic questions about Moroccan food. They knew just enough to walk us through the recipes. But the experience fell short of cooking classes we have taken in the past where we actually learned something about the cuisine and culture rather than just follow a recipe as we did here.    In general we found the food and drink options on the property to be lacking high in price and low in quality which is a shame because the place is so lovely. We would have spend more time but after a couple of disappointing meals we ate and drank elsewhere. We found food at other riads and restaurants to be far higher quality at a far lower price.    The concierge service was also lacking. We didn't get great recommendations and a staffer made a mistake on setting up a booking. Frustrated we stopped asking and relied on our own research. A property charging high prices should be equipped with people who can provide solid advice.    These kinds of shortcomings would be excusable at a budget property but not at this price point. It's a shame because the property and rooms are lovely with beautiful details and lots of great places to explore and relax in including a great pool and rooftop.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great location beautiful rooms great food but most of all wonderful staff. We stayed in The Elephant room which was huge and had its own balcony overlooking the pool area. Will definitely be back to this hotel as I felt so relaxed here and the atmosphere was friendly. At times it almost felt like we had the place to ourselves. Heaven!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Betty Rice wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: - exquisite spa beautiful decor the nicest maids in the world!    - had to change rooms due to air conditioning not working. Staff left our luggage for over an hour and we had to collect it from the old room ourselves which had been left wide open.    - The hotel called a doctor on request and collected a prescription for me although I would expect this level of customer service for the price.    - Staff were OK but nothing like we had heard. Below average customer service except the maids who were amazing.    - Disappointing food despite the hotel being aware of our dietary requirements they made no preparation to cater for this. Seriously my husband was offered a tomato sandwich...    - Spa needs a second mention as it was amazing.    - I doubt we would pay a crazy amount of money to return (we were on our honeymoon and expected the hotel to make more of a fuss about this!) but I would return to the spa.    - The location is brilliant but would recommend people visit the La Sultana in Oualidia over this one!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Claudia R wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: My husband and I traveled to Morocco with another couple of friends. After have been to Casablanca we drove our own car to Marrakesh. As we members of SLH we could not miss out La Sultana Marrakesh. Hidden in a small road the hotel has a unique gate from which you can never image there are 5 entire riad inside! Arrived in the evening we were welcome with fresh milk and some sweet Moroccan biscuits while sitting in a table at the roof top. Just with this atmosphere we were more than satisfied. Our room was an enchanting style with huge bed fire place and a big bath (which we never tried coz we figured out that the time and the water to cover the bath could have been thousand of liters!). The only thing we were disappointed was the air condition that was broken. However the staff immediately gave us another room to repair the inconvenience. We decide later to go back to our room the day after once they fix because my husband preferred a balcony room for his smoking needs! Beyond that we all of us highly recommend La Sultana! The reasons why are various: firstly human resource are more than friendly and professional (a special thanks to Hasan who helped us out for a desert trip to Er Chagaga!) and never rude; secondly the food is more than fabulous (sheep kebab- as in the picture- and the Moroccan salad) and beside we tried the restaurants outside La Sultana restaurant (even if a bit late to serve!) for us ranks the highest position. Thirdly swimming and decoration are terrific! Impressive place
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Shaun H wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Title: Could not fault in any way!
Review_Text: An oasis of calm in the maelstrom of chaos that is Marrakech.  Beautiful hotel great food near to all the things you need to experience - whether good or bad : it is a crazy city which can take some getting used to! - but what tops it off the perfect staff.  Highly recommended.  My tip - get a taxi around the city about sunset to get the feel of the place without being thrown right in the deep end.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Outstanding Riad, outstanding service. . .I could stay forever
Review_Text: La Sultana Marrakech is THE BEST experience ever. We stayed June 30 - July 2. The entire staff is excellent and the service is 5 star. There are four themed sections of the Riad; African Moorish Moroccan and Spanish. Each is very beautiful relaxing and peaceful. Because there are a limited number of rooms and suites there are plenty of quiet areas to relax and enjoy. There is a pool quiet fountains and an amazing rooftop for drinks breakfast dinner sunbathing and jacuzzi. There is a wonderful spa too. The meals were excellent. We had breakfast each day and dinner one evening. The staff was also very helpful making reservations with a local restaurant on the second night. We highly recommend La Sultana. You will want to return over and over again!    A.M. and D.P  Washington DC
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I am overcome with a surreal amount of giddy glee when I think about the wonderful stay my travel buddy and I enjoyed at La Sultana. So in an attempt to organize my thoughts and to make this review informative I broke my review out by category:    Service    A month prior to our arrival I begin to email the staff about my itinerary included with the mechanics was a disclaimer that my friend and I were women traveling alone and as such were apprehensive and needed some guidance and recommendations. I received an email back the next morning from La Sultana specifically; Hassan with a very detailed itinerary including tour guides excursions and car pick up as requested. This interaction very much put myself and friend at ease. Ladies traveling solo...I would 100% endorse that you stay here.    Upon arrival at La Sultana we were greeted by the friendly and accommodating staff who from start to finish they made our stay seamless and wonderful. Thinking back every request question and need was attended to.  2 things I will call out as I believe they are an example of exemplary service:  1. I mentioned that I left me pool shoes at home accidentally and later that evening a pair of leather house shoes were left in my room.  2. My friend mentioned that she was going to need to buy a small bag to carry all her purchases home since we were busy packing to leave the property a bellman went out to source and purchase a small suitcase in her stead. Talk about a great sendoff!    The rooms    Spacious with beautiful decor the rooms are opulent yet warm and welcoming. Your stay is well thought out from the snacks that await you in your room to the little extras like sun hats tote bags and extra towels. I especially loved the wood doors that shutter the main door for sun and privacy. But my favorite thing about my room (Ibis) was the shower...mental note to buy one for home.    The property    We spent most of our time while in hotel at the pool or on the rooftop. Both areas offer everything you need to spend a lazy posh afternoon away from the busy suks and sites. My favorite place in hotel was the whirlpool on the rooftop where I spent most evenings reading while sipping my mint tea.    The Restaurant    The cuisine was exceptional. I enjoyed the "make your own salads" options for lunch in the pool atrium; all the ingredients were fresh and greens were perfectly crisp. for dinners I was able to enjoy the tasting menu as well as a la cart options. The tasting menu was perfectly paced and portioned so it did not leave me feeling gut wrenching full. The menu took you on a cultural journey with berber salads and tagines however the chef took these traditional dishes and added some modern techniques which was quite fun and delicious! Oh and the wine list is pretty good try the local Medallion Rose ;)    The Spa  Go and indulge...the hammam (sitting in a room filled with hot steam followed by washing and massage) is one of my favorite parts of my trip. The spa facilities were clean and serene. The staff is professional gracious and courteous.    Overall La Sultana (property) meets every expectation and the staff goes above and beyond...for me the perfect place to stay while on vacation!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Onkar S wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: Stayed at La Sulatana for a week and thoroughly enjoyed our stay the rooms were lovely with nice details as wad the rest of the place. Food and the cactus mojitos are a must as is the tangine on the lunch menu. This hotel is in Old Marrakech and hidden away next to sadian tombs in an excellent location with staff that go out of their way to help as much as they can. I would recommend this hotel to anyone its amazing as are the spa facilities.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My four year old daughter and I spent an amazing week at La Sultana in Marrakech. The staff was incredibly attentive and flexible to our needs. They helped arrange activities that could work for us including modifying the cooking to accommodate a four year old. Setting up city guides day trips and restaurant reservations. Everyone on the staff (front desk restaurant spa housekeeping and bell staff) went above and beyond to make our stay special including arranging little treats for my daughter! We took advantage of the beautiful spa and spent a relaxing couple of afternoons there or at the pool. The property is stunning. From the pools to the rooftop restaurant to the unique rooms everything is beautiful and immaculate. The location is also incredibly convenient and we were able to walk to the square many of the sights and the souks.    I hope to be back someday soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We travel regularly to Morroco and Marrakech in particular. You find many five stars hotel in what has become a very touristic location. This said La Sultana is a world apart. The succession of five magnificent riads is making this hotel absolutely unique. Whoever appreciates the architecture know how the atmosphere and decoration of those clever constructions will be absolutely delighted. The hotel is also perfectly located in the medina and easy to find even by car. The staff is wonderful and very professional. They took care of the full family with a lot of small attentions. You could feel a real and natural pleasure to make our stay as exceptional as possible. Similar to what you would do with your best friends staying at your home. Whether at the restaurant at the swimming pool at the spa the teams were fantastic. By the way the Spa is the best ever we experienced in Morroco one where time does not matter anymore but just your wellbeing counts. We will back for sure and look forward to it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Great locale and a truly fabulous hotel. I have travelled the world but I defy even the most cyncial not to be impressed. Each room has genuine character and the rooftop bar is a great place relax at night as is the pool during the day. If you are watching your wallet this is not the place for you but if you have the money or fancy a splurge - go for a genuinely memorable experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had an amazing stay at La Sultana Marrakech. The staff was incredibly attentive and made our stay so enjoyable. We took advantage of the Cooking Classes and Spa Services during our stay. The rooms were tastefully decorated and included wonderful amenities. We enjoyed the delicious breakfast buffets and inspired dinner options. The location was ideal with convenient access to many of the Marrakech highlights. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a convenient and luxurious riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Damir R wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: My girlfriend booked the Zebra suite for my birthday and I have to say it was like something out of a movie set. The most beautiful setting and rooms the staff are outgoing and there to assist with anything you need with a friendly and personal touch. We really did love this place and if we returned we'd stay here again. Location is right in the heart of the Medina (old town) where you can walk to the main square and the old souks in 10minutes.    I highly recommend this hotel if you are visiting the area! 10/10.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had an amazing experience in La Sultana. The hotel was incredible very cosy and the room was enormous and clean. I would like to highlight the staff; they were very friendly attentive and helpful!! It is the place to be in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We went to La Sultana Marrakech for honeymoon!!!! it was the best choice that we could have done!!! they were very polite and friendly! Mrs Saida arranged everything from our transfers to airport and the guide tour they also made a reservation for dinner with a good table to one of the best restaurants in the city that you can see belly dancing.  This that was unexpected was that every time you go to hotel you are waiting to see worst things than you see in the internet but La Sultana was better than every photos we had seen before in the internet.  it is the first time that we met this everything was much better than we expected.  It was very clean and chambermaids were coming to our room at least 3 times to put roses and candles in our room.  As honeymooners(Mrs Saida was calling us like that :)) they upgraded our room from Junior Suite to the Dromadaire suite which was fabulous with gold sinks it was perfect!!!! We combined la sultana Marrakesh with La Sultana Oualidia and we leaved 6 nights like king and princess!!!! everything was perfect!!!!  Everything was like fairytale!!!    We are waiting for our first anniversary now!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Eli B wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Title: You will not want to leave..ever
Review_Text: There's nothing much to do here except read snooze swim and walk. Time seems to slow. Traipsing around in a frenzy of sightseeing requires this treatment. The landscape is too beautiful to languish in the hammam. The lagoon's changing colours are hypnotic morning silver to blue sapphire to evening purple when lamps glimmer in the garden and tiny frogs emit love calls from the lily ponds.  Qualidia is a three-hour drive from Marrakesh with no carpet shops beach bars or street hustlers/ Cubist houses tumble towards the lagoon and its haven for sardine lovers... the fishermen will cook them on the beach over charcoal. oysters are bought by the bucket-load.  Our suit is heavenly and breakfast and evening dining is a hymn to the area's seafood abundance. Fish and more fish cooked in a salt crust deboned at your table on a silver platter with practised flicks of the wrist. The wine is white and is revelation as is the gold and then pink of the world outside. I never want to leave    i
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing hotel, great staff, inspiring property!
Review_Text: We went to La Sultana for a romantic escapade and it couldn't be better. The rooms are enormous and very 'marrocain' ours has an impressive bathroom... The staff was very friendly and helpful. Here you get the 5 stars treatment without the 'snobish' attitude that sometimes comes with it... We felt like home...  Best features: Great pool inside the Medina! Very good spa!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ramon C wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: As always a perfect stay impeccable service relaxation and tranquility in every corner. Undoubtedly the best option of the medina as we already knew.    It has greatly improved the offer of the restaurant. quality and innovation without losing the roots of Moroccan cuisine.    Back for sure we will return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David C wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: The hotel is superbly decorated and is a true haven from the hustle outside. All staff are professional friendly and attentive especially Ilyass who welcomed us after a long flight and made us feel at home immediately. The food is also a very high standard and a wider menu than the other restaurants we tried. Worth every penny!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Oasis of beauty...Impossible to beat this !
Review_Text: We returned for the second time to La Sultana this time we brought friends from LA with us...They weren't disappointed!! We had the most incredible trip there is nothing that the staff won't do for you everything is PERFECT! We had two rooms all of which were beautiful just stunning. The lunches are delicious as was dinner on the roof terrace and the breakfasts were fresh and full of great choices and juices. We will never go anywhere else when in Marrakesh we are always made so welcome... Thank you all so much we can't wait to return again next year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Colleen M wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay at this beautiful 5-riad hotel. We were able to have an authentic experience without having to compromise on location service cleanliness atmosphere. The staff were ready and willing to handle all things we requested and all those things we had not considered to request. After a lackluster experience at a 5-star hotel nearby one day we were relieved to come back to the sanctity of La Sultana. The food is delicious as well - breakfast and dinners on the rooftop could not be beat! As someone who thoroughly researches travel particularly hotels I can save you quite a bit of time by telling you to look no further and book here - you won't regret it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I was in La Sultana on my Honeymoon.  When I choose the accommodation I focus on room condition service and spa.  All of them are really great there.    In addition the site of hotel is very near to historical place so I feel like stay in the middle of history.    La Sultana is lovely and luxury hotel in Morocco. I will stay in La Sultana when I go back to Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ana T wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Title: Marrakech and the thousand and one nights
Review_Text: Very nice place to rest comfortable quiet where one can stay near the pool to read a book or go to the roof terrace to take a mint tea as in the other terraces with many well decorated rooms inside. This hotel includes several "riads" mine was the Sherazade each one with several bedrooms. Each room is identified not by a number but by a animal's name instead - elephant rhino leopard tiger etc. All the bedrooms are spacious but very cosy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Like something out of a fairytale. Every floor ceiling and wall is done to perfection. The nicest hotel I've ever stayed in.  The rooms are huge. mine had a loft area. Many little alcoves and sitting areas to explore. Like something out of a movie.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Possibly the best hotel we have stayed in. And we've stayed in a lot.
Review_Text: From the moment you arrive you feel as though you're home. If your home is stunningly eye-wateringly detailed with beautiful touches everywhere you turn. I even lay flat on my back to take a photo of a small section of ceiling. The flowers in the water features vases and bowls are lovely touches and show an excellent flair for design.    You will feel pampered from the start. The staff will look after every little detail for you - checking us in for our flight home ensuring our glasses are topped up as required (without being pushy) and bringing a small chair for your handbag should they spy it on the floor. They provided us with an excellent transfer service to and from the airport. Which made things much simpler.    The sunbathing areas both by the main pool the roof-top plunge pool and even the small jacuzzi pools dotted around have the perfect number of sunloungers - enough space between them to make you feel relaxed rather than crowded. Towels and cushions as required. Waiter service is friendly and set at just the right level to make you feel looked after. Complimentary delicacies are brought round from time to time which give you a glimpse of the cuisine.    On the subject of cuisine...... Breakfast is excellent. A very good selection of meats and cheeses pastries - sweet and savoury - cereals juices and a large selection of egg options. Lunch is a very good menu which offers snack-size meals upwards. If you feel like it you can enjoy three courses of excellent food along with a very good selection of wine or just a beer. My husband was a huge fan of the barbecue. The camel is very tasty and should be tried as should the cactus mojito.    The evening meal deserves its own paragraph. Pre-dinner drinks on the terrace. Attentive friendly service. A wonderful position for the sunset watching storks on the minarets and enjoying the swooping swifts as they scramble for whatever insects are in the air is possibly worth the cost of the holiday on its own (though we saw very few insects during the days and evenings - no mosquito issues at all). You will be escorted across the beautifully lit terrace to your table where you will receive after placing your order an amuse bouche just to get those taste buds working. You would then be presented (with a flourish!) with your first course. Should you wish they also provide a choice of two tasting menus. Excellent for introducing you to their menu for later nights. The wines are excellent and very easy to pair with your selection of food. If you can manage to fit in a desert you really should. These are each a work of art both gastronomically and visually. Accompanying your meal is some live music which is delightful. We always thanked the performer as we left as well as the waiting staff. We cannot compare the pricing with other restaurants in Marrakech as we chose to only eat in the hotel however I have seen comments saying that this restaurant is on the pricey side. In our opinion we felt that it was worth every penny and when we return we suspect we would only eat here again.    The spa is well worth a visit and the hammam should be tried to be believed. One of the most thorough scrub-downs I have ever experienced and just ideal for kicking off the holiday. We followed with a massage and facial and left feeling totally relaxed. And clean. So very clean.    Usually I like to get the name of any staff member I feel is over and above the others in an effort to ensure their commitment is recognised. I find it impossible to do in this instance. They are simply all superb. Maids cleaners maintenance gardeners waiting staff front of house....... Without exception.    This hotel is worth visiting for the restaurant alone whether you choose to stay here or not. Arrive in time for the sunset and don't forget to book. We stayed in low season and it was still necessary most nights.    We stayed in the Jaguar Suite and found it to be in an excellent position enjoying two private terrace areas and overlooking the main pool. A large lounge area office area walk-in wardrobe very well appointed bathroom (jacuzzi bath separate rain-shower double basins and well-lit make up table) separate toilet and a very comfortable very large bed. We found the suite to be peaceful. Even late one afternoon when a family with young children were enthusiastically enjoying the pool after we had retired to our room with the windows and doors open.    We are keen to return and would recommend others to visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: La sultana is an oasis hidden behind a wall within the walled old city and is so beautiful and sumptuous and rich in every detail that you just gasp as you go from  Room to exquisite room - and the pool and the terrace and the spa - words fail me! The staff is kind lovely and caring for ecru detail from the welcoming mint tea and cookies to arranging dinners hammam (the morrocan spa treatment that puts any other spa treatment to shame) just an elegant relaxing experience as the entire city of Marrakech - like a cool Nessim (breeze) during a terrific warm summer day - we loved our stay!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Dropped in for cocktails and returned for dinner as well
Review_Text: While staying nearby with my family we had often seen the bright red uniform worn by staff outside the entrance to the hotel waiting for guests to arrive. We decided we would be brave and ask if we could go in for drinks one evening and commit to spending more than usual to see what the hotel was like.  We were made very welcome indeed and shown to the pretty roof terrace where we watched swallows and storks fly over as the sun set and we peeped down at the Saadian Tombs next door.Just lovely sitting among the candles and flowers decorating the terrace. Drinks a fraction dearer than in our 5 star hotel and less than we would pay in a 4 star one in England!  After enjoying the delicious canapes that came with our drinks and meeting some lovely staff we asked for a menu and were surprised at the very reasonable prices (230 dirhams for my enormous seafood and fish Ocean Couscous) considering this is a Luxe Hotel and so we booked a table for the next night.    We returned to enjoy an excellent meal with a good variety of things to choose from we were invited to take a look round the hotel's main rooms which were fascinating with pools and tropical greenery glimpsed through decorated archways. So glad we went in as everyone was very friendly and the hotel inside is as amazing as we hoped it would be.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: James N wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: I know a revisit sounds like a lack of ambition and perhaps it may do however to total experience is one of only sumptuous luxury. From the moment you walk through the large carved doors the welcome is second to none. Each room is a quirky cool magnificent eclectic mix of cultures reassuringly warm gorgeous and simply excellent. The staff are unobtrusively attentive led by Saida Loutou attend your every whim however ridiculous! The photos speak for themselves and the staff make you feel like you've always been there as something more elevated than a guest; and endear themselves so you would always go back! We have booked again despite visiting the La Mamounia to check it out. Thank you Saida and staff another wonderful trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hands down the nicest place I've ever stayed. Great room carved Marble ceilings and huge bathroom. Helpful friendly staff beautiful common areas. La Sultana was a quiet peaceful oasis in a loud and busy city. The roof is a great place to watch the city below.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Robin R wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: We visited Marrakech in June of this year (just before Michelle Obama and her daughters!). We were fortunate to spend 5 nights at La Sultana. What an amazing experience. Our riad was beautifully decorated and our room was decadent and lavish. I cannot say enough kind words about the staff. They made us feel like welcomed guests and went above and beyond or expectations. The location in the medina was quiet and relaxing. Most times it seemed as if the entire resort was our alone. To the staff the ladies in the spa to the waiters chefs and front desk staff - thank you. We will cherish our memories of this luxury hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A relaxation oasis in the middle of the busy city of Marrakech! We loved our room and the spa and of course every unique corner in this hotel! Excellent service! Thanks for an amazing stay at La Sultana!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jale H wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: Try it  so You'll know it!  We have been overall very happy and will repeat.  Thank you: to every person of the staff and specifically thanks to the cook for his personalized menus.  1 thing would be the music at dinner same musician every night is just too much. Some change would be appreciated.    J & J
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: RITA M wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: I am use to stay in la Sultana for business or leasure. Inmy opinion it's the best place and the most beautiful place in Marrakech also in Morocco ! That's gorgeous! The staff is absolutely perfect the food is fantastic. The spa is a marvellous place. Sultana website photos are reflecting the perfect atmostphere of the location.  I am travelling a lot and I really think that this place is one of the best in the world!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Magic! Absolute luxury in the heart of Marrkech
Review_Text: No photographs and no words can do justice to this gorgeous riad. La Sultana is by far the most gorgeous place I've ever stayed in - it feels like a fairy tale a magical palace that is also your cozy home. It was an absolute highlight of our travel through Europe and Africa. The location is excellent â€“ you are in the very heart of the medina yet completely quiet private and secluded. The rooms are the work of art; the swimming pool and the spa are breath-takingly beautiful. Their interior design unbelievable with masterfully selected art. The staff - Ilyass Rachida Khalid and Saida treated us like family every minute of the stay. In one of our rooms we had a minor technical glitch that most hotels wouldn't even consider an issue. Folks at La Sultana surprised us with an upgrade to a luxurious two story suite with a balcony and to spare us the inconvenience of moving (!) offered to keep our suitcases in the original room. We were speechless. The only tough part of the stay was that we had to leaveâ€¦ Oh and the food in the restaurant is delectable. And the spa is excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: An incredible experience....beautiful staff....amazing food....I'm not even going to mention the room we stayed in because quite frankly I don't want anyone else staying in it ever again I only want it to be kept in its perfect perfect state for me and my ecstatic family. I think you can tell we were overjoyed with our experience having never been to Marrakech before and felt enlightened into the Islamic way of life (Ramadam started the day we left)...I fear I'm sounding like a member of a bias family but I'm a Londoner with no Moroccan connections up until now!!! I'm/we're definitely going back....no shadow of a doubt....hopefully into the same room!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sherry S wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: La Sultana was a dream not often does a hotel meet the lofty expectations of ones bucket list but this stay did. We loved the properties Moroccan styles Riads lots of common areas and a fabulous roof top area with views over the Medina. The location being right in the Kasbah was perfect for us. La Sultana arranged for a great guide Ali to help us navigate the endless paths and alleys. It was a dream property for us.    Only room for improvement the arrangement for our pick up was messed up but they agreed to credit this back so that was fair.    Can't wait to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here last week for 3 nights. Everything was perfect The room was exquisite the spa wonderful and the staff could not do enough for us. The buffet breakfast was terrific and served on the roof of the hotel We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and hope to return
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An amazing time at La Sultana
Review_Text: I visited La Sultana for mint tea 10 years ago and have dreamed of returning ever since. The reality of our 3 day stay certainly met all expectations and more.  La Sultana was one of the stand out experiences of all the luxury hotels we have ever stayed in. It would be one of the main reasons for my return to Morocco. We would love to return!  We particularly enjoyed the beauty of the design and the effort that has gone into detailing to create the most beautiful aesthetic environment- its astounding.  I particularly liked the original riad The Sherazade which is the most African in style.  We stayed in the GIraffe Room which couldnt have been more breathtaking 100% satisfyed !  My spa experience was fantastic it is the most beautiful jewel like atmosphere  all mint green and rose pink and to have warm water tipped over your head and body from a beautiful brass bowl was incredibly nuturing. Put me off going to other hammams as I didnt think it got any better than this!  We dined by the pool each night serenaded by fabulous music the food was of fine dining standard the chef excellent.  My only suggestion was the quality of the cooked foods at breakfast time didn't quite match the standard of the rest of the experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was definitiv the best hotel I Ever staid!!! PERFECT SERVICE and very beautiful familar house.Situated near all sightseeings by walking Distance.  Breakfast at the roof with all you need. WiFi works everywhere very good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Susie J wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed 3 nights. The hotel was like being in a museum. They have five riads and each has a different theme. Unique pieces complete each riad. Breakfast was on the top floor. The waiters were so nice always calling us by names. In fact I am Facebook friends with one. They all hug you when you leave. Our room was beautiful and the bathroom had a huge bathtub and a separate shower. We felt like we were really staying in Morocco. Location was great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Guy P wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Title: Beautiful, peaceful Riad in the Median
Review_Text: The hotel comprises 4 different Raids joined together. The decor in the open areas is simply beautiful with four different courtyards in different styles. Our room was off a pale marble courtyard and had a gorgeous four poster and marble bathroom. The restaurant is located around a sheltered ground floor pool with high walls. On the roof terrace there is another restaurant bar and a plunge pool. The Hamam is peaceful and so stylish.. If you want to "feel" Marrakech then stay here in the Medina not out on the fringes. And dont worry about the noise from the market it can barely be heard.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We recently stayed at La Sultana. The hotel room and facilities was excellent only surpassed by the excellent and accommodating staff. Each morning we were greeting by the restaurant staff at the open air rooftop dining area. The hotel is very cozy. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Simon P wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: We had booked La Sultana in Marrakech having found it on TripAdvisor for our honeymoon. I can honestly say that the hotel was not like it was in the pictures - it was FAR better!!. The dÃ©cor is stunning. We stayed in the Lion Suite which was large comfortable and very luxurious. The staff at the hotel were lovely the service impeccable. I cannot praise the hotel highly enough - highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Abu Faroug wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: This place is a real piece of art its comprised of 5 Riads (houses) joined together to make an enchanting hotel.  A spa to die for service is amazing food is scrumptious and the Medina market is right outside the hotel door.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: We could have stayed for way more than 1001 nights...
Review_Text: Perfectly restored old Arabian style palace in a perfect proximity to major historical sites.  Cozy and secluded rooftop terrace - an oasis above the hustle and bustle of the Medinah below.  Be sure to make use of its legendary Hamam: sooo good!  Elegant dinner setting in one of the beautifully illuminated patios - accompanied by live acoustical guitar music. Dinner was nice while somewhat overpriced for the local circumstances.  Reception desk: they're going the extra 1001 miles for you...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: If you are interested to see and to feel the real morrocan atmosphere you totally HAVE to go to this magic hotel. Every detail is precisely studied from the ambiance to the authentic cuisine. It is hidden in a busy street in the centre of the city and once you enter you will not want to go away from here seem the incredible quietness of the hotel. Elegant and relaxing it's the best place to stay in marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Wowza. This Riad is top notch, first class, perfection!
Review_Text: It is 5 Riads joined together and they are all quite different in their style of building and architecture which makes for a visual treat! This is one of the finest hotels we have ever stayed in. It was comparable to the Palaces in India where we have stayed. You know they are trying hard to create a beautiful environment when you lift the toilet seat to discover rose petals floating in the water. No detail has gone unnoticed or unadorned in this lux property. Such beauty and elegance are rarely found. Be sure to eat here as it was our BEST meal in all of Morroco. They candle lit poolside tables and live music only add to the perfect experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ian S wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: Let's put it this way.  I spent 5 nights in the Leopard Ryad and I never switched the TV on...It's real relax and great service. Do the Hamam in couple...its superb. Food is good. Of course you will be eating various kinds of Cuscus but Lamb wins!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Very nice greeting and friendly people. Loved the ambiance the authentic cuisine and not rushing service. Making each course enjoyable with live music and great decor. A must romantic location for couples looking to spend a quiet but nice evening together.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Milan P wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: From the street this riad is easy to be overlooked. Elegently hidden on a busy street. However once you enter you immediatelly forget buzz and noise of Medinas street. An oppulent elegantly constructed property will suddenly welcome you. Hotel is composed of 4 former riads each decorated in a different decor. I preferred a white marbled riad with yacuzzi in the middle. Swimming pool is well accessible though it is not a complete outdoor pool so if you are after some sun bathing you will need use roof top terrace.    Spa is amazing and book early concierge is very proactive and gave great dining tips and recommendations what to see and what to avoid.    I loved it and hope to come....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Gabrielle U wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: I recently stayed at La Sultana in Marrakech during a trip through Morocco. I had been to the northern part of the country and stayed in a small riad (almost like a Moroccan bed and breakfast). I was excited to return and bring my father to see Morocco.    La Sultana was the perfect hotel because it is built of 5 riads connected together to form a complete hotel. Thus the hotel maintains a quaint and boutique feeling but is still large enough to accommodate the luxuries of a larger hotel.    Some particular highlights were the stunning views of the courtyard from my room Le Fennec; cocktails on the rooftop overlooking the city; and the restaurant! The food was absolutely delicious and although I usually venture out of the hotel when traveling to eat and experience new things I was overwhelmingly happy that we chose to eat at the restaurant our first night.    The staff is incredibly helpful attentive and pleasant. All of our needs were met immediately. In particular Ilyass at the front desk was exceptionally welcoming. He showed us to our rooms stayed to make sure we knew how to work everything inside recommended fantastic dining experiences and offered to make us reservations all before we had even unpacked. He truly made our stay even more special.    I highly recommend La Sultana if you are staying in Marrakech and want a comfortable well-located and beautifully designed place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We weren't staying at this hotel but visited for the Hammam from entering the hotel it's a beautiful experience. We were welcomed by one of the staff who escorted us through the hotel into the spa area. This was a beautiful marble setting you felt relaxed straight away.  The traditional hammam involved first being in a marble room the ladies wash your body with lovely warm water and black soap you do end up naked but it's a natural experience so don't feel embarrassed after the wash you're taken to a second marble room where you are given a body scrub I also opted for the clay wrap. You are then thoroughly washed again before being led to the relaxation area which is tranquil and beautiful. The treatment lasted around 45 minutes and you are left glowing and feeling amazing.  I then had a back massage which again was amazing my friend had a deep tissue massage which she also said was perfect.  We then relaxed by the Jacuzzi for an hour to wind down with mint tea.  This was truly a lovely relaxing experience. We both felt wonderful afterwards and left with glowing skin feeling thoroughly rejuvenated.  Following the spa we visited the roof top terrace for lunch again this was delightful. The setting is beautiful. I had a Mediterranean salad which was perfect my friend opted for the vegetable tart also lovely.  I would definitely recommend this as an escape from the exciting madness that is Marrakech you won't be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A perfect way to begin a trip to Morocco
Review_Text: Our arrival at the airport was somewhat chaotic with lost luggage late at night. Once we found our driver and headed to La Sultana everything improved. The grounds are beautiful the food is excellent including oysters that couldn't be fresher. The staff was extremely accommodating giving me clothes to wear since my luggage did not arrive. The spa is not only visually stunning but the staff is very skilled providing a calming experience. The breakfast served on our patio was delightful. Our room was a bit small but the grounds were so inviting it did not matter. I would recommend La Sultana to anyone who enjoys tranquility and excellent service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were there just for the spa experience. It was simply marvellous and relaxing experience! We felt rejuvenated afterwards! Prepare to be awed for something beyond expectation. The ladies there have done a great job of scrubbing washing us. We fell asleep during the 50 mins massage. The hotel itself was so beautiful and stylish we would want to stay there for a few nights next time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Our stay at La Sultana was the most delightful experience the staff is very attentive the premises are luxurious the location is excellent right beside the Tombs Saadiens in the Kasbah. A truly enjoyable experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Melanie Martins wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: A Magical Experience in the heart of the Medina!
Review_Text: If you want a truly authentic experience then don't look further: La Sutana is definitely what you are looking for! All the main attraction of Marrakech are within walking distance from La Sultana.    When we arrived in the evening we didn't know what to expect to be honest: it was in the middle of the Medina and we had to go from the main door walk thru the outdoor patio enlighten by candles and then get into a second door to arrive at the reception. It was like a secret place a mystery.    Once we entered in the lobby we understood immediately how magical this place was! We got welcomed with traditional mint tea and pastry front of a very cozy fireplace.  The manager welcomed us and gave us a complete tour of the Hotel that was really much bigger than we thought! The Hotel has 5 Riads each one has a different style and different story. We went to the African styled Riad and got a beautiful suite in tones of black white and gold with high vaulted ceilings decorated in precious woods marble and copper and littered with paintings and objets dâ€™arts.    The Spa is definitely a must try as you have the best masseuse in town a fantastic Jacuzzi and 2 traditional hammams. Since I staid only 1 night I had time to do only the massage but it totally worth it as she was definitely amazing!  We had dinner at the restaurant near the pool with live traditional Moroccan music that turned the entire environment so magical full of candles and exoticism.  The food was really tasty although I had a very light meal (as I ate too much pastries during the day).    The next morning we had our breakfast at the rooftop terrace with the magical views of the Royal Palace the Koutoubia Mosque and the snow-capped Atlas Mountains in the distance! Was really impressive!    For lunch we got fish at the terrace since the weather was really sunny and warm. We felt definitely relaxed distressed and... in holidays!    1 day was definitely not enough to enjoy at the fullest this incredible and memorable place! We definitely have to come back again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tom D wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: This is an excellent hotel with exceptional standards across the board. The rooms are splendid and the rooftop terrace is as tranquil a place you will find in Marrakech. The staff are extremely friendly and accommodating. The highlights are the spa the food and the decor. It is perfect for those on a honeymoon. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: La Sultana Oualidia is a really lovely hotel. One of the best I've stayed in. Delicious fresh food and friendly people. Wonderful facilities. Would love to go back! Indoor pool was especially good - heated!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Catherine B wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: La Sultana is THE most amazing hotel!
Review_Text: We spent 5 nights at the beautiful La Sultana Hotel situated in the heart of Marrakesh. From the moment you walk through the door from the bustling busy streets you are transported into a world of calm and tranquillity. The staff are AMAZING...so helpful and thoughtful. Our room was spacious very clean and very comfortable. The food in the restaurant was fantastic. I really cannot praise this beautiful hotel enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Pretty Hotel, but not worth the stay
Review_Text: We were very much looking forward to this hotel based on all the wonderful reviews found during our search. We had booked our visit to Morocco and chose this hotel as the last stop and a nice way to end our honeymoon which brought us to other great hotels around the world. Sadly our vision of this hotel did not live up to the expectations we had based on other reviews. This being the 3rd hotel in our trip all of which were "5 stars" but this by far was not a 5 star hotel in comparison to the others. The riads are very beautiful there is no question about it. They have done an amazing job restoring and creating a small oasis from the chaos outside. Every picture taken is beautiful but this is where it ends. It's the service side of things where this hotel falls very short based on our experience. First of the other hotels we stayed at during this trip this was the only hotel not not acknowledge our special occasion. We weren't expecting a grand gesture by any means but at the other hotels both left a hand written note congratulating us and thanking us for staying with them. It's these small things that great hotels from average. Upon entering our room everything seems normal for awhile but then the smell of sewer started seeping into our room from the bathroom. We aren't the type to complain and we understand that the infrastructure of the city isn't always going to be modern so we dealt with the smell for the duration of our stay. But its hard to understand why the hotel wouldn't do a little more to alleviate this issue as it prides itself on being a premier boutique hotel and we couldn't have been the 1st to experience this issue. We felt like second class quickly upon our arrival. Its hard to figure out why other than our age and/or our nationality had something to do with it. We had nothing to deserve this as we are both quiet people and never complain and roll with whatever comes our way. It is unfortunate to have to write this as we have been all over the world and haven't experienced this issue before. My comment is based on how we observed others being treated in comparisons to ourselves. I guess this is why there are so many good reviews but we did not experience these first hand. After a day long discussion we decided that this hotel wasn't worth trying to make the best of it anymore and decided to check out a day early losing out on a nights stay and spending even more to change airfare.    This might be a premier boutique hotel but its far from it in comparison to others around the world.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: IF YOU DON'T SPEAK FRENCH OR ARE AN AMERICAN DON'T BOTHER.
Review_Text: Hotel staff was more favorable to the French. Oh and if you are Arabic speaking I wouldn't say you are from any Gulf countries either like Kuwait etc. Apparently they don't like them either.    A few instances with hotel staff which made them aloof to the fact we chose to stay at this particular Riad:    First night we had dinner there the main guy or I guess you could say more like manager dude (only guy wearing a black suit) was less than impressed he had to wait on us. As we walked up he was arguing with what appeared to be another patron not really sure as it was in French. Mind you we had been traveling all day and were exhausted. He didn't smile wasn't friendly and didn't really seem to have wanted us at his table. However when the British came to sit at a table next to ours his tune changed. Maybe because they were not American??? This was a common theme in Morocco.    The cooking class we paid a nice chunk of change to make our own food had a rude and downright just pissy instructor if that's what you want to call her. She never introduced herself never smiled nothing. We started the cooking class in silence with her pointing at objects to cut wash etc. And I told her I spoke a little Arabic and she still was pissy. My husband and I never felt more uninvited than we did then in that hotel. Luckily it was our last day. We ended the cooking class also in silence as she never said thank you which she could have said in French which she didn't or Arabic but that was too much trouble for her. You don't have to speak any language to know when people are rude. My advice is pay extra and go somewhere else with a few more options/ activities just in case it does rain and you are stuck inside at the mercy of the hotel and is overall bigger in nature. We kept seeing the same staff everywhere as they did multiple jobs at our Riad and maybe somewhere else like the Four Season's you won't have to go through what we did.    Finally in addition to the hotel Morocco is one of those places I will never go back. It just overall was not worth the time money and aggravation in my opinion.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I spent 4 nights here over the Christmas holiday. We luxuriated in comfort and peace after days shopping in the chaotic souks as well as exploring historical sights. Each day began with a superb breakfast by the pool. Choices included western or Moroccan specialties. Initially it was confusing to find our room - crocodile in the African part but soon we adjusted (there were always staff members strategically located to guide you) and enjoyed walking through the various courtyards. The friendly always attentive staff even left us a basket of wrapped gifts on Dec 24.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great location + you pay more for luxury
Review_Text: My wife & I spent 3 nights at La Sultana. Nicely located within the medina (walled area within the city) close to the main souk (market) it was well positioned for our daily explorations.    Great food & service plus a wonderful spa with "hammam" for couples that must be enjoyed! Quiet oasis away from the busy streets. Beautiful room. Very interesting multiple floors with interesting decorations & cozy hidden areas to steal away to. Nice terrace with bar dipping pool seats & a 360 degree view of the surrounding area.    The hotel was expensive but one usually pays more for luxurious surroundings.    The only negatives were:  - The shower floor never drained despite requests to fix it. I overheard other guests had similar/other bathroom issues. Possibly a weak point due to the constraints of the medina.  - Our room had a fireplace but we were forbidden to yse it for "safety reasons".

Review_Date: Nikos N wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: This hotel was perfect. The service was the best we have ever experienced. We were attended too at our every request. Nothing was an impossible task. The staff were very respectful and so polite. The food was beautifully cooked and well presented always. I cannot recommend this place enough. A MUST GO!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We didn't stay here but we might well on a future visit as it looked like the nicest of all the hotels/riads we visited in Marrakech. We spotted their rooftop restaurant when we were visiting the Saadian tombs (actually how we found most of our restaurants in Marrakech so do take the time to look up wherever you go!) thought it looked like a delightful spot and returned for lunch a few days later. We were not disappointed; from the moment we stepped through the door (and even the approach to the door is beautiful with really interesting brickwork) we were made to feel very welcome by the wonderful staff. Our lunch was delicious and the service excellent including bringing me a pretty miniature chair for my handbag so it didn't need to go on the floor. We had to walk through quite a lot of the hotel to reach the terrace and I must say it looks stunning with a gorgeous pool area - completely deserted during our visit.    It's in a great location not too far from the chaos of Jemaa el Fna but far enough to feel like a world apart. And judging by our meal the welcome we received and what we saw of the property I can only imagine the rooms are lovely. It's a member of the Small Leading Hotels of the World group a handful of which I've stayed in all of them excellent. We actually preferred the atmosphere of La Sultana to that at La Mamounia which we also visited for drinks. La Sultana is now top of my list of places to consider staying if I return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My friends and I have traveled quite extensively and we have stayed at high end small boutique hotels. We all felt this riad was probably the most beautiful and exquisite place we experienced. The riad is in an excellent location to the medina for easy access yet close enough to the outside.  The facility was beautifully decorated and the service impeccable. Ellias at the desk (and all the staff) went above their duties to make sure our stay was memorable.  When we return we will definitely stay at this facility and will recommend it to all of our friends.  FYI the restaurant is excellent and unfortunately we tried a local hamam but wish we had used the riad's amenities.  A true gem :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: One of the most beautiful accomodations I've ever been
Review_Text: Everything was just perfect! The view from the terrace our room the breakfast the staff. It is so beautiful too. Everybody was so helpful and we felt very comfortable and in a good place. The location of the Riad is also great in the southern part of the Medina - I would say in the calmer part of the Medina - but still it was only a 15 min walk to the souks and the "center" of the Medina. It was all perfect!  PS: We didn't try other food than breakfast.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Maria S wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: Superb small luxury hotel in the middle of the medina in old town. The 360 degree view from the rooftop is a nice little extra. Tasting menu with the Marrakech wine is hard to beat. Highly recommend it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a great place to stay. They'll pick you up from the airport and take you into the city - nice quick 10 min transfer too. When we got dropped off we were pretty confused as it looked like we had been dropped off not by a hotel which was a little disturbing however the hotel is down a short alley so fear not.    The staff were fantastic service was of the very highest level. The hotel is a combo of 5 old house and each open out into their own little courtyard and all have their own feel to them. No reason to pick one over the other but it's lovely to explore all the different sections and their different feelings. The hotel itself has a lovely feel - not very big and just has an intimate feel to it and wonderfully situated to wander around from if you choose to.    The room was superb beautifully decorated and very comfortable. Fantastic blackout shades which reduced light to virtually zero and muffled sound so we were able to sleep late on a couple of occasions with no issues.    The pool is a fantastic place to just relax at after a day of exploration and the staff will bring you whatever food or drink you ask for. The hotel also has a beautiful open air restaurant on the roof with panoramic view of the city. Eating there one evening was one of the highlights of our trip - fantastic local food available there too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We didn't stay there but we had a wonderful breakfast by the pool.the staff were so charming we were shown round the hotel which was amazing and then to the spa. Review in other section  We are definetly going to find the time to return and stay at La Sultana
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ruth G wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: kind welcome nice room  exquisite bath  every thing very clean  friendly helpful people  perfect service  good food . tipical Riad. wonderful terrac e near to the center  You can't find a better location!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chantelle M wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: I spent my birthday weekend here and was thoroughly spoiled. The staff are lovely very attentive and genuinely helpful. I would recommend booking the spa for a hammam and massage which was amazing. Beautiful rooms and gardens - I would highly recommend staying here as it is a beautiful Riad and very central.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jude B wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: Fantastic hotel all round. Room was exquisite communal areas plentiful amd comfortable service exemplary. I had a very indulgent two hours in the spa being scrubbed from top to toe which I thoroughly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Treat me like a Sultan at la sultana
Review_Text: A special thanks to :  Moustafa  Hassan  Khalid  Bader  Abbas    And the rest of la sultana team who make my stay absolutely amazing    I definitely recommend this Riad for those looking for the Moroccan dream experience
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Fantastic one of a kind hotel and staff. An oasis. Must be one of the best in Marocco. Beautiful rooms and common areas. Great gourmet food. Outstanding service - we have never experienced such exemplary service. We would most definitely go back. I would highly recommend this hotel there is nothing negative about it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gundula B wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Title: A true luxury gem in the middle of the Medina
Review_Text: Don't look any further: La Sultana is where you wnat to stay in Marrakech. The location is superb and is close to everything and it is tucked away in a little laneway and you find absolute peace and quiet in there. La Sultana is made of 4 different riads combined together in this amazing palace. Rooms are big and beautiful with beautiful interiors. The rooftop is amazing: you can view the Atlas Mountains and look over the city. Everything is just perfect! The service and the staff are OUTSTANDING. From the moment you arrive you are in the best hands and everything is looked after. They help you with tickets local drivers with excellent knowledge. Whatever you wish for they make it happen. Try the restaurant as well: amazing modern twist to traditional Maroccon dishes. We had a dream holiday and didn't really want to leave!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Friendly. Quiet. A great spa. Great location. We were a bit surprised upon arrival as the surroundings were not what we expected but we loved the fact that the hotel is in the middle of the busy streets of the old town.    Try the Hammam in the spa.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Well worth it! This place it a feast for the senses...
Review_Text: A friend and I stayed here on our last day in Morocco in December 2014 and it was one of the highlights of our trip! This place is like walking into every old movie you're ever seen that painted exotic visions of old Marrakesh complete eye-candy with every detail picture perfect and you can touch it and live in it during your stay! The staff were incredibly nice and helpful and went out of there way to assist use when we had trouble with our luggage drop off. The restaurant was also fantastic the service was amazing my friend has Celiac's disease and is allergic to dairy the minute we mentioned this the waiter said no problem brought out Gluten Free Bread and walked her through all the items on the menu that met her diet restrictions as well as pointed out which items could be modified. I've been to 49 countries and eaten a lot of incredible meals and between the ambiance the service and the incredible food (the homemade Foie Gras was soooooo good!) the dinner we had at La Saltana makes my 'top 5 best meals' ever list. The location is also great - easy walking distance to the city's biggest attractions. The Hammam is also very pretty but be advised the water is cool (its not a hot pool).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Maya K wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Title: best place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: La Sultana is a great hotel! We loved the location and being inside the Medina. The hotel staff was incredibly helpful. The rooms were gorgeous. We fell in the love with the rooftop which was huge. We had drinks up there a few times. Breakfast was really great. Mostly we loved the proximity to the Hamams souks and square. The conceirge was wonderful in helping us find amazing restaurants. On Christmas they put an amazing gift bag in the room which was incredibly nice. The staff and decor was fantastic.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I was very much looking forward to our stay here. It was our 12th or so visit to Marrakech. It was expensive but I thought would be worth it.    On a plus note staff and service excellent. The food was very good.    The not so good...    My room was a shoe box. No windows or balcony which from the website is very much insinuated and would be included with a view to the outside. If my room is bad it ruins my trip and it did. The room was smaller than the one I had in the first small Riad I stayed in Marrakech years ago and less palatial. It had pointless artefacts that overcrowded an already small room.    La sultana gives the description of a newly built hotel with a Riad feel and very luxurious. I disagree. I have previously stayed at Villa des Orangers and was hoping for a similar if not more luxe version. The website shows what looks like an outdoor pool area. It is in fact ground level inside and the open air section covered with plastic. Never have I seen this and it's not nice. So I had to sunbathe on roof swim on ground floor. If I had know I would never had stayed. Very misleading website.    I am sorry to have to write such a bad review.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Adrian A wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Title: Privacy in the Heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: The Sultana is a charming place . The privacy and the short distances we experienced during our Christmas holidays in the middle of the Medina were unique .  The roof top lounge is one of the best places to relax after a day in the Medina or after a trip to the regfional landmarks.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Location is awesome for walking around town and the main square and souks. My friend had a hammam (which she said was the best experience!) and I was tagging along for the ride. We had breakfast by the pool which was delicious and my friend went to the spa. I didn't have an appointment and they asked me if I wanted to wait while using their jacuzzi. They gave me a robe slippers and locked my belongings up while I took advantage of the jacuzzi (for free!!!). It was so nice of them- that would not happen in the USA. I highly recommend coming here for a meal and using the spa!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: La Sultana is a dream Hotel compromised of five beautiful riads. Intricate and luxury rooms with multiple special touches. The staff was amazing knowledgeable professional & very accommodating. Excellent drivers & guides. La Sultana made our visit to Morocco unforgettable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: La Sultana Marrakech is a gem for an authentic and comfortable luxurious stay.  Also the warmth kindness and professionality of every single staff member has made my stay truly unforgettable.  Tastefully decorated one just can't stop admiring all the details of finest craftsmanship which make this building so special.  I really recommend a stay in this Oasis in the heart of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: This was our dream of Marrakesh..completely fulfilled..!
Review_Text: From the first moment we wandered  bleary eyed  into the magical portal to this mysterious realm my eyes were dancing with joy at the beauty in every detail of this place. And my heart was warmed at every moment I had contact with a member of staff by the incredible kindness and hospitality of the staff. I cannot imagine a more beautiful place to have stayed in Marrakesh..one of the very many charms of this place is that you have all the luxury and benefits of the large five star hotels without being out of the city center you are five minutes walking to the souks  but above all the hotel itself is a jewel and the staff are its diamonds. WOnderful place- especially my great compliments to the majestic Madame Saida who I would consider the Queen of this palace  what a beautiful heart and a fine sense of wisdom and kindness with others after her how to begin? So many lovely people working at the hotel..I will always remember Yassine at the bar what a charming angel of a person. He was so kind with us..also Hannan(?) in the Hamman? A beautifl angel who treated me as if I were her own child during my spa time and brought me back to joy in a moment when I had much stress...all the ladies of the Hamman are wonderful Madame Rashaida (?) (forgive me if I do damage to the spelling of anyone's name ) was like a mother hen who knew exactly what I needed she made a wonderful spa planning for me when I was too exhausted to think and did it all in such a way that nothing felt hurried or "on the clock" . I will miss this place  very much and I look forward to my return Inshallah. Thank you  La Sultana!! We love you. Christina and Karim.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Susi S wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: ... it was like a dream! We had a magical stay at La Sultana everything  was perfect!  very very nice staff (thanks to Khalid and Saida!) - they all made our Holidays very special...  The room was great big with all facilities you need.. the Hamam is good to relax  Breakfast nearby the pool let your day start wonderful!  we can absolutely recommend the Hotel to everyone!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I loved La Sultana it made my visit to Marrakesh much more enjoyable. Indeed it was one of the highlights of my trip to such terrific city. The courtyards - 5 of them - are beautiful well decorated peaceful and relaxing. The slightly heated pool is great for refreshing and cooling down after a long day visiting the Souks (markets) and sharing time with local people in Jemaa El Fna the main plaza.    My room was one of the least expensive if not the least but it was roomy wonderfully appointed and decorated. My bathroom was out of the One Thousand and One Nights... with a great bath tub that topped off the rest of the decoration. Loved the "Birds" courtyard where my room was found. What a peaceful space and what beautiful and aromatic yellow roses on the old marble water fountain.    During my trip I visited a good number of high level Riads and none compared to La Sultana.    The staff are top of the line nice gentle Moroccans showing the hospitality of their country their culture. Ilyas was a great host and always very helpful as were his other colleagues.
