I recommend taking the cooking classes - I've never cooked so deliciously!    I'll stay there the next time I visit Marrakesh no doubt!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Absolutely recommend La Sultana to anyone considering visiting Morocco. The property itself is beautiful and impeccably maintained. The staff is awesome. The location in the Kasbah section of the Medina is convenient and fun.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Per S wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Title: Amazing five star palace with best possible location
Review_Text: We really love la Sultana. The location is great the kasbah area is very secure and calm but yet close to the souks and sights. This is really a very steong five star hotel but it yet feels intimate and personal. The staff is great both very attentive and friendly we have been here many times and service is always on top level. The restaurant is world class great food and very nice wine list the hotel or should we say palace is a dream! There are several beautiful courtyards to discover a fantastic spa very nice pools and a roof terrace with the best views in town. The suites of La Sultana are gorgeous we stayed in the Jaguar suite with 2 terraces and lots of space. This is by far your best option if you are looking for a five star hotel in the medina. So much nicer more personal and more exclusive than for instance la mamounia. We will be back soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Location is perfect it's in the old city and near the main attraction wich is Al fana square. It's located right in the middle or surrounded by local market wich is great the hotel itself is amazing in style and decoration the food was perfect and most importantly the service it was more than excellent. Specially Mr. Hassan at the reception he was very helpful and professional. We recommend this hotel for people who are looking for something different and special we really enjoyed our stay and will be back soon.    Thank you la sultana for the amazing time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Valeriano A wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: The arrival experience was really authentic with a hand-pulled-wagon pulled by a nice real (not fake) porter of the Suk thru the narrow and crowded streets of suk.  In my view this was the best possible arrival experience to enter the magic of "Marrakesh".    The hotel is part of Small Luxury Hotels of the World and it is truly a small luxury hotel.    The design of the hotel is towards the many indoor courtyards as the majority of the houses in this city. The roof top terrace has a wonderful view on the city and many minarets; this is the perfect location for a spectacular breakfast.    My recommendation is to pay attention when you reserve your room to ask for a room on high floor with a view. My room was very nicely decorated but was on the ground floor of a small courtyard and had no privacy.    Enjoy your stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dominik O wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Title: Wonderful stay in a very professional 5 star boutique hotel
Review_Text: Our two days stay in La Sultana was wonderful!  We felt very comfortable and the big surprise was that we got upgraded to the Jaguar Suite which we really liked. (especially the private Jacuzzi after long days walking in the busy city).  Breakfast at the pool was very delicious and cosy. All the staff is doing a great job. But we want to highlight the excellent service of Mr. Elyas from the reception. He gave us a very warm welcome and was all the time very obliging and kind.  Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Fredrik H wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: Our stay was amazing and every detail from room to service was 5+ !!!    The spa was beutiful for body and mind. The resturant was good. The breakfast on the roof was so nice in every aspect. Everyting about otur stay was made easier With the high service from everyone in the hotel.    Please enjoy!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sumayya H wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: Ultimate Luxury in the Old City
Review_Text: Location was great if you're looking for a close to authentic feel of the old part of the city. The hotel is surrounded by little shops and restaurants populated by locals. Walking distance to the Souks and Bahia Palace.  Hotel staff hooked us up with a great driver and guide for taking day trips.  Design: the hotel consists of a few different 'riads' which has the appearance of different houses with different themes connected by courtyards. I spent a good part of my last day just discovering the hidden delightful nooks crannies and rooms in the hotel.  Spa was excellent. Try the hammam (bath) experience.  La Sultana makes you feel like you're a million miles away from home in a truly exotic place equipped with all the amenities and luxuries you could want.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Paul T wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: Return Visit To An Old Favourite
Review_Text: If you're looking for the genuine Marrakech but with 5* luxury then La Sultana offers so much for the traveller who wants to experience the best.    It's central location within the old town means all the famous sights are within walking distance. The hotel itself is an oasis of calm and tranquility after the hustle and bustle of the city.    If I described the hotel as beautiful I would be under-selling it it is absolutely sublime! The staff always have a genuine friendliness and take interest in the well-being of the guests and will attend to your every requirement without fuss.    It was our fourth visit to what is one of our favourite hotels. When we were asked if there was anything I thought they could improve I simply couldn't think of a single thing. Nothing could possibly disappoint and how can one possibly improve on perfection?
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Yes its not cheap but are you really looking for cheap or you rather stay and feel like a Sultan.  The place is the result of connecting 4 old riad's each one with a different style. So of course all rooms are different giving a unique exclusivity feeling to all guests.  Their location its unbeatable because its in walking distance to medina you can actually see the Saddian Tombs from the hotel (they are wall to wall with the hotel).  Food its probably the best I had in all our trip. (and we where everywhere)  Last service and staff what can I say the are the sultana they are the reason you sit down and write a review. They are always smiling and willing to cater you in any way. They will help you book reservations for anything provide you with excellent advice and will be checking on you all the time.    Ps don't forget to book the cooking lesson they are and experience on their own.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We arrived for a prolonged weekend and found a wonderful hideaway in La Sultana. The place is as taken out of 1001 nights adventures with stunningly beautiful decor and immensely helpful staff dedicated to your sublime experience.  The place is a tranquil oasis amidst the pulsating city of Marrakech a place that can take your breath away in multiple ways. For our purpose which was relaxation and romance we could not have found a better place and left only the premises reluctantly.  The service is really outstanding here from the breakfast on the roof terraces to the Hammam in the cellars.  I can truly recommend this hotel for anyone thinking of a quick getaway. Splash yourselves with private airport pickup lavish dinners and soothing spa-experiences.  We will most certainly be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Erik B wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: We are a family with two teenagers who looked for a luxury but still traditional Riad and we found it in La Sultana.  Peaceful and tranquil just a couple of meters off the busy Rue de la Kasbah and within a short walk to the Souk.  ItÂ´s beautiful and it takes care of you and give you the good life.  We enjoyed the SPA with black soap scrubbing steam bath and massage :-) Excellent!  We combined our Marrakech stay with a two day trip to the high Atlas where we stayed at Kasbah du Toubkal and did some Hiking and the combo gave us a perfect vacation full of good memories.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: My second home away from home - a dream place for all senses
Review_Text: A wonderful place with different Riads. Every architectural and decorative detail worthwhile to admire and to enjoy. A calm and very personal atmosphere. Like living in a private place. A dream the terrace for whatever moment of the day. Fantastic food and foremost of all very friendly and well trained staff serving with professional care and a heart full of natural genuine hospitality. That was most amazing!  Our room The Parrot was like 1001 nights - not missing anything. Top international Standard.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Aundrea S wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: I don't ever review but I really had to say something about this fantastic place because it was too good not to. From the moment we arrived the service was phenomenal complimentary canapes while having a glass of wine on the terrace overlooking the city had us off to a good start! We ordered the Risotto with scallops and braised Beef and by the time our food arrived we were so full with all the wonderful complimentary food provided! We ate nonetheless and enjoyed every last little bite! The waiters host and doorman were exceptional and we felt very "looked after". Do yourself a favour and visit this incredible place. You will not regret it!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: La Sultana Marrakech is a luxurious hotel ideally located in the old city close to the main attractions and only a ten minute walk from Jemaa El Fna square. Just a few yards from the busy Rue de la Kasbah you enter into an oasis of calm from the â€˜hustle and bustleâ€™ that is the Marrakech Medina!  We were greeted on our arrival by Hassan who showed us to the roof-top terrace for mint tea and Moroccan pastries gave us an overview of Marrakech and a tour of the hotel before showing us to our room. There are amazing views from the panoramic terraces which overlook the Saadian Tombs.  The hotel is well appointed in traditional Riad style with rooms facing onto central courtyards. Each area had its own design and furnishing theme and we were impressed by the architecture and attention to detail We had a ground floor Prestige room which was very well appointed and spacious with a great sunken bath!  The service in all areas of the hotel from reception to restaurants was outstanding. We were always addressed by name in the restaurant and by the reception staff. All the staff were very attentive and pro-active anticipating your every need but in a calm understated manner.  Hassan arranged for us to have a guide to show us around the Medina for our first morning which provided the ideal introduction and orientation. He also arranged for a full dayâ€™s private tour to the High Atlas mountains which was outstanding great scenery and a further insight into Moroccan life history and the Berbers.  This was our first visit to Morocco and we could not have chosen a better hotel! Great location outstanding architecture and dÃ©cor and service that could not be faulted!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Loved our room in the Moroccan section. The staff at a La Sultana were very friendly helpful and courteous at all times. Breakfast on the Roof Terrace was a delight and there was a great choice of both Western and Moroccan food both at breakfast and at night. On entering the Riad you know it is a special place with beautifully decorated rooms throughout. Being in the Old Town it is within easy walking distance to the Souq and the vibrant Djemaa el Fna. On our next trip to Morocco we will certainly come back to La Sultana. Don't forget to have the traditional Hamman in the Wellness Room
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michael R wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: A Riad worthy of magical Marrakesh
Review_Text: Everything you've heard and wondered about the magic of Marrakesh is true: it is a unique city with a magic all its own. And in la Sultana there is a riad worthy of the city in every way. You enter trhough a narrow alley at the edge of old Marrakesh. And what you find on entering is an Arabian night's dream of what elegance is all about...and it is done entirely tastefully: consider it a definition of opulent indulgence. Ubderstand that as in any riad your room or suite will have no windows to the outside: all is inner-directed to quiet courtyards each having a different theme. An excellent swimming pool a spa area and a lovely roof-garden which doubles as a restaurant when the weather permits completethe picture. And yes the restaurant is outstanding andf the staff helpful and friendly. So if you want to spoil hyourself in Marrakesh this is hte place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We stayed in here for a week. I've never known such attention to detail and eagerness to please their guests. From the minute our driver collected us from the airport it was 5 star treatment all the way. No hanging around reception waiting to be seen or checked in. We were ushered into a beautiful riad and served mint tea while the luggage was being taken to our room and all the boring formalities were being taken care of. I would highly recommend going for a Hamman and massage in the lovely spa.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Robert B wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: We stayed at La Sultana for 6 nights in late September of 2015. As you enter the Hotel through the beautifully carved doors you realize that this is a special place.The Hotel itself is a beautiful Riad with finishings and artwork that reflect the atmosphere of Morocco. It is located in the old Kasbah and everything is within walking distance if not the friendly staff will assist in any way they can to procure transportation for you.    Speaking of the staff we have traveled the world and we both agreed that this was one of the best service we have ever experienced everyone in the Hotel was super friendly and helpful in any way. Special mention goes to Azis (spelling?) Maitre D of the restaurant who made us feel special every time. Food by the way is fantastic The menu offers something for everyone's taste western cuisine as well as traditional moroccan cuisine.    The front Desk Staff Hassan and all others whose name I don't remember where so professional and incredibly helpful in making all kind of reservations excursions and other questions we may have had.    Thank you Thank you    We can't wait to go back......
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dorthe K wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: We stayed at La Sultana for 4 nights with our big teenagers.It was absolutely fantastic! I'm glad we choose this cosy riad instead of a big impersonal hotel. Rooms and food are very hight quality staf very friendly and the spa is value for money. We will recommend to book the guide upon arrival - he is a big experience. We will be back :-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jeremy J wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: We did the spa for two... and what an experience it was. Gorgeous Riad overlooking the medina. Made us want to stay here next time. Both the Hammam and the massage were excellent but the real draw is the atmosphere and facility itself which rivals the palaces.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a beautiful hotel with elegant rooms set into 5 riads. Like most places we visited in Morocco it is easy for the directionally impaired (me) to make wrong turns in the labyrinth. Rose petals abound in the room--on the bed the carefully arranged towels and even floating in the toilet! Breakfast on the terrace a delight and the dining room serves delicious meals. The staff is helpful too. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Cristina M wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: REFINED AND UNDERSTATED ELEGANCE AT ITS BEST
Review_Text: Every space every corner even the smallest detail has been carefully appointed. This is understated elegance and refined sophistication at its best. The service is the best I've seen and not overbearingly so. Sophisticated romantic simply beautiful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michelle P wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: We visited one afternoon for a drink and stayed 4hrs such a peaceful location away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech  We arrived and asked if we could have a drink to be told the restaurant was closed we then asked to see the restaurant area and the menu and proceeded to make a dinner reservation. Reception then asked if we would like to take a drink on the roof terrace once we had made the reservation which we jumped at the chance to do. Great views over the city lovely wine and great canapÃ©s.  Dinner was an experience around the pool area food was plentiful and very fresh. Prices were at the higher end of the price range but was well worth it.  Bizarrely they asked where we were staying and took our room information despite us telling them we had booked a taxi to get us back there.  We comment on their feedback card which they presented us and they were very keen to understand why we had written what we had.  Must see for yourselves it's truly amazing
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Leonardcarshalt... C wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: AS GOOD AS ALL THE REPORTS
Review_Text: We have just returned after a three day staywe were very happy with all the good reports of this Hotel. The contrast from the rest of Marrakech to being back to this lovely hotel makes it even more special. we ate in the hotel each night which was excellent. YOU WILL NOT BE DISSAPONITED
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Trav e wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: I've managed to book the hammam and facial in this hotel spa through my riad with a few hours notice and was absolutely overwhelmed with the traditional Morrocan style set up of the interior. The therapists were absolutely amazing and attentive to the every detail of the chosen procedures. I was really impressed to hear that they keep looking for newest improvements on the products in use like bringing in prickly pear and etc. Quite expensive treat but worth every penny! Brilliant and highly recommended! x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Kirk W wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: The Art of Luxury - Riad at its best
Review_Text: La Sultana is absolutely amazing. Our room was spectacular the entire RIAD is better than a movie set it is clearly one of the finest places I have every stayed. Entering from a busy chaotic street in the Kasbah district within 20 meters you are suddenly in a tranquil unbelievably beautiful oasis of luxury. The location is great short cab ride to all the new trendy places and 7 min walk to El Fna square. If you want to really live it up this is the place you must go.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Located direct at the Saadier tombs and Kasbah market you feel to be in a different world once you have entered the hotel. The interior of the five different riads connected to each other is unique even for the high standards in Marrakech. All rooms are different. The dinner around the pool-deck was the best during our stay (and we tried many other highly recommended places). Not to forget: The service is very polite and tries to fulfill every wish.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Feel like a prince or princess and spend your time in this Moroccan kasbah surrounded by fresh roses and fountains. This is a true luxury hotel in Morocco. Each room or space has been beautifully decorated in a unique African or Moroccan theme. The restaurant offers a wide range of delicious authentic Moroccan dishes. The staff makes you feel very welcome and very special. I would love to go back to this beautiful country again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: La Sultana is simply a gorgeous riad so conveniently located near the medina. Once we entered the property my son remarked that he was not going anywhere else but to stay and enjoy the beautiful space. The riad has been decorated with great passion in different styles all so well put together.  Service was marvellous congratulations to Xavier and his team! They really make us feel like a family. Special thanks to Hassan and concierge for all your kind help!  My cooking classes with Hayat was fantastic too so well taught and delicious. Mariam assisted so well in the class and thank you for teaching me to make the mint tea!  We will return and stay at this delightful place anytime! With fond memories thank you again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: La Sultana â€“ a place which makes you feel like royalty
Review_Text: A tranquil most beautiful oasis in the midst of the noisy medina. The hotel consists of 5 different riads so you wonâ€™t get the feeling of being in a large hotel. All rooms are individually decorated and the staff go by their names â€žleopardâ€œ or â€žpure bloodâ€œ instead of their numbers.    The staff is exceptionally attentive knowing all guestsâ€™ names by heart helping out with guided tours or other activities and making restaurant reservations. Even the daily newspaper has your own name printed on it! But most of all they show great interest in you as a guest and treat you like royalty.    Since you're in the middle of the medina and the hight of buildings is limited don't expect great views from your room. Most rooms seem to have windows or a balcony towards the inner courtyard so will be a bit on the dark side. However this guarantees you cooler temperatures which you will be grateful for!    The absolute highlights of the hotel are its rooftop terrace with fantastic views for breakfast lunch and dinner  its pool area surrounded by columns which also serves as a dining-room when itâ€™s too hot or too cold up on the terrace and last but not least their hammam. If you choose to go to the hammam as a couple no problem there will be two ladies scrubbing both of you at the same time!    The next time we go to Marrakech we will certainly choose the Sultana again â€“ canâ€™t imagine a better hotel in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stopped here for lunch on our last day. Roof terrace is stylishly done. Centred around open void to ground floor. 12 tables. Mix of European/Moroccan food. Marvellous bbq grilled food. Prices are really good for a 5 star boutique hotel. Staff excellent. Heartedly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: HÃ©lÃ¨ne A wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: Best hotel we have been to!
Review_Text: The hotel is fantastic. Each part are decorated in differents styles all amazing. It is really quiet and relaxing (which offer a huge contrast with the medina just outside).    The hammam and massage in the spa was a great experience and the food overall is amazing.    The staff is really taking care of you and make you feel that you are important not an other client lost amongst all the others. A special thanks to Zaccaria the head waiter :-)    The best hotel I've been to!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A very quirky hotel with some excellent staff
Review_Text: The whole experience is very relaxing so much so you need great motivation to leave and go exploring.    The best is the roof terrance by day a relaxing place to sunbathe drink and have lunch by night a wonderful open air restaurant. Both experiences heighten end by a couple of wonderful characters serving you with a smile and sense of humour. We also had a few meals by the main pool one especially memorable night wonderful lighting and ambiance.    Food and drink was very good value we did both to excess and concentrated on the Moroccan wine highly recommended and always accompanied by delicious snacks.    The rooms are quirky large and generally without any neighbours. There are numerous casual seating areas dotted around you can always find a quiet corner where you will not be found for hours.    Five star hotels here are not the same level as you will find in the most developed tourist destinations around the globe. This isn't a criticism the standards are still very very high but it's the trade off to be surrounded by such ancient culture and looked after by local staff who can add so much.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anthea S wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: La Sultana is a gorgeous hotel. The architectural detail is absolutely stunning it makes you feel like you have entered a little piece of paradise after you walk in from the bustling streets of Marrakech. The service throughout the hotel was amazing. Everyone is very attentive and helpful. The food and amenities are fabulous. I recommend getting your breakfast included. Its very yummy. And I highly recommend spending some time at the spa. We had hammam treatments followed by one hour massages and the treatments were excellent. I look forward to returning to this hotel one day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Francisca R wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Title: I wish there were more stars for this place!
Review_Text: We were on vacation with another couple and the tour company booked us at La Sultana. Everything was beyond our wildest expectations. The rooms were gorgeously decorated the facilities were wonderful and the food at the restaurant was fantastic. We had a room facing a courtyard with a fountain - our room was called The Pelican. Each room has a different theme and dÃ©cor which made the hotel quite unique.  We also had a chance to try the spa took the exfoliating bath and massage. Everything was wonderful. The only downside was that even though we booked the massage appointment well in advance for 4 people they only had one masseuse. Therefore our friends decided to cancel their massage because they didn't want to wait too long.  The roof terrace was great - we had pre-dinner cocktails there every night with a view of the mosque. Everything was wonderful... will definitely come back if we're ever in Marrakech again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: jacobo o wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: We (I and my wife) have travelled a lot and we have been to many 5 stars hotels around the world.    This hotel has the best service we have ever experienced!!!!!    Moreover its location 8in the heart of the city) and architecture make that the stay at La Sultana is not only a dream in terms of service but also in terms of authentic sensations.    The hotel is full of charming details (the fragrances the flowers the lovely furniture and linen the sensation of exclusitivity the peace) that make you feel like you were in a 1001 nights tale.    To the direction of the hotel and the staff: Good job!!!!! We are looking forward to try the Oualidia hotel and the yachting expirience!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I chose this hotel based on it's great reviews and it was everything we hoped for and more ... thank you Tripadvisor ! This really is a fantastic hotel our room was located in Riad Bahia which is particularly beautiful with it's white stucco work. The hotel is also located in the kasbah so it's very easy to reach everything. The thing that makes this hotel truly special are it's staff who cannot do enough to ensure you have a wonderful time. We were looked after by Ghizlane who helped us plan our time so we got to see and appreciate the different sides of the city our holiday was very memorable thanks to her recommendations. The hotel has a really good spa too with first-class therapists ! Can't wait to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alicja D wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Title: An oasis within the beating heart of the medina in the Kasbah district of Marrakesh
Review_Text: A wonderful experience to be amongst such beautiful historic architecture. La Sultana in Marrakesh is truly a gem a unique experience. Every room suite is individually designed with such attention to detail and style. My recent stay was enhanced by the wonderful hospitality offered by everyone. "No" was not in their ethos as with a problem came an instant solution. Situated in a good location as main attractions are within walking distance. A big thank you to everyone for your generous hospitality. Alicja
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: mary k wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: Excellent stay really friendly staff breakfast good and great service rooftop great view and sunbathing spot the pool very clean and lovely to swim in only gets afternoon sun though we stayed in zebra suite awesome would recommend this one we came a small problem whilst we were. There the staff were amazing and offered us a solution which we were very happy with would go back here if in Morocco
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We recently returned from Marrakech and had a wonderful stay at La Sultana. The staff was fantastic and the riad was just SO beautiful. The rooms were all different and so neat. The food was good rooftop was lovely and the spa... oh the spa!! We had several wonderful visits! The traditional hamman was a neat experience and my massage and facial were fantastic! La Sultana is in a very good location and despite being right in the city the noise is 100% masked which is incredible! We had a very nice stay here and I would recommend this to anyone!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Donna V wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Title: Paradise in the heart of the medina in Marrakech
Review_Text: We recently returned from our summer family vacation in Morocco and had the pleasure of spending a few nights at La Sultana. What a gem. The property is exquisite and the service impeccable. The staff is so gracious and always ready to help. The breakfasts each morning on the roof top terrace restaurant was superb. The rooms are beautifully designed clean and comfortable. It's also conveniently located close to the action with walking distance to the famous square but allows you to retreat to the peace and tranquility when needed. I highly recommend La Sulatana. Thanks to the entire staff for making our stay so special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: cindy f wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: We spent 4 amazing nights in the apartment. The hotel is located right in the medina but once inside it is so peaceful. It is beautifully decorated and impeccably clean. The staff are always smiling greeting the guests and willing to assist. Hassan welcomed us and helped to get us checked in. He gave us a tour and took us to the rooftop area so that we could have mint tea and Moroccan pastries. We dined at the restaurant every morning for breakfast and also for dinner twice (there is live music during dinner which is a nice treat). All of the food is prepared with fresh ingredients presented beautifully and tasted wonderful. Zakaria Abbas and the rest of the waitstaff go above and beyond for the guests. They will recommend dishes and what Moroccan wines pair best with them. The spa is amazing. We did the traditional Hammam treatment and massages. We would definitely stay at La Sultana again when in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jillian M wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: There are not enough words in the english language to describe the AMAZING quality of the service the food the ambiance the views ( i could go on ) of this perfect hotel. You walk off the busy streets of Marrakech into a beautiful quiet oasis. We stayed in the Panthere room in Bahia - our room was beautiful and very large (with very good AC) with a soaking tub in the middle of our center patio. The only thing that could upstage the beauty of this gorgeous hotel is the staff. First and foremost Dady went above and beyond and helped us in every way imaginable. I hate that I can't remember the rest of the names but EVERY person that worked in the hotel went beyond to be helpful and friendly to us every day greeting us as old friends! We went to the Jemma al Fna market with a guide (as was suggested) and set up by the hotel - if it is your first time i would highly suggest it. our guide was helpful in showing us the 'quality from the quantity' inside the souks and showed us an amazing time with a VERY good lamb lunch with olives and mint tea - it was an experience not to be missed. The hotel also set us up with a hot air balloon ride that was perfection. I could go on and on but i'll stop now - my husband and I pray to return to Marrakech just to stay at this hotel once more - just for longer!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Debs B wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Title: An amazing hotel in the centre of the kasbah
Review_Text: This is an extraordinary luxurious oasis of tranquility right in the heart of the authentic Marrakech. You step from the hotel to the busy kasbah overlook the Saladian tombs and savour the true Marrakech from a place of beauty and five star service. The food was lovely the rooms spacious well equipped and opulent and the staff were utterly charming - nothing was too much trouble and they were solicitous and helpful. The spa was fabulous with high standard treatments.We would definitely go again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Viks J wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: Amazing quality of food and service. Beautiful setting does not feel it is in the hustle and bustle of the city centre.    Staff and customer service make visiting this restaurant a joy to return to. Very clean efficient and helpful place all in all. Staff willing to accommodate tourists for surprises for birthdays etc will visit again! What a gem!

Review_Date: Ruth Z wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: La Sultana Marrakech is an excellent hotel with the greatest attention to detail. Guests are treated to impeccably designed Morroccan themed decor. The whole hotel is just amazing every corner is interesting. However the real jewel of the hotel is the incredible team of people who work tirelessly to ensure your visit is as enjoyable as possible. The staff are wonderful- so friendly.  Mr & Mrs Zrihen
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: La Sultana is definitely one of my best experience around the world .  Everything is made for you in this calm and quiet place .  You have to see this one time in your life i'm travelling all year in different place but this place is just wow .  You should book .. ;)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Giovanni C wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: We just stayed at the Sultana Hotel with our family with 3 teenagers. It was a wonderful experience. The hotel is located close to all interesting places in Marrakesh. The hotel offers great value: being that close to the hectic heartbeat of this vibrant city it is a wonder to experience a heaven of silence at the hotel. The service is impeccable the food great and the staff more than outstanding. A big recommendation!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Klara G wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: La Sultana is definitely the most unique Hotel in all of Marrakech it is not just beautifully designed but the dÃ©cor itself is amazing imagine every suit has a different theme all very tasteful the food the rooftop terrace the live music dazzles everyone away.  Unfortunately we had the pleasure of staying in this Hotel for one night only but if we ever visit Morocco again we will definitely be back.  The food itself was great you can try everything from Moroccon traditional dishes to international cuisines the wine list was quite extensive for a Hotel quite impressive I have to say.  We enjoyed a couples hammam followed by a relaxing massage (one of the best massages we have ever got) followed by dinner and wine... Paradise.    Tips:  Try their hammam and their massage- you can swim in the pool between or after the sessions.  Make sure you go up the rooftop and have a drink in the moonlight :)  If you are going over the summer they will lay the tables for dinner on the rooftop! Extremely romantic if there are no clouds you can see the top of the Atlas Range!    If it is colder dinner will be served next to the pool still gorgeous.  Reserve your table and enjoy ;)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A magnificent hotel surely 5 stars rated. Although it is very noisy outside you walk into a sea of calm. The hotel is composed of several riads each having their own identity. We stayed in the African riad near to the small yet beautiful pool. I also recommend the roof terrace for drinks and a nice dinner with Moroccan or French food. The staff is very friendly helpful and professional.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sandrine L wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Title: wonderful experience (welcoming; architecture; dÃ©cor; cuisine; spa)
Review_Text: The hotel is amazingly recovered and has a very intimate environment from the terrace to the ground floor.  Due to the prime location if you decide to have breakfast or dinner on the top floor you will remember about your experience due to the view especially if you try the Morocco salad and the splendid couscous.  The service is really professional although quiet 'warmth' from top management to the trainees. They are very engaged in welcoming you. We had such a wonderful experience that we are thinking in coming back.    ps: just one note: although the spa environment is quiet special (architecture; quality of the massages; pool) while you try to relax on the pool you might hear the 'unfortunate' sound of the hairdryers...

Review_Title: Wonderful, calm oasis in Marrakech - you will not want to leave
Review_Text: A wonderful place to stay and hideaway from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. The five riads are stunning and pictures do not do them justice. All the staff are wonderful - helpful attentive and warm. Great restaurant and spa as well. We truly did not want to leave and will find an excuse to visit again. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful and unique hotel in the heart of the city
Review_Text: We wanted to visit the sights of Marrakech but also have a calm oasis away from the hustle and bustle - and La Sultana provided it all. It was a fantastic base to explore the city and the staff were attentive (without being fussy) and the hotel never felt full or busy - there was always space to read or relax. The food was excellent and the taxi service was worth every penny. We also partook in a massage in their spa and had a cookery course there to learn the secrets of tagine making. We would thoroughly recommend La Sultana if you feel like being pampered!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Off the hook, truly an awesome experience
Review_Text: I am writing this on my last morning at La Sultana and I mean to tell you that if you are going to visit Marrakesh you must stay here. First off- the staff. I find the Moroccan people in general to be very warm and gracious people- but in the Medina they have an agenda and are pushy about it- they have families so I can't blame them. But when they are not hawking their wares when their livelihood does not depend on you paying the highest price the Moroccan people are gentle and filled with good humor. The staff here exemplifies that taken to the extreme- some parts great hospitality training mixed with those already wonderful traits. We loved Zachary Ayub Beder Hassan Sayid Asmat... All such wonderful examples of not just good service but ability to connect and befriend. Beder was our waiter and was really funny and playful. Ayub and Zachary both possess constant grins as if there is a wonderful secret they want to share but they can't. The food was excellent- I recommend the scallop carpaccio the tomato gazpacho and the carrots that were in the Mediterranean salad were amazing. There is a lute (oud) player every night to accompany dinner on the roof terrace for which they dress it up with carpets and sexy lamps at each table. The spa is gorgeous- you'll feel like royalty. Their massage techniques are different and made me fall asleep- so gentle. The place itself is gorgeous- over the top in some aspects but that is what this place is. The use of color and lighting Induces a sense of wonder and tranquility- the Balinese also possess this ability to light their environments in this way. My now fiancÃ© proposed while we were here- he was going to do it on the 25th in Tangier but this place made him want to do it here. We will definitely be back! One final note- do not go out without a guide. Our guide Mustafa made all the difference in the world. We went out on our own the first day and it was a terrible mistake. Without a guide you will be accosted and won't have a moments peace to take in the wonderful chaos that is Marrakesh. And don't take any carriage rides- most treat those poor horses terribly. The animals here are not cared for. Make sure you take leftovers with you to feed the many stray cats and have small denominations ready for the old ladies who ask for alms. They need help. Our guide said to only give to the elderly- the rest are professionals.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed at this hotel during a recent holiday to Morocco. During the ten days we stayed at four lovely riads/ hotels but this was by far the best. The room was beautiful with lovely little touches including complimentary soft drinks and pastries and fruit. The staff were all so helpful and there was always somebody around to assist with anything. The breakfast was wonderful with traditional morracan options plus a selection of egg options which we tried a couple of and they were delicious and set us up for the rest of the day. This hotel is perfect for Marrakech as it offers peace and relaxation in a manic city- it was so tempting to just spend the whole time in the hotel rather than exploring the city! Would recommend this hotel to anybody! Thanks again for a lovely stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Luxury at its height, Service beyond expectations
Review_Text: On a whim and because of a sudden long weekend I had I decided to fly to Marrakech from Paris. The hotel choice was between a luxury chain international hotel and Le Sultana. I chose the latter and my stay upto now as I write this at Marrakesh International Airport I long to go back to this amazing place. From the initial inquiry on the telephone to the moment they send you off to your vehicle to the airport Le Sultana has perfected the art of luxury service. I was travelling alone and they were there for everything that I needed even before I knew I needed it. I arrived at 8 AM and requested early check in. They offered a fabulous breakfast while I waited where the wait staff (special shout out to Yula! ) were very attentive without being intrusive. I was upgraded from a junior suite to a full suite. The fantastic service is coupled with interiors that is reminiscent of the Golden Era of the Saadien dynasty. From the open air roof top restaurant and cabana bar to the opulent rooms to the pristine pool to the surreal spa this hotel has it all.    I would however like to congratulate Ms Saida Loutou Front desk manager who made my stay all the more memorable because of her warmth genuine concern and unparalleled hospitality. I also say thank you to the wonderful Charles the French intern who I am sure will one day make it big in the hospitality industry.    I had a magical time. Kudos to Le Sultana!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Shaun B wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: this hotel was pure elegance. Every nook and every corner decorated beautifully. Especially with roses. I was greeted with tea in the beautiful garden and went immediately to the spa for hammam and massage. The spa is one of the best ive been at. Our room was beautiful and large and outlets were adequate. We ate dinner one night at the restaurant by the pool. the food was amazing. If i ever go back to Marrakesh this is where i would stay over and over again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Many thanks to all the staff at La Sultana for making our visit so wonderful
Review_Text: La Sultana in Marrakech is the best hotel I have ever stayed in.  The staff were very polite and kind and extremely thoughtful. Little touches like refreshing towels and bottles of cold water given for us to the driver of the private car who met us at the airport made all the difference. When we left they had even filled out the embarcation forms which we needed to present at departures at Marrakech Menara airport.  The hotel itself is a work of art - constructed from five Riads by 420 craftsmen over three years the attention to detail shows everywhere. Each Riad has its own style and it was a great pleasure to explore the hotel.  On arrival there was no hanging about in reception filling in forms - we were taken to a shaded gazebo on the roof with cooling water mist to control the temperature where we were given Moroccan mint tea and pastries. Saiid then took us on a guided tour of the hotel and showed us all five Riads and the extensive facilities offered by this great hotel. We saw the Saadian tombs from the hotel - it is right next door.  Our room was located in the Riad built in the Moroccan style and was wonderful. The air conditioning was effective but quiet. We felt that we were staying in a Moroccan Palace. It was spotlessly clean and the Moroccan tiled bathroom was amazing.  La Sultana is an oasis of calm in bustle and hubbub which is Marrakech. When we left the hotel to explore the city the staff on reception offered us bottles of cold water to take with us. It was only a short walk from the hotel to the Jemaa El Fna square and the entrance to the Souks. We particularly enjoyed our visit to the Majorelle gardens and the Berber museum.  The food at La Sultana is excellent - the scrambled eggs at breakfast were the finest that I have ever eaten and the croissants as good as any I have eaten in France. Lunch is served in the roof restaurant and in the courtyard by the pool and there is a great choice of Moroccan and French dishes and Moroccan and French wine. Dinner is served in the main courtyard on the ground floor and the combination of great architecture and subtle lighting gives a very romantic atmosphere which is enhanced by a musician playing a lute on the other side of the courtyard.  During the day lying by the pool sipping a refreshing gin & tonic I spent a long time examining the details of the building - the amazing brickwork the Morrocan/moorish style ironwork the floor based and hanging lanterns and the details of the ceilings in the covered part of the courtyard.  I had organised our stay at La Sultana as a surprise for Jovie's 60th birthday. I had asked the hotel via email before the trip if they could recommend a local florist so I could get Jovie some flowers. As well as providing the numbers of three florists Ghizlane also told me that La Sultana could also provide the flowers themselves - I chose this option and Jovie was delighted with the arrangement of 60 roses which the hotel provided - I would like to give a big thank-you to the person who created that arrangement.  Many thanks to all the staff at La Sultana for making our visit so wonderful.  If you visit Marrakech and stay anywhere else you're nuts!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Well situated and relaxing hotel in buzzing Marrakech
Review_Text: Quiet oasis of calm immediately you step off the street and into La Sultana. This hotel has plenty of open public space including a rooftop terrace bar restaurant and plungepool. It also has a more conventional pool at ground level. Staff all speak excellent English and go out of their way to help. The food in the restaurant is excellent - breakfast usually included in the room rate too. Spa treatments are amazing. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Katie W wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: Visited this restaurant for my boyfriends birthday and it was amazing. Everything from the greeting was incredible. They give women a little chair to put your bag on and provide blankets once the sun has gone down as it can be quite chilly.    The food is absolutely sensational. One of the best meals I have ever had! Although pricey you don't mind when you receive this meal and service.    If we hadn't gone on our last night of holiday we would have definitely gone back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great hotel in a great city!
Review_Text: Excellent hotel in a good location in Marrakech about 15 minute walk to the main square. Nice rooms and great restaurant. Awesome sunset in the hotel terrace. Service is superb. Great hotels for couples.

Wow from the moment we were dropped outside with the porter waiting for us in his traditional uniform we knew we had arrived in paradise. The entrance alone is sensational wonderful welcome by the very attentive staff. We had 2 beautiful rooms in a quaint courtyard. The rooms were gorgeous you couldn't want for more the Clarins toiletries in the rooms are a lovely touch. The pool area in wonderful but if there are no sun beds available there is plenty of choice on the roof terrace with a plunge pool to cool down in. We loved the food everything was freshly made and delicious. We will definitely return as this was the most perfect hotel and in a wonderful position my children aged 18&16 loved the trip. Thank you to all the staff who made our trip so enjoyable. Mohammed Johnson & Family !!!!

Conveniently located next to the Saadian Tombs in the Kasbah area La Sultana is a fantastic hotel tucked away from the madness of the Marrakech streets. The hotel itself is simply stunning comprising of a number of different themed riads all exquisitely furnished and designed. Its like something out of Arabian nights!    The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful - nothing was too much trouble and they always had a smile of their faces despite the fact it was Ramadan and must have been exhausted with the heat!    All the rooms in the hotel are different; we stayed in the koudou room and I cannot fault it. Beautiful furnishings lovely big comfy bed huge bath complimentary soft drinks and welcome Moroccan pastries and fruit.    The facilities were great - nice sized pool given the central location and was very relaxing and peaceful. We ate in the restaurant twice and whilst it was on the pricey side it wasnt unexpected given the quality of the hotel and the food was the best we had in Morocco. Lunches by the pool were also good although huge!    Yes you will find cheaper hotels in Marrakech but you get what you pay for and you will not regret booking La Sultana. Thank you for a wonderful stay - we wouldnt hesitate to recommend you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: La Sultana was like stepping back in time to the Mogals dynastyit was like another place altogether.  Each room is decorated differentlythe staff are on hand and always willing to help.  We had a 7 am flight outand had to leave by 4.30 am from HotelThe Manager himself brought us a full breakfastand filled a flask with juice for my then 3 year old to take withthat's the kind of personal service we got.  In Additionthe spa/Hammam is stunningeverything is close byand the mini bar is freestocked with the best stuff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Michelle W wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Title: Amazing gem in heart of Marrakech!
Review_Text: Talk about ticking all boxes...La Sultana does it. Great location we walked nearly everywhere but you're just around the corner from caliche and taxi stands. We had a standard but still gorgeous room stocked with Clarins bath products and a mini-bar (an amenity this American appreciated). While at the hotel we spent a lot of our time on the amazingly beautiful rooftop space that is used for reception and meals. It was a great place to unwind with a glass of wine after a busy day exploring Marrakech. We dined there most meals and each was great! Finally I can't say enough about amazing service we received at La Sultana. Truly above and beyond!  What else is there to say?!?  Thanks to everyone who made our trip truly memorable. Well done!

Review_Date: OVI H wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: La Sultana lived upto the reviews on the site. for first timers in marrakech we didnt know what to expect and the exterior of the property was not fantastic. However coming into the hotel and doing the check-in was excellent!! The staff were very attentive and realized we were tired and just signed us in and off we went to our room. We stayed in the Jaguar suite and there was nothing to say.. fabulous!!! the bathroom had a jacuzzi and felt like a palace. the roof terrace was wonderful we could have stayed in the hotel indefinitely. Nothing was too much trouble. The service was above and beyond a member of staff saw us on the first afternoon looking lost and ensured even though he was on his way home that we got to the square and that was the gardener!!!    Finally i should say we noticed that there is a sister hotel in qualidia which is on the coast and they transferred our final night to the hotel same standard of room with no additional charge. We did have to pay for the car which took us there but that was it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sonia B wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Title: Perfect Oasis amongst the madness in the Old Town
Review_Text: I've stayed at a lot of amazing hotels around the world there are very few that get absolutely everything right. La Sultana truly is an experience. The Hotel itself does an exceptional job maintaining the tradition & authenticity of the original riads whilst incorporating all of the mod cons. Its the finer details that makes this hotel stand out. The furnishings thoughout the hotel & in the rooms (each room is unique) the public spaces you can relax in and lose yourself the poolside complementary treats the 5pm complimentary "hors d'oeuvres" the friendly staff and the "Yes Can" attitude. My partner & I would love relaxing by the pool sitting on the rooftop drinking champagne or simply relaxing in our room with the sun streaming in. I would return to Marrakech simply to stay at La Sultana. Thank you to all of the amazing staff for making our stay truly exceptional.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gordon T wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: What can we add to all of the lovely reviews. La sultana is simply out if this world - its a really tranquil and beautiful place. The service is impeccable and the staff are delightful. The Head Concierge is very very helpful too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: La Sultana surpassed all of our expectations
Review_Text: My wife and I celebrated our 39th anniversary on this trip and our stay on La Sultana was one of the most memorable yet the place was an Oasis in itself the people and their service was outstanding we would recommend to all lovers sharing their time in La Sultana.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: everything was perfect from the warm welcome by Saida to the excellent service and food.we loved it all.the hotel is exquisite charming and mostly beautiful !! it's a small but very luxury riad in la casbah neighboorhood close to everything that matters in Marrakech.we will come back !!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Booked this Riad after looking at most of the positive reviews. booked for 4 nights HALF BOARD.  Pros: Superb location 5 mins to the main square very quiet place with a nice swimming pool and jacuzzis. Its a small place with just 28 rooms. Rooms are very quiet and are very clean.    Cons. Upon check in we stated that we had half board and that we were Vegetarians and we were assured we would be looked after. Our nightmare at the hotel started the 1st evening where they had made no arrangements and the service was really poor food served cold and small instructions were not followed at all. We gave up with our half board option after that experience and told the manager about it the next morning but instead of helping us and making any arrangements he decided to just give up and cancel our half board option.    We didnt want to spoil our little break so decided to just eat out everyday! Breakfast was also a struggle as nothing was there for us and lived on the cold limited optioned buffet of cereal and bread.    Must admit we were extremely surprised with our experience with the food part so on that part i wouldnt go there again as lots was assured during check in and nothing delivered at check out!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A palace in the middle of the Kasbah
Review_Text: It was our first time in Morocco first time in Marrakech and nothing could have been more welcoming than La Sultana. The hotel is composed of 5 differently themed beautiful riads courtyards all with relaxing places to sit or tan some with pools or jacuzzi's even. As the riads the rooms are also differently themed and everything inside them is curated to the highest degree I would find it hard to believe someone would be displeased with spending a night in any given room. The rooftop is amazing with yet another jacuzzi tanning beds and a covered space to relax and have a drink. The view is breathtaking from there all around you looking at the streets of the Kasbah in Marrakech. At night the rooftop or the bigger pool's area become a restaurant that is said to be amazing although unfortunately we did not have the time to experience so I can't talk about the food except for the breakfast. The breakfast is amazing the tea is great (better than the coffee if you ask me) fresh selection of an egg dish made on the moment and a buffet of delicacies that will keep you energised for a long day out or satisfied for a relaxing time at the hotel's many spots or spa. The staff was lovely and very helpful always you are really taken care of and can experience a great time of relaxing and enjoying a hotel that is as beautiful as a moroccan palace. For someone looking for a great place to stay in Marrakech this is a thing to see but for someone coming back to Marrakech (something we would like to do soon enough) this hotel is a place you could spend days in and still feel you are in morocco but living in great luxury and peace. Either way the place is amazing and worth a visit. Definitely going back. â€”OMWteam
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Believe me  This IS the most amazing place i ever seen in my life.  Service is more than perfectthe hotel is tipically and so romanticperfect cleaned and a lot of privacy!!!!  SIMPLY PERFECT.    MR. Davide Corradini
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just spent 4 fabulous days at La Sultana in Marrakech and absolutely LOVED IT!  We travel a great deal and appreciate exquisite hotels such as this one. The food was excellent the staff outstanding and we enjoyed its proximity to al the "action". I can't imagine anyone not being happy staying there. We would recommend that you put it in your list.  Also when in Marrakech ballooning with Ciel D'Aftique is a MUST! Magical mystical and out of this world!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We arrived at the end of a marathon trip from Australia and it was AMAZING! Nothing was too much trouble - the location comfort of room and amenities were exceptional. the roof terrace restaurant was perfect and the dinner beside the pool one night was faultless...I have never said that about anywhere!! It really is a place that fits the  imagining of Morocco...warm welcome quiet and superb 'cocoon'.  Yet right outside is the chaotic medina!!  I hope I can return sooner rather than later!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dee K wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: Words cannot begin to describe La Sultana Marrakesh Hotel from the breathtaking architecture to the superb service. The staff were very friendly proffessional and accommodating. The rooftop restaurant cooking classes and Hammam Spa were memorable. I highly recommended this hotel and shall most definately stay there during my next trip to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Laura G wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: We had the most wonderful stay at La Sultana; the entire team looked after us so well and nothing was too much trouble. The location was excellent within the medina and the hotel was beautiful. We adored our breakfasts by the pool and on the rooftop and loved our cooking class. Can highly recommend it to other travellers.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A luxurious oasis in the Medina
Review_Text: I've stayed in several riads forts & hotels in Marrakech but La Sultana is the best I've encountered. A member of the Small Luxury Hotels group it has a pool (unusual for a riad in the Medina) and a pleasant rooftop sunbathing/ bar area. Best of all were the meals (a stupendous foi gras pastilla) and genuinely helpful staff. As the weather was poor we wanted a fiad with places where you could sit and relax and as the hotel consists of four houses joined together each elegantly themed and lit this was easy. There's also a top-notch spa inside and it can be reached by taxi.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A PEACEFUL OASIS WITHIN THE WALLED MEDINA OF MARRAKECH
Review_Text: La Sultana is a boutique hotel compromising of 5 charming riads; each bought by the French owners carefully restored and connected together; allowing for 28 individually designed rooms to be created. With seven categories of rooms to choose from my husband and I had the pleasure of experiencing the delux suite otherwise known as the Jaguar suite. It is positioned within the courtyard featuring the jewel of La Sultana: the turquoise heated swimming pool within a patio of palm banana and sica trees and high brick walls covered with Virginia creeper to the right and to the left a long corridor of earthy peach archways and enclaves. By day the courtyard is the heart of La Sultana with guests lounging by the ionised pool or enjoying lunch in one of the enclaves. At night the courtyard is candle lit and tables are laid with colourful yet elegant crockery.    Read the full review here:  http://travellersplaces.com/la-sultana-peaceful-oasis-within-the-walled-medina-of-marrakech/
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Huw R wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: Other reviews have described La Sultana as straight out of Arabian Nights - I fully endorse that. La Sultana is exceptional in every respect. We have enjoyed 5 star luxury hotel all over the world but nothing quite like this. The public areas and every room are superbly restored at a high level of authentic detail. As one walks around one is confronted by yet another stunning vista- and the effect does not wane after several days.  Grand as it is it quickly feels like home - which is mainly due to the staff who really understand service without intrusion. They will gladly engage in conversation about their country and culture - really friendly people - makes a huge difference. Nothing is too much trouble - even the smallest detail gets prompt attention.  The restaurant tasting menu is just a marvel - make sure you are hungry!Again it is matched with top service and details of the local cuisine - first class.  Now the Spa - my wife is not a spa person but this is truly something else - the web photos tell the story - its exquisite.  For reasons not clear to me La Sultana is not the highest on the list of Riads in Marrakesh - in our view it's a clear number one - we will be back soon
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at La Sultana for four nights at the end of April. Marrakech has been described as an assault on the senses so I can think of nowhere better than La Sultana to escape the noise hectic pace and heat of the city.  We booked a Deluxe Suite and were delighted with our accommodation. We had a seating area downstairs which led onto the hotel's courtyard pool. Upstairs we had a very comfortable bedroom more seating a large dressing area another seating area / library (as they called it) overlooking the inner courtyard and a side balcony with chairs.  The hotel is made up of five raids all linked. Gorgeous artefacts decor and an abundance of beautiful flowers make this a delightful place to stay.  The service is excellent staff polite and friendly and professional.  The food was very good too. In fact why would you stay anywhere else?  Our suite was called Jaguar. I recommend it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Straight out of the Arabian Nights
Review_Text: Stayed here for two nights in Feb 2015.  It's right in heart of the Kasbah in heart of the Medina of Marrakech so easy walking distance of everywhere within the old city walls.  However because it is a riad you are cocooned from all the hustle and bustle of the streets - it's all only a few paces from front door but feel like it's miles away.  Hotel is actually 5 riads that have been joined together and meticulously restored by an army of traditional craftsmen in conjunction with the ministry of culture so the interiors are utterly amazing. The attention to detail is incredible with every riad and every room quite different. Like staying in a real palace fit for a sultan and his family/harem/courtiers.  Heated pool gorgeous roof terrace overlooking the city with Atlas Mountains behind beautiful spa very welcoming and attentive staff (everyone from manager to chamber maids was charming) superb food...  Read the other reviews - La Sultana is genuinely this magical they are not exagerating!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I had wonderful time in this luxury riad. In the middle of the Medina a great spot for sightseeing. The riad has a design style but it maintains the traditional ambience. Personnel is great best service in Marocco. The terrace provvides an astonishing view of the City and it is perfect for breakfast.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Tracy F wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: We stayed 4 nights at La Sultana and enjoyed it immensely. A beautiful and well-maintained property every room is spectacular and unique. The rooftop bar restaurant and lounge areas have a wonderful view of Marrakech. Hotel staff is very good everyone remembers your name and needs and helps in any way they can. I much prefer the smaller scale and intimacy of this Riad to La Mamounia which has the feel of a very large and impersonal hotel (despite its lovely gardens). Stick to La Sultana for your stay and have a drink at Mamounia.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Authentic Collection of Riads, but run like a 5 star hotel, wonderful!
Review_Text: Situated just inside the medina thus hotel has it all.    The Riads have different themes which gives the whole place such character. The rooms are a good size with Clarins products thrown in.    The spa is excellent the bar terrace is beautiful and the restaurant and breakfast areas are delightful.    A special mention must go to the staff who cannot do enough to help you and really make your whole stay bliss.    Highly recommend as the prices are very good throughout your stay so it isn't an expensive option.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jaymie K wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: At the end of a rather hectic back-packing tour we realised we had booked the incorrect hotel location. We turned up at the front desk of the hotel looking less than stellar and rather stressed and Hassan could not help us enough. He transferred our stay to the La Sultana in Marrakech with little issue and a great big smile.    Upon early arrival the next morning the front desk staff ensured our room was readied as quickly as possible we were given delicious mint tea and a tour of the facilities as well as an opportunity to rest on the roof top deck while our room was completed.    Everyone at this hotel (the cleaners the kitchen wait and bar staff the spa staff and front of house personnel) spoke multiple languages were very knowledgable on the facility and imparted plenty of local and world knowledge during our frequent chats.    All of our meals were amazing the spa experience was devine and no matter where we turned there was always a friendly and helpful staff member ready to assist.    I would absolutely recommend this hotel and hope to one day return and enjoy this gorgeous facility again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Laurie L wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Perfect hideway , so quite and yet so close to the real centre
Review_Text: All different beautiful and luxury rooms  a professional and kind staff  good service  a very good SPA treatment  excellent meals  2 small swimming pools  one on the roof terrace where the excellent breakfast was served
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: A superb riad; I would come back to this hotel in Marrakech. It is conveniently located in the medina and all the activities a tourist would want to participate in. Their spa is absolutely wonderful. Excellent food and very lovely dÃ©cor. Outstanding service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: KATE D wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Amazing jewel hidden in this chaotic city.
Review_Text: Had a fantastic evening meal (taster menu) with friends whilst staying in another hotel near Marrakech. We advised the staff upon arrival that i'm Coeliac and my friend is Vegetarian that was no problem. All the food was beautifully presented and tasted amazing within a truly Moroccan setting. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Nothing not to like about this hotel and it's staff and decor. Photos do not do it justice. Every room is unique (with serious attention to detail) and the hotel (riad) is actually 5 houses connected together each one nicer than the next. Was our first time in Morocco and they made the transition easy and enjoyable (thank you Saida). They organized guides schedules etc. Also just a few minutes walking to the Souks (although you would never know once you are inside). An oasis in the middle of a pretty incredible city. Nothing against La Mamounia (or Royal Mansour) they are both extremely beautiful and nice but with them being out of the city La Sultana just feels more authentic and genuine. Would definitely go back and encourage other people to try this hotel as well...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: ZITA G wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: 7 sisters on a trip to marrakech with the excellent guidance of boutique souk
Review_Text: we had the most wonderful experience from the la sultana hotel to the desert experience . The atlas mountain trek and lunch at tamadot kasbah . the restaurants  the private transfer for the entire trip . It was perfect  magical and truly memorable . All organised by boutique souk .  thanks so much
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Yvonne H wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: My sisters and I stayed at La Sultana and were not misled by the photo's on their site...it is an absolutely gorgeous hotel where you feel at home immediately and where you will find all the details for a thousand and one night stay!! The architecture is stunning and although you are in the midst of the kasbah area you experience absolute rest inside these walls.  The very professional staff will and can arrange everything for you and are most friendly:-)  The Spa was my ultimate favorite...a wonderful atmosphere of tranquility. The Hammam treatment is quite the experience and the sultana massage performed by Nema was my absolute number one massage I've had in a very long time!!! The restaurant serves typical moroccan as well as international dishes. The quality is very good and again the ambiance where you enjoy your diner and breakfast are absolutely amazing!! With warm weather the restaurant on the rooftop is a delight too with the sound of the buzz of the people in the streets beneath you and the incidental Mineret chanting makes the oriental experience complete. My favorite waiter is Mahmoud...very professional and sympathetic.  I know for sure this will not be the last time im visiting beautiful Marrakech with its fibrant medina and souks and delightful restaurants and very nice people:-))
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jani P wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Most special hotel I have stayed
Review_Text: Very special hotel which consists of 5 riads. Every riad is perfect different from the other (different African styles) and are full of beautiful plants. When you enter the hotel after a few meters even if outside you have seen and heard a big confusion you enter in a calm space...  Respect
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Fantastic place in Marrakech Medina! Very beautiful inside very friendly staff excellent breakfast and dinner in an absolutely gorgeous environment!! Good location easy to walk around in the Medina. We havew travelled a lot but never stayed in a place like this before! Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: marta b wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: I decide to celebrate my birthday in a new place and I chose Marrakesh and La Sultana as the place where to stay.  My experience was excellent!  Not only the location is just 10 min walk from the main square and the spice marketin a lively and colourful casbahbut the hotel itself is a jewel well hidden from the outer world.  You cannot notice the entrance perhaps the reception desk seems at first sight an ordinary onebut once you walk inside....well ...it is just a beautifulpeacefulcolourful clean place!! Roses everywherethe dining place around the swimming pool area so well preparedso well furnished so romantic..and then the terrace that offers a beautiful view of the Medina and a perfect place to dine or just having a drink. The service is very good and the people friendly but discreet what more can I say? I felt like at home with a five stars service! We had the Lion suite that has a nice and big balcony over a riad. It was the perfect place to chill out after a walk in the outer streets. My husband organized for the day of my birthday a beautiful day full of surprise and Kalid at the concierge was the perfect help for everything and was always there whatever we needed. The chef of La Sultana prepared for us a very good and tasty vegan birthday cake that surprised me so much! I could never expect itbeautiful from outside and sooo good! thank you again! You made my day one of the best in my life!! Last but not least: The Spa. We had few treatments thereproducts excellentpeople very well trainedthe Spa itself is something you have to see because is just beautiful! I know when I will be back to Marrakesh La Sultana will be my placeno doubt! Thanks again to all the people working there and a particular thank you to Kalid.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The most Awesome place we've stayed
Review_Text: My wife and I live in San Diego CA and travel quite a bit all over the world. We have stayed in some incredible places luxurious expensive travels. We lead a simple life at home I drive a Jetta but we travel like movie stars and it's so much fun:) La Sultana has been the most interestingly beautiful place we have ever stayed! The service was top notch. Without any pre-planning they hooked us up with a tour guide who was pursuing his PHD in International Tourism. The restaurant on the roof offered the most romantic dinner we have ever had. The setting the music the architecture. Each section of the hotel offers extremely intricate filigree and architecture from the different periods of Moroccan history. The "secret" gem is the spa pool underneath the property. We still fantasize about having that secretly under our house. La Sultana was the first place we stayed in Morocco and we immediately were taken in by its grace beauty and accessibility to Americans. We felt safe and were pampered as if we were the only guests. My review does not do justice to all that La Sultana had to offer for a truly 5 Star original and truly Moroccan experience. There are so many places to see in the world and we actually plan to return to La Sultana someday. I highly highly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Most memorable holiday thanks to the beautiful hotel and attentive staff. The food was delicious and authentic. The hotel delivered on every level more than we had ever hoped. Very romantic. Fantastic first class way to experience Marrakech.  Mr and Mrs Reed
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Intimate Authenticity and Luxury in Marrakech
Review_Text: La Sultana is an elegant way to experience the soul of Marrakech. My husband and I were traveling with our 7 year old son and we spent 3 nights at La Sultana.    Arrival: Seamless - one of the highlights of our entire trip in fact. We were greeted right outside customs and whisked away on a rainy evening to the Casbah section of the Medina escorted off the street under a hotel umbrella to the tucked-back main entrance of the Riad. Through the noble entrance way and around a peaceful central garden we were nestled into a luxurious chamber. Crackling smoky fireplace dramatic pours of our fist sips of mint tea and a tower of sumptuous Moroccan pastries this was the best hotel check-in experience I can remember.
