Food: We're in the restaurant business and food/dining is incredibly important to us. The setting in the restaurant for dinner is romantic and serene with transporting live music from a single musician. The food was traditional: super clean and very well prepared. We are vegetarian and we found a nice amount of variety. The Moroccan Salads are beautiful including some of the best olives we've ever eaten. The same space is bright and inviting for breakfast. Service here and at the upper rooftop bar was excellent with a wonderful wine list local beers and spirits.    Spa: The Royal Hammam was an refreshing new experience. The space is relaxing professional and clean. The staff is also very professional pampering and discrete. The products (eucalyptus rose anise) all made for an intoxicating sensory experience.    Service/Concierge: From knowing our names and remembering our wine selections to coordinating with our tour to the Ouzoud Falls we got the sense the staff truly cared about us having a personalized and enjoyable experience. They are proud of the unique experience they offer and eager to impress.    Location: While the hotel itself is quiet and peaceful the streets outside offer the vibrant hustle and bustle of the medina. You're a short drive from the airport very conveniently located between the 2 royal palaces just about 10 minutes walk to the jemaa el fna. It's easy to catch a taxi to any other parts of the down town area or to head our of Marrakech (Ouxoud Essouria etc.) for a day trip.    Highlights: Arrival with Tea Service Delicious stuffed Dates placed in the room Inspired Design in the rooms and throughout the different sections of the Riad Stunning Views from the expansive rooftop Tagine
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Extremely good service. Good food. Beautiful building with Marocan design. Very helpful staff. Great spa facilities. Very nice facilities for food. Even had wonderful roof top restaurant. Great New Year's celebration. Would definitely stay here again when in Marrakech the next time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Eli G wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: My husband and I just got back from an amazing week at La Sultana in Marrakech. We live in Manhattan and travel quite often. Our hotel preference is usually the Aman resorts Four Seasons Ritz Carlton and the SoHo houses. In Marrakech La Sultana will definitely be added to this list. The hotel is out of a post card. Every corner is designed with amazing decor.The service is outstanding and consistent. Very personalized and attentive- at ALL times. A small story to share was that one night we got charged almost double for a cab ride that was a 5 minute drive (being tourists the taxi driver took advantage of us). We made a very casual comment to the front desk attendant about this taxi experience. The next day they had an envelope with the extra cash that we paid the taxi driver. They contacted the company and demanded that we get our money back. The location of the hotel is also very good. You are very closed to the main square and souks but not in the crazy part of town. If you travel to Marrakech and you want luxury & top notch service stay here. Enjoy our pictures!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Exquisite does not begin to describe this jewel. From fountains brimming with fresh roses and a bath fit for a queen to glimmering lamplit corridors and a dreamy roof terrace this is luxury and romance at its finest. Step outside and you are in the bustling heart of the Medina close to the main attractions and the market. Step inside and you are in total tranquility. The food is fabulous and my usual no-carb rule was soon vanquished by the delicious Berber pancakes (with not a single regret). As for the people who work here they are truly welcoming warm and expert and we loved meeting them all. We have been fortunate to stay at many great hotels around the world -- La Sultana is without a doubt one of the greatest.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Amazing experience at La Sultana. Service and facilities were top. Every detail was taken care of.  Really enjoyed the restaurant loved the local food part of the menu. We also had a cooking class on the roof which was lovely.  Great experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A stunningly beautiful hotel with excellent service. Five Riads were combined In perfect and authentic taste to create a unique first class hotel. We have traveled the world and the Sultana is in a class of its own. Highly recommended. A jewel in the middle of the Marrakesh Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mary Ann S wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: We stayed here for 5 nights - our first trip to Marrakech! It was wonderful! The staff was exceptional and paid attention to every detail. Every room is uniquely appointed . We traveled with three other couples and had the opportunity to see each other's rooms- amazing!! Fresh roses are everywhere... The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms had a great shower! This is a great place to stay and we highly recommend it!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Where to begin with La Sultana? Out of our entire 20 day vacation in Egypt and Morocco this place was our favorite by far; and this includes stays at places like the Four Seasons in Cairo Riad Fes in Fes and the Fairmont in Cairo. There are numerous reasons why this place was the best but the biggest one for us was the service. To give you a perfect example of the level of service while touring one day I was struck by a motorcyclist coming around a blind curve. I was barely able to walk for a few hours but after our guide phoned the hotel about the accident Saida the property manager of La Sultana leapt into action by going to a nearby pharmacy purchasing alcohol and cotton swabs to clean the wound as well as arnica gel for the swelling and proceeded to treat me as if I was her own child. In fact as she was treating my wounds she stated that we weren't just guests we were family. It definitely makes you feel special and not just another hotel guest.  So in addition to the incredible level of service there were the facilities themselves which were amazingly opulent. From the exquisitely carved walls and doors to the beautiful fixtures no detail was overlooked. And despite the opulence of the facilities it still managed to feel warm and homey. We also highly recommend dinner by the pool on your first night in town. It's a great way to ease into Moroccan cooking and not have to worry about getting lost in the Medina on your first day there.  This place truly is an oasis among the craziness of the medina. It was remarkable that once you stepped into La Sultana you ceased hearing the honking horns of cars speeding motorcycles and loud merchants hawking their wares and were seemingly transported to a quiet little paradise.  There are undoubtedly a number of great places to stay in Marrakech and while planning our trip we were deciding between a few but if you're wanting a cozy more personalized experience I believe La Sultana is the way to go. We really can't recommend this place enough. We've been lucky enough to stay at some amazing places around the world but La Sultana is definitely in our top 3.  Thank you Saida and the rest of the staff of La Sultana for an incredible experience. We hope to be back one day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: 5* from the moment your met by the bellboy
Review_Text: This was our 1st trip tp Marrakech & certainly won't be our last. Afternoon tea in a cool courtyard whilst checking in then a candlelight dinner by the pool with excellent food served by attentive staff & a musician playing was so relaxing followed by a peaceful drink on the rooftop. Breakfast served on the rooftop with the nesting storks flying about was so good we found lunch was usually just a drink. This wonderful vibrant city can be quite exhausting but arriving back to the quiet of La Sultana was always a delight. Nothing was to much trouble for the friendly attentive staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Joe B wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: We have just returned from a fabulous and restorative four nights break at La Sultana Hotel in Marrakesh. It is possibly the most beautiful and well run hotel I have ever stayed at. Khalid and his team could not to enough to make our stay more comfortable and make us feel at home. The Zebra suite is delightful with views looking down onto the pool. We ate in the restaurant two out of our four nights as the food was perfection and the atmosphere around the candlelit pool and gentle live Moroccan music really couldn't be beaten. I cannot wait to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: La Sultana Marrakech is quite simply one of the most beautiful and unique hotels in the world. We stayed for our honeymoon and could simply not have been more delighted by our experience. Everything about the hotel was simply world class. The customer service attention to detail beauty of the property location and food made it a memory we will cherish for a lifetime. We will definitely be back and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a luxurious experience in the center of all the action.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Roger P wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: The best hotel we've ever stayed in by a long way.
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived at La Sultana we were so well looked after by the staff that it was wonderful. We stayed for 7 nights and during that time we experienced the utmost friendliness charm efficiency professionalism and "unstuffiness" from every member of staff with whom we dealt. We had reserved a suite and were upgraded to a deluxe suite which was simply stunning.  Breakfast was an absolute delight with the most gorgeous selection of cereals home made yoghurts fresh fruit breads etc. taken on the terrace upstairs looking out over the snowcapped Atlas Mountains. Lunch again on the terrace was excellent - although we couldn't manage both lunch and dinner on the same day because the portions are so generous!! Dinner was served around the pool lit by candles to the sound of a local musician - simply wonderful setting and beautifully prepared and served food.  The Spa is probably the finest we've ever experienced. We went twice during our week for a Hamman and then a massage - you sleep like a baby afterwards.  La Sultana has 28 rooms/suites and this means that guests can be given individual attention but at the same time the hotel is large enough to have all the facilities of a much larger establishment. I would highly recommend La Sultana. It is completely magical. At how many hotels have you been to that the front desk staff give you a hug and shed a tear when you leave? That is the real spirit of La Sultana.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Eric A wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: The hotel is made up of five riads each with their own distinct style. The interior is impeccably decorated and the rooms are very nice. The hotel staff are what make La Sultana stand apart - each person is incredibly friendly and helpful. The food is also very good and I'd recommend eating breakfast and getting drinks and snacks on the rooftop - which has an amazing view of the Atlas Mountains. The location of the hotel itself is very central and right next door to the Saadian tombs which are definitely worth a visit. It's only a 10 minute walk to downtown Marrakech and the souks. Overall 10/ 10! We are planning on making this an annual trip!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Austin A wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: The most exquisite memory of Marrakech - we will return
Review_Text: Scheherazade had one more beautiful story to tell to defer death on the 1001st night and that tale would have recounted the delights of La Sultana. My designer wife and I spend a lot of time scrutinising the best boutique hotels round the world for our visits and are very demanding with regards to service food and aesthetics. The riad/hotel surpassed our very highest expectations - I would like to name a few staff but there are many that helped us feel at home: Khalid Hassan Mahmoud and Afid.    The key to a perfect welcome for a guest is the very first impression and the impressive entrance and traditional carpets flanked by lanterns teased our imagination from the very beginning. The front office staff immediately ushered us into a separate and cosy anteroom with mint tea and traditional sweet pastries while they made the perfunctory checks on our passports and hence causing the least possible distress. The meal by the pool on our first night was both impressive and evocative of the great berber traditions that founded the town while retaining an air of sophistication and our waitress was extremely sweet and helpful.    We have had constructive discussions with La Sultana regarding our first room which lacked a little bit of the joy and beautiful colour which characterises the rest of the hotel (though clean and good amenities) but our next suite was quite simply one of the most beautiful and thoughtfully decorated rooms we have ever stayed in. The Elephant room reflects the majesty and size of the animal yet softened by the luxurious fabrics crystal handles and bespoke furniture.    At every turn through the multitude of communal rooms there were details that left us spellbound and anxious like a small child for more treats! The roof terrace overlooked both historical features such as the Saadian tombs but also the raw energy of the market place and the day to day life in the medina. Drinks and breakfast were drawn out and infused us with a sense of complete well being. The cookery course is an absolutely essential and fabulous experience under the tutelage of the chef in a separate area with a full array of new and clean kitchen paraphernalia and the chicken tagine with preserved lemon and aubergine salad we created was a triumphant conclusion!    Please believe me as i have researched thoroughly riads and hotels in Marrakech that you cannot find a better place to stay in terms of location authentic impression of the culture and sheer luxury and indulgence with service to match. It is the only place that I and my wife will stay as I am drawn to plan my next trip already!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: service wonderful, hotel maybe needs a spruce up
Review_Text: Have stayed at sister hotel in Oualidia (see separate review) and this one in Marrakech. Chose the hotel from photos in Riads of Marrakech book and reviews. This hotel is not for people who like minimalism- it is quite stuffy and full of antiques maybe just a bit much. I hate to be critical because the hotel offers very warm service and has a lovely roof top terrace right next to the Saadian tombs and great location.  Stayed in the zebra room- fittings are a bit old-fashioned but lovely effect overall.  We appreciated the champagne and nibbles for our anniversary. Because there are some many other hotels in Marrakech to chose from (also stayed at Villa des Orangers see review) not sure would come back but the service was great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Nothing is casual in this place: from the attention of the front manager to the kindness of the waiters from the beauty of the terrace burnt by the sun of Marrakech to the peaceful silence of each riad wrapped in La Sultana.    In a word: heaven!    Me and my partner joined five days here and everything was absolutely perfect! From the private dinner to the many one we had in the restaurant nearby the amazing pool.    Also if you are in a magic city when you find a place as La Sultana is really hard going outside because everything here is more of what you can expect. Strong of my experience in 5 starts luxury hotel I could say that I've never seen as in La Sultana people so genuine and kind doing their work at their best to create an unforgettable trip for the guests always ready to give you the best smile they have.    The Sultana is not just a riad but thousand places in one an Arabian night dream where each corner bring you in another experience or world: the terrace where you can see Atlas mountain and the sunset of Marrakech or the storks flying around the mosque; the pool where you can have a relaxing and romantic moment enjoying the melodies of a great musician; the hammam where skilful hands will provide to stretch your muscles. Ask and be sure you will have more of what you have request!    The day after in London makes me feel that La Sultana was the best dream I've ever had!    Elisa
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Christoph S wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Excellent location with excellent and very friendly services
Review_Text: Thank you for the very comfortable stay in the "La Sultana". The rooms are very specially designed. In old Berber style....but very proper and comfortable. The personal is very friendly.... i can recommand to every. Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Philippe L wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Every touch point was a positive experience at La Sultana since all staff members know what caring is about...  From the GM to the maids everyone tried their best to make it a memorable experience.  We shall gladly recommend this hotel to our family and friends as we feel disappointment will never be an option!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nadia K wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: A superb delightful oasis in Marrakech
Review_Text: We loved it so much! Excellent location in the kasbah. Inside the Riad is an oasis of pure beauty la Sultana shows Moroccan craftsmanship at its best. Every little detail is a delight to see it is difficult to describe such beauty in words. The service is warm and the staff is very helpful. Great and extremely courteous! We ate some delicious Moroccan food at incredible romantic places (beside the pool  on the rooftop terrace facing the Atlas mountains). It was our first time in Marrakech and La Sultana made it heavenly! Thank you so much for a wonderful stay! We hope to come back. Christophe and Nadia
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed in this wonderful hotel for a week. I've never known such attention to detail and eagerness to please their guests. From the minute our driver collected us from the airport it was 5 star treatment all the way. No hanging around reception waiting to be seen or checked in. We were ushered into a beautiful riad and served mint tea while the luggage was being taken to our room and all the boring formalities were being taken care of. I would highly recommend going for a Hamman and massage in the lovely spa. We spent a very relaxing afternoon being scrubbed and pampered. The hotel staff were also very helpful recommending good restaurants nearby to eat out. Everyone of them were fantastic. There's nothing negative I can say about this hotel. It's peaceful it's stunning inside and the staff are truly helpful and welcoming.

Review_Date: Mark B wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: Hotel was fantastic and made even better by the service. The staff genuinely enjoy their jobs and want to make you feel welcome. The Medina outside is a hive of activity and noise but inside the hotel it is an oasis. It really is like a different world. If you want to experience the real Marrakech this hotel is a great place to do it from. Great food great rooms and wonderful spa. Highly recommended.    When you walk outside prepare to have people trying to persuade you to go into their restaurant or tell you you are going the wrong way. Its par for the course. Politely saying no and then ignoring them is the most effective way to deal with it and its not threatening. Annoying sometimes but well worth the minor inconvenience to experience this great city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This small luxury hotel is simply stunning constructed from five separate riads all with their own distinctive styles.    Situated in the Medina and next door to the tombs and about a 10/15 walk to the main square.    Nothing is to much trouble for the staff who are friendly and efficient. The roof terrace has views to the Atlas mountains and there is ample room to sunbath. Lunch is served on the terrace and it is worth trying the camel.    Dinner is served around the pool and again is worth every penny.    Our room and bathroom were without fault.    A hotel with a deservedly high reputation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Pamper yourself and your loved ones!
Review_Text: What a great vacation my daughter and I had in Marrakech and Qualidia......La Sultana hotels both places are simply just so beautiful mixed with the authentic Arab mystic and to this added with the most helpful and nice hotel staff that we have met so far. Thank you sooooo much for a wonderful stay! We will definitely be back in not too long :-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Julia T wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Title: A Real Treasure of a Riad Hotel
Review_Text: Very comfortable excellent service and food to match. Nothing was too much trouble. Free upgrade very peaceful full of atmosphere dining by the Pool completely beautiful outstanding dinner Roof Garden quite with good views and well designed with another charming restaurant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Sitting drinking mint tea with a view to the Atlas Mountains isn't a bad way to spend an afternoon. The roof terrace is relaxing with bar restaurant sun terrace as well as a gym. If you can tear yourself away from the view the riads which make up this hotel are amazing each one has a different style. An eclectic mix. Nooks and crannies keep you on your toes with lots of hideaways if you need a seat cup of tea and some time to yourself.    The nightly music drifting through our shuttered windows was restful and aided a good nights sleep    A beautiful place to stay recommended for a honeymoon or a much needed " me time" holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andreas K wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Title: Staying 5 nights in 1000 and one night
Review_Text: we arrived at midnight and Khalid showed us the necessary rooms in the hotel and then he brought us to our room - wonderful ceillings and appliques - a perfect bed and washroom.We slept wonderful. Next morning we had marrocan breakfast a beautiful few to the snowcovered atlas and the roofs of marrakesh. In La Sultana you are in the heart of the medina you can walk to the sights withhin 20 minutes and you will be back from adventoures shoppingtours through the souks in 15 minutes if you find the way out.  Food is good and service is perfect you will allways find a friendly face and helping hand.  Swimmingpool spa terrace as well as the gym are of good quality you can enjoy a relaxing day in the hotel and enjoy life.  if i come back to marrakesh i will stay in La Sultana it has the breath of 1000 and one night
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Melanie B wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: We stayed here for 3 nights in February. This hotel is made up of 5 riads. The architecture is absolutely stunning; as we were shown round the hotel at every turn we kept saying 'amazing'. Each riad is in a different style. The rooftop terrace has fantastic views across the city. Breakfast was served by attentive staff who made you feel very welcome. In fact all of the staff were very attentive. The hotel is located about 10 mins walk from the main square down a short alleyway - very easy to find. We would definitely recommend this hotel as a base for exploring Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Like staying in a five-star medieval church
Review_Text: Just leaving after four nights in the fabulous Jaguar suite at the Sultana. It's five riads connected together to make 28 rooms each with its own unique historical style. Everything is over the top yet never gauche from the wall appliquÃ©s of pounded tin to the tasseled cord that drops out of the ceiling and is pulled to activate the in-suite sunken massage tub.    The location is in the heart of the Medina the old city a stone's throw from the Royal Palace. That's good and bad: good because everything is a short walk away bad because you emerge from the utter tranquility and luxury of the Sultana into the chaos of the Ochre City which includes spotters who track where you go and pull stunts like sidle up to you as you're walking around and say "Hello! I work at your hotel!" and guide you eventually but inexorably to a carpet store where you are pressed with hot mint tea and shown rug after rug until you either a) invent a pressing appointment; b) fake an allergic reaction; or c) make it very clear by your facial expression that you are onto their game and to quote Patsy on AbFab "finish the Beaujolais and walk away from it sweetie." You really really have to watch your step. You're unlikely to get robbed but you're highly likely to get pulled into a buying situation not of your own making. Just smile refuse smile and get out. Unless of course you need a Kilim rug.    The pool at the hotel is small as is the rooftop gym but both are great for quick workouts. The spa is very traditional right down to a cinnamon scrub that from a towering beauty of an aesthetician that made me wonder whether I'd have skin at the other end of it. The full-body sports massage was divine.    The restaurant is top notch. We had dinner there every night and breakfast there every day. Which brings me to the staff. They are among the best group of hotel employees I've ever met. When was the last time you hugged the front desk manager (the wonderful and ebullient Saida) before you left? The roving managers like Said are terrific as well and every waiter or waitress was just a delight. You forget what a huge difference the staff makes in your travel experience but they couldn't do enough. Including I might add have two double espressos with steamed milk ready for us at 3:15 AM for our early departure to the airport. I mean who does that?    I booked this trip through the Small Luxury Hotels of the World program at $500 a night and expected an upgrade from a regular room to a small suite. What we didn't expect was to find ourselves in the $1000 a night Jaguar suite. There was a foyer with its own TV a 22-step staircase up to the living area two balconies an office a walk-in closet a huge sitting area la la la.    Like everyone else who visits I think we made the 10-minute trek on foot to La Mamounia the true grande dame of Moroccan hotels and possibly the best hotel in all of Africa for drinks at the Italian Bar. I have to say though the displays of raw wealth and wealthy inebriation there really put me off and made me and my partner eager to return to the Sultana. It's truly a jewel among hotels.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jeyakumar N wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: We stayed 3 days at La Sultana and I couldn't be more impressed. Absolutely stunning interior design and architecture; extremely attentive staff great location. I could go on and on but honestly the moment we entered the building our jaws were to the floor. The amount of detail is just mind boggling. We fully enjoyed our stay and can't recommend it enough.    You are right in the center of the medina so going anywhere is a quick walk or cab away.    The restaurant is good and the service is solid.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
Reviewer_Location: New York, New York, United States

Review_Title: An oasis of calm in the Medina
Review_Text: We were surprised at the mixed reviews for La Sultana. Our experience was one of impecable service truly atmospheric surroundings and excellent food. The staff were attentive and friendly at all times and gave every impression that no request would be too much trouble. At dinner the mix of traditional Morrocan and French cuisine gave a broad choice of dining at reasonable prices given the quality of the hotel. We also experienced the surprise birthday treatment at dinner all the more remarkable given that we had not mentioned it was a special occasion (we can only assume they had worked it out from the passport). The spa is wonderful all the treatments you would expect and genuinely relaxing. La Sultana is well located in the Kasbah area of the Medina immediately next door to the Saadian Tombs and within a short walk of other important sites. Despite being within such a busy district once you pass through the front doors the calm and serenity of the Riads that make up La Sultana takes you back to a world of relaxation and comfort. Full marks and many thanks to all the staff who make it such a special place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Klaus F wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: Not small luxury , has seen better days
Review_Text: If you search for a place close to the Medina you might be attracted rooms are small full of old smell everything is outdated  there is no view garden terrace covered with plastic foil. Breakfast is terrible bathroom borderline to dirty... Internet photos are not the reality ...better double check  The worst SLH ever
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The most incredible hotel we have stayed in!
Review_Text: Where do I start? My girlfriend decided to take me away for 4 days for my birthday and the destination was Marrakech. She booked two nights in a junior suite at La Sultana and as soon as we stepped into the arrivals hall everything was perfect. The hotel is literally in the thick of things with the roof terrace of the hotel over looking the most famous attraction in Marrakech Le Tombeaux des saddiens.  The staff at all times were absolutely brilliant nothing too much trouble and the service exceptional. Being used to staying in 5* hotels through work this was up there with the best we have ever experienced!  It was my birthday on Monday and we decided to eat at the hotel restaurant. Blown away is all I can say. Michelin star quality food without the price tag or stuffy service that goes with it. The staff were exceptional as they were the whole trip and the food was to die for! I was then treated to happy birthday in 4 languages by 4 waiters and the in house musician which was a lovely experience despite normally not wanting to be centre of attention. We also received a free dessert for my birthday which was extremely generous.  If you are going to Marrakech spend one night in absolute luxury and give this place a go. Or alternatively book dinner in the restaurant one evening. We spent Â£120 for two including starters mains cocktails and desserts.  10/10 excellent in every single way!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: When traveling solo you are treated different than if as family couple or group. Here I was given THE WORST room. It was the only room on the ground floor next to the swimming pool/dining area. The room opens directly into the dining area. When I checked in I was shown the elevator to the roof and my room - apparently this is a historic building but I was not shown any of it. There was an annoying vibration coming from somewhere when I asked about it no one else could hear it except the young mechanic nothing was done. Since room opened to the dining area I was awakened each morning by staff dragging tables and chairs for breakfast service. The restaurant was not bad but not great: lamb couscous was very good beef tagine was very fatty. Be careful ordering. Service for breakfast and dinner was indifferent. For this price I would expect better.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Ramon G wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: Fabulous oasis and haven of tranquility
Review_Text: This is a really great unusual place right in the middle of what first appears to be a thriving and chaotic market street. The entrance to the hotel is wonderfully hidden and once inside you can begin to explore the hidden charms of these 5 exquisitely refurbished Riads or large once private palaces. I was warmly greeted by Hassan and Saida who ensured throughout the week that I was well looked after. The rooms (there are 28 I think) are exotically decorated and themed. Mine was very spacious well appointed and quiet. I ate many meals in the hotel restaurant and the food was first class as was the service. The roof top garden was a great place to lay down in the sun and relax or eat a meal in the outdoor restaurant (the manager of the restaurants Said will look after you superbly) I also took the cooking class given by a local Dada (Chef) and really enjoyed it and learning about the Moroccan ingredients. Although the hotel is right in the middle of the Kasbah the area is not as intimidating after a few days as on first glance and I was extremely glad I choose La Sultana and experienced a real taste of the local culture.    As an aside and a respite from the hustle and bustle of the Medina I enjoyed outdoor walks and lunch at some of the larger hotels or palaces .....in particular the Sellman Palace (amazing stud farm attached to hotel) was a fabulous day out and La Mamounia had gorgeous gardens. The 4 Season was fun for people watching outdoor by the pool for lunch. I found the much touted gardens of Yves St. Laurent (Jardin Majorelle) a huge disappointment and could not recommend them.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: If you are like me you are obsessing over where to stay in Marrakech. The choices are overwhelming and when you start looking at riads in the old city each one seems more spectacular than the last. We book-ended our trip with 3 nights in Marrakech which gave me the opportunity to choose 2 different hotels. Once we decided not to stay out in the Palmeraie that narrowed the possibilities; after much research we decided to spend the first 3 nights at La Sultana and the last 3 nights at La Mamounia so I can give you a decent comparison of those two at least.    La Sultana is quite simply one of the most atmospheric charismatic properties I have ever stayed at. The beauty of this hotel and the design integration of the different riads will knock your socks off. As a result of combining 4 different riads the hotel ends up being a fairly large property and for us this is a huge selling point as some of the riads (we visited Maison MK for example) feel somewhat claustrophobic because of their limited footprint. La Sultana manages to feel both intimate and spacious while exuding an authenticity that we found very compelling; there is nothing "institutional" about it.    At La Sultana each riad has a completely different architectural aesthetic and wandering throughout the hotel is an amazing experience. We never tired of it. We stayed in the Lion Suite which is the one with the enormous private porch overlooking one of the courtyards and this room (their largest and therefore the most expensive) is definitely worth the splurge. There are 2 bathrooms (one with rain shower the other with an enormous round jacuzzi tub) a separate sitting room and large bedroom that gives out onto the porch. It is absolutely silent with no noise of any kind if you worry about that kind of thing. The service is exceptional with twice daily maid service and every detail has been thought out. Even all the non-alcoholic drinks in the mini bar are free and the wifi works great    We had breakfast included with our room and this was excellent with a huge selection of pastries/cheeses/ meats plus they would cook eggs and other dishes to order if you wanted something hot. The service is friendly and professional just the way you want it.    If you have gorgeous weather like we had you will want to head up immediately to the roof top which is enormous! It was so much larger than I anticipated with many different areas for lounging sitting enjoying a drink taking in the view of the Atlas mountains or the surrounding neighborhood all with really comfortable cushy furniture. Lunch is served there during the winter months but that is the only meal you can enjoy there at this time of year. Breakfast and dinner are taken on the first floor around the pool and particularly at night it is incredibly atmospheric; the one dinner we had (their Moroccan tasting) was terrific and we really enjoyed the live music.    The location is great because taxis can get right to the little alleyway that leads to the front door unlike many hotels in the heart of the Medina where you are going to be walking and getting really lost. It is a chaotic 10 minute walk to the square through a really busy area without sidewalks and you will feel like you are risking your life each time you cross a street.....but we even got used to this.    If you are on a budget I think you could take the smallest (therefore cheapest) room in this hotel and simply enjoy the many public areas which harbor hidden nooks and spacious alcoves for reading or hanging out not to mention the vast and comfortable space of the roof-top terrace. Unfortunately I didn't see any of the other rooms so can't offer any more specific advice. But if you want to feel like you are in Marrakech this hotel offers an aesthetic immersion that is second to none.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Arrive as a guest - Depart as family
Review_Text: After a last minute change in plans we booked the hotel based on the reviews here and we were not disappointed.    Down a very small alley off the busy market street you are greeted by a carpet and lantern lined entry. Impressive doors open to welcome you to the small reception where the staff is waiting to ensure every moment of your stay is faultless. They refer to your room as your home and this is they way they make you feel.    Each room dÃ©cor reflects that of the Riad ours was an amazing suite called buffalo. With a huge bed on a marble platform fireplace and loft seating area. As well the luxury bathroom and jacuzzi. A paradise - close the doors and forget the world!    Dining in the poolside restaurant for a the taster menu dinner or the roof for lunch are both memorable with traditional and European cuisine choices. The staff again greets you with warm smiles and ensures you are looked after.    The spa is simply the ultimate escape with private/couple rooms and treatments. We went twice it was so amazing. The spa staff like the rest of the hotel are so very kind.    After our short stay we felt like family more than guests and the acts of kindness from the staff will stay with us forever. This is a special hotel run by some of the nicest people we've ever met.    HINTS  - Join http://www.slh.com/ to enjoy a room upgrade and other benefits.  - Relax as Marrakesh is safe and the people so very friendly  - Let the staff suggest excursions and book their private cars/drivers
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: This is only a restaurant review: Simply one of the best in the city!
Review_Text: This hotel and restaurant is hidden in the Kasbah of Marrakech. Do not be shocked or afraid of the street! It is completely different to the western world. The easiest way to reach it is to have a driver. Upon arrival you will get guided into the hotel (Riad Dar). Well the welcome was not like expected. One lady was looking into her computer and her colleague was looking a little bit unfriendly at us and it needed 5 minutes to get guided to our table located inside and you already will feel like in a dream of 1001 night. The table was directly at the pool inside ! perfect. This is adventoures and romantic as well for having a dinner. For starters we have ordered lobster with ravioli which was good. Then as a main course we have ordered monkfish. What a pity it came too dry and seemed to be frozen. The bottle of white wine was too warm. After the dessert we have got a questionaire. I have answered it at once and then happens what is very seldom. The manager came and talked to us. He has cancelled that amount for the maincourse. And then his boss was intoduced to us. We were very impressed by this honest interest in guests and their impression. As a result we have returned next day for lunch. Then you will sit outside on the terrace. We have ordered Hamburgers with french fried and Club Sandwich and a bottle of white wine. The wine was served too warm and the Club Sandwich was poor. The french fried were still swimming in oil. The service was perfect like always and because of our complaints we did not need to pay the wine and Club sandwich. After that we got introduced to the lady from the reception and she said sorry that she has not paid enough attention at our arrival. Then we have got shown the Riads (5 Riads in one) which was impressive. But the main result of our visits is that nobody will or need to leave this hotel or especially restaurants who is not really satisfied. But like in general you should inform the staff or management about it. We will return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: catherine b wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: We spent five nights at the Sultana over New Year. The hotel and our room were beautiful Moroccan style with wonderful antique furniture and textiles. The staff were so friendly and helpful and made us feel very welcome. We utilized the fantastic spa and enjoyed the relaxing hammam and massages. Therapists and the spa manager were very professional and made us forget the hectic outside world for a little while. The restaurant serves delicious authentic Moroccan food or contemporary food with french influences. Sitting around the large pool with soft background live music made for a romantic ambiance. The Highlight was New Year's Eve! We first enjoyed some gourmet amuse bouches and champagne on the top floor listening to a local Moroccan band. A superb dinner was served in the open air restaurant with more entertainment from a local singer and a belly dancer. It was a truly unforgettable night with guests dancing between the tables and around the pool. We can't wait to go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our group of six were ensconced in the three different riads which comprise the La Sultana. Each riad has it's own mystique. From Mohammed at the reception who painstakingly advised us on booking excursions and dinner reservations to the staff at breakfast the La Sultana team were perfect hosts.  Our teens enjoyed the pool while the open sitting areas gave us a feel of space. Every night the fireplace in the Scharezade riad was lit casting a warm glow. The perfume of fresh roses enchanted us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My wife booked this as a suprise break for my birthday we stayed for 4 nights it was lovely excellent location just what you would expect from a traditional romantic luxuary hotel. Very interesting architecture and lovely rooms and decor we stayed in a suite.    The staff were excellent and service very good at meals. We decided to stay on half board after looking at the choice of menu and also not wanting to stumble our way across Marrakech getting a bit lost after a few drinks. This was a good choice the food was excellent and we have very high standards and regularly eat at Michelin restaurants the setting around the pool was lovely. One thing on the Morroccan food it can be very sweet so suggest you balance it with Western. But you have all the choice here.    Lastly we were blessed with wonderful weather and my wife sunbathed on the roof in her Bikini on the last morning and you can see fantastic views over the mountains and look down over the market below.    Overall exquisite!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jm I wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: We have spent a week End of Nov at the super Riad La Sultana. We enjoyed the spotless premisses and the very helpful staff. The bedroom was charming. The courtyard of our Riad (there are 5 Riads total cleverly merged in this hotel) was one of the smallest but the fresh rose buds in the center basin made it a fine almost-private corner. The furniture has been thoroughly chosen in antiques and ethnic styles so that it matches graciously the proportion and history of the buildings in all places of the Hotel. The extremely clean hammam and massage place is run by skilled and trained people. The conceiled equipment equipement for these steam/ bath premissess filtering and cleaning must be brutally efficient as no trace of anything unclean shows anywhwere. Pink marble pillars and all-around bath construction and warm waters can be enjoyed as one of Marrakech's favorite and a worldwide reference. The restaurant is very good and the price is OK. The solo singer with its oud arbi guitar under the the arch of the restaurant and large swimming pool Riad beneficiates from the excellent acoustics and can be heared as he speaks or sings softly during the evening meal. The place is unbeatable. And the merged terraces with view on the surrounding streets the stork nests on the next city ancient gate pillars are the perfect place for a delicious sunbath..or Spa. The staff and management serve you and this hotel clockwork with much skill and dedication. A pleasure all around. JMI
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: All you need on a holiday, impeccable service
Review_Text: This is a hotel that makes your visit more than worthwile to Marrakech. Not only is the service impeccable but the food is of the best we ate here. We will come back here more for the hotel than for the city. And Marrakech is already nice. The hotel accepts American Express which can not be said of all etablishments in this city.

Had the pleasure of staying at La Sultana for one week in November and really found it difficult to leave at the end.    My job requires me to travel the world a lot and stay in many hotels - most of them 5 star - so my bench mark is set quite high.  I've also stayed in other 5 star hotels in Marrakech over the past 3 years and for me none of them even come close to how amazing La Sultana is.    The hotel itself is stunning - you need a week just to explore all of its corridors and hidden nooks and crannies - all individually furnished complete with their own stories from history. The rooftop provides some extraordinary views of the atlas mountains and is a great place to watch the sunset with a glass of bubbly (or tea).    The rooms are beautiful all individual in design and extremely spacious with all of the mod cons you expect of a 5 star hotel - wifi plush towels quality linen and cloud like pillows plus they also come with a complimentary mini bar so you always have some cold drinks and water handy (replenished daily).    The food is divine - breakfast served around the pool in a gorgeous setting - a good selection of pastries and also a cooked to order menu to chose from - best Pain au chocolat I've ever had.    The staff are some of the friendliest and most competent hotel staff I've ever come across. Everybody knows your name. They ALWAYS greet you with a smile even if they've already seen you 5 times that day. They ask about your day with genuine interest. Nothing is too hard or too much or impossible. They are all Immaculately presented they look like they love working here so in turn you love being here. They go above and beyond at every request and in my opinion are what sets this hotel apart from the rest. There are too many to name individually as I wouldn't leave a single one out.    The hammam is one of the most beautiful I've seen - you could easily spend an afternoon unwinding and pampering yourself.    Location - you can't beat it. 10 minute walk to Jemaa el fna and surrounded by little streets with cafes and shops selling all sorts of delicacies.    Can't wait to be back there again next year - easily in my top 10 hotel experiences of all time - Shokran!

Review_Date: Victoria E wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: I was very happy to spend few days in this magic beautiful hotel...: Very nice environment pleasant atmosphere very attentively staff. For sure I'll recommend this hotel to my friends.  So grateful for my wonderful vacations!    Victoria Edward.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo
Reviewer_Location: Saint Petersburg, Saint Petersburg City, Russia

Review_Date: Anna A wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: After a 15min drive from the airport we arrived in the very lively old town of Marrakesh. But then a small and narrow path brings you in less than 1 min to this exceptional beautiful Riad hotel which is an oasis of tranquility. We travelled with our 20months old son and he was straight away the little prince and Habibi of all the very friendly staff. Reception and room service was very good. The restaurant served delicious meals and the spa offers many relaxing massages and a great real Marrocon Hammam. The idea of having one hotel consisting of 5 Riads was an awesome experience and we were fascinated by the warm atmosphere and attention to detail throughout the hotel. We can only recommend this beautiful hotel!!

Review_Title: OMG just book a meal here, you only live once!
Review_Text: Let me clarify first i did not stay in the hotel  just went for dinner. Amazing dinner and amazing setting! don't miss the chocolate ravioli dessert the setting is unreal quiet and atmospheric with oud player in the background  so soothing and such amazing architecture. Do not begrudge a penny spent on this meal (or staying at the hotel) because the chances of you eating in a place like this back home are remote. After the meal I asked to tour the hotel (didnt see the rooms) so waiters took us to tour around and yes i will be staying here next time im in marrakech because it has the finest architecture I've seen in the city. Location is paramount bang in the middle of the kasbah. Service was also very very good and attentive. You just have to do this place when you are in Marrakech ...couldnt fault a thing
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stuart K wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: Last night here and terribly sad to leave. This hotel epitomises what a 5 star hotel experience should be. I could list many examples... The hotel's staff all the staff are a delight friendly courteous and informative. Always being greeted as Mr Kaye ie never forgetting who I am by all the many staff is a touch of class I love. The thing that will stick in my mind (and the stay is not even over yet) is that one morning at breakfast I put my book on the floor. Immediately out of nowhere a baby chair was presented and the book placed on it. That is not just attention to detail but attention to me and one cannot put a price on that. My only complaint is that they do not have a branch in London. This hotel is an oasis and sanctuary from the world outside. Life is too short not to experience this hotel at least once.

Review_Date: ale v wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: we loved our holiday at la sultana staff was absolutely amazing and my kids enjoyed every minutes.  The Spa is over the top and the food is excellent.  We have asked for a guide and the provide us a very expert guide who was very able to involve our children in the tour with different stories.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A little paradise in the madness of Marrakech
Review_Text: We have just got back from a long weekend in marrakech at La Sultana and enjoyed the most magical and romantic stay despite the rain. My boyfriend and I travel quite a lot and we have both said that this hotel stands out for us and we can't wait to go back. The hotel and rooms are stunning the staff fabulous the spa treatments a god send and the tasting menu was delicious. We spent hours wondering around trying to take it all in. Highly recommend to everyone!    Note to hotel: now the weather is much cooler it would of been nicer for the water in the spa to be hotter. But that is my only tiny little criticism - the hotels absolutely wonderful.    Miss Sophie Hurford
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: mike s wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: I wrote a review in August when I spent time at La Sultana with my family and had a wonderful experience. I visited again in October and the impression remained the same. This time we stayed in a less expensive room but the experience and service was truly outstanding. I would advise guess who book suits try to get one with a terrace or courtyard as this truly opens up the space and improves the experience. I did notice this time that some of the regular rooms were not in ideal locations for example next to the swimming pool and quite public but the suits offer total privacy. Given that it is now winter the upper terrace is seldom open for meals so the dining experience is more limited being by the swimming pool. The views of Marrakech are obviously not part of the dining experience in winter but the pool area is a nice place to dine. Overnight there are plastic covers placed over the Riad open roof areas to protect against rain and this takes away part of the experience but this is just for limited winter months and the covers are removed during the day.  It is worth taking the hotel offered transfer from the Airport to the hotel as Marrakech can be somewhat chaotic. The transfer to the hotel is however quite short.  Overall the hotel is in a league of its own for service and care and we will most definitely return for a third time. Pricy it is but value for money and does give the visitor a safe and luxurious way of experiencing Riad living unique to this part of the world.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Razman Razali wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: La Sultana is (somewhat) an oasis of calm right in the middle of the madness that is Marrakech.    Situated off a small alley the hotel is right in the middle of the medina within the hustle & bustle and just minutes walk away from Jemaa el-Fna ie the main square in old Marrakech.    We stayed in the Jaguar Room (Junior Suite) and it was Moroccan decadence at its best. A little over the top for this reviewer's taste the lavish gold plated everything in the bathroom felt like Tony Montana's personal holiday home but with a tiny shower and tinier separate lavatory. The bedroom & living areas was quite dark with a pretty uncomfortable hard bed.    The lady we initially talked to about improving the room conditions was less than accommodating but after a strong word or 2 with the front desk an extra mattress was provided to make the bed more comfortable and also a pair of bedside lamps. I must note here that Khaled & Hassan were excellent hosts (which cannot be said about the others on duty).    The Spa at the Sultana must have been the worst I have experienced. It really was a chronic waste of time and money.    But having said all that the city does have a magical albeit slightly crazy vibe to it. And i guess La Sultana captures that essence perfectly. It could have been a truly outstanding hotel but sadly falls a bit short. Especially considering the prices.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Heather S wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Had one of my best meals in Marrakech thus far at the La Sultana. Beautiful presentation delightful waitstaff incredible atmosphere. Raves all around. Would highly recommend. Set around their courtyard pool with a live musician - couldn't have asked for more!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Yves M wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Excellent and very kind hospitality and impeccable service !  We needed services for a baby and the staff was attentive : baby milk doctor medicine ...  Very good recommendations for restaurants and tours to do.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Tahir A wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: I arranged a birthday treat for my wife here.. it has to be one of the most beautiful restaurats I have ever eater. The food and service is second to none and the atmosphere is simply like a dream.. can't recommend it enough. Just go.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Honestly if you are into experiencing the different Riads of Morocco this place is pretty mind blowing. It is four Riad/Dars that are connected each one having a different motif for example one is pretty much all carved plaster. The space is really incredible and whether it's to have a drink hammam dinner or sleep you are on the right track.    My partner and I did hammam with a clay wrap here. The hammam space is also beautiful the hammam itself was okay but it was worth it for the moderate price and experience. We couldn't get a good reference on a local hammam and this seemed to be on par with the other hammam experiences in its price range. Afterwards we decided to have a drink and then decided to have dinner. Luckily they were able to squeeze us in but I'm sure you'd want to make a reservation if possible. During dinner there was a terrific live musician playing acoustic guitar this isn't something I normally care about but the musician was actually great as was our meal - one of our best dinners in Morocco (we did the multi-course Moroccan prix fixe).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I don't usually make reviews but this place was special. We were told by the staff that this used to be a Saadian Sultan's Kasbah (big house) now a riad/hotel with a restaurant. We came here for dinner. Couldn't have asked for anything more romantic for me and my husband's anniversary! Perfect setting! We got dropped off by a taxi a gentleman was waiting for us outside walked us through a dimly-lit short alley with a red carpet towards the entrance. I was thinking of the movie Aladdin the whole time because I truly felt like (as corny as it sounds) it was "a whole new world". They took us to the rooftop for cocktails overlooking one of the mosques. The Saadian sultan's tomb is right behind it - the place is full of history. Then we had dinner downstairs by the pool. It was amazing. Food was excellent - big portion for a fine dining restaurant but didn't cut back on the ingredients. Service was 5-star. They had a gentleman playing a traditional moroccan guitar live; ambiance was wonderful. If you're looking to have a special evening that you'll remember for the rest of your life this is the place to go!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed in La Sultana in Marrakech for 4 nights from the 1st November 2014 for our Honeymoon. The hotel is in great location within 10 minutes slow walking distance of the Jamma El Fna Square and the Souks. The hotel itself is magnificent. Our room was very clean the oversized bed was very comfortable and we couldn't hear any other residents once in the room with the door closed. The staff were fantastic and were always on hand no matter what time of the day to attend to you. The food was of exceptional quality - so much so we didn't eat anywhere else during our stay. We relaxed by the pool which was very peaceful. The spa and the treatments were of the highest standard. We had an amazing time and would not hesitate to visit La Sultana again in the future. Highly recommended and thanks to all the staff at the hotel for making our stay so very special well done. Mr & Mrs Russo
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect location to find peace after the organised chaos of Marrakech
Review_Text: A wonderful hotel that is quietly luxurious and thoughtful  In every aspect of its design. We arrived at night and were welcomed to reception down a small candle lit alleyway - beautiful! Reception staff are forever helpful courteous and desperate to please guiding us with restaurant recommendations and prices for tourist attractions ( they even negotiated the cost of our horse and cart tour of the city wall; we'd have paid double the price had we done it ourselves) our room was clean beautiful in its design and extremely comfortable. The pool is deliciously warm and forever peaceful and staff are more than happy To bring drinks and extra towels should you need them. The terrace restaurant is wonderful - particularly at lunchtime and as for the breakfast fresh fruit copious amounts of freshly squeezed juices and home baked bread are on offer at the buffet table. I can't eecommend this Hotel highly enough. A truly memorable experience.

Review_Title: Great food, atmosphere and overall experience
Review_Text: We did not stay at La Sultana but dined there for valentines day the food and service was great staff were very attentive to all our needs.    The hotel itself is set on beautiful grounds in the centre of the Medina and is beautifully decorated.    Spaces at the restaurant are very limited so would advise you book in advanced.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Diana Wonderlust wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: Such a beautiful and luxury hotel! Historic building with an amazing interiour! Staff is extremely helpful and nice!  The spa and the pool is beautiful and the rooftop terrace as well!  Rooms are nice clean and well renovated.  Perfect for a romantic getaway in the old part of the Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: If you are looking for a haven of luxury serenity and exemplary service in the centre of all the action of Marrakech then look no further than La Sultana. If you are looking for 5 star service in an authentic and luxurious riad setting then this is your place. The decor is magnificent with unique beauty through every doorway and courtyard. The rooftop restaurant was excellent and had a wonderful view of the Royal tombs below the small square and of the mosque. The hammam was an opulent and gorgeous experience. All the staff and especially Hassan & Saida at the front desk could not have been more helpful friendly and accommodating in every way. I highly reccommend this hotel for convenience to the sights of Marrakech luxury and 5 star service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Stayed at La Sultana for a week break with the family. A truely amazing hotel located on a road that belies the quality of the building when we first arrived by taxi we had a short walk to the hotel and I confess that the street had me worried! But once you turn into the alley where the hotel is all doubts are gone it is beautiful! Staff were very welcoming offering us tea and treats upon arrival. We stayed in the Lion suite all I can say is wow! We ate many times at their rooftop restaurant taster menu both Moroccan and European are excellent. wife and daughter tried out the cookery lesson and thoroughly enjoyed it. If I had to describe our experience in a word it would be "superb" can't wait to come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jan W wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: La Sultana is pure luxury a very friendy happy place to return to at the end of a busy day drinks at the rooftop bar and maybe dinner later if you are not going out to eat (hotel restaurant very good ) we used the hotel car most evenings which again was sheer luxury. We had a amazing time staying at La Sultana and in Marrakech...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We returned to La Sultana Marrakech following our first visit in March this year. This time it was coupled with a stay in Oualidia - see separate review.  My last review "Peace and Tranquility" tells you everything you need to know about this wonderful Riad and all of its attentive and friendly staff. Go there to be treated with professional individual attention. The staff cannot do enough to ensure your stay is both pleasant and memorable. They want you to come back and that is so easy to do!  Special mention this time must go to Saida and Xavier who took ownership of our bad experience in La Sultana Oualidia and ensured we left Morocco relaxed and elated. Our grateful thanks to you both and good wishes always.  Anyone reading this please go to La Sultana once in your life to be overawed by the opulence variety of room decor unusual furniture in the 5 individually themed Riads and finally the wonderful restaurant and spa. Highly recommended is the Royal Hamman and followed by the Sultana Relaxing massage.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed at La Sultana while in Morocco to see Essaouira and Marrakech...wonderful place to come back to at the end of each day to relax and unwind.    Excellent service helpful staff and beautiful property in the Medina.    http://leighmiller.zenfolio.com/blog/2014/9/photo-essay-marrakech-morocco
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A real oasis in the craziness of Marrakech!
Review_Text: Stayed here for 5 nights in September 2014. We had a prestige room and it was absolutely gorgeous big room with a beautiful bathroom with a bath and separate shower. The bath was set into the wall and looked like a shell. Plenty of room for more than 1 person in it. We dined in the rooftop terrace and the food was very good. Lovely views from there over the surrounding buildings. We had a massage in the spa which again was very good a nice jacuzzi pool down in the spa area.  The pool in the hotel was in a courtyard and was really lovely and tranquil. Drinks were served around the pool and they always brought little snacks too. The staff were very good spoke good English and were happy to help. Once inside the hotel you felt a million miles from all the noise and bustle of Marrakech loved this place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A welcome oasis of calm and cool luxury
Review_Text: We stayed at La Sultana for 5 days in September following on from 10 days spent at the coast. This is a delightful hotel with outstanding service. In all areas - cleaning meals helpfulness comfort atmosphere location - this hotel excels. We stayed in junior suite deluxe (Girafe) that featured a small balcony overlooking the pool a huge heart-shaped bath in a large bathroom with the normal huge bed chairs desk etc. etc. We ate twice at the rooftop restaurant and found the food wine and service exceptionally good. All this comes at a price but we feel it was well worth it. If you are making a special trip or can afford this luxury anyway this is a very good hotel for your visit to Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A great place to spend my birthday
Review_Text: My husband and I spent 2 nights at La Sultana at Marrakech at the end of August. It was great to experience such luxury after several nights out in the desert areas. It is such a beautiful hotel with four different types of decor to reflect the area's history. We felt like we were in an art gallery at times. I celebrated my birthday at the restaurant on the rooftop terrace and it was a wonderful evening. All the staff in all areas were excellent and couldn't do enough to assist us especially when the air conditioning failed in our room. They quickly moved us to an even better room. The swimming pool in a beautiful courtyard was a welcome haven after experiencing the heat of sightseeing. We thoroughly recommend this hotel. Elizabeth Foster
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ramon C wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Title: If your budget allows, this is the Riad have to choose.
Review_Text: Since my last visit they have improved greatly in the small details that make a stay be special.    The location is perfect the pool area is still a peaceful place to cool off after a day of hiking.    The terrace invites few minutes to relax with a tea or a cocktail.    It is without doubt the reference Riad within the Medina.    I shall return !!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This place is amazing. You can leave the dusty alleyways of this demanding city and dive into the calm of an spectacular hotel. The rooms are moorish & decadent the service impeccable and the rooftop a smug reminder of how the other half live. When you are here - you are the other half. Incredible
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Paul D wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: We stayed at the La Sultana for 4 nights at the start of our holiday in Marrakech a 5 star hotel which is actually a group of Riads. From the moment we were greated by the porters in their splendid livery we were transported from the hussle and bussle of the Medina and swept into a hidden paradise which was certainly full of charm and character. The check-in was very informal and relaxing sipping Mint Tea (the first of many) and eating Morrocan pastries while sitting in the courtyard surrounded by fine art plants and a cooling fountain.  We had booked 2 x Prestige Deluxe rooms and were very pleasantly surprised to find we had been upgraded to Junior Suites. My wife and I were in the Camel Suite whilst our daughters were in the Giraffe Suite. Both suites were very well appointed and spacious the bathrooms were tremendous with huge sunken baths as well as showers. Each room had a number of welcome gifts including Wine a Tagine and various fruits and pastries.  The hotel itself was extremely quite and peaceful the facilities were excellent. The pool was great for a morning dip and the roof-top restaurant was ideal for breakfast. The breakfast itself was very nice some may find the choice a little limited though the quality was exceptional (as was everything at La Sultana).  We spent most of our days in and around the Medina the Souks and the Square (more on that in a separate review).  When returning mid-afternoon after the heat of the Morrocan sun we found out perfectly air-conditioned rooms provided an immediate relief. We would then spend most late afternoons at the roof-top bar sitting under the Pergola sipping cold drinks whilst reading a good book. All the time we were being cooled by water vapour which was raining down from above - very refreshing and much needed in the Marrakech heat.  In the evenings the food and the ambience was wonderful. Service was tremendous lots of little surprises and treats and the food was wonderful. The menu may appear expensive at first glance however the chef will create bespoke dishes for you and all were reasonably priced. This was great for as all 4 of us are vegetarian and we had a great choice as a result of the chefs flexibility. I would certainly recommend the mushroom lasagne as this was the best lasagne i have ever tasted.  Finally i would just say that the service we received was the best we have ever experienced. The front desk staff were always courteous and helpful the room staff were efficicient and kept our rooms wonderfully fresh and clean. and the bar and restuarant staff were extremely accomodating.  I would certainly recommend to anyone that they should stay at the La Sultana as it is without doubt one of the most romantic and authentic small hotels you will ever find.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: mike s wrote a review Aug 2014
Review_Text: Wonderful Riad hotel excellent location excellent service and very caring staff. My fourth trip to Marrakech and this was by far the best experience. We were given a room upgrade on arrival and things just got better all the time. I would recommend to anybody as the place to stay in this special city    Mike Saunders
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: mary t wrote a review Aug 2014
Review_Text: Not knowing what to expect when the taxi dropped us off but when a porter arrived from just around the corner with the gold coloured luggage trolley and wearing an immaculate attractive uniform we began to realise this hotel might be a bit special. We were not wrong. Reception greeted us with smiles and friendliness and took us to our Riads with the lovely surprise of an upgrade to a junior suite with complimentary mint tea and pastries. The facilities of this hotel are second to none and the attentiveness  politeness  helpfulness and amiability of the staff can't be praised highly enough. Food is delicious served on the roof terrace for breakfast and dinner or by the pool for lunch. All this in complete contrast to the outside which is fascinating to look down upon from the hotel roof. A much appreciated oasis of comfort and luxury
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is such an amazing hotel. At first when I booked I thought that it would be just like any other local charming hotel around in Marrakech since it was a "Riyadh". Well I was not wrong but then all our expectations have been exceeded. It's not too small but not big either. The hotel has a number of swimming pools around including a jacuzzi and a little one on the roof. The breakfast area on the roof is amazing where they also prepare Barbar Omelet. The location is also very good as it's not too busy and the famous "Jame'a Al Fana" is about 10 minutes walk. Theere a nice coffee shop close to the hotel which I also recommend and some other little shops around. The neighbourhood is very friendly. What else can anyone ask for. Ms. Speed at the reception was very helpful since the day we checked in till when we left the hotel. I highly recommend this property for couples and families too. Might also be good for solo travellers.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Daina B wrote a review Aug 2014
Review_Text: We spent six nights at the Sultana Hotel in Marrakech and can only say that it was an almost flawless experience... right from beginning to end. The hotel itself is in a perfect location in the old part of the city right on a very bustling street but as a guest you don't notice much of the fuss because upon entering La Sultana you are overtaken by a feeling of tranquility. Sitting in the bar/restaurant of the hotel which is on the roof you have a picturesque view of the near-by mosque the storks the date trees... The hotel has absolutely lovely interiors - air-conditioning (very useful!) a beautiful pool a spa section fresh flowers delivered and placed all around every morning... But the very best thing about La Sultana is the staff - right from the flower deliverer to the porters to the driver to the cleaners to the chef to the waiters to the reception staff... A never-ending flow of always smiling always helpful always interested people who seem to be there right when you need them or even before you know that you need them. I can only think of two things that could have been a bit better - one is the lighting in the room which was a bit too dim (there are no windows towards the street in the rooms) and the second is that I got the impression that some members of the staff did not know English very well which is a bit frustrating for those of us who don't speak French or the local lingo but would like to respond to the friendly staff in a like-wise friendly manner. It's a bit sad when they don't understand your jokes.... Oh and one evening I was served an incredibly sour Mai Tai cocktail on the roof terrace - better order a Casablanca beer or some Maroccan wine instead! If you are looking for a "one-of-a-kind" hotel experience in Marrakech I can't imagine anything more appropriate than La Sultana.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Malcolm M wrote a review Aug 2014
Review_Title: Haven of tranquility in a city of chaos
Review_Text: Booked this off the internet from the strength of the pictures and website.    Was slightly worried when we got dropped off right next to a small market stall in the middle of the old town but then spied the valet and found the hotel. For check in they took us straight to the roof terrace serving us mint tea and pastries. This gave us a tour of a huge building that has been refurbished to a stupidly high standard and is even more beautiful than the photos suggest.    The room itself was called Gazelle and was full of characterful touches and was about as luxurious as we could have wanted. The fully marble bathroom was breathtaking.    The service in the hotel was top class and always felt that they were providing a service first and trying to make money second - a huge relief in a city where you feel that you are seen as a walking wallet.    The holiday we had was then made by this hotel - being able to wander into town and explore the area but then return to the pool when it got too hot was the key.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: One word: Amazing! not sure there is anything else to say here.    The staff always went above and beyond to make sure everything is "as you wish" from planning trips to arranging dinners to as something as simple as making conversation to find out about your days can't wait to visit them again.    The rooms and hotel itself feel like you are staying in some Arabian dream. The location is perfect inside the medina and close to the central square but once you turn on the street it is actually quite peaceful. The roof top terrace is so tranquil and peaceful we actually had to force ourselves not to go there every night ... food is also great and I would definitely recommend the restaurant and to get breakfast included in your stay.    Also of special note is the art furniture and pool ... WOW!    Can't wait to visit La Sultana again soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Luxury riad in heart of medina
Review_Text: We have only been here two days but this place is magical. The 15 yr old and 12 yr old would have preferred a bland American hotel but for us adults this is something quite different and special . We came with Virgin hip hotels and stayed in the Lion apartment. Mint tea and pastries and cold towels on arrival . Complimentary tagine and bottle of champagne in our room along with another tray of pastries. We ate in the rooftop restaurant on our first night and the service and food were impeccable. We had the tasting menu for approx Â£46 each and it was London dining standard which was a wonderful surprise. Tonight we are trying the international tasting menu and it is just as good. The local wine well priced and actually much better than anticipated. The levels of service at this hotel are excellent and you feel they really do care and know your name( benefit of a riad as opposed to large hotel) the apartment was very unique and we had a wonderful marble jacuzzi in our room.
