My only minor complaint would be re the water pressure in the shower but this is a small point and something that many hotels suffer around the world. The pool was a welcome relief and felt chilled. Staff here really care especially the manager and the concierge. I would come back here again minus unappreciative children as this road is very well located. Do not miss the rooftop dining experience. Yet to try the spa but may add to my review later.

Review_Date: Glenn H wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: When I think of Morocco I think of tale of adventures like Arabian Nights Aladdin and his Lamp Ali Baba and the 40 thieves. These stories center on a hero and his adventures in the markets of Marrakech saving the damsel in distress or searching for hidden treasure. I found such a treasure in the heart the medina of Marrakech in La Sultana a grand dame of Marrakechâ€™s riads.    My adventure began with my entrance into the Medina which is a UNESCO World Heritage site with a thousand years of history and an amazing true open-air. It is a bustling market even at night as I passed through the winding streets of vendors selling their wares. A sense of adventure quickly sets in as I enter the long corridor with Moroccan lamps along the carpeted walkway leading to La Sultana Marrakech. It is a grand and fitting entrance.  The doorman gives me a friendly greeting welcoming me to La Sultana. It is a bit late when I arrive but the staff has been waiting and provides me with attentive and personalized service making me feel welcomed.    La Sultana is actually comprised of five connecting buildings and has 28 unique and special accommodations from rooms to grand suites to accommodate a family. The five buildings are riads which are traditional Moroccan houses with a central patio and all the windows overlooking the interior rather than the outdoors as in European houses.    The tile wood and metal work in each building are nothing less than functional pieces of art with every inch of this property being a celebration of Moroccan craftsmanship. Each of the five buildings is different so there is a new level of amazement as you explore and enter each building and room.    The buildings are designed with Moorish or Andalusian architectural influences with high vaulted ceilings. The spaces are decorated with precious woods marble and copper and littered with paintings and objets dâ€™arts.    I was in the Pelican suite on the first floor which opened into a beautiful courtyard. I felt that I was staying in someoneâ€™s home and not a hotel. Inside my room was absolutely remarkable. It was blue with vaulted ceiling and Moroccan details. What I love about Morocco is the artistic craftsmanship and detail that you find here is like nowhere else in the world. The bed was on an elevated platform and below there was a comfortable sitting area around a fireplace and mantel. The bathroom was elaborate with an artesian shower and deep sunken bath.    Every corner was tastefully decorated with design surprises such as the stained glass window that opened into the courtyard. All of the modern conveniences of a five star hotel were there from the flat screen TV complimentary high speed internet and complimentary soft drinks. After my long trip I was pleased to be greeted with the snack tray and a selection of fruits.    My favorite feature at the property was the rooftop terrace which connects the five roofs of the building into a massive outdoor space with spectacular views of the snow capped Atlas Mountains the vibrant markets below as well as the nearby Royal Palace Koutoubia Mosque and other landmarks. There were large palms and orange trees an outdoor bar and restaurant and trellised patios with places to sit or sunbathe.    Indoors there is a beautiful pool in a garden of palm trees bougainvillea bushes and large art pieces surrounded by red brick walls and an arched walkway. It is the place for breakfast where a friendly and attentive staff brings you fresh croissants fruits and juices to start your day. The dining experience is as perfect as the lodging and combines Moroccan and Mediterranean cuisine in are fined ambience. The restaurant of La Sultana offers a traditional Moroccan cuisine to reflect the flavors of the season with the Tasting Menu the Traditional Lamb Couscous with Seven Vegetables. Dinner is served either in the cozy atmosphere of the patio in the winter or on the rooftop overlooking the vibrant city and the Atlas mountains in the summer. A favorite experience for guests is that La Sultana delivers the secrets of popular Moroccan cuisine with daily cooking classes.    The spa at La Sultana evokes the sensuous world of the harem with ancient doors opening onto an interior of crimson marble illuminated by wrought-iron lanterns with a vaulted ceiling suspended on pillars rising up from a turquoise pool. The Sultana Spa offers two superb hammams a Jacuzzi sauna beauty centre hairdresser balneotherapy baths massage cabins in the open air. It is in the heart of the Sultana the hammam serves as a temple of body relaxation and spirit massage.    My adventure from this sanctuary called La Sultana lead me to explore the Medina just beyond the entrance. In the souk youâ€™ll find a fascinating array of handicrafts from rugs and spices to hammered copper and brass goods and colorful fabrics. You can also take a horse drawn carriage to take in the sights.    La Sultana is in the district Quarter of the Imperial Kasbah which was a citadel and has been continuously occupied by the Sultans of Morocco since the twelfth century. Consequently this area focuses within the vicinity of the splendid palaces and magnificent monuments built by the Sultans. The Bab Agnaou is the most beautiful and impressive of the gates in the entire city ramparts; it was constructed in the twelfth century using local stone as the ceremonial entrance of the Sultans into the Kasbah. The gardens and pavilions of the Royal Palace dominate the view to the East from roof terraces.    After some touring and exploring I return back to my temporary sanctuary La Sultana for a few more days of rest and rejuvenation. La Sultana is a treasure of the Medina a remarkable and special hotel that will provide you with a not-to-be-missed experience in an exciting location.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Cassie B wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Title: I felt like royalty staying at this Marrakech palace
Review_Text: Staying at La Sultana was an experience of a lifetime. I felt like a Marrakech princess walking down their intricately textured decorated and lighted hallways. I stayed in the camel suite and I can honestly say I've never stayed in a hotel room quite like this before. The bathroom was fit for a king beautiful intricate doors a bathtub with beautiful pillars surrounding it (it was a little small to fit 2) but best of all was the service. Upon checking in we were warmly and graciously welcomed. It was the perfect place to end my trip.

Review_Date: Kathelijne S wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: After taking a little magazine in a store in the new town of Marrakech - Madame a Marrakech - we have read a nice review and decided to have a dinner on the rooftop. The way to the Riad was quite an adventure since it was Ramadan and it was after eight o'clock. The Riad is right behind the mosque so there was quite some crowd in rue de Kasbah.  There was a strong wind this evening the staff inmediately gave us a nice fleece blanket. The dinner was sublime we started off with an amuse bouche and for starters the best pastilla I ever had. After I had a stuffed young hen which not even just looked good it tasted fantastic!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We thank al the stuff at la sultana for the great weekend escape and the great experience at la sultana. It was a great weekend and we will sone come back. Everything was great and all the people in La sultana make our stay to a great experience
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I loved our stay at this fantastic riad which gives you quality 5 star service of any international chain in an authentic moroccan style! The staff make you feel like royalty extremely accomodating and service impeccable! Could not recommend more! Also great location for all the tourist attractions and new town within a short taxi ride.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing stay at an amazing riad
Review_Text: We have just stayed from the 16th - 20th June 2014. If your looking for a perfect riad look no further. Each and every member of staff are truly dedicated to making your stay enjoyable always greeting us with a wonderful smile and booking us some great dinner reservations. Its a beautiful peaceful riad and a perfect oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the medina. At times it felt like our own private residence ! We had dinner in the roof top restaurant and several lunches the food is excellent and the serving staff very knowledgeable . The bedrooms are just gorgeous and the bathrooms are just divine.  We had treatments in the spa not only were the girls amazing the spa is just pure luxury  Nothing was ever too much trouble just a fabulous just a wonderful 4 nights
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful Riad in the heart of the action.
Review_Text: Beautiful rooftop terrace looking over Marrakech. Short and interesting stroll into the medina- but watch out you may see more tourists than locals on the way!  The rooms were traditionally styled which was charming. Staff were helpful and well trained.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I loved our 3 night stay at La Sultana. Much care has gone into developing the collection of Riads. It was a great retreat after wandering the streets alleys and souks of Marrakech. The staff were all very accommodating as is to be expected. We enjoyed the shaded pool area in the court area as opposed to trying to bake on the roof terrace like some pasty Brits chose. In other words there is a great variety of spaces throughout the facilities.    Our only gripe would be at the expense of breakfast. I had forgot that breakfast was not included (as is at most Riads) and when we were leaving we were given the $40 USD bill for some tea and a couple croissants. Had I remembered I would have definitely ordered more food.    Still were we to visit Marrakech again La Sultana would be at the top of the list.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gill W wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: We have just spent a fabulous week at la Sultana.A beautiful building.The staff were charming nothing was too much trouble.Initially We struggled with no natural light in our room although soon adjusted had a fantastic time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband decided to treat me to this fabulous Riad just a few blocks from the Medina. The location is deceiving as you enter a narrow alley with people selling spices on the street and at the end you find a front door were you are invited to check in while enjoying local sweets and mint tea in a beautiful private garden. Our room was excellently appointed and the service was superb. Although if I ever go back I would love to stay at one of the suites. We tried the restaurants and everything was good and beautifully presented. The spa is the best in Marrakech so be sure to try it. We enjoyed the Hamman together and I highly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely place to escape from our busy lives. Renovated to a high standard with beautiful furnishings. If peace privacy and relaxation is what you're after then this hotel ticks all the boxes. Extremely comfortable rooms good showers utterly charming staff who all bothered to know your name and make you feel welcome. Great roof terrace perfect for sunbathers with a stocked bar and cool restaurant for breakfast and lunch. Food is simple and easy in true Moroccan style - recommend the Pigeon Pastilla. The spa was excellent especially the massage - best I've had by far for a very long time - the masseuse knew what she was doing which is quite rare nowadays. The street is on your doorstep with the souk a stones throw away but have to say I couldn't wait to cross the threshold back in to the calm of this delightful Moroccan getaway.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Jerry Y wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: From a chaotic street with no hotel in site up an alleyway and into tranquility and peace. Service perfect surroundings perfect. Difficult to believe that just outside is busy city life and all that goes with it. With only 26 rooms it was never going to feel busy but it really did feel empty. The roof terrace was cleverly used for sun loungers during the day and dinner tables at night. Expensive but not over the top for such a luxurious hotel. Would definitely go again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Beautiful little boutique hotel right out of a dream
Review_Text: Each room is uniquely decorated and designed with riads in the middle. The staff is really helpful and make your stay amazing! The food no matter in the restaurant or on the terrace is excellent and solely Maroccan. Worth the price!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Beautiful oasis in the middle of the medina
Review_Text: This is the second time I have stayed at La Sultana in Marrakech. I must admit that the staff ensure the stay is amazing every time. The rooms are unique and beautiful. The service is exceptional. Since the hotel is smaller and more intimate the service is very personalized. The front desk and concierge provide excellent tips on where to go and how to go around the city. The staff at the restaurant are friendly and helpful. Saida and the entire team at La Sultana always ensure the stay is enjoyable and memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Paul B wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: Excellent welcome in the Sultana restaurant is delicious food at the top and quiet and fantastic area. We spend 4 wonderful days. Riads are really very nice and the personal is discret and always "smily". To summ Sultana is a real top Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Paul S wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Title: tranquility away from the hustle and bustle
Review_Text: If your looking for a riad style smaller hotel but with facilities within the walls/scruffiness of the old city as opposed to the large modern hotels in the newer well laid out part of town then La Sultana meets this requirement though it is expensive. It is has a number of different riad style covered courtyards plus an indoor pool/inside dining area as well as rooftop terrace dining/drinks and soak pool. It also has a spa and a pc lounge. We dined out at other top restaurants in town so cant comment about the food but Saida especially and the front desk staff were excellent and extremely helpful. Housekeeping Staff and kids outside hotel entrance could be a bit noisy in the morning when we were trying to sleep late.  Marrakesh itself  The old city is very busy-we stayed 3 days but felt it could be done in a full single day to get the experience ie souks which are endless sheds of various objects mainly tat and old palaces/religious school all of similar design without any furnishings ie walls/floor/ceilings only but cheap to enter. Remember that the call to prayer occurs at 530am. We had a hot air balloon flight with Marrakesh by air to see sunrise over the atlas mountains and that was excellent though doesn't actually travel much distance.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: LaSultana Marrakech is comprised of a cluster of four beautiful large riads. Its French owners - or someone - looks like they had fun decorating the place with brocade curtains heavy carved wood doors marble floors over-sized silver and pottery tea pots lovely blue and white tiled courtyards. The decor is whimsical; a blend of Morocco meets rococo meets Victorian mansion meets African safari.  But riads seem too small to over-decorate with heavy furniture. I don't get why hotels in Marrakech want to infuse the African theme. For one there are no lion buffalo or giraffe left in Morocco. The African art doesn't seem to work with a decor that seems to strive for sumptuous elegance and so comes off as gimmicky.  The Hammam was incredible (ask for Helen) but the massage so-so.  Food generally good if inconsistent. I thought the European dishes were better than the Moroccan.  LaSultana is meant to be a five-star hotel but the service is two star at best. I paid 500 dirham ($60) for a room service dinner with no wine - the risotto was delicious - but it was delivered on a tray with no drinking glasses. The plastic water bottle with a torn label was lying on its side.  Butter is served in cheap little plastic tubs.  There's a lovely dining area on the roof but in case it's cold and windy there are no other dining areas.  The rooms - three categories. The least expensive is way too small and the most expensive ridiculously large with two rooms a living area you never use. The Queen size room is the best value but they seem booked up early.  My last day I asked reception to arrange a car to take me to Tangiers. The manager beamed and gave me a quote that was $200 over an amount for a similar car I wound up arranging for myself.  The hotel is clean well-tended and tranquility pervades.  The staff was friendly and accommodating. But for me a five star hotel is not just about decor and a smiling staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Zoe T wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Title: Perfect wee diamond in the rough...
Review_Text: This is our 2nd time in Marrakech weve stayed at the 4 seasons which is amazing but we decided to extend our stay and the 4 seasons was full so we found this little gem!  On arrival i was a wee bit thrown by the entrance and a bit apprehensive as its on a random market street with an abundance of mopeds and stalls but..... wow! First impressions are most deceiving...  This lovely wee boutique hotel is so quirky but un a very Moroccan chic way.  The staff are so attentive and lovely our room is very Moroccan a wee bit aladdin esque but very stylish with it.  The food is fabulous but our 1 down fall is the breakfast... if you love croissants bread cheese and eggs lovely but itd be nice to have more options small smudge on the perfect score id give this place.  My high point was when i asked the lovely lady from the spa (who came round as we were sunbathing)  She was an absolute legend and managed to arrange the manicurist to come and do my hands and toes in the sun... amazing service.  Another small detail is that there is a slight lack of pools we've spent most of our time on the lovely flowery tree lined roof but there is only a tiny 4x16(ish) plunge pool.  There is a slightly larger pool downstairs but i cant comment as i never got there.  All in all... a fantastic few days definitely worth checking out if youd like a wee taste of marrakech x

WOW its just amazing! I travelled with 12 girls in october 2013 and we had a wonderful long lunch at the amazing rooftop restaurant looking at the beautiful sunset while drinking champagne. A nice memory! I would LOVE to stay here forever....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We spent three nights at La Sultana in March 2013. The hotel was beautiful spotlessly clean and with a tranquil atmosphere in complete contrast to the hubbub of Marrakech. Each area of the hotel was different but fabulous. We ate breakfast around the courtyard pool and had dinner in the hotel on one evening. The food was excellent and staff were very helpful and attentive at all times. Although the hotel has a roof terrace which is brilliant for outdoor eating and cocktails it wasn't warm enough to sit up there on our visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Very nice hotel inside Medina of Marrakech.  Friendly and helpful Front Desk Management.  Overall good and attentive personal.  The hotel has a nice sundeck and a roof garden restaurant that may be recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: stephen h wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: Just spent 4 nights in La Sultana    A lovely location beautiful Riad and very helpful staff    Room was spacious on a very attractive courtyard    The pool area is tranquil - we would have used it more but it rained! (some things the Hotel cannot guarantee!)    In all a very quiet refuge away from the bustle going on out on the street    Stephen H
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great property let down by service
Review_Text: This is a fantastic property that's ideally situated and furnished to a high standard. It has a roof terrace with bar and restaurant which was a bit cold when we visited but I imagine is fantastic when a little warmer. Our room was clean but with no windows gave the feeling of being a bit claustrophobic.    The staff are friendly and helpful but at breakfast and dinner the service was very poor. There were too many times when there were several staff talking to each instead of clearing plates or taking an order. I'm not keen on over- attentive service but time after time we found ourselves frustrated with trying to get their attention.

Review_Date: Judi R wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: We had the privilege of staying in this magnificent riad for ten days. We wanted to stay in a traditional Moroccan residence in the heart of the real Marrakech and this place certainly didn't disappoint. The architecture is absolutely amazing with something different around every corner - the five riads are all individual in their character and design and utterly charming. The service is second to none and the staff are so friendly and helpful. I must admit when we first arrived we were taken aback by the general atmosphere of the kasbah in the street outside La Sultana. However we soon got used to the general buzz of the place and had a great time exploring. If you want to see the real Marrakech but want to escape to tranquility after a while then La Sultana is the place to stay. We would love to return.  Judi and Stephen Ross-Gower
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The Amazing La Sultana Hotel Marrakech
Review_Text: The hotel is situated in the Medina and within walking distance of all the major sights (except Majorelle and Menera Gardens).  The hotel staff could't be more helpful and friendly and it is small enough for everyone to get to know you but not so small that you may feel awkward as one catering for a very small number of guests.  The decor and furnishings inside of the hotel are quite amazing and unlike anything I have seen in a 5 star hotel. In addition the sun bathing and relaxation area on the roof is a great retreat after a few hours trudging around the Medina and Souks.  Restaurant is very good also.  It is expensive but it does seem more authentic than the box style hotels outside the Medina.  Would definitely recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Wendy F wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: We loved our time at la sultana. All the staff were very attentive and couldn't do enough. We had breakfastlunch and dinner at the hotel and were never disappointed. The spa was a delight and very relaxing. Right in the heart of Marrakech but perfect peace and tranquility once inside. A special thanks to Ghizlaine and Khalid who were extremely helpful and made our stay extra special. Can't wait to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lynne P wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: We wanted to stay in a typically morrocan riad in the centre of everything  La Sultana is in the Kasbah close to all the attractions. The hotel consists  of 5 riads all with different dÃ©cor the riads are a sight to behold every where  is so beautiful & opulent you could spent your entire stay and not leave the  hotel. Our suite consisted of lounge  bedroom bathroom & terrace all of equal  size (huge) there was a lovely courtyard with water feature & your own sun loungers.  The staff are so polite friendly & attentive nothing is too much trouble we stayed for 4  nights & ate in the restaurant every day & night the food & wine were supurb as was the  service. The roof terrace was amazing areas for sun bathing or shaded areas for reading  & chilling out or watching the hub bub going on in the streets below. This was our first  trip to Morroco & we thoroughly enjoyed our experience because we chose to stay  at La Sultana. We would highly recommend this hotel. An oasis of calm & tranquillity.  A big thank you to all the staff for making our stay so wonderful.  Lynne & Nigel Pitt
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a wonderful place to stay! It's not like any other hotel - indeed to call it a hotel demeans it because EVERYONE treats you as though you were a very special guest in their own home. That is hard to find. All staff are so polite and attentive and are happy to talk about anything. So a special mention and thank you to everyone we met particularly in the restaurant reception and spa and also a big thank you to all those behind the scenes whom we did not see but who help to make La Sultana such an out of this world destination.  This was our first visit to Marrakech so that first venture out to the souks and Place Jemaa el Fna was daunting indeed. When it all became too much we knew that we had a retreat to a place of peace and tranquility in La Sultana. It is hard to describe and believe but just 20 paces takes you from the frenetic street activity of the Kasbah to a place of quiet solitude and calm. As soon as you go through the doors of reception the noise heat and dust of the street disappear and you can lose yourself in any number of beautifully decorated alcoves rooms and themed courtyards/riads to relax and reflect. That helped us to appreciate Marrakech to the full as to begin with we were overwhelmed by the street life souks and Jemma el Fna but by the time we had to leave we did not want to go!  We also tried eating out to experience the vitality of the town at night but on the two occasions we did eat in La Sultana we concluded that we wished we had eaten in all the time. Food is superb choice is excellent and ambience wonderful. In fact we did not find a better room setting and atmosphere.  It only leaves us to say that we have no hesitation recommending La Sultana as THE place to stay in Marrakech and we will return ourselves.    Mel & Zalena Robinson
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alison T wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: We had the most fab time at La Sultana Hotel. The staff couldn't have been more helpful while we were there. They gave great recommendations for dining out which they booked for us and organised a guide for us for the souk and for a general tour around the Medina. They organised a trip into the Atlas Mountains and got our taxis for us too. The hotel is well placed for the Main Square which is 10 mins walk away as is the souk just at the back of the square. The Saddian tombs are adjacent to the hotel. Everything else is just a short easy taxi ride away. The roof terrace is lovely to sunbathe or watch the sun go down with a cocktail.  We had the Jaguar suite which was lovely and very well appointed though perhaps a little dark. The 2 balconies it had did help with that though and the bathroom was sumptuous! The complementary 1/2 bottle of champagne and delicious nibbles and fruit left in the room was a lovely touch along with free soft drinks from the mini bar.  The hotel has different styles in the riads which make it up - they are all gorgeous and we loved just wandering around them all. We both used the spa for massage which was what we needed after the souk and indeed seemed very popular with all guests. We dined in 2 nights and the food was delicious. I certainly would recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted Morrocan character lovely food and convenience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Terri S wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: My husband & 1 are global travellers have not been to Morrocco before we were taken back with the ambience and hospitality that we encountered the staff at the sultana were the nicest that I have ever met felt very much at home and very spoiltalmost to the point of embarrassment.  Beautiful hotelclean and full of character.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We cannot rate this hotel highly enough. The staff made our stay so welcoming and relaxing.  The roof top terrace was a delight and the views looking over to the Atlas Mountains were stunning.  We ate every night (three) in the restaurant as the food was so good. As was the ambience we sat in.  My only complaint (slight) was the size of our room. But we had a door onto a fabulous courtyard with seats in it so it gave a feeling of a little more space. But would check on booking exactly how big your room will be.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Julie G wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: Perfect combination of local decor serviceoriented staff and utmost luxury. A truly distinct and unique luxury hotel. The perfect place to relax after sightseeing in the lively city of Marrakesh. Sitting on the rooftop terrace looking at ancient tombs and storks with the Atlas mountains in the background sipping a cool drink is absolutely marvelous.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alfredo K wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Title: One Thousand and One Nights - in the middle of the Arabian Nights
Review_Text: This hotel is in the middle of the Midina of Marrakesh - it's like 1000 and 1 Nights in Arabian (originally it's Berber area). The entranc brings you form the loud and ambrosial steet to a absolute quiet and gentle area - the Hotel La Sultana. And absoltule must for every one!! You will never forget these magic place. They have 5 different Atriums - one more beatuiful than the other - and the rooms are realy nice and generous - what reflect in the price but it's value!!  Ot the roof you have a view in all 4 drections and a nice sun terrace and you can see a stork's nest not far way.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A LITTLE BIT OF HEAVEN AND PEACE IN THE BUSSLE OF THE MEDINA
Review_Text: An upmarket and very romantic Riad. Upon entering for the first time we were taken not to the check in desk but to the roof terrace where we were offered mint tea whilst we completed the registration process. On a short stay of three nights we can only describe our whole stay as delightful. The Sultana consists of three separate Riads (town houses) that have been combined into one. We were double upgraded to a deluxe junior suite with its own balcony overlooking the pool below. Trying to describe the ambiance of the whole place is very difficult best to check out their own web address to see what an amazing place it is.  Just like staying in a Moroccon Palace. It is a short 10 minute walk from the Jemaa el-Fnaa square with all the souks surrounding it and a 10 minute taxi ride to the modernism of the new town. The service was excellent as was the restaurant food.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Amazing stay in a beautiful friendly memorable hotel. Everything was first class and staff was helpful and friendly. It was the most beautiful city hotel we have experienced and very harmonic and relaxing in a busy town like Marrakech. If we return to Marrakech we will come back to La Sultana for sure.    M Stern with family
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Carol C wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Title: A haven of tranquility amist the chaos of Marrakech
Review_Text: A beautiful and peaceful hotel amongst the craziness of Marrakech. I was travelling alone in Marrakech which I found very hard work; lots of unwanted attention and hassle which felt quit threatening a lot of the time.    Le Santana was a real haven to bolt back to at the end of the day. The rooms are amazing and the public areas are tranquil and very authentic. The service was great too with friendly efficient staff who appeared to take pride in what they do. I also visited the spa a number of times which was also a great experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Luke S wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: I never write a review but the service and hospitality of this hotel was like something I've never experienced. The staff can not help and do enough for you. Me and my partner have been treated like a king and queen. The hotel is like a little palace too. So beautiful. I've had 2 spa treatments and a wash and blow dry and my partner told me I look 10 years younger. Lol I've taken 3 bottles of argan oil home!! Amazing stuff. All in all an amazing 4 days. Thank you Sultana
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rachel J wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Title: Perfect for a first time Marrakech visitor
Review_Text: I'll admit I was a bit nervous about visiting Marrakech for the first time but La Sultana made the experience both relaxing and exciting. The beautiful architecture within the hotel was a site itself and the staff made every effort to make the visit memorable and personal. There were a few special touches that I've never experienced before at other four star hotels. I especially enjoyed the welcome tea on the roof the personalized news in the morning and the late night staff ready to serve you cocktails wherever you please in the hotel. They also expertly guided us to dinner and arranged a very special excursion. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for anyone looking to experience all the excitement and beauty of Marrakesh. Cheers.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Dear La Sultana Hotel team!  Thank you very much for incredible 5 days indulgence at your beautiful property in Marrkaesh. My friends and I enjoyed our stay big time: great personalized service great rooms attentive skilled staff members fantastic terrace and efficient concierge suggesting and booking best restaurants in town. Location is perfect too especially if you come for the first time and willing to discover Medina- medieval heart of Marrakesh. Everything you except from a five star boutique hotel - member of Small Luxury Hotels you will find there. The place gives you a feeling of private exotic manor (Vizir's riad) rather then a luxury hotel. Everything is unique and hand crafted. Owners have great sense of beauty and art. Nice paintings and artifacts all over the place.    Spa is very beautiful but therapists should pay bit more attention to details and techniques. Still nice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The Hotel ranks with the best hospitality I have experienced in the world. I am away up to 150 days a year staying at 5 star or boutique establishments and this is no idle compliment. The Hotel has managed to capture the essence of genteel living in Marrakech where the Riad is a haven of peace and tranquility nestled into the frantic buzz of the city outside. Add this to a Company ethic of outstanding service quality together with one of the finest and most tasteful building redevelopments and one has a flawless product.    The level of personal service is a credit to the training and supervision of the hotel management. Staff are obviously proud to work for the hotel and anticipate a guest's needs so nothing is a problem. The standards of cuisine are excellent. The wine list is very good but ask for recommendations from the Moroccan selection which is outstanding.    The Spa is exceptional. Rooms are well appointed and scrupulously clean. The pool area is an "Arabian Nights" dream after dark.    Sipping a 'sundowner' on the roof terrace watching the sunset and the majestic Atlas Mountains as the stars emerge while hearing the faint sounds of the vibrant city somewhere in the world below should be on everyone's list of essential life experiences. Please treat yourself.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Outstanding!!!! Reviewed by Dr. Frank Sarre, Munich, Germany
Review_Text: The La Sultana Marrakech is an outstanding hotel from any point of view. The hotel can be compared to the leading hotels of the world. The atmosphere is very nice and the servants are more than helpful. We enjoyed the stay very much because everything was very relaxing - especially the first day when we had the chance to have tea at the roof of the hotel. For sure we will come back to this outstanding hotel as soon as possible!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lesley Ann W wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: A wonderful hotel in the middle of Marrakech.  There are 28 rooms they have 100 staff to look after everyone they do a good job.  The rooms were all different the food was fabulous the roof terrace was a delight.  It was great. A little bit of paradise in the middle of all the hustle.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Winstone B wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: The pool looked like a Spanish courtyard from the middle ages. Simple setting and design yet lovely. The pool area looks romantic at night. Small rooms but so full of culture and design I liked how they stuck to the conceptualizing every room they had. The breakfast is delicious and the servers were courteous. Their choice of furniture is very interesting. The lounge area is very inviting. I would stay here again when I get back to Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Definitely an excellent hotel to stay in a Moroccan journey! We found this hotel to be superbly designed which allowed us to experience Marrakech in an amazing way. The staff they have was exceptional and very helpful during our stay. It was like living the Arabian dream. As its name it is a place fit for a Sultan.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jana S wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: Hotel is located close to the all places to see and the hotel itself is worth staying longer to enjoy all the amenities they offer. Cuisine was simply perfect pool and the roof terrace also. We enjoyed massage and the typical Moroccan treatment Hammam which was a very interesting experience. Interior of the hotel and its rooms are designed with a cultivated taste staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was upgraded (low season I guess) and we enjoyed a suite Tiger with a fire place and a really beautiful bathroom.  Ideal place for honeymoon or relaxations or when you just need to be sure about a perfect service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Recently stayed for one night in la sultana. Firstly the reception staff and porter were very helpful friendly and professional. The building itself is simply amazing both inside and out. Location is perfect 5-10 minutes walk and your in the main square a taxi to the airport from here was 150drh the roof terrace even overlooks the tombs and gives an amazing (and free) viewpoint. I simply cannot fault the building 5 beautiful riads make up the hotel each with its own style but each as good as the last. Everywhere was spotless the service impeccable and staff spoke fluent English and also understood my poor French!!  The food in the restaurant was very good quality and not overpriced the beef tag one with almonds and sultanas was very nice. There is a huge roof terrace area with plunge pool a swimming pool In one of the road courtyards.  The staff all look very smart in uniforms and their attention to detail was plain to see.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a truly beautiful hotel...four courtyard houses...each one very different...finished to a very high standard.  The room we were given (an upgrade to Panther...low season) was comfortable and well appointed. In the evening (it was cold and rainy in January) a man came with logs and made a very welcoming fire  The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful from the front desk people to the waiters and the driver who picked us up from the airport.  I found the food a little expensive though the evening meal was good but the breakfast could have been better...the cooked breakfasts were not inspiring and there could have been a much better selection of breads and cold foods rather than so many sweet things.  The spa looked lovely but treatments were very expensive.  I would stay here again...no reason to look any further and hope to enjoy the beautiful roof terrace in sunshine next time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I would have liked to given this hotel 5 stars. The service is impeccable and the breakfast is wonderful. The people are just so amazingly nice. But my room was small and very claustrophobic and felt like a cell. This is a riad so the architecture is typical but my room was small and felt like it had no air. Moreover everytime I needed to adjust the air conditioning (absolutely necessary as there was no window in the room) I needed to call reception and they had to send up someone with the remote control - something I have never experienced before. It meant that I was sometimes way too cold or too hot as I did not wish to call someone at 3am.  Perhaps the larger rooms are better but if you are at all claustrophobic don't take a smaller one.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Amazing design, excellent service and location!
Review_Text: This is an amazing "Riad" (hotel with traditional inner court).    The design is to say the least impressive. Once through the gates you will be struck with the "1001 nights" middle eastern atmosphere. It might be extravagant and a little over the top but Marrakech is not the perfect setting for a minimalist isn't it?    The rooftop -that we regretfully couldn't use to full effect because of chilly nights in January- is a class of its own. It is a real blessing to be able to escape the chaos of the Medina and enjoy the views with a nice drink.    Located at a 10-12 minutes walk from the Jama el Fnaa square (on a main street) it might not be as close as other Riads but being a little away from the center is a bonus when getting in and out of the Medina (the old city). In addition I have seen some Riads on dark alleyways and I can guarantee you will want your hotel on a main street accessible by car.    The restaurant located in the main courtyard in the winter looks surreal. Dark candlelights oriental music inner pool etc... You get the idea. Food is very good. Service at the restaurant is ok but not perfect. The music is very nice the first night (an old musician playing a stringed instrument with occasional arabic vocals) but if you dine twice it kind of gets on your nerves. I would suggest removing the amplifier to reduce volume and maybe have different musicians.    Service in the hotel was excellent. The concierge was extremely helpful in organizing every aspect of our trip the drivers we had for airport transfers and day trips were excellent. Everything was perfect.    Highly reccomended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Teofilo M wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: We went twice in our last day in Marrakech. It was a surprise got us the place was very close our Riad. It was a very sophisticated hotel with an amazing restaurant. In the lunch we enjoy the sunshine of Marrakech at the roof terrace we had little food and local beer. All was super and very well served. We asked to our waiter if would be possible to have a reservation for dinner and although they were full she managed to find a table for our dinner. The place was so especial that night the singer song adorable arabic musics during out time there. We had very good food!

We stayed for a few days and had a great time. Dinner was superb as well as the service. Clean and very comfortable place with good location. Beautiful inside a real gem. We agree with all the comments listed and highly recommend this hotel. Would also like to mention a wonderful Mr. Abdelmoula who can can transport you to any place you like in Marrakesh for a very low fee. His taxi is usually stopped just outside of the La Sultana entrance (Mr. Abdelmoula mobile is 06 66 169 181). He is super honest and was driving us around for several days. He is local so can recommend good places to see and indeed showed us some interesting locations. We were really impressed with him so wanted to include him in this review in case someone would like to have an honest and pleasant guide in Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Monira A wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Title: Beautiful, out of this world hotel.
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon and it was one of the most surreal experiences ever and this is coming from a couple that travels a lot. The staff was so sweet and friendly we got an upgrade on arrival the room was beautiful with a beautiful bathroom that had a balcony overlooking the courtyard the food was delicious and the location was to die for.    We went in September and it was really hot so we didn't really enjoy the pool that much (too hot to lay out) but the spa was excellent and you just get this relaxed vibe when you're there. Th bed was a little stiff/hard for us but that's a personal preference and I'm not sure if all the rooms have the same bed/mattress.    This is a must if you're going to Marrakech you won't regret it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: First time to Marrakech. The hotel is situated near the tombs and palace. Very convenient. Great room excellent service and very good knowledgeable and helpful staff.    The restaurant is also very good with a good tasting menu. Wonderful to have a warm pool and the spa is also superb (though there are cheaper ones outside you will find the hotel one a nice experience).    All in all a wonderful stay and will return to stay when next in Marrakech again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gerdy H wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Text: La Sultana Hotel in Marrakech has an excellent location in the Kasbah in Medina. We have 40 years of business and private traveled and stayed in luxury hotels but Hotel La Sultana in Marrakech is the nicest hotel in all facets together. We enjoyed the excellent hospitality service and very friendly staff. The dinner in lovely inside garden was a fairy tale especially with the beautiful Arab live music. We felt at home and a fairy tale of 1001 nights. What a class. What a special Arab atmosphere we would never really go away so we will book soon a new stay at La Sultana in Marrakech.    Everything in Hotel La Sultana is High Quality.    Gerdy Harteveld Alphen aan den Rijn Netherland
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends
Reviewer_Location: Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands

Review_Text: We stayed here for three nights and couldn't have been happier. The decor was fantastic and the roof top terrace truly amazing. The service was exceptional and the staff literally could not do enough for you. Being 'checked in' with mint tea and a cake stand of pastries was a great touch. Would love to go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We chose La Sultana after looking at the reviews on Trip Advisor.    Every single good point that you read in other reviews is correct. It is a wonderful hotel tucked away down a small street it is a seperate world of calm in the middle of the madness and mayhem that makes Marrakech so fantastic.    The hotel is beautiful 5 seperate Riads linked together make it spectacular. The rooms are all decorated in the seperate style of the individual Riad very well equiped and furnished. Sitting on the roof for breakfast was wonderful looking across the Medina and towards the Atlas Mountains in the distance. The staff are great too nothing is too much trouble. From reception to check-out the service is top class.    We ate in the restaurant 1 night it was without doubt the best food we had during our trip so that is recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A sanctuary away from the bustle of the medina
Review_Text: The Sultana offers a sanctuary away from the bustle and madness of the medina. Each of the 5 linked Riads are influenced by different decor and styles. We stayed in Gazelle a sumptuous room all be it one of the smaller more than adequately furnished with every amenity on hand. The staff are friendly cheerful and cannot do enough for you. With a wonderful bright central pool area divine rooftop looking towards the Atlas Mountains and relaxing spa on hand La Sultana is a fabulous boutique property for those looking for a genuine and real Moroccan stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nina A wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: We did a lot of research when planning our trip to Marrakech in Sept of 2012 and La Sultana exceeded all expectations. The property itself is beautiful and secluded. All the rooms are different - we got to experience two of them during two different stays. Although you realize it's a hotel you really feel like you're staying in some pasha's private Kasbah and you are the only guest there.Whether you're having breakfast on the breathtaking rooftop or relaxing by the pool in the shade La Sultana feels magical luxurious relaxing and very organic. The staff are truly fantastic and key to making your stay unforgettable. From the front desk being able to help you with absolutely anything to the spa attendants and waiters in the restaurant everyone is the kindest person you'll ever meet. I called the hotel before our trip and Mohammed helped me plan a trip to the desert that was the most memorable and romantic thing we've ever done. We were alone in a luxury camp in the middle of the Sahara under the stars. It was absolutely magical. Mohammed also helped us book a tour guide to walk around Marrakech and was there to answer any questions make suggestions and make sure we had everything we needed. I cannot wait to go back to marrakech and stay at the Sultana again. I would also love to check out their beach property.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
Reviewer_Location: New York, New York, United States

Review_Date: Chris B wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: From the welcome to the great service an excellent base for exploring Marrakech.  Easy walk to most of the city and very convenient for the square.  The riad design means that the whole place is peaceful in contrast to the streets all around.  Food in restaurant really good - atmosphere a little staid while we were there.  Excellent stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Eve S wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Title: Excellent service at this peacful oasis in a medieval mecca
Review_Text: I had read rave reviews about La Sultana and I am pleased to say that it was all true All the staff were super helpful Ghislane on reception was brilliant. such a beautiful and peaceful hotel a mix of old riads joined together with uniquely designed rooms. I was upgraded to a suite from a junior suite and we were able to extend the room until we left.it felt like we were the only people in the hotel even though it was fairly busy. great terrace with plunge pool. This hotel made our stay in Marrakech and I will be coming back again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Fabulous place to stay and eat.
Review_Text: We were staying at another hotel in Marrakech and someone recommended that we go look and eat at La Sultana what a wonderful place we will go back and this time will stay at this hotel.    The food was easily best we eat during our trip to Morocco and can not be recommended highly enough. The service was spot on and there was a willingness for all the team to show what made this such a special place
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This is a small luxury hotel 28 rooms in what could be an old palace. I learned that a French couple remodeled it to look like an old palace and they did a great job with lots of authentic architectural detail. In my opinion the building was better than the actual palace we did visit.    The hotel is built around 5 courtyards or "riads" each with a different look. Each courtyard is shared by a few of the rooms. The rest of the hotel is decorated well also. The hotel has a small pool which was a must for my daughter.    There is a garden courtyard on top of the building which has a bar and restaurant for breakfast and lunch. Dinner is held in the main courtyard where the pool is located. They put out candles and the hotel was specially lit at night to make it seem magical. They also burned incense in the hotel to give it more atmosphere. The food was great and dinner had an Arab classical guitarist. The restaurant is separately listed in the Tripadvisor top 10 at the time of this review.    The service was also great. This is a five-star hotel and the service was exactly that. We did the spa also. The spa is beautiful. The massage was great but my wife said the mani/pedi she received was more of an accommodation to the guests and not something they did well.    Once you leave the hotel and walk out a short alley you enter a main shopping street in Marrakech. In 10 minutes you can walk to the "main square" which is basically the center of the medina or old town. There is located the entrance to the "souk" or artisan shops. The main square is a local landmark and anyone on the street will point you there. They actually call it "the main square". From the main square we visited some of the top Tripadvisor sights like the palace and madrassa.The hotel itself is in the medina and is about 15 minutes to the airport.    The only drawback for this hotel was the price. I paid about $800 for a suite plus $100 for an extra bed for my daughter and $20 each for breakfast. With taxes etcetera the price per night was over $1000 more than my usual budget. If this is within your budget this should not be a problem. I think the hotel was worth the money.    Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Marrakech. A word about Marrakech. It is dirty and smelly but the people were very friendly. It's an exotic unusual place to visit and a throwback to medeval times. A great place for experienced travellers looking for an authentic place to see. The country is a former French colony so the local speak mainly arabic and French though most of the tourist places spoke at least limited English. The weather in November during my stay was perfect: sunny and warm.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Just returned from a 3 night stay at La Sultana and had a spectacular time! Top of the list were the people there who were very friendly and helpful without being intrusive -- from the management to the housekeeping staff. The food was excellent and we enjoyed both local and international dishes cooked to perfection. My partner and I enjoyed a special birthday meal in the dining area by the pool and had a wonderful time celebrating with a Moroccan flavour! Everything ran extremely smoothly in this boutique hotel consisting of four riads joined together. Every need was catered for from the smallest requests to advice on sightseeing and haggling in the local market. The spa was good - the hammam was especially invigorating! A sincere â€œmerci beaucoupâ€ and â€œshukranâ€ to everyone there for making our stay so enjoyable! Would love to return someday!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After a very early start to catch the 06.15 easyJet flight to Marrakech and a ridiculous wait in the immigration hall at Menara airport we endured a long bumpy and scenically dull 4 hour drive to Oualidia.    The approach on the elevated coast road isn't promising but as you descend to the property itself the beautiful architecture and manicured grounds of the property hint at the promise of what lies inside â€“ truly a reward for an arduous journey.    La Sultana really is an oasis within the surrounding desert. The hotel itself rooms public areas and restaurants are simply yet sensitively designed. Our deluxe suite was enormous and the space was appreciated with our eight year old son sharing the room.    The outdoor swimming pool is beautiful if a little chilly during late October but it's a great and necessary place to lounge as the sea quality in the lagoon is well lagoonish.    However the stand-out quality of this small hotel is the service. From the front desk to the waiters there was a genuine warmth to the welcome. Our son's name was quickly remembered and nothing was too much trouble. Rarely have we met waiting staff who appeared to be so authentically into their jobs. Surfing lessons were arranged a canoe was provided and the GM Khalil Guerraoui went out of his charming way to ensure that our brief two night stay was comfortable.    A spectacular hotel modest in its pretence and one of few that actually delivers beyond expectations. The GM warned us that our next stop at Bab Ourika might disappoint and he wasn't wrong. What he didn't know is that his operation also knocked the spots off the much vaunted and yet lamentable Palais Namaskar in Marrakech. The small La Sultana group is one to watch. Well done!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Rod C wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: It's absolutely terrific a world class hotel that delivers in every respect. Only holds 58 guests and I can't wait to be one of them again!!  This hotel provides service which the majority of hotels only aspire too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: LA SULTANA.........THE PLACE TO STAY IN MARRAKECH
Review_Text: Extremely good location very well presented and compellingly interesting property with individual interior design for each suite and room. Good house keeping good management and excellent cuisine with a stunning roof top restaurant with bar providing extremely good design and privacy. Service from the front desk staff on arrival..... and from all the staff..... was excellent throughout our stay from October 5th - October 8th.  We were recommended to La Sultana by the Trip Advisor Number 1 Rated property in Marrakech.... as they were fully booked. .  We celebrated a birthday and wedding anniversary At La Sultana and we will certainly return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Daniela G wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Title: I will be back there, for sure
Review_Text: I would say that our experience has been very good starting from the assistance I got before confirming our stay in La Sultana. The Staff once there has always been very kind and professional. I still remember the very useful suggestions and explanations Mrs. Saida Manager of reception gave us. She is very smiling and polite and she was there just for us! Thanks.  The location is beautifully "arab" and this is what I wanted: not an international hotel but a very "arabic" and decorated place. The suite we were in was beautiful clean and very wel equipped. We had massages at Spa and the ladies who took care of us were very professional. To dine at the terrace restaurant was lovely romantic and food and also Moroccon wines were very good with also the touch of their musicand voice....it was exactly what I expected to receive.Probably the only "defect" was the small space around the swimming pool in our Riad or let's say that when we were there the Hotel was full. Our experience was really beautiful also because of the position that allowed us to walk at midnight and it was not dangerous. Beautiful!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel itself is made up of a number of houses and the variety of architectural styles makes for a fascinating atmosphere.  The staff could not have been more friendly or efficient. Our dietary needs were understood and well catered for from the off and with some thoughtfulness. The room (La dromaderie) was a hoot with an amazing bathroom and spotless.  Dinner around the pool and breakfast on the roof terrace were treats as was the view down into the kasbah and the royal tombs.  We only had one night here as we were headed off to its sister hotel but we will return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing place, very original with lovely roof terrace and good service.
Review_Text: We liked the different raids the pool is nice and the roof terrace is lovely in the evening. The staff area very friendly and helpful especially in the restaurant. The food is very good and the wine list particularly the marroc ones the head waiter selected some lovely ones for us.

Review_Title: One of the best places to stay in Marrakech !
Review_Text: First let me start by saying the staff are the best and most friendly I have ever meet in any hotel I have stayed in.  The food in the restaurant is very good.  This place is a jewel in the crown and I will be back again  thank you too all the staff there for making my trip so peaceful.

Review_Title: One of the finest riads in Marrakech
Review_Text: This riad stye hotel is just great one of the best in town. Only 10 minutes from the medina centre you can enjoy traditional architecture food and comfort in a luxury way and with the finest service. Besides the inner pool and the spa centre having your breakfast or just sunbathing on the roof terrace is simply a must. Our room ("La Cigogne") was amazing: pleasant and quiet sleep always clean very comfortable and an unexpected & wonderful hearth which made you feel just perfect. Don't get fooled by the street before the entrance of the hotel: remember in muslim culture luxury does not shine on the outside but in the inside!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anna S wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Title: Little oasis in the crazy Medina
Review_Text: After two nights in the Palmeraie region of the city my husband and I headed to the medina for one night. La Sultana is in the Kasbah region of the medina and a 10 minute walk to the jemaa el fna (main square). We were greeted when we arrived by the luggage porter and welcomed into the main Riad (La Sultana is 5 small riads joined together) and offered traditional Moroccan Tea and pastries. We were shown all around the hotel and then to our room - the Lion apartment. Beautifully authentic old Marrakech. We had drinks on the roof listening to the magical call to prayer and were only sorry that we had dinner reservations elsewhere that night. Khalid on the Front Desk was an angel - always smiling and nothing was too much trouble for him. A lovely property and we would definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mark C wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Text: This hotel is great in every way. The local is fantastic10 minutes from the medina centre. The style is very traditional and authentic loads of lovely artifacts and magical little corners of peace but also very luxurious. Nice ppol alhtough a bit crowded during the afternoon. Our room was the apartment a great option for a family of 4. Breakfast was really good on the terrace but the dinner on the roof was truly outstanding - the tasting meal at around Â£60 per head without wine was a high cost but the food and location and service made is very special - highly recommended. Nothing to fault on this hotel; five star all the way!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Perfect for a luxury Marrakech Stay
Review_Text: After staying at the Sofitel in Casablanca and Palais Royal in Fez we hadn't found the Moroccan experience we were looking for yet; that blend of traditional Moroccan elegance and hospitality delivered in a contemporary style. This place was just perfect. The four differently styled Riad courtyards the historic entranceway the beautiful pool delightful rooftop restaurant. Everything worked so well. The service was fabulous and attentive. Will be recommending this to all our friends. The evening musician was fabulous and captivated our 2 year old who now owns an Oud.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Myself and three friends recently stayed at the Sultana we had rather a fraught journey over but on arrival at the Riad all was quickly forgotten. The reception staff ushered us through and served us tea and pastries whilst they performed all the check in formalities for us. We were then shown to our beautiful rooms these really were quite something. We ate in the restaurant upstairs beautiful setting the food was good but it probably didn't live upto the places we ate on the other nights. The pool in the courtyard is a haven from the heat and hustle and bustle of Marrakech we always had a choice of sun loungers this may have been due to the fact we were there in "low" season though. The treatments offered aren't cheap but certainly enable you to relax properly. The location of the Riad is excellent only a 10 minute walk from the main square with all the Souks etc etc. In short a great place to stay and I'd happily come back for another break.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The reviews on this hotel are 100% true. The hotel is beautiful the staff are attentive and the service was amazing. My husband and I had a mini weekend break and stayed 2 nights in the Pelican room. We also had our evening meal in the restaurant and were not disappointed. I particularly appreciated the musician who played throughout the evening and really put the ambience into the evening.  I'd like to give special thanks to the staff member ( Clark Kent lookalike with the glasses ) who ran after us when we were leaving to hand me my Iphone which I had mistakenly forgotten in the IPOD docking station - thank you.  Overall if u are looking for ultimate luxury impeccable service and first class food this is the hotel you should book. You will not be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jac P wrote a review Jul 2013
Review_Text: The hotel is absolutely beautiful it's set amongst a series of courtyards each with a unique feel and style. The roof terrace is simply perfect to enjoy the last of the afternoon sun and escape the noise and bustle of Marrakech. Our room was lovely other reviews have commented on the rooms being dark I found this kept the room cool private and also provided the perfect conditions for a great nights sleep.    The restaurant food was wonderful and service on the whole very good reception staff in particular were fantastic providing some good advice and booking cabs etc. Service at breakfast was sometimes a little slow but the staff were always polite.    Would love to return to the Sultana and would recommend to anyone looking to experience a bit of luxury in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Angela S wrote a review Jul 2013
Review_Text: This gem of a hotel rests in the heart of the Medina close to all of the sights and sounds of the Kasbah. We arrived late but were met with a smile and some welcome refreshments and pastries.    You must try the restaurant - it isn't cheap (Â£90 for a three course meal for two with no alcohol) but the ambience of the roof-top together with the excellent menu choice makes it worth a go. Breakfast is buffet style with a good choice of fresh fruit cereals eggs breads and meat etc.    Rooms are lovely - we had a junior suite and the fridges are stocked daily with free soft drinks.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: ERNEST C wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: The hotel is in the casbah section of the Medina. You would never guess what luxury is hidden behind the plain exterior. The staff are warm and courteous and friendly. The food was superb. The rooms are luxurious. Off season the price is about 350 euros a day but off-season gets really hot.Lovely dining around an inside pool and rooftop breakfasts with views of stork nests TV antennas and mosques wherever you look. Our first trip to a muslim country. Hectic. growing city exotic and a pleasure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emilia S wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: One of the best hotels we have stayed in.  Truly beautiful surroundings in the middle of the Medina.  From the moment we have arrived every little detail of our trip was taken care of and nothing was too much trouble. Every staff member made us feel they do their best to make our stay as pleasurable and comfortable as possible but the real star in there is Saida.  Rooms are fantastic roof top terrace with a restaurant with good food views over the Medina and live music spa with relaxing treatments.  It was so peaceful we felt like we were the only guests in there.  Not one thing to dislike place definitely worth staying or in our case going back to.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: tina a wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: We have just returned from a 4 night stay in this lovely oasis of calm in the middle of chaotic Marrakech. From the moment we checked in which was made to feel very pleasant in itself. We felt like we were the only guests in the hotel. Nothing was too much trouble for the wonderful staff here. Our room was a basic twin which my friend and I found to be perfectly adequate. Bathroom very well equipped. No complaints at all there. Nice touch to have daily complementary water and soft drinks in the room. Swimming pool which I believe is quite rare for a riad to have was small but perfectly formed. The spa and treatments we had were lovely could have gone every day had funds permitted! Breakfast was simple but just enough and the food a lunchtime delicious. The riad is perfectly situated in the Kasbah and a short walk from the lively main square and souks. Superb staff who really made us feel special and they were there to make us happy. Would highly recommend this riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Denis T wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: I travel abroad maybe half a dozen times a year and have only ever been compelled to do one review because the hotel I stayed in in Cannes was so bad. But  I felt only for the second time in a few years to write another but this time for the opposite reason. This hotel is wonderful ! It was a calm and beautiful hideaway and was so peaceful it could have been in the middle of a desert but in fact if you walk out on to the street you were in the bustling Medina. We had a perfect room called ' Puma ' a strange name for a room but it was lovely. From the moment we walked in to the room and closed the door we felt we were in our own little world peaceful quiet and very very relaxing.    Every single member of staff from the reception to the bell boy to the restaurant staff and the spa  could not have been any better. Always with genuine smiles and so friendly and helpful.    Only 28 rooms you feel like you have the whole place to yourself very romantic and a very special place.    Just inside the Medina walls and only a ten minute walk from the main square.    A special mention must be made for our guide who was recommended by the hotel Moulat. A very friendly  decent and unimposing man who showed us things we would not have seen had we just walked around on our own. He made Marrakesh a much more memorable holiday for us and we would totally recommend that you use him if you stay at the hotel.    In the last couple of years I have stayed at some great hotels like the Carlton in Cannes the Victoria Grand in Switzerland and Villa D'este in lake Como and the Sultana Marrakesh is every bit as good but with a special ambience and very personal service that larger hotels could only aspire to be like.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Charles W wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: We stayed for 5 nights - I arrived with a broken foot ( accident 7 days prior to arrival ) - on day 3 foot would take no weight - so Saida (front desk manager) took us to hospital - cutting thro all red tape !! Beyond call of duty - the whole experience was like that - they couldn't do enough for us - very charming  friendly  great food  delightful surroundings  and on a par with La Residencia in Majorca ! Will go again for w/end break .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hard to fault - impeccable service in beautiful surroundings in the heart of Marrakech. Only downside is that the pool is separate from the rooftop 'sun bathing area'. This might be better in the middle of summer as the pool is in a tranquil shaded area but when we were there at the end of May it was a little cool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Samuel James wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: We stayed for 3 nights in a gorgeous well apportioned room which was tastefully decorated but benefited from all mod cons. La Sultana is a boutique authentic property which is beautifully designed and superbly located in the Kasbah area of the Medina. Our welcome consisted of fresh mint tea and delightful pastries followed by a tour of the hotel which is formed from the amalgamation of a number of raids. Breakfast was served by the pool or on the roof terrace. Food was wonderful and fresh. All the staff we encountered could not do enough for us and this hotel can not come more highly reccommeded.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: You would never think as you wander down the chaotic dusty donkey cart infested street with a perfume which alternates between the smoke of street vendors' charcoal barbecues and the sweet aromatic symphony of the many herbalist shops that you were 20 meters from a luxury oasis.    The hotel is delightful mix of authentic Moroccan architecture styles finishes and fabrics understated and achieved with a certain grace. Use of natural lighting sets off the typical brickwork and the amazing intricacy of the carved paster and wood fretwork in every angle.    We stayed in the Jaguar suite which was very stylishly finished with a sunken bath marble throughout two terraces and two sitting rooms and walk in wardrobe. Despite its size however it remained quite intimate and cozy with a lovely outlook over the courtyard pool.    The staff are friendly attentive and professional and everything was made seamless and easy. The restaurant on the roof terrace at lunchtime is competent and has a limited but tasty menu. In the evening the restaurant moves to being around the pool and is both romantic and pretty good if not a little expensive (compared to similar standard non hotel restaurants so nothing new there). Try the Moroccan tasting menu as it will give you good first impression of Morrocan food.    Finally when you have had enough of the souks grab a sun-bed on the rooftop enjoy the complimentary virgin Mojito's and chill in the North African sun (don't forget the sun cream!).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Dinner with friends at La Sultana
Review_Text: This was a special occasion so we splashed out for dinner here and it was worth every penny.  We were treated like royalty from the beginning the service was impeccable .  The food was absolutely delicious Moroccan cuisine with good sized helpings.  Delightful deserts too and superb surroundings.  Go if you can!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Amidst the chaos of the Medina - this glorious hotel provides everything we dreamed of finding in Marrakech. It exceeded all of our expectations. The service is excellent - they were always available to satisfy every whim - and yet we felt we had complete privacy. The decor is stunning - the hotel is made up of several unique riads - each more interesting and beautiful then the last. The attention to detail is superb. The spa is a beautifully designed space and the services are amazing. This was one of the most romantic hotels I have ever been to. The food is delicious and if we expressed interest in something not on the menu - they were happy to make it for us. We really felt at home here and look forward to returning soon. Absolute Luxury and Complete 5 Star experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A stay at La Sultana is a different world from that outside in the mayhem that is Marrakech. When we were dropped off by the taxi from the airport we thought there must have been a mistake we could not have paid so much to be staying in this dingy noisy back street. Don't be fooled. Within seconds we were ensconced in the grandeur calm and peace that is La Sultana.    Our stay couldn't have been better the staff were attentive without being overbearing which was a relief from the frenzy and stress (why do the shop keepers not seem to understand that they are likely to sell much more if you are left alone?) that is shopping in Marrakech.    The hotel itself is fabulous the attention to detail faultless and although we thought it was perhaps slightly overdone feels very grand just as an old palace may have been. Our room was sumptuous with everything you could need or want. The only slight flaw was the wonderful rainfall shower which it was impossible to use without soaking the bathroom; but this wasn't much of a problem with the housekeeping coming in every evening to turn down the sheets and clearly mop the floor.    Marrakech is quite an expensive city to eat if you want decent food so although La Sultana wasn't cheap it compared well with other places we visited. And although it was wonderful to eat beneath the stars we were underwhelmed by the lighting. I'm all for ambient lighting in the right place but it would have been nice to see what we were eating. Fortunately we were early enough to be able to read the menu but more experienced visitors than ourselves had brought mini torches. A handy tip!    It was only a short walk to the Jemaa-el-Fna and if you enjoy taking your life into your hands - there seem to be no rules of the road - it is an unmissable experience to join in the evening promenade.    Overall we had a great time both in Marrakech and in La Sultana. It was a relief to hide away beside the pool after a frenetic morning and to recharge the batteries ready for the chaos that is a Marrakechi evening.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Indulgence with breakfast on the roof overlooking Marrakech
Review_Text: A magnificent hotel reflecting the indulgences of a bygone era. This is a beautifully renovated group of buildings that has become a single Riad.
