Our room was most opulent with all the fixtures and fittings (including Wi-Fi) that one could expect. Even the mini bar consumption of soft drinks was included.    Breakfast was served on the roof of the Riad and one could survey some of the kasbah including the Saadian Tombs which are next door. It's only a short walk to Jemaa-el-Fna square with its huge number of night time food stalls and the buzz of big and friendly crowds.    Hotel staff were most accommodating and our time here was memorable
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: christine c wrote a review May 2013
Review_Title: a so exceptional place to stay !
Review_Text: the Sultana Marrakech is a majic and exceptional Riad  a beautiful  luxius and a quiet hotel very well located to have a quick access to visit the city.  we've spend a fantastic week and benefit of a hight level of professional services.  Thanks to the team !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Very special & beautiful Riad but over priced
Review_Text: The hotel has some luxurious rooms and amazing surroundings with several courtyards and a roof terraces. The decorations in the room and bath-room are unique; it is like staying in the 1001 fair-tale places. The reception manager Saida is very friendly and super professional; she made our stay in the hotel enjoyable despite the problems with the room and the check-in process. The dinner is very good with nice service and beautiful surrounding near the pool.  The hotel is more suitable for couples without children. Furthermore we missed that personal approach which we experienced at some other hotels of this price range. For instance the service during the check-in process was unacceptable. Upon our arrival at 12:45 we were told that the Prestige double room we booked does not allow a child so we had to take one of their suits with significant amount of additional charges. We accepted it but had to wait more than 2Â½ hours for the room to be ready even though we informed them that we have been up since 5:30 am and would really like to have our room as soon as possible. The elevator needs urgent service so it would not make such noise that clearly went through to this expensive suit. The staff at the breakfast is friendly but it misses that extra level of genuine engagement. A normal taxi from airport without any bargain cost 50 MAD. The hotel charged us 380 MAD for a very old & dirty car to pick us up from the airport. The benefit was that there was no problem to find the hotel. The street immediately outside of the hotel was dirty smelling of garbage and crowded.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I stayed in this hotel last year (with my brother) - it is so utterly stunning.... - lots of beautiful court yards and little luxury areas to sit and relax - Marrakech itself is totally bonkers (in a wonderful way) and the La Sultana is a wonderful place to get away from it all after the city has twisted your melon (man!).....simply amazing....a once in a lifetime experience for me.....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We are Marrakech lovers and Morocco lovers in general therefore we spend the second short holiday this year at our beloved country. This time we booked in LS based on the feed back from TA travellers whilst our earlier stay was spend at Riad Idra.  Overall LS is a very good hotel which offers the std comfort of a 5* rated hotel but it misses that extra level of genuine engagement of the staff: the terras could be a wonderful place but the staff for whatever reason forgets to pamper the hosts with some genuine friendliness and hospitality. From a 5* hotel you should expect with the limited number of tables what yr guests drink or with how many people they are so table can be dressed accordingly. Here it was like every day was a new day for the waiters and we missed that personal approach which we experienced at some other hotels of this price range.  It has to be said that all other staff is extremely friendly and even if we had an smell issue in our room the manager without hesitation offered us to change room and to do all moves themselves. Really appreciated.  So overall we really appreciated the hotel but not enough to return as it missed that Small Luxury Hotel personal touch.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Catharine B wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: We stayed at la Sultana for 3 nights. It met every expectation and beyond.  The rooms are absolutely beautiful. The amenities superb. Staff is discreet but very friendly and helpful. I give this hotel and A+ or 5 star rating.  Our guide arranged through the hotel: Ahmed cell 0021266241241 was very knowledgeable and just great. Our taxi driver Abdelmoula mobile 0666169181 was equally wonderful. Both very honest and honorable people.  Marrakech felt safer than any city I have been to-and I have been to many.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: a v wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: My wife and me spend 5 beautifull days in La Sultana Marrakech for our 5-year wedding anniversary. We slept in Suite La Panthere. Everything was absolutely perfect and romantic: a 1001night fairytaill. With a climax: a Massage and Spa for two in Spa La Sultana (PlaiSir Absolu). Mouna and Tirzam were incredible. Absolutely relaxing. Dream we hoped for come true. Thanks all the crew from La Sultana (but specially Mouna and Tirzam). Itâ€™s quite a lot of money. But itâ€™s absolutely worth it. Staff is so attentive. 100% recommended.  P&A from The Netherlands
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A colleague and I roughed it at a modest riad for five nights and then splurged at La Sultana for one. From the moment we entered we felt like princesses in a palace. The decor was extraordinary and the welcoming staff treated us like the royalty we had instantly become. Breakfast was sumptuous dinner by the pool ultra picturesque food delicious and the oud player gifted with stamina and a charming repertoire. My dip in the pool at 8 am allowed me to work off the previous night's dinner. Our room was out of a fairy tale and the rest of our brief time there was spent photographing every exotic nook and cranny. Destined to become one of my Top 10.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Michael P wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: Excellent location fifteen minutes walk from the souks and the square. So you feel you are in the middle of everything yet when you enter the hotel you are in a calm oasis. The staff could not be more helpful or attentive without being intrusive. We stayed in the Le cigne (the Swan) room - it was wonderful! Roof terrace is a delight with fabulous views of the Atlas Mountains. We would stay there again if visiting Marrakech and do not hesitate in recommending it to others. Thanks for a superb experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Beluga C wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Title: WE LOVED IT......HOME FROM HOME.....WE WILL BE BACK!
Review_Text: We had heard how good the hotel was but it was SO MUCH BETTER....it was hard to say goodbye...we then had a plane nightmare and were able to return...we were looked after and it was home from home...we are going back...if you do not go you will miss out!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: excellent - if you look for a romantic place with lots of love for details and out of 1001 night -now you have found it !!! the staff is so friendly and polite -they give you a very worm welcome and a wonderful feeling meanwhile your stay !!!  i - as a woman - came alone but i never felt lonely because all of them took so much care about me !!!  all together : a great place to be -with a romantic atmosphere wonderful people( staff) and good food-not to forget the lovely rooftop with the breathtaking view !!!  thanks of being your guest !!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: If you want peace and tranquility this is the place to go.the staff are first class and attend to you every need.The location is excellent very close to all the historic sites.It has a roof terrace that is to die for
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just come back from a wonderful break at La Sultana in Marrakech. The hotel is beautiful the room (a junior suite) was spacious and decorated to a very high standard. The food was fantastic but the thing that really made it stand out was the wonderful staff they were incredibly attentive and friendly and really made you feel welcome and at ease. It is our first stay at an SLH and we certainly plan to go to another. Anyone thinking of visiting Marrakech or just going to a great hotel for a luxury break will not be disappointed with this hotel.    Jane E
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tanja L wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in this wonderful hotel. Each detail is excellent. We booked in for a Junior Suite and asked for a room with a balcony. And the Concierge managed it to give us a beautiful room with a great balcony looking to the swimming pool. The bathroom was like you feel in thousands and one night. A very romantic place. I really would like to give a compliment to the cleaning persons: They tidied up the rooms very carefully; each day there were petals of roses in the bathroom.  The Quarter in which the hotel is located is very interesting. You can look to a market from the top of the hotel. But you have to walk about 15 minutes to the souks.  And one great welcome: We arrived at about 12 o`clock and the management of the hotel gave us a room for the time our room was prepared. Thanks for the wunderful stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is the most exquisite place we have ever visited. Our Elephant bedroom was so beautiful romantic and comfortable I could have stayed there for ever! The attention to details and its architecture throughout the hotel made us feel we were experiencing old Marrakech. The food and service were fantastic. Having dinner at their Terrace's Restaurant while watching the sky and hearing their prayer's calling was mystical! Spending a day hiking the Atlas Mountains and having lunch there was amazing. Would love to go back... Only if we can stay at La Sultana! :)

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel in the heart of Kasbah
Review_Text: We only stayed in this hotel for a few days wishing we could have stayed for a bit longer. La Sultana is a beautifully designed hotel combining 5 separate riads each one of them have different feel and finishes. Some riads are minimalistic and traditional and some very bold and colourful eager to surprise you with distinctive African furniture. We have stayed in the Africa themed riad in the gazelle room. The room wasnâ€™t very large but was well designed and comfortable. Housekeeping went the extra mile to keep our room clean and tidy rose petals in the bathroom and traditional sweets and nuts on a tea table were well received. Small touches like chocolates at night and complementary gifts made us feel very special. Everything from arrival to departure was perfect and well thought The hotel staff are well trained and exceptionally polite & helpful but not intrusive.  Breakfast in the hotel simply amazing with prepared to order dishes. The ingredients used are the highest quality and cooked to perfection. Those tasty dishes are served in the restaurant area which is beautifully designed around the indoor swimming pool.  On the first night we drank cocktails in the basement bar that resembles a luxury boat the barmaid was very friendly and made as feel very welcome.  One evening we used the indoor pool in Spa area and had an amazing experience there which made us feel very invigorated before a night out.  Throughout our stay we used different communal areas which were designed in an individual style and for different purpose finishes in the hotel are wonderful and you can admire so many pieces of beautiful furniture and decorative objects around the hotel.  I highly recommend this hotel to couples for romantic breaks.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely & relaxing place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: Stayed in La Sultana for 5 nights and absolutely loved it. The hotel is amazing and it is the perfect getaway if you want to relax and want to have privacy. The hotel and rooms are beautifully decorated staff is super friendly and willing to arrange everything that you need during your stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I stayed at La Sultana for 7 nights in mid-March. We had a ground floor Prestige room which was very well appointed and spacious. The service in all areas of the hotel from reception to restaurants was superb. We ate dinner in the hotel several times and particularly enjoyed sharing the shoulder of lamb. Less enjoyable was the musician who plays ethnic music endlessly - a short break occasionally for some peaceful conversation would be welcome! The staff must get a particular mention. They were always attentive without being obtrusive addressed us by name and seemed to anticipate our needs even before we knew them ourselves. The hotel's location is within easy walking distance of many of the places of interest in the centre of Marrakech. It's not cheap but is heartily recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Magnificently decorated with service to match and right in the heart of Marrakech.  It is like walking into 1001 nights. The moment you enter the hallway you are enthralled.  Beautiful courtyards invite you to linger. Food and service are excellent.  The rooms are comfortable and nicely decorated.  This is one of the best Riads in Morrokko.  Highly recommended. You step out of the front door and you are in the middle of the Souk.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: Me and my wife just came back from a Honey Moon in La Sultana. The hotel is beautiful the rooms are great the service is friendly the food is good and as honey moon guests we have received great extras but above all management was remarkable especially Saida who made sure that every moment of our stay will be pleasant and enjoyable from recommending the right spa treatments to great town tours. Thank You
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for two nights in February. The hotel is beautiful whichever part you stay in is highly decorative. There are several courtyards and our room CamÃ©lion opened onto the largest where the swimming pool is and also the restaurant for breakfast and dinner. This had one great advantage. In the afternoons after we had visited the Medina there was never anyone at the pool. With the pool just outside our room it was like having our own private pool!  Our room was very nice with some exquisite Morrocan details although I found a little small. The bath was quirky and the bathroom was lovely with a variety of lighting. The bed was sooooooo comfortable and huge. Lighting in the room was atmospheric and innovative but it lacked the odd lamp here and there. There was a desk but absolutely no lighting at that end of the room. For a new hotel we found the lack of sockets irritating. We couldn't both charge our phones at the same time and all sockets were inaccessible except one in the bathroom.  Breakfast was really nice an array of juices cereals and breads and things on the breakfast menu we have never been offered before or even heard of before. The cooked food you order is delicious hot and arrived quickly. Breakfast service was really excellent.  Dinner? Dinner was strange. Service seemed slow and underwhelming although always polite. The food was a little bland and the style inconsistent considering there was only one menu. One evening our main courses really made us laugh. My plate looked like I was eating in a Michelin starred restaurant - a plate of neatly arranged food equal to any fine dining restaurant and my husbands looked like a meal for at least 4 hungry peasants plonked on the table with no finesse at all!! The other thing about dinner.... there is a musician who sits at the other side of the pool. He plays authentic Morrocan music. At first you think this is nice then you wonder if he will ever take a break (he doesn't) as it become tedious and then it becomes downright irritating. It is loud and the sound harsh with all the hard surfaces. After dinner we would have like to have sat on our terrace with a drink or two and relaxed. Instead we had to go into our room and shut the shutters and watch a DVD.  The hotel claims the rooms are soundproofed and we can testify they certainly arewe couldn't hear the music from inside our room so you will not be disturbed by noise in this hotel.  One thing I would like to mention we went in Februaryearly in the month. The days were pleasantly warm and the nights very cold. The hotel has a system of covering the courtyards with a clear plastic roof so that you are not cold when dining swimming or sitting. This makes everything more comfortable. There is a superb roof terrace with tiny plunge pool where you can enjoy sunbathing(there are sunbeds) fresh air refreshments and lunch in the open air restaurant.  The position of the hotel is pretty good as you can walk to everywhere in the Medina from there. There is a huge taxi station nearby if you want to go outside the Medina.  I don't have anything bad to say about the hotel and I would certainly stay there again but I did email several times before we went to ask for a pick up from the airport and did not get a reply. In the end I had to phone to confirm the airport pick up which was there to pick us up and bring us to the hotel in a nice air conditioned limousine. I did feel that the service was very good but did not match the price paid for the hotel but perhaps that is Morrocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent a long weekend at La Sultana and it was wonderful. The hotel is perfect very good service nice decoration and very relaxing despite the location very close to the busy centre. We really enjoyed our stay there! Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marc v wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Title: It is not a hotel, is is your home!
Review_Text: Thanks to the hospitality of the people an amazing experience. And indeed they give you the feeling of being home a beautiful home where you can be spoiled as much as you like: a nice treatment in the spa fantastic food in the restaurant or being served at the roof of the riads while overlooking the city or reading your book. Just do it and go!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: ROBERTO G wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: Five riad put together to create a perfect magical atmosphere. Every day you discover something new walking in the various corridors stairs rooms which animate this special place.  The entry of the hotel is completely hidden arriving from the kasbah. As soon as you step in the hotel you find a different world full of serenity and extreme relaxation. All the 31 rooms have a different design and personality. We love to have breakfast and dinner in the small restaurant around the pool seating always at different tables discovering new angles of beauty. View from the roof is amazing with the Atlas mountains far away on the horizon and just below the fast life of the Medica with its sounds parfume and colours. Service in the restaurant was excellent very professional concierge staff and a very amazing hotel guide Hassan. Two thumbs up for any of my international friends who likes a luxury vacation with the true taste and spirit of Maroc.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Homoki L wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: A wonderful magic Riad where we had an unforgetable honeymoon!!! A place to find sirenety after the lifely busy streets either in the Spa or on the Medina overlooking roof terrase to chill-out accombined with the wonderful redish sky of the sunset. Beeing pampered in the Spa with couple treatments in the Hammam and relaxing massages is another highlight of La Sultana. A magnificent and authentic Riad which makes you drift into another world. Excellent service with very friendly and superb staff! A place you don't want to leave anymore and we deffinitly will come back to celebrate our wedding anniverseries!! A place with only superlatives! A big thank to the entire team at La Salutana!!  We also recommend La Sultana - Qualidia where we have spent the first days of our honeymoon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marco M wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: This is probaly one of the best hotel I have ever been. I would go back to Marrakech just to stay there again. Everything is just magic... The building is hidden in the lanes and once you enter the door this magnificent riad duzzles your eyes. What impressed me much was the athmospheare you could breath in it. The roof is amazing with the view over the city...the perfume of the roses in the inside garden and other tropical plants..the music and the noize of the praiers..the taste of the the extraordinary maroccan cusine.. And of couse the rooms and the spa... Everything was just perfect. You cannot miss it even if it is more expensive than others it is really worth it.

A place to be pampered and relax from the craziest that's Marrakesh. The zebre room was simply wonderful. A great location to explore the medina with easy access to most of the sights of Marrakesh. From the roof deck one can look down into the Saadian Tombs and looking to the east the Atlas mountains along with Morocco's high peak complete the view.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: our family with 2 teenagers stayed at La Sultana for 4-5 days and could have spent a month- or more!  La Sultana is beautiful peaceful quiet and comfortable in the midst of bustling Marrakech. The staff is superb- and will arrange everything. Every room is gorgeous and different in design and decor elements- while maintaining your arabian dream.  You can walk to almost everywhere you want to go within the city walls which makes morning and late afternoon ideal for touring around easy and spontaneous (early morning runs recommended for optimal weather nice orientation less crowds and a real picture of daily life in Marrakech). Breakfast or evening drinks on the roof deck overlooking the city surrounding you are a must for sunrises and sunsets. Mid afternoons are usually hot- so ideal time to rendevous back at La Sultana for lunch at the poolside. Although the restaurant is superb the staff will help book the best tables at the best and most scenic restaurants in Marrakech for a few dinners. They also will arrange the requisite camel rides just outside the city. La Sultana is a must experience while in Marrakech and a 'home' I would love to live in anywhere.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: La Sultana is a true haven of peace and tranquility in a chaotic environment. It`s standards are far higher than the other 5 star hotels. It is elegant smart and fantastically stylish but not in a garish or excessive manner.  The staff are genuinely considerate and patient; wishing for your comfort at all times and thinking ahead to your needs.  The rooms are designed in a unique and comfortable way and spa and the staff there are superb too.  The welcome is generous and considerate with a little surprise and so is the departure... I won`t spoil it for you!  There is a tour of the hotel too so if you prefer another room or suite you can chose more easily too.  How could it get better? Well it can... the food in the restaurant cannot be beaten. The menu is a fusion of French and Moroccan cuisine and it works remarkably well.  I cannot recommend it more highly. For those of you who know what luxury really means and have high expectations; this is for you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Catherine T wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: We spent three glorious nights at La Sultana at the end of our honeymoon. Everything about this place and the people who work there is AMAZING! From the moment we walked in it was all about our comfort and the staff did all they could to make our stay unforgettable. Khalid welcomed us with a delicious cup of mint tea before showing us to our beautiful room. The Prestige room we had was spacious and very private. Only metres away lies the hustle and bustel of Marrakesh and yet it is so quiet inside the walls of La sultana. Breakfast is delicious and there are many choices on the menu as well as a buffet. The rooftop area is great for lunch. The bar opens at 6pm and we had our very own friendly barman. Dinner menu is great food is so fresh and not too pricey. The reception staff are very helpful they organised a guide to spend half a day with us. Nothing was too much trouble. The Spaa is lovely. My husband and I had a body scrub treatment and massage and we thoroughly enjoyed the pampering. They even left a sweet gift for us on the last night. It was definitely a five star experience. The staff speak great English and we liked their sense of humour also.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David P wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: We had a lovely - but too short - holiday; The room and the hotel were superb and so quiet considering the hustle and bustle of the street outside. The food and service were exceptional and we were treated very handsomely. We were not actually on our honeymoon (!) as we have been married for nearly 48 years but perhaps we looked so happy it might appear that we were on a special break. Thank you; we are planning to come again as soon as we can.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is amazing. It is hidden down a small allley and through a door into a beautiful oasis. Each room is unique and well appointed. Had dinner in the restaurant and the meal was lovely. The staff was great and were very helpful with arranging a car for an early morning airport transport and having a small meal delivered to the room at 6:15 a.m. The roof top seating and bar is great to watch the sunset and people watch while having a pot of mint tea. The hotel belongs to the "Smalll Luxury Hotels of the World" group and deservingly so.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: effi a wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: Five star plus treatment at La Sultana and more!!!! Amazing hotel small luxurious and very romantic. The staff was helpful and accommodating to all our needs. The food was delicious and the spa treatments were exceptional!!!! A hidden treasure in the Medina looking forward to our next visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: La Sultana was an amazing experience throughout our 6 day stay and lived up to its reputation as an SLH property. Located in Marrakech's busy city center yet still felt like an oasis. The staff had fantastic attention to detail -- most staff greeted us by name by the second day -- it gave a very personal feeling to our stay. Rooms are amazing food is excellent location is great for holiday traveling. Pricing is expensive but that's to be expected for an experience like this. Looking forward to having the chance to return one day.    We considered two alternative hotels of similar caliber in the area and I am glad we chose to stay at La Sultana.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Had an amazing time in La Sultana - the hotel is stunning in architecture and design and offers a tranquil retreat from the outside world after a day around the Medina. The rooms were beautiful with sunken baths and copper sinks. The staff were extremely helpful and seemed to appear just as you need them to collect bags or order drinks. The reception helped us with hiring a guide and booking restaurants. The service was excelkent overall. Highly recommend.

Review_Title: WHAT A GREAT EXPERIENCE!!!!!!!!! A++++++ to the staff!!!!!!
Review_Text: Great Location!!!! Awesome Hotel Fantastic experience and Very Polite and friendly staff!!!! Congratulations to the management for running a Great hotel!!!!!!!    You are made to feel that you have visited friends and family from beginning to end....very comfortable and pleasant!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: One of the best hotels I stayed in
Review_Text: Amazing stay at La Sultana Front Office will do everything for you what is in her power to make it the most memorable stay. The Hotel is a small Boutique Hotel with excellent Staff food is outstanding and very fresh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Iain S wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Title: It's like being on the set of a James Bond film!!
Review_Text: Excellent location service and price!!  We went for a friends 40th and could not have asked for more.  The service staff and location are perfect.  The hotel rooms are slightly pricey but worth paying the extra for a great location.

It started with the warm welcome accompanied by mint tea and pastries and the attention to detail never stopped. It is peaceful haven within the busy streets of the medina and walking distance to the souks and many of the famous landmarks. The gorgeous courtyards fabulous roof terrace and excellent service made this a holiday to remember.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great service but put off by smokers
Review_Text: delightful check in done at the beautiful cafe on the roof top beautifully appointed rooms and excellent service and helpful and cheerful staff.    was nice to have peace and quiet and heating in the winter but was unable to sleep as the heater was a tad noisy. turned off heater but as they have put a covering over the courtyard to keep out the cold the smell of cigarettes wafted up to the room as they allowed smoking in the courtyard restaurant below. we had guests in another room that also faced the same problem with a covered courtyard and smokers in the next suite polluted the whole place with their smoking. temperature would have been perfect for sleeping without heating. what a shame to allow smoking in the rooms and in an enclosed area.    wonderful breakfast and dinner also marred by passive smoke from other smokers.  would not consider staying there again in winter as i am 100% against passive smoking.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: As the taxi dropped us off on the busy street I thought he had taken me to the wrong place but in fact the hotel is located on the busy Kashbah street which can be hectic. It's full of life which people buying selling and cars motorbikes and bikes flying past.... Then you enter La Sultana and it couldn't be further away from that atmosphere. It's peaceful beautifully decorated and truly out of this world. The welcome we received was excellent. We were given a tour of the hotel and served mint tea and Moroccan cakes on the roof top. I was in in rush to get to the room as I was enjoying the tea and the surroundings. Then when we saw the room we were thrilled it was so beautiful and everything you needed is there iPod docking station DVD player all the usual extra slippers robe etc. Bathroom was spacious and the bed was so comfortable. It's by the far the best 5 star hotel we have ever stayed in. I'm sad to leave but look forward to returning. The staff go out of their way for all their guests.

Review_Date: Christina K wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Text: We stayed at La Sultana for 4 nights. And we loved it!!  The staff is absolutely wonderful they makes you feel at home and so comfortable. IÂ´ve been on their website before to look at the pictures. But in real life it exceeded the photos. So if you want to live in a Morrocan dream & fairytale for a couple of days. This is the place!  And donÂ´t forget to book treatments at the spa. We went twice because itÂ´s so beautiful: And so relaxing to have the hamambath with a massage.  I would love to stay there again next time I go to Marrakech.  / Christina Karlsson Sweden
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: It was an absolute amazing stay at La Sultana Saida the Front Office Manager will do everything for you what is in her power to make it the most memorable stay. The Hotel is a small Boutique Hotel with excellent Staff food is outstanding and very fresh. If you are vegetarian or you do have some food allergies like Gluten Allergie or Lactose intollerance you just let the staff know and they will organize everything for you what you need.  The Spa was excellent clean very hygenic and amazing treatments.  I will definately come back and i hope very soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Oasis in the middle of the busy Kasbah
Review_Text: Excellent location tastefully decorated riads and very friendly staff make this luxury hotel a definite recommendation! They were very flexible with breakfast times and we really enjoyed the hamam treatments. The rooftop terrace is a great place to hang out and observe busy Marrakech.

We spend 10 days in Marrakech and 6 in La Sultana. We had a wonderful time. The staff is lovely and very helpful. La Sultana is probably the best boutique hotel in town and the Kasbah or Median is the best place to be off season as most of the hotel in the Palmeraie are empty. Also you can walk to the Medina from it.  We visit most of the top hotels and really the Sultana is the most beautiful one. The renovation is spectacular and the furniture are gorgeous.  One little point I will prefer that the all breakfast will be serve than on a buffet...I don't like buffet
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ana G wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Text: The hotel is ok located if you want to stay in the Medina but frankly it's nicer outside. The rooms service staff spa etc. is simply not good. This should be not more than a 2-3 star hotel. Disappointing and not worth the price at all.

Review_Date: eric g wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Text: This place is spectacular. It's in the medina of Marrakech in the kasbah area and from the outside doesn't look like much. In fact from the street you wouldn't even know that this very large hotel is even there. Inside it's a beautiful restoration of several traditional riads each one more eye-popping than the last for their elegant traditional interiors. There is a large swimming pool in the final courtyard. Meals are served around the pool. The restaurant is superb. Everything we ate was good but we particularly recommend the sampler menu to get an idea of fine Moroccan cuisine and the skills of the chef. Our suite was lovely a two-story affair with all sorts of nooks and and fine Moroccan furniture. I suppose every room is different in layout and/or furnishings so you might want to take a look at yours before you accept it. The staff are highly professional. There is a very pleasant planted roof terrace where you can also eat and drink and look out over the daily life of the medina. The medina itself is fascinating although the speeding mopeds that go swerving and honking up and down the narrow alleys are really dangerous and detract from the experience. The whole atmosphere of the medina must have been so different before the masses of mopeds arrived on the scene.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: eric p wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Text: Our family (3 children) spend a lovely full week at la Sultana this fall. The staff was great with the kids and the service was perfect making our holiday a very peaceful and pleasant one. We were initially planning to spend 3 days then try another hotel in the Palmeraie but after 3 days there we decided to finish the week in this riad.  Rooms were great and we would highly recommend the appartment which is gorgeous. Very important for us the place is quiet and extremely clean. In a word it was a real treat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Very friendly staff and a true Oasis
Review_Text: great luxurious rooms amazing surroundings. Only tiny complaint that the pool was on the small side and in the ground floor which is too shaded but we made up for it by sunbathing on the roof terrace! will be coming back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nicola P wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Text: We stayed at La Sultana mid October and had a wonderful room - Giraffe - overlooking the pool with a balcony which we made use of for morning coffee and in the evening for a digestif listening to the musician. The hotel is magical in design and the staff so warm and friendly. I made friends with Lynne Hey and family so it is good to see her review too. Reception was excellent in recommending places to visit or sorting out any minor issues immediately. The breakfast and dinner was excellent especially the tasting menu - and the chef took the time to visit us and seek feedback. I went out and about on my own with confidence in Marrakesh which not many women did but I found the city exciting and vibrant with life. Despite the intgroduction of the fixed price green taxis we were overcharged and the hotel spend nearly a day getting the overcharge back for us - how is that for service? Jasmine and her husband could not have done more for us in the restaurant and we wish them well for the future. Mohammed is an asset to front of house. Our antique rug arrived from Morroco yesterday. Price started at Â£10000 and we settled at Â£3000 delivered and taxed UK. My husband was described as a Berber in terms of negotiation!! So lovely memories to reflect on and a stunning rug to view each day. We intend to visit La Sultana again and combine with a visit to their sister hotel on the coast and a trip to the desert.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed here for the last 2 weeks of October the weather was mostly good but a few rainy days.  All of the rooms are completely different I have never stayed anywhere quite like this there are actually 5 Riads at this property. The location is in the Kasbah a very busy area taxis are unable to park directly outside of the property they park on the street and it is a short walk to La Sultana which is like a tardis! Upon entering the area just beyond the small reception the smell of incense envelops you Moroccan lanterns adorn the passage offering a romantic glow initiating a feeling of complete tranquillity away from the chaos outside. The staff are excellent nothing is too much trouble Saida is superb she organised many different activities for us restaurants guides a trip to the Atlas Mountains. The Spa here is very good I can recommend Jasmine she is very very strong so if you like a hard massage you will not be disappointed! If you need a cab use Abdulmoula he won't rip you off (they know him at the hotel if you ask) he even offered to pay our hotel bill when the hotel chip and pin machine didn't work! If you need a guide it costs around Â£15 for half a day Havid(Hafeed) is a real gentleman and extremely knowledgeable. If you drink alcohol I would suggest you buy some duty free on the plane as all of the alcohol here appears to be quite expensive. The food at La Sultana is good as much as you like at breakfast with a large and varied selection of produce.  This is a very busy area with a great deal going on I was there for the first week with my 16 year old daughter and although we initially felt a little conspicuous after a couple of days we were absolutely fine. To watch belly dancing I can recommend La Comptoir but go late it starts around 10.30pm and at the weekend ensure you have seats upstairs (although the tables are a little low). We dined at the Royal Mansour it cost just short of Â£400 for 2 including drinks mega expensive but WOW! We also visited the Kasbah Tamadot (Richard Bransons place) the property is amazing but appeared quite isolated compared to La Sultana the food was mediocre not what we expected to be fair it was just the one meal but we were disappointed. There are over 2600 shops in the Souks so every day is different. For me it was a holiday like no other. I hope that my comments help anyone considering a visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: frederic m wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Text: we had a wonderful stay last week in La Sultana; extreme relaxing atmosphere amid hectic Marrakech. The staff is extremely helpful meals are perfect and rooms heavenly...  We spend hours just relaxing with a glass of wine and a book on the roof top terras.  Highly recommended for special occasions; expensive venue but worth the price...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A stunning oasis in the Medina
Review_Text: A fantastic stay in a stunning Riad. A quiet oasis away from the bustle of the City. Wonderful food served in amazing surroundings. The staff could not have been more helpful. Would recommend this Riad to anyone visiting Marrakech and if you are not staying here make sure you have dinner!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We just spent 4 days in this hotel and couldn't have asked for more. The service was exceptional the food delicious and varied and the architecture stunning. A wonderful oasis amidst the hustle and bustle of the streets.  And for those of us who need to stay in touch free wifi!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Personal service, in an atmosphere of peace and tranquility
Review_Text: A beautiful restoration of 5 riads tucked away from the bustle/noise/smells of the Kasbah Quarter. The central courtyard is a lovely setting for excellent food. Dinner here is a 'must' with very reasonably-priced food and wines. Lots of individual sitting areas with a pleasant rooftop terrace. The staff provided first class service and English was widely spoken. Do not be put off by the lack of the 'Grand Entrance'; this is a riad-style hotel and once inside the door it is total peace. We were delighted with our suite - individual stylish and huge! Thank you La Sultana and thank you for the nice treats in our room before check-out. Much appreciated.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jane F wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: This is far and away the most beautiful hotel I have ever stayed in. The place is magical the rooftop terrace to die for wonderful dining and the nicestwarmestmost professional staff. Amit's if in Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I enjoyed a lovely stay at La Sultana in September. All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly nothing was too much trouble. Five riads combined each has a different classical style and the pool area is a joy after a busy day in the soukhs. There is a large roof terrace where breakfast and dinner are served and my wife decribed her spa treatment as the best she's ever had. A short walk from the main square the hotel is well placed in the Medina. Our room was a bit dark but overall La Sultana was all we hoped for our 30th wedding anniversary.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An amazing hotel, staff and location
Review_Text: We loved everything abt this beautiful hotel. Must try is the shoulder of lamb at their restaurant! The rooms are beautifully appointed and pool and spa pools are great especially in the heat. The staff were fantastic in organizing transportation from airport & taking us on tours & driving us to Essouria.

We thoroughly enjoyed our recent 5 night stay at La Sultana in Marrakech. The hotel is very handy for Medina square and soukhs. The rooms are furnished very elegantly and we found the staff to be extremely efficient and polite. We could only fault one area and that is the rooftop area. Although we enjoyed breakfast and dinner here there is limited service throughout the rest of the day. Although there are plenty of sunloungers and a pool it is difficult to obtain drinks.    We would recommend that anyone wishing to visit the soukhs or nearby places of interest takes a local guide. We used a person called Ahmed which La Sultana arranged for us on two consecutive mornings and found him to be excellent. He also represented very good value for money.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Hitomi K wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: Very elegant and stylish the property's design are perfect match modern african and traditional morrocan. Every Front staff are all very fruent in English very helpful friendly and they could give some information precisely.  There is a restaurant at the roof high quality of cuisine and nice atmosphere and friendly staff as well. Hammam space are very elegant I could enjoy there during my vacation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Marco A wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: This Riad is the state of art for luxurious and amazing place in the tradition of this Country. Secluded from the noise You will just have to choose where to lay lazy.... The staff is always at Your service (my opinion is that the roof bar must be open till 1.00 am at least to enjoy the fantastic atmosphere of the night). All the rooms are different and furnished with taste. The location is perfect. The restaurant is fantastic for dinner on the roof terrace and the food quality is of high level.  Only one suggestion such a beautiful place must not accept kids under 12.  Nothing personal I have three but in my opinion You cannot oblige people that pay to go in such a relaxing place to listen the big mess that young kids normally do and it is good they do.  I will be back there for sure
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Graeme G wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: This was a very special time for us and we spent a lot of time trying to find a special hotel for a special week!..... This hotel exceeded all our expectations in particular the service nothing was too much trouble. I have used several SLH hotels over the years and this one tops the lot! My wife and I spend a lot of time travelling and staying in hotels all over the world so we are very particular in our choice. As far as Marrakesh as a city is concerned it is very hot and busy and the only aspect that put me off was the high pressure sales people in the streets and market. But go with this in mind and you can have some fun too haggling with them! If you don't like haggling and pressure the hotel pointed us to a HUGE emporium of everything literally a few yards from the hotel where you won't receive any pressure - pick a rainy day though (if you get one) because you will spend a long time browsing the three floors of this Aladin's cave!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our stay at La Sultana was perfect. We had high expectations and the place and staff exceeded them. The room was fabulous in decor and also very comfortable. The peace and serenity found in this place was amazing. The staff very welcoming and helpful. Nothing was too much for them.  Food was delicious and we really enjoyed dining under the stars on the La Sultana terrace.  The spa and treatments there are great.  I cannot think of one thing I would change as there was none.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This Riad will blow your mind. it is an oasis in the midst of mayhem. it was very hot in Marrakech when we visited and so we did sightseeing in the morning and then chilled by the pool in the afternoon. it was very quiet and peaceful. the staff were amazing and we were on honeymoon and they could not have done more for us spoiling us every way. thankyou!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Eric G wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: My partner and I recently spent 4 days at La Sultana during a week long trip to Morocco. The hotel is an oasis in the middle of the absolutely crazy Medina in Marrakesh. This is one of the nicest hotels we've stayed in anywhere. We stayed in a Deluxe suite which was very large and decorated beautifully and the pool area and roof deck are gorgeous places to hang out during your stay. All of the staff were extremely attentive and handled our every need from arranging a tour guide to a day excursion to sending out my sandals which had broken and having them back repaired in less than 24 hours. The spa is also very beautiful but it's overpriced for what you get. I enjoyed the traditional hammam bath but could have skipped the massages for that price  which is very high. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are interested in having a luxury hotel experience while also having an authentic Moroccan one.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I stayed at La Sultana for our honeymoon in August 2012. The hotel was simply breath taking. We stayed in a junior suite that we did not want to leave... were it not for the beauty of the rest of the hotel (especially the pool!).    Compared to the hustle and heat outside the walls the hotel felt like a cool palace a million miles away. The dÃ©cor is stunning the staff are great and the entire experience is overwhelming in the best possible way. A hotel like no other that you will remember for all the right reasons.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our frist trip to Morocco and we stayed in the beautiful La Sultana. It is in real even more gorgeous than on the pictures. Entering THE hotel was really entering another world. It is THE most beautiful hotel I have ever stayed and I would definately recommend it to everybody. It is not cheap but worth every penny. Some periods they have nice offers so you will be upgraded. We stayed in THE junior suite giraffe with a nice balcony. It was quality time with excellent service. Breakfast and diner on THE roof top was perfect. THE view amazing and THE location great. I love to go back Some time. Please keep THE elephant suite for me reserved ;-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: James N wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Text: We have just returned from the most amazing holiday. Truly one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff attention to detail was faultless and all the staff made our stay very memorable especially Saida. The roof top terrace with its views over the Medina was a beautiful setting and the food exceptional. The hotel is in a great location for the local town and is on tourist bus route which is a must. We cant wait to go back to the Oasis and planning a return trip already.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This place was an oasis of generosity and calm for me after a complicated start to my morocco trip where my accommodation fell through at the airport. After hours at the airport in extreme heat Nadia was very empathic and sweet and patient with me in my flustered and disorganised state. She helped me book a room and generously took time to give me clear and useful directions to get to the hotel. A big fat thankyou to our dear and genteel afternoon front desk person Khalid who followed through with our requests and bent over backwards to assist us with our every whim over our 2 day stay. He even preempted my wishes before I even made a request. Mohammed at the front desk was also jusy lovely and generous with his time assisting in arranging our forwarding itinerary.  Yes there are some hotel flaws - the rooms are dark but each riad we have seen since have often been dark - i think this is mostly an architectural aspect of the riad. And yes the food at dinner was pretty plain but who cares when the service is SO GOOD andq there are plenty of restaurants nearby if you are more particular about the quality of your food.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: If paradise had a pace on earth
Review_Text: We visited with my husband for our anniversary. Truly one of the best hotels I have ever seen. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff no detail was overlooked no request was denied. Amazing in every sense of the word. It is located in the old town which is very convenient for site seeing but it is a bit of a paradox as well...the hotel is luxury and peaceful and two steps from its entrance is the 'real' marrakesh. So be warned that the hotel s not a true depicition of morrocian realty... Nevertheless it is wonderful. Definitely try the restaurant and the lamb. one year later and we still dream of it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Silvia D wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Title: A peaceful oasis in the middle of the mad Marrakech
Review_Text: A really wonderful and charming hotel in the heart of the medina near to the place but far miles away from the noise and the pollution of the town. Personnal really kind and available to any request. A big and special thanks to Saida!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Muhamad N wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Title: Best team of staff ever met
Review_Text: Although we were a bit surprised about the location of the hotel in the old town the warm and sincere hospitality of the team of staff looking after guestsmade our stay very pleasant. We were deeply touched and are very grateful to every staff member.  Thanks guys for every thingyour smiles cooled Marrakesh temperature and made us feel truly at home with friends and family members.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A beautiful Hotel and very kind personnal.
Review_Text: A beautiful hotel and very kind personnal always avaiable. A good surprise in the Medina!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: What a hidden gem!! we arrived by taxi to the hotel - we felt like we had just been left on the side of a street. But when we turned into the entrance - what a wonderful surprise. Stunning hotel great staff and service - a place of peace away from the fantastic chaos going on beneath you. The room was fantastic ( I don't think we had the best room though) - extremely tastefully decorated. We went to relax and an unwind - it could not have been a better choice. The staff were genuinely excellent - and the restaurant food was brilliant. Actually my favourite food was the beautiful salad we had at lunch by the pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: If there was a seven star rating La Sultana would be worthy of it. The staff here Saida and Xavier to name a few made our stay one to remember for life. Nothing is too small to ask for. The attention to detail here is outstanding. The 'Elephant Suite' where we stayed could be front cover of Contde Naste Traveler as the room is simply awesome and an interior designers heaven.    Having traveled the world the spa is the best. A massage by Ilam (Yasmin) was a trip to heaven after a long day negotiating in the Souks and looking at film locations.    The roof top restaurant is the most romantic place for dinner in Marrakech and the food outstanding.    We will be back - been twice - can't wait for the third time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Nice place in a good location
Review_Text: The hotel is very well decorated and the rooms are nice in size along with pretty large bathrooms they clean the rooms twice a day and turn down the bed sheets as well the staff is very friendly especially at the front desk we had a beautiful spa day excellent massage and traditional ham man the restaurant is just ok service is very slow and not great at rooftop restaurant great spa very beautiful hotel with a lovely pool n staff in a great location
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful place to stay while you are in Marrakech
Review_Text: First La Sultana is absolutely beautiful on the inside. And the swimming pool is an excellent feature (although we think thought that 7:00pm was too early for it to close).    Second the staff is just phenomenal. The service was just great. We really couldn't want for anything from them.    The food was very good... standard Moroccan with some European dishes mixed in. You wouldn't go wrong if you decided to stay at the Riad for dinner. The breakfast was excellent as well with many choices and quick effiecient service. We ate lunch a few times there are as well and although the menu was a bit limited everything we had was very good.    Our room was top notch and the air conditioning worked very well (an important feature for June in Marrakech!).    The Riad is a bit pricy but I never once felt like we made a bad choice or that the cost wasn't worth it. We really enjoyed our stay and were a bit sad to leave.    Highly recommended if you are looking for a 5+ star in Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Susan G wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: A glistening door greets you at the end of a narrow street and behind the door lied a true oasis. A truly beautiful riad the decor is stunning and our Lion suite was room after room and true Moroccan style.    A must is dining on the rooftop at sunset and breakfast on the roof is equally satisfying.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Heaven in the middle of mayhem ...
Review_Text: My husband and I celebrated our 10 year wedding anniversary in Marrakech all organised by the amazing Marrakech Boutique Souk who recommended and booked this amazing Riad for us. When our driver brought us to the small alley entrance to the Riad I thought I had booked the wrong place. This is one of the most wonderful places to stay when you enter this Riad it is like another world. Our junior suite was divine so quiet you would never think you are in the centre of Marrakech. Perfect for popping out and walking everywhere yet the most tranquil beautiful and quiet place to escape from the mayhem. The staff were impeccable nothing was ever a problem no matter what you requested so friendly and always asking if there is anything they can do or help with and how your day was. Boutique Souk organised a fantastic guide and amazing restaurants to suit our mood every night and were always at the end of a phone (which the driver gave you on arrival!) no matter what you wanted and the best tables restaurants. Will definitely return here again and can highly recommend La Sultana and also Boutique Souk to arrange everything for you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Its the most amazing place - totally outstanding!!
Review_Text: We spent our 10th wedding anniversary at this beautiful hidden gem and we spent the days walking around in the 5 " riads" repeating the word " amazing" all the time. New hidden treasures everywear. We were upgraded to the Girafe -room and then due to some minor electric problems upgraded to the outstanding Zebra-room. Rooms are fabulous roof-top restaurant and breakfast restaurant has a splendid view and the staff are so professional and friendly all the time. The spa was also a very nice experience. The hotel is well situated in walking distance to the big square and its such a relief to walk in to this hotel dream after all the hustle and bustle in the streets!!!! Bring your camera and a large memory stick - you will for sure need it with all the memorable sights in the La Sultana!!!  Best regards from Wenche Smestad and Trond Samuelsen form Norway!!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tamara S wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: A truly beautiful hotel right in the Kasbah with easy access to the "square" and souks. The hotel is an oasis of calm and cool a welcome releif from the noise and heat of the city and decorated a in traditional decor .  The staff make this hotel truly exceptional with friendly service they anticipated our every need and were never intruusive.  The roof top terrace is ideal for a leisurley dinner with cooling breezes and local musicians to serenade you.  You must try the spa which was a fabulous experience.  Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Abdullah R wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: Spent the first night of my trip to marrakech at this beautiful place. As someone who has visited a handful of other Riads and done extensive research online prior it lived up to expectation. Each of the five riads is even more beautiful than the other. The staff were brilliant and always helpful. My wife and i also had the pleasure of taking a one on one cooking class with the wonderful Chef Ibrahim and SuChef Khalid; a truly wonderful experience where we were even treated to a special live performance by the local musician on the Arabic Guitar ('Oud).    My only regret is that we stayed only one night here. The location is also great as it is much easier to access by taxi than other riads located inside the old Madina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: When you are in the hotel or having diner on the roof top listening to wonderful local music you can easily forget the hotel is in the city.    The rooms are very quiet the decor outstanding and the service exceptional. The outstanding management of this hotel is reflected everywhere you look. It may not have gardens but it has everything else - ambiance quality great food great service good value wonderful customer service outstanding rooms and it's very romantic.  Going back as soon as possible :)  NOT TO BE MISSED.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emma A wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: Our first time in Morocco... I splashed out a little on the hotel and hoped it would be worth it I was NOT disappointed.    As soon as we entered the street our bags were whisked away so we didn't have to lug them around we were escorted into a comfortable lounge to check in that was complete with fresh pastries and mint tea for us. They could not have possibly done more for us we were  Graded and received a voucher for a spa treatment free. We got a full tour of the five stunning riads that make up the hotel (each has a different style) and were shown everything we could possibly need to know. Soft drinks are complimentary and wifi is on the house too. We were told that during our day this is our home and it actually feels that way.    Service is impeccable everyone is smartly dressed. Everyday we have fresh rose petals placed on our new sheets and towels and the air con is a life saver in this heat!    The evening meal was beautiful (although expensive) and we didn't mind paying. I had scallops king prawn and ginger curry while my partner had a fillet steak and it was delicious. We were served tomato and mozzarella prior to this with tomato bread which was equally as yummy.    This hotel urged me to join trip advisor to write this review as it is truly unforgettable. Nowhere I have stayed before could possibly compare and I wish to return again and again. Go - its worth it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Paul T wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: We enjoyed our 7 night stay here so much last June that we were determined to return this year (we combined it with 4 nights at the unforgettable La Sultana Oualidia). Normally when you return to a place it never seems to capture the initial experience however La Sultana Marrakech is quite exceptional in every way and sheer beauty of the place grips you immediately. Saida (the manager) remembered us from last year and she really made us feel at home as did all of the same charming staff.  Once inside the old city walls Marrakech really is a "full on" experience think Indiana Jones and double it! The porters will be expecting you and they will be waiting to transport your bags up the tiny street to the hotel entrance once inside all is calming and tranquil the tinkling of the water fountains adding to the ambience. Delicious traditional Morrocan pastries and mint tea help you unwind.  Since we were splitting our 3 nights in Marrakech either side of the 4 nights in Oualidia we had 2 different rooms and all I can say is that the rooms are simply stunning (we stayed in Jaguar and Elephant) on the Africa floor (Zebra last year) each with a private balcony over the pool courtyard. La Sultana is a photographers paradise with so many details to capture what you see on the web-site is only scratching the surface of this incredible place.  Saida and her staff are always ready to help with any reservations or advice and they will make your stay an unforgettable experience. A charming taxi driver called Adelmoula (the hotel have his number) who speakes excellent English offered to show us some sights in the old part of Marrakech we hadn't seen before it was amazing. He took us to many places including The Museum of Islamic Scool of Music a bakers who bakes bread the way it has been done for thousands of years and a place where men shovel saw-dust into a furnace to heat hammams. He is very reasonable (cheap!).  Both breakfast and dinner are delicious pleasures at La Sultana and the settings are so romantic you will never want to leave the hotel but staff will make suggestions and bookings and lay on the transport for you. One night I left it to Sadia and she arranged a taxi which took us into the centre (5 minutes) where we transferred to a horse and cart for a short ride through the square to a recomended restuarant. The carriage driver returned after dinner to collect us (he was waiting) and a magical trip back to the hotel under the stars.  We have confirmed so many friendships and been treated so well (spoilt) we can't wait to return for a third visit next year!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is gorgeous.  It was my first time in Marrakech and wanted to stay somewhere where it felt like Morocco.  La Sultana was perfect. The decoration is proper Moroccan. It's magical. This hotel is a place to see. It's like a museum!    The staff was very nice the atmosphere was amazing especially at night while having dinner. There is a man playing the "guitar" (Moroccan type of instrument) and singing. It's stunning.  The roof terrace is super nice especially under the stars!    The spa is good had a proper hammam and felt really clean!    The hotel is situated in the Medina so be ready to get hit by the "real thing" when you exit the door of hotel. It can be pretty hard to go out to reality. It was quite a shock for me the first day because I wasn't expecting all of this chaos. So it was always a pleasure/relief when I was back in the hotel.    If I had to go back to Marrakech I'd stay there again. I'd just take a bigger room because they might feel a bit claustrophobic to some people. The hotel is built around different courtyards meaning your windows face the courtyards and might not give enough light. I'd definitely go for a room on the 1st floor.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Greg P wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Title: So good that I registered to this site to spread the word...
Review_Text: I think the true test of a good hotel is not necessarily in its successes but how it deals with its mistakes or failures (no hotel is perfect after all). This hotel was truly beautiful and offered really great service but it truly distinguished itself with how it dealt with one of its mistakes (more on that at the end).    I stayed at La Sultana with my partner for a quick romantic getaway and we were drawn by the reviews on this site. They did not disappoint...we have had an amazing stay.  The roof terrace (where they take you for your check-in - inc. mint tea and lovely Moroccan pastries) was like a small paradise. Palm trees wicker chairs in the shade loungers with parasols (needed in June!) a plunge pool and a very helpful and attentive staff. In the heat of the afternoon there are misters under the gazebo spraying quietly to keep you cool. The pool in the courtyard was absolute tranquillity and lovely in the heat of Moroccan summer. We made excellent use of their Spa (a little expensive but well worth the top-class treatments) and would HIGHLY recommend a four-handed massage and a traditional hammam!    The Restaurant was lovely (we made a point to eat out on most nights but for our last dinner we couldn't resist the La Sultana tasting menu!) and the setting is truly perfect - up on the roof terrace with the musician and the adhan serenading you...it felt a little too good to be true at times! Breakfast was great and can be brought to your room at no extra cost.    As mentioned the worst part of our stay was the excursion to the Ourika Valley (including visiting a traditional Berber village) which the hotel arranged for us. This trip just went all wrong from the very start. The 'driver' / 'guide' could not speak English or French and he stalled our 4x4 several times (not giving us a great feeling of security as he drove along some VERY precarious roads in the High Atlas). He stopped at several unscheduled places (usually friends of his who tried to sell us things) and he didn't make any effort to speak to us or explain anything. To top it all off he took us to a restaurant for lunch which was FOUL! We both became ill as a result and could not go out the next day.    So why have I given La Sultana 5 stars despite this? Because I am willing to accept that this was caused by a bad tour agency and that the Hotel will not let this happen again. When we returned to the hotel and told them of our 'adventure' their reaction was admirable. Almost immediately afterwards the desk manager came to find us and apologised unreservedly. She offered an explanation made no excuses refunded the cost and offered another day trip gratis as compensation. We could not unfortunately take her up on the kind offer as we only had 1 more day in the country but even then she offered us a free guide to take us around Marrakech. I am sure if we had been able to stay at La Sultana any longer they would have more than compensated for this error made by the outside agency they used but perhaps this will have to wait until next time.    I can't say for sure if we will be returning to Marrakech but I can definitely say that if I do I would be staying at La Sultana.    Top Pros:  - Excellent staff who bend over backwards;  - stunning roof-top terrace and swimming pool; and  - great location.    Top Cons:  - Room was a little dark;  - pretty pricey (but they do offer a lot of freebies!); and  - the excursion (maybe source this yourself with a reputable company).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Hidden gem - perfect for a romantic getaway
Review_Text: We stayed at La Sultana for 5 nights from 4 June 2012. We were really impressed by the quality of the hotel and the decor in particular is just divine. We visited a number of the other hotels in Marrakech for dinner and La Sultana was by far the best we saw. The location is also perfect for visiting the sites of Marrakech and you feel completely protected from the hustle and bustle of the city going on around you.    Having seen the layout of the hotel I think in hindsight we would have asked for a room with as much light as possible. Our room was lovely and there are great little things like dates on the pillow and free soft drinks from the mini-bar that add those little touches to make a stay even better. However it was very very dark - there was one very small dark stained glass window which looked out onto a corridor which meant that in reality there is no natural light at all and I had a lot of trouble waking up in the morning. Having looked at the website again though it does warn you of this and tells you to mention it at the time of booking if you would like a room with natural light.    The hotel staff were very pleasant and courteous and always wanted to help any way they could. We ate dinner there on two nights and both nights asked for our tea to be brought to the room which they were happy to do. Saaida the general manager in particular deserves a special mention for being lovely and friendly. Everything was easy taxi's were arranged dinners booked and we were even checked in on the terrace with mint tea and a welcome tray of morrocan pastries.    We ate at the hotel three times twice for dinner (once the a la carte and once the tasting menu) and once for lunch. The tasting menu was absolutely divine and didn't suffer from the problem a lot of Marrakech seems to have which is to provide you with so much food it's wasteful and you cannot possibly finish. Other than that I think the dishes are a bit hit and miss. The lunch was perfectly nice and very tasty food and our starter of Morrocan salads from the a la carte was also by far the best we had with delicate spiced flavours. Unfortunately what let it down was the lamb couscous dish which I had on the first night. The lamb was by far the worst quality I had anywhere in Marrakech and was on a giant bed of flavourless couscous with a jug of some sort of stock which was supposed to be used as a sauce to provide flavour. The whole dish was a disaster and it was a real shame as everything else we ate at La Sultana was amongst the nicest food we had on the trip however the lamb dish sticks in my mind as the worst thing I ate. I would still recommend the food though and would definitely tell people to go for dinner on the beautiful terrace (avoiding the lamb dish!).    Unfortunately we arranged a tour through the hotel which did not go to plan and which we were very disappointed with and when we arrived back from the tour we did complain. Their response could not have been better they phoned the agency they use to establish what had gone wrong didn't charge us for the tour and offered us a chance to take another tour. Unfortunately we couldn't take them up on this as we were short on time but their response was really fantastic and I think in the circumstances they did everything they possibly could to compensate for the bad experience (even though it wasn't really their fault but the agency they book the tours through).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: best hotel I Â´ve ever visited
Review_Text: great location wonderfull rooms delicious food friendly and proffesional staff unforgettable stay in heart of marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: This is a lovely place as with most here the charm is well hidden behind a huge door in the corner of a bustling market. The central courtyard is beautiful you can breakfast or dine here beneath the palms. The food and service very good. The rooms are dark and cozy beautifully furnished and comfortable but definitely an AliBaba cave feel everything is oriented toward the interiors. I prefer light and openness so I would not plan a long stay. Bathrobes and Sultana toiletries are nice touches in the modern comfortable bathroom though even here we were told NOT to use the water for tooth-brushing or drinking. Really DONT it;s just how things are in Morocco even in the nicest hotel apparently. Nice touches like a book closet where you can help yourself to volumes left behind by others and leave one behind in return. The rooftop bar is magical and you can dine and watch the world go by in the streets below. A small gift shop with luxurious things too. Staff on the whole helpful but small front desk which can get a little overloaded on checkout - allow plenty of time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Experience was fantastic dinners were great on the roof terrace overlooking the kasbah    Very expensive but worth the money. Location just behind the main square of Marrakech and close to getting in and out of the city...

Review_Date: Laurent L wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: This hotel is the epitome of great taste. Impeccable service yet friendly luxury without pretention situated in an ideal location foot steps away from all the main attractions.    Food is great and rooms are gorgeous and the view from the roof terrace is breathtaking.    This hotel is an absolute must!!    L. Levac
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Philip R wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: This is one of those special places the service was excellent and the accommodation out of this world. We stayed in the Tiger Room (all the rooms were named after animals) it was truly special with a huge and comfortable bed and elegantly decorated. The various courtyards all had a theme and the facilities were luxurious yet tranquil. I had a massage which was sooo relaxing.    The location was great on the outskirts of the town and a short (10 minute) walk to the town square.    I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone considering a visit to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Cate S wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: We have stayed in a lot of hotels all around the world and this is our favorite by far. The rooms are extremely comfortable the service impeccable and breakfast delicious! Not only did the staff meet our every request promptly they actually anticipated our needs several times so we didn't even have to ask!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This was a last minute booking - all 5 star establishments were full. We booked La Sultana as it was a group of converted Riads. It is really in the most amazing spot in the old Kasbah near the city walls and easy distance to "must see" places. The roof terrace is a marvellous bonus and just finding your way around the corridors and stairways is a visual delight. The whole place is tastefully restored and very photogenic!!  The restaurant is excellent and the ambience due to the setting around a pool with candles everywhere is perfect after a day of sightseeing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: jaclyn s wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: Really the most luxurious and beautiful place to stay. I couldn't believe the atmosphere kind and thoughtful staff and delicious food. This place was the highlight in my long vacation and one of the fondest memories I will ever have. I can't recommend it enough to someone visiting marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Karen H wrote a review May 2012
Review_Title: Nothing was too much trouble which made for a wonderful trip
Review_Text: A beautiful tranquil setting amidst all the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. The staff made us feel extra special and we found th setting to be amazing. We would highly recommend La Sultana to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Dinner in the most beautiful place.
