Review_Text: We had drinks on the roof terrace stunning. The hotel is possibly the most beautiful I have ever been to. Dinner sublime setting just magical. YOU MUST GO!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Amazing service!  Beautiful pool!  Nice people!  Surely one of the best in the city
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Unique rooms with all the amenities you would need. Spectacular decoration and very well thought out for peace and relaxation very close to the Souks. One cant imagine such a nice hotel is hidden through the entrance. Quite an experience!    Great food too!    The Spa wasnt entirely up to par reservations were far in between with nothing to do while you wait for your slot.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Maggie G wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Title: An Oasis of Calm in the Kasbah
Review_Text: This is a gem of a hotel built around five ryiads conveniently located a walk away from the old town. We had an amazing three nights stay and were treated with impecable hospitality. The staff are a credit to the hotel always friendly and helpful and the facilities are very well maintained. We had the best massage ever thirty minutes of which were complimentary together with an unexpected room upgrade to a junior suite. Note that there are seven grades of rooms/suites to consider. We have already recommended La Sultana to a friend and would happily return again. Wonderful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: G P wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Title: best of marrakech in La Sultana
Review_Text: From the very first moment of the check in at La Sultana Hassan was our tour guide thru the lovely Riad(s)  the pool the overwhelming terrace  everything was great: Lovely suite at the African Riad an energy breakfast and the wise advice of the Reception Manager who organized our weekend accordings to our needs Our first experience in Marrakesh a 10/10  we definitely be back Besos!!! Don't miss at least one dinner near the pool..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Really a Small Luxury Hotel inside the Medina!!!  A charming atmosphere accompanied by a friendly but discrete treatment.  The only complain could be a limited space to place your suits.  Rooms quite spacious different styles but always very nice and elegant.  Unbelievable terrace joining forum different Ryads in the same location.  The restaurant is quite aligned with the best ones in Marrakech.  No words for Khalid the manager who was plenty of attentions for everybody.  I was there with my family and my friends and can grant that even if you are a golf player La Sultana is a great solution since in 15-20 minutes by car you can reach any course in Marrakesh but enjoying the Medina atmosphere for the rest of the day.  Very satisfied!!! I would recommend it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Karin Hewlett wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Text: We stayed for 1 week in La Sultana in February. It is a delightful place. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. We loved the atmosphere the roof terrace and dining area. The choice of meals on the terrace and in the restaurant were a delight. We strongly recommend the pidgeon pie. La Sultana is situated right in the middle of the busy life around. But a haven to relax in.  Karin H
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: olivia f wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Title: A relaxing haven among bustling Marrakech
Review_Text: The fragrant smells the smiles the mint tea and delicate Moroccan Pastries were just a few of the things that greeted us on our arrival to La Sultana.....from our first sit down in the exotic and calming courtyard we felt instantly relaxed and so comfortable among the friendly and discrete staff. The tortoise that walked into our sight was just a small indication of the quirks and atmosphere of this beautiful riad. We stayed in a lower tier price of room and it was perfect - the largest bed we've ever seen in a room rich with individual boutique features and double sinked bathroom - all very luxurious. the hotel has so many places to sit and read swim or sauna - but we found lying on the roof with a mojito in hand on a sunbed the most relaxing. I cannot rate this small hotel highly enough - treat yourself!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andrea G wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Title: La Sultana - Easter holidays in Marrakech
Review_Text: I'd like to recommed La Sultana Hotel for travellers who want to experience the true atmosphere of Marrakech and at the same time live in a small luxury hotel.    I spent Easter holidays with my wife our children and other 2 families of friends.  We all found the hotel its location at the heart of Medina and the service level as impeccable.    If you vist Marrakech and you have a solid budget...take the opportunity to stay at La Sultana the experience of a sunset on their terrace is unforettable.    If you are golfer despite there are many hotel closer to best courses I would still recommend La Sultana given that the driving distance is quite short and the atmosphere is completely different than the "conventional" hotels around the golf courses.    Andrea
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Our second stay in this exquisite hotel. French style with Morocan culture. What a combination!  Rooms that take you to another world of opulence and grace. Food skilfully prepared by attentive multi-lingual staff. Roof garden to sunbathe whilst listening to the busy market below. Cool sitting rooms where you can read surrounded by beautiful pictures and intricate Arabic mosaics and be served mint tea. A Spa where you can be pampered. And you walk out of the front door straight into the bustle noise and smell of Marrakech markets and souks. Something to suit everyone and a staff who become friends and ensure that your stay will be unforgettable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: paul h wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Text: You simply cannot fault this sumptuous hotel - first class location faciities service quality... You are looked after every moment of your stay in a perfectly discreet and non-intrusive way. In fact I recently stayed at the Savoy in London and the service at La Sultana was even better then the Savoy because it is a small boutique hotel so there is that added very personal touch. At over Â£200 a night it wasn't cheap but it was worth absolutely every penny. Marrakech is magical and when I go back I am positive I will stay at La Sultana.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Enrico S wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Title: Unique setting in the middle of the Kasbah...with few weak points
Review_Text: As a preamble i do stand by my title. It has been my first time in Morocco and Marrakech the Riad is in a great setting smack in the middle of a bustling area where few tourists go apart from the nearby Saadi's Tombs. Is enormously silent and quiet so if relax is what you are looking for than look no further.    At the same time as a seasoned traveller i have to point out few things that didn't quite worked so that the charming Xavier (Manager) might find how to fix it.    Roof restaurant    On our second from last day we came back quite late (3:30pm) to the Riad and asked if we could still eat. a nice asian lady told us 'certainly at the roof top restaurant'. we headed there and the table was been prepared for us. we were told no grill would have been available because of the late hour but anything else would. we therefore ordered two tagines of which we made a real diet during our stay. we ordered two sides of rice as well. my tagine arrived cold no rice. i asked for it to be heated up but i wasn't happy. after having being treated to so many good meals a cold tagine was a real disappointment. i reminded the waiter of our rices and i finally got one quite frankly unedible.    my point is if reception knows it's late please don't send clients to the restaurant for them to be treated like this. i am sure this will be corrected    Femme de chambre / cleaners    We stayed 5 nights. everyday the room clening was a surprise in itself. one day there were no liners in the bins. another there were liners but no pillow cases. a third there were pillow cases and liners but no hand towels...i mean come on!    SPA    We went once and we tried a relaxing massage side by side. if you have tried massages in Thailand then do not go.    Spa is in the lower ground and welcomes you with a beautiful marble pool. unfortunately the water is cold and having a jacuzzi cold is not my idea of jacuzzi.    Excursions    we spent a whole day with Assan and a private car. we were told it would have been a 4x4 and it wasn't but it was still a great day out in the Atlas Valley. Assan is a great guy and clearly knows his trades. strongly recommend.    Language    If people think all moroccans speak english and french please reconsider. the cleaning staff doesn't and their french is not the french we are taught in europe. it will require extreme patience when ordering room service and dealing with staff in general. it's the way it is and there is nothing anybody can do. just be warned.    Lounge bar    La Sultana has a lounge bar designed as a transatlantic bar. one evening we spent 15' there hoping to have a tea. noboby ever showed up and we left...    MARRAKECH    Marrakech taxis    Main mean of transport for us. they will never use the meter and if asked might even get angry. apart from this they are very friendly and at the end of the day cheap so it's an acceptable flaw.    Main Square    If i were you i would avoid it. it's a tourist trap with terrible food on sale in nearby restaurants. rather go to the huge souk that starts from its back.    Conclusion    I loved Marrakech and La Sultana. i think we overstayed and maube a shorter stay would have been enough. The Riad is great and has fantastic design.    hope it helps.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: La Sultana Marrakech is maybe one of the best hotels I have ever been. To start they don't make you stand in the reception but they offer you to seat in one of the wonderful patios and they do all the check in there while they offer you a delicious mint tea with traditional sweets! Then they guide you through the hotel. This is the way to start a unique experience!!! I was travelling with my partner and we felt all the time very welcomed. We are now in love with the hotel.    La Sultana it's based on 5 different riads but which all make a singular and unique building very stylishly decorated. The have (I'm sure) the best terrace in Marrakech! with views to la Kasbha or Koutoubia mosques to the Atlas to the Saadian tombs.... It's an amazing experience to have a drink for the sunset.The rooms are splendid full of comfort and amenities.    The room service the reception and restaurant staff are highly professional they are always friendly they get all what you want (specially appreciated are the honest taxi drivers!!!). Maybe some of the waiters of the terrace could be a bit quicker... but is it really important when we are on vacation and we have great views?    It's not a hotel in the Ville Nouvelle it's in the Medina - so of course the streets are a bit messy. However it must be said that around the Kashba mosque the area has been renovated and cleaned. From inside La Sultana we get no sounds from the streets.    To sum up: La Sultana is maybe the best hotel in Marrakech. It's expensive (and really the access to the spa could be included....) but it does live up to the expectations! I 100% recommend the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed there for 4 nights with my family (2 young boys). Our room was very nice in a typical Morrocan style. Very nice breakfast. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and looked after us during our stay. The hotel has free wifi (also in the rooms). It has an indoor heated pool right next to where you have breakfast and dinner. It also has a wonderful terrace where there is a small pool and where you can have lunch and get something to drink. Our guide Hassan was very good with us and went out of his way to fulfill our requests (children and a birthday). He drove us around Morocco and helped us with our purchases. Thank you very much. Only negative side of the hotel is that we couldn't really go out walking buy ourselves at night as there wasn't anything or anywhere near to go to. But the hotel offers you everything you need.

Review_Date: farid m wrote a review Feb 2012
Review_Text: I've done many hotels but this remains a very unique experience.  The staff was so friendly that I just don't have any words to describe it!!  Thank you for the wonderful care.  And a very big thank you to our driver Anouar!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Laetitia P wrote a review Feb 2012
Review_Text: It was unexpected to be wellcomed like we were... Upgrated because on honey moon amability and efficience of the whole team.... A dream into reality... The shock going outside is hardest...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Have just returned from a week's trip to Marrakech and we both were not too happy in our comfort zone. However after 3 days with the incredible service provided by La Sultana as well as many great tips on where to eat our trip ended up being fantastic. If you want to be spoilt this hotel is a definite MUST!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sarah H wrote a review Feb 2012
Review_Text: We have just returned form a truly fantastic time at the la Sultana.We were made to feel like royalty from the moment we arrived and upgraded to the best suite as well!The staff were incredibly politeattentive and welcoming and went out of their way to make us feel special.    The whole place has a magical 'Arabian nights' feel and the decore is fabulous.Birds sing in the courtyardsfountains tinkle in the background and there are even resident tortoises who may cross your path once in a while....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: If you are looking at the Sultana then think no further - just book it! It is just the most wonderful oasis in the heart of the Medina. The architecture is just fabulous and the attention to details is just wonderful. There are 5 riads all joined together but each with a different theme. There are so many different areas to sit that you will not be bumping into any other guests. The rooms are all wonderful. We started off in the least expensive - but it was absolutely gorgeous. There is NO 'basic' room in this hotel! The only thing I would have added to the room was a docking station. For our last night the hotel manageress insisted on upgrading us because of a comment we had made (it was not a big problem but in the mornings we could hear the cleaners on terrace above us). We were moved to a Deluxe Suite - wow!!! I think we could have had about 6 of us in the bed it was so large! All the rooms have their own theme and each one is different. We also used the spa - absolutely recommend the Hammam - I don't think I have ever been so clean. We also dined at the hotel every night as the food and the service was really great and just delightful in the soft lighting.  I really can't think of a negative to say about this hotel - just book it!  Many thanks to all the staff who made our time so special.  Mr & Mrs Rickman England
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Julie B wrote a review Feb 2012
Review_Text: From the minute we were greeted by the La Sultana staff we both felt very priveleged and pampered. My husband had an accident which involved an overnight stay in hospital and without the help from Saida in La Sultana we would have found the experience very difficult.  I enjoyed the experience of making lamb tagine one morning and then eating the results for lunch! Throughout our week's stay all of the staff were very kind and helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: We had a wonderful stay at la sultana, will be visiting again!
Review_Text: Highly recommended. Cannot fault hotel staff & location.

I visited on Friday 3rd of February and had one of the two tasting menus. It was one of the most memorable meals of my long life. The style taste could not be bettered in any Michalin starred restaurant. I would advise any one to go for a remarkable experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: After opening the golden gate you enter an superior quit en stylish atmosphere!  The management is very kind and helpfull. I was there with a friend (2 ladies) we booked another small road where we stayed 3 nights and for the last night we gave ourselves a thread for a 1 night stay at La Sultana. Anyway whenever I would go back to Marrakech I would go back to this place. In the evening we had dinner next to the swimming pool with some nice musicians next to the pool food was excellent. The rooms are very spacious and more then comfortable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Unexpected oasis with a few remarks
Review_Text: Very quiet inside the property (although located on a very busy area). There is a short strow -pedestrians only - from the street to the hotel entrace that was not very nice with construction works going on and quite dirty that the hotel itself could have taken care of cleaning. Also there was no internet connection in our room. The concierge service was amazing! Very attentive and much better than the cleaning staff that was pretty intrusive and lacked trainning. I believe they are working on getting it all on track and would definetely recomend the hotel. Breakfast was delicious!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bjorn P G wrote a review Feb 2012
Review_Text: Coming throught a dusty road filled with people and their small outlets you open La SultanaÂ´s gold door and youÂ´re suddenly in another world! As our guide put it: " In Morroco in contrary to Europe they put the beatiful things on the inside not on the outside.    The hotel is quiet clean and has fabolous rooms with great architecture. A very friendly staff helped us in a great way with anything we asked for.    My wife and I stayed here to participate in the Marrakech Marathon. (Which we also reccomend!) The hotel is really great and i reccomend it to anyone coming to Marrakech. After a day haggling and constantly finding yourself surrounded by people this is a great place to kick back. After the marathon we took a 4 hour full service SPA incuding massage and hammam! Wonderful!  We can not find anything to critcize but it not the cheapet place in town.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Rooms are beautifully organised around little fountains which gives the whole thing a very intimate and friendly look. The location is perfect just on the edge of the Kasbah and the food is very good
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bernardo T wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Title: Very good atmosphere! Great service and creative architecture!!
Review_Text: We came to spend a couple of nights here actually choice was based on tripadvisor!  We got the "la giraffe" with balcony overlooking the pool - very nice.  The service is very friendly and respectful.  I found it to be very well located as we didn't feel like waking up every morning in the middle of the souks - rather having the choice to "dive" in or stay in the Hotel - the terrace is amazing about 1000m2 overlooking the city!    We scheduled a meeting with the concierge to know the do's and don'ts - very friendly!  Loved the bathroom! And the food is quite good!  The Spa is great and the treatments are to remember!    Would definitely come back!!  Enjoyed it! Nothing negative to say at all.  Sorry that only got to see the house turtle once... So cute!

Hidden in the middle of the Casbah within the walled Medina La Sultana is in fact five â€œriadsâ€ converted into one property. Interconnected by a series of corridors and stairways each riad has been individually designed and furnished in a highly eclectic and most comfortable style. Rooms look inward (as is the Morrocan tradition) to beautiful courtyards and some on the upper level have balconies. In high season (or when the hotel is fully occupied) there could be a feeling of being â€œoverlookedâ€ but this is a small price to pay for the degree of calm La Sultana provides in the midst of the bustle which is Marrakech. The roof-top terrace has views over the Casbah and Medina.  Our Deluxe Suite had three spacious well appointed areas - living room bedroom and bathroom; free soft drinks in the mini-bar comfortable bed i-pod docking station flat screen TV twin-sinks in the bathroom corner Jacuzzi-style bath and walk-in shower (door/screen would be nice so as to control overflow!)  The staff are remarkable; they achieve the impossible by being there when required and discreet as necessary. Service is superb. Breakfast looks modest but is in fact a feast with breads cold cuts and cheeses supplemented by delicious local delicacies cooked on demand with the most amazing date milk and the freshest fruit juices and is served overlooking the small pool. The camel is a nice touch! Dinner is also served here and has the additional charm of having a musician playing in the background. The food was great and service is second to none. Dine here even if you are not a resident guest.  La Sultana is a luxury retreat an oasis of tranquillity and provides a welcome traditional and different alternative to the big hotel groups. You feel as though you are in a different world enhanced by the service given throughout this beautiful riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Galli D wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Text: We have spent 6 marvelous days in this elegant riad. The personnel is kind smiling and very available. The evening of New Year's eve the supper and the environment were taken care of even more and pleasant. The SPA allows really to relax and to be able to enjoy some pleasant treatments. Also the central location allows to stir afoot.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Not quite as good as we expected
Review_Text: La Sultana initially didn't quite satisfy our (high) expectations and in the end I don't think we'll return.    We had looked at the pictures on the website and expected something in a similar style (simple and elegant white walls) yet were given the Ibis room which was simply quite ugly to us: yellow-orange walls with blue curtains and no natural light except for yellow and blue stained glass windows high up on one side of the room. The bathroom was a bit of an oddity with a bathtub that was fit for a small child at the end of a little passage but it looked nice enough.    When we asked if for a shisha (waterpipe) the first night on the roof terrace we spent ten minutes smoking on a chilly terrace to be charged 35 euros. We were also told that that charge had to be in cash and could not be part of our extras so it felt like even in our hotel we had to be aware of being ripped off. By then we got into a bad mood and decided to complain about the room we were given (being so different from what we had seen on the Sultana website). Our last and fourth night we were given an upgrade which made up for these discomforts to an extent (better to have had no discomforts in the first place).    Be aware also of the prices in the spa where a half-hour massage is 50 euros and the only free thing available is the jacuzzi which we tried out and was crowded.    We did enjoy the morroccan cooking course but again 80 euros per person seemed a bit extravagant.    Disregarding the prices the hotel was good but didn't blow us away. Good food and service but nothing amazing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Stunning place, great atmosphere and service
Review_Text: Tucked away in a small street in the Medina this Riad is an Oasis in the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Service was impeccable from reception to assistance with excursions. We had a memorable dinner at the restaurant and contrary to some of the comments we could not fault the quality and imagination of the food.  Beautiful rooftop lounge bar with views of the Atlas mountains.  Would definitely recommend and visit again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I came for dinner and drinks at La Sultana - this is one of the most beautiful spaces we have encountered on our travels. The meal was delicious and such a great value (~100 euros total with 1 shared appetizer 2 entrees a higher-range bottle of wine at 35 euros plus 4 drinks). We were seated by the pool and a lute player played music the entire evening for our meal. This hotel is probably one of the most amazing spaces in Marrakech and is must-do during your trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: I can't wait to return to La Sultana!
Review_Text: My one week stay at La Sultana exceeded all my expectations.  The food was delicious the service exquisite (thank you to the lovely Jamila and the rest of the team!) and the rooms very comfortable...it felt like being at home but so much better! Also the location of the Riad is ideal in the city centre (in walking distance of the Jemaa el-Fna) yet hidden.  I already miss Sultana breakfasts with Pomegranate salads and Date Milk.  Look very much forward to returning soon definitely no. 1 choice in Marrakech.  Thank you ever so much for being such great hosts!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Indeed You Will Feel Like a Sultan
Review_Text: I recently had dinner at La Sultana and was incredibly impressed with the property staff and restaurant. I did not stay at this Riad but stopped in one afternoon whilst in the Kasbah to inquire about directions around Marrakech and get a tour of the property. The staff was amazingly attenttive spent time making recommednations providing direction giving me a tour of the property then booking a table for dinner the next night. When I arrived the next eve the staff remembered my name greeted my warmly and escorted me to a wonderful dinner around. Started with drinks on the rooftops with the long view over the Medina then dinnner around a glowing pool with top-notch service food and drink. A thoroughly enjoyable experience. They could not have made me feel more welcomed if I had been staying there which indeed I will next time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: 5 wonderful days and nights at this superb Hotel.The room was comfortable in every respect all the staff were exceptionally helpful (nothing was too much trouble) and the location was ideal near enough to the action but far enough away to be peaceful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: heather t wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Text: Hidden away from the hussle and bustle of local Marrakech this is a haven of beauty luxury and calm. This beautiful Riad excels all expectations of even the most discerning customer. The opulence of the decor and high standard of accomodation is made even more special by the wonderfully attentive personable staff and the top grade standard of cuisine. The dining area surrounds the most beautiful indoor pool which contributes to its peaceful tranquil atmosphere.  La Sultana THOROUGHLY deserves its already first class reputation and I fully intend to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bernice P wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Text: We spent a week at this lovely hotel and were thoroughly spoiled the staff were excellent and had a good sense of humour. Hidden down an alley away from the hustle and bustle that is Marrakech you enter a different world with beautiful riads each with its own unique decor with luxurious rooms leading off them. The food was delicious with a large choice of Moroccan and European food.  The web site does not do justice to the charm of the place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We arrived yesterday and have been amazed by the beauty of the buildings the decadence of the room and the service.    We have tried a lot of the spa treatments already and I would recommend the 50min massage and the angel skin hamman.    The food is wonderful and the atmostphere takes some beating. As I'm writing this we are overlooking the pool and it is all lit by lights.    I would absolutely recommend this as a place to stay. They have arranged a tour guide camel riding (which we do in the morning) and have been very helpful in everything that we have asked. It is my birthday today and I've also recieved a present! The manager Xavier has a wonderful sense of humour and Ghislaine deserves a special mention along with all the members of staff in the spa.    Overall the hotel has been the highlight of our trip so far!

Review_Date: Reese L wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Text: Although a fairely regular user of tripadvisor.com I don't typically take the time to comment on my stay at particular hotels. Most of the time the stay is "fine" so I don't bother to highlight anything in particular. Our most recent stay at La Sultana however is worthy of note.    We have traveled extensively around the world for both business and pleasure. As a result we have experienced a very wide range of accommodations from the lowliest hostel-style bare bones rooms to the finest five-star resorts. La Sultana stands out among all the great hotels of the world that we've visited.    From the moment we arrived in reception to the moment we departed for the airport at the end of our stay we were struck by the incredible level of service we received. Beyond the truly magnificent architecture and interior design details of La Sultana the staff rates among the best we've ever encountered. Hassan and Saida (I hope I spelled their names correctly!) in particular were gracious accommodating and unflappable as we peppered them with typical tourist questions as well as several special requests designed to accommodate our limited schedule in Marrakech.    By the end of our stay our discussion had turned from "Where do we want to go next?" to "How soon could we arrange to come back?" La Sultana offered everything we look for and more. In short we would highly recommend this property to anyone anytime.    To the skeptical (or jaded) traveler I say "You won't be disappointed." To the excellent staff of La Sultana I say "Well done....and thank you! We will see you again!"    Reese Lackey and Greg Erfani (Nov. 2011)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A great place to escape to if you want some winter sunshine in an oasis of calm set overlooking a lagoon. Excellent service in charming surroundings. Beautiful gardens. A fabulous indoor pool and a gorgeous outdoor pool as well. The staff will do their best to provide whatever you want whether it is a private picnic on an island or a trip to a local souk. Nothing is too much trouble. It seems a long way from home but is only a short flight and the whole trip was beautifully organised by Red Savannah.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This was an amazing experience. the staff were so welcoming and helpful going out of their way to assist. The hotel is a gem. The photos say it all.    I have never been anywhere like this before and I really enjoyed my stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is wonderful well located the most beautiful decoration you can imagine and full of details.  The service deserves a special mention (Mohammed thanks for all your advices and your charming atention speaking with your fluent spanish!!!) the food is very good the rooms are comfortable and nice decorated.....  You feel like Sherezade
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jose b wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: We are a Spanish couple and stayed in la Sultana for a long week-end in October 2011.The riad itself can in our view not be parised enough: the location is very good (just a 10 minute walk to Jaama-el-Fna) the riad is very nice with very different decorations (from almohade to arabic-andalousian) the spa is very nice (don't expect a big pool though) rooms are tastefully decorated food is top class and the attention at reception is truly admirable (would like to single out the Spanish speaking guy at rÃ©ception and Mayumi). The only downside we found was service at the restaurant which is very interested in ensuring that you are happy but the takes forever...  All in all a fantastic place worth going back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: veron p wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: La Sultana offered a welcome sanctuary away from the hustle and bustle of the colourful and lively streets of Marrakech. The setting was as I imagine the palace to be in Arabian nights exotic with the most incredible architecture. The facilities were fantastic and well maintained. The staff were charming and always willing to offer assistance and advice. We would definitely go back or recommend to others.  I felt a real sense of detachment from reality once inside which allowed me to indulge my senses and appreciate how lucky I was to be there yet still be right there in the heart of the Marrakech ready to take on the wonderful souks within easy reach.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Tucked away in a small alley in the Old Medina La Sultana is a wonderful and perfect setting for my idea of Marrakech. Away from the dust and maddening touts La Sultana is a peaceful oasis where the beauty of the furnishing and riads can be appreciated close up. Consisting of five riads all the rooms are exquisitely furnished down to the littlest detail.    Not to miss is the lone musician strumming his exotic moroccan instrument and singing by the pool in the evenings. The luminescent pool lights and the traditional brick ceilings provide a very surreal atmosphere and immediately transports the listeners to the old Marrakech.    The spa and hammam was a little less deserving on accolades as we found the ladies handled us rather roughly however the resting room was another beautiful setting.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed 4 nights at this beautiful Riad  Outside our room was an open courtyard and we were woken in the morning from a glorious dawn chorus from small birds  Every corner of the hotel was absolutely beautiful and so peaceful amazing considering the hustle and bustle in the street outside  The spa was terrific with really good treatments  When anything was not right it was put right immediately  The GM was always around and available which is why it was such a lovely experience  We were not impressed with our dinner That was the only negative  Breakfast however was fine!

Review_Date: Susan T wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: WeÂ´ve seen a lot of wonderful hotels but "la Sultana" is the best weÂ´ve ever seen. It is a dream becoming reality.  We stayed in the "tiger suite" and it was quiet and clean.  After visiting the medina relax by the pool is recommended.  The staff is discreet and obliging.    You canÂ´t do it better!!!!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: All your fairytale wishes come true
Review_Text: This is the most professional hotel I ever visited (and I did visit a lot of hotels for professional reasons). We had a very warm welcome with an individual approach. When we arrived they gave us a tour in the hotel and a welcome tea. (with delicious sweets) We made reservations for dinner. It was amazing. Very tasteful and fine typical food. We enjoyed the relaxing swimmingpool and the sunterrace with plungepool. Breakfast was served on the roofterrace and was perfect. You had a lot of choice (pancakes eggs fruit cheese meat bakery fresh orange juice...)  The service was great! If i return to Marrakech I would definitely go back. It was wonderful to be a little princess for a few days. A big thank you to the hotel!  Wendy Van Driessche
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: GARRY n V wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Title: Beautiful Riad & Excellent Service but they forgot to pick us up from the airport
Review_Text: We booked a honeymoon special with the basic room for 3 nights which includes hamman + 30mins massage each. It's pretty good value.    The Riad Hotel is beautiful. One of the most beautiful & quaint places we've stayed. Chill out on the roof besides the pool and the awesome spa.    The only disappointment would be our room. As it's the cheapest it's the ugliest :( we had a nosy of the suites and they are amazing. I guess u pay for what u get.    Attention to detail lacks a bit for a 5* hotel but they are very tentative. Well done Khalaid! You made our stay very enjoyable.    Food is ok. But nothing to rave about. Especially for a 5* hotel.    If u can afford it don't book the Cigonge Room.    Oh. They also forgot to pick us up at the airport but that's no big deal. They arrived 15mins after we called them.    Overall an enjoyable stay.

La Sultana is a fantasy made in to a reality. The hotel consists of five connecting riads each with a different decorative theme. We stayed in the Camel Suite on the first floor.  Upon walking through the front door of the hotel you are immediately struck by the peace and serenity of the place. The reception staff greet you with real warmth and friendliness. Khalid who signed us in and not by way the way on reception but in a beautiful room off one of the many courtyards was friendly informative and professional.  Our room was spacious and again beautifully decorated. Everywhere was spotlessly clean. The roof terrace where we took our meals was again beautiful There were plenty of sun loungers and seating on the terrace. The small plunge pool was small but it was a plunge pool not a swimming pool. From the roof terrace you could look down on the market outside the hotel. The calm of the hotel seemed a different world away from the street.  The food was excellent and well presented and the service exceptional. The waiter Said who we saw most off was friendly and attentive and it was a pleasure to meet him.  The swimming pool was quiet and perhaps we were lucky for we only saw two other people around the pool whilst we were there.  The service and attention to detail was excellent the rose petals in the bathroom for example and I would certainly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jo C wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Text: I actually thought I had died and gone to heaven. Such a serenely calm hotel. Every member of staff went out of their way to care for us. The surroundings were not only sumptuous and comfortable but also a fascination to our eyes. Each area has its own individual theme with exquisite detail in every corner. Everywhere was immaculately clean and the food was wonderful. I strongly recommend a trip to the spa where any last remaining stresses will be rubbed and washed away from you. Fantastic!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: The perfect oasis amidst the hustle and bustle
Review_Text: La Sultana Marrakech    We have stayed in several world-class hotels; Hotel Splendido in Portofino Four Seasons Sultenahmet in Istanbul Claridges London and Mandarin Oriental in Bangkok to name a few. To date these have been our favorite hotel experiences but coming away from Morroco (I am on the plane as I type!) we feel that La Sultana Marrakech has surpassed all of them.    This hotel is like an Alladin's cave full of treasure! The architecture is stunning and the furnishings palatial. But the jewel in this crown is the unbelievable level of attention and service offered by every member of staff. Saida says 'welcome home' as you come through the door - at first it might seem like a presentation for the cynical Englishman. But after staying a few days you realise that they really mean it!    Marrakech was great we loved the Souks and we adored Hamid's balloon ride and visit to a Berber village. But for us Marrakech will always mean La Sultana... One of life's treasured memories for the fortunate few.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Deborah B wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Title: A wonderful way to spend our 25th Wedding Anniversary!
Review_Text: We stayed at La Sultana at the end of Ramadan and celebrated our anniversary on the same day as Eid. This all added to the excitment of the holiday and did not cause any problems regarding food or service etc.  La Sultana was a true sanctuary in what can only be described as the madness of Marrakesh! After some very interesting visits to palaces and the souks to come back to La Sultana and enjoy our lovely air conditioned room fantastic service and great food was heaven on earth!  We were given excellent advice on restaurants and trips by Mohammed in reception and enjoyed chatting with waiters in the restaurant. Although if you don't want to chat they are the most descreet and accommodating staff we have ever come across. We ate several lunches and a couple of dinners at the retaurant everything from traditional Morroccan to club sandwich all fantastic.  We can recommend the excursion to Kasbah de Toubkal - which is a stunning hotel retreat in the foothills of the Atlas mountains - a great day trip to see a different side of Marrakesh! Although if you are not at least moderately fit - take the option of the mule - fun and a lot easier to breath at this altitude! This was all arranged by the hotel for us even though we did not make up our minds to go until 10pm the night before!  All in all a brilliant holiday and we hope to be back soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: ve r wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Text: La Sultana is the most lovely riad in Marrakech. Prior to first arrival to the door it is very unsettling as i learned most of Marrakech is. Once inside the doors past the pre- reception front desk it all changes you are transported to a place you dont want to leave. Wonderful design in this Riad  it is world class. The rooms are amazing and like out of a movie. Each one is unique and most have some sort of soaking tub and an internal courtyard balcony.  We were there early and midweek and several rooms were empty so i got to peak in. We had a suite that was very spacious. The first thing i did was crack the champagne and take a long bath in the sunken round tub. Complementary soft drinks water  fresh fruit and pistachios were refreshed throughout our stay.  The restaurant is open for all meals and the best thing is eating on the roof top here there is a bar and small plunge pool.  The spa is nicely decorated and soaking pool is amazing but the massage rooms and massage was noisy and average. Stick with the hamams.    I was glad we stayed at this beautiful one of a kind riad. If i return to Marrakech in future i will consider returning here. The service was fantastic and the beauty of design were top reasons. You need a convenient and top quality place to come back to after experiencing the chaos of old Marrakech. This one is close to the walls of the city and very easy to get to the new city just outside if you need a break. We had friends on the same trip and they were exhausted just getting back to their Riad everyday because of its location. Something to think about and something we thought in the beginning to be a disappointment in the beginning turned out to be a great asset.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A Stunning Hotel with exceptional service..
Review_Text: Just returned home after 4 days at this Hotel and from the moment we stepped foot inside to the moment we said goodbye we loved it. This hotel is made up of 4/5 Raids that have been decorated to the highest standard. Each Raid has a slightly different feel but all to a high standard. When you walk into the main reception area from the chaos on the street its like an oasis of beauty. We took the transfer from the airport which I recommend as the hotel is not easy to find its about 150 dhm more than a local taxis but worth it. When we arrived we were seated in a stunning room and given fresh mint team and local pastries while the front desk checked us in. We arrived at 10am and the room was not officially ready until 3pm however after some drinks on the roof terrace we were shown to our room at 11:45. The hotel had upgraded is to a suite deluxe with balcony overlooking the pool the Giraffe room. A lovely room everything you need and the balcony was great. We ate in the roof terrace most nights as the food and service was excellent. The sweets are the best the chef specialism is great puddings. The service was excellent at all meal times breakfast was simple but enough choice and the staff would more or less make anything for you. They often referred to the hotel as a home and guest should treat it that way We had a complementary Hammam scrub in the SPA as we are SLH.com members We loved it and regretted not going for more treatments as its was reasonably priced.    Overall this was a great break a stunning hotel and the service was first class. The management were always around helping and took a real interest to ensure the guests felt at home.    We plan to go back and maybe try the other hotel in the group.    Try the tasting menu and the Moroccan pancakes for breakfast. The rooftop plunge is great to cool off in and let me know if you ever see anyone in the gym we did not... The free non-alcohol in the room is a nice touch as is the internet access and ipod dock.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is just superb. Very traditional with Moorish and Moroccan furnishings. The bathroom was large and well appointed in the finest marble. The breakfast was good with traditional moroccan mint tea. We ate traditional moroccan food in the evening which was excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Katie N wrote a review Aug 2011
Review_Title: Very Nice Hotel, But I Don't Think I'd Go Back
Review_Text: My sixteen year old son and I stayed at La Sultana last December for a week and found it to be a beautiful and fascinating hotel although a bit different than what we expected. It was quite difficult to get to by car and by foot because the entire area in front of the hotel had been reduced to impassible rubble by some kind of road construction. We had rented a car and literally spent hours just trying to find the place then weren't able to get the car (and our luggage) anywhere near the hotel itself - THEN were told that we had better move our car or we would be getting a very expensive ticket. Ugh. Hardly the reception one expects at "The Small Luxury Hotels of World".    Each of the room is set up around a central square "medina" style. I had booked a large room (not the cheapest room not the most expensive as I recall). Well when they put us in our room it had shuttered windows that opened up onto the pool/restaurant area and was about 10 feet by 7 feet. People in the pool/restaurant smoke quite a bit so there was constant smoke coming in the room through the shutters - not to mention that the room was dark (because it was either smoky and light and no privacy or dark and a bit smoky).  So it was not a great situation.    By the second night they moved our room but by then I really felt like the whole trip was tainted by my complaining about this and that. And you know the hotel is quite expensive it should have just been great from the beginning.    There are so many awesome places in Marrakech I think I stay somewhere else next time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Me and my husbannd travelled in August 2011 to Marrakech and we stayed for 4 nights at "La Sultana". Even outside is a lot of noise as the hotel is into the Medina (old town of Marrakech) inside there is quiet and peacefully a true oasis. The highlight is the swimming pool and the architecture of the whole place as there have been used these colourful morrocan tiles everywhere and the hotel consists of 4 riads. We stayed at the "Morrocan style" riad and our room had an astonishing bathroom. The hotel also had spa (which we didn't use) and restaurant (which we only ate one evening and it was so and so). The breakfast is very good and we were served from a menu. Service is excellent. They cleaned our room twice a day!!! We've chosen it because we wanted good service and something traditional of Morroco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Most beautiful hotel of Marrakech. Authenticity of a very high level - better than Mammounia. Rooms excellent spa excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The beauty of the intimate riads in Morocco is that you so often feel like you are staying in someone's home rather than a faceless hotel. I have had the good fortune to stay in several riads in Morocco and I do have an absolute favourite but I still like to try other riads for a few nights before returning to my No1. On this trip I decided to start my trip with a stay at La Sultana as many people rate it the best riad in Marrakech - so I had very high expectations. Upon making my reservation I noted a small detail - La Sultana  charge to collect you at the airport - no other riad has ever done so. Plus La  Sultana is possibly the most expensive riad there is and take a 50% deposit up front.    Anyway I went ahead with my booking - was collected at the airport - and without doubt upon arrival at the riad and being shown around it is a beautiful riad full of artisnal  handiwork (though I have stayed at riads more immaginativley and creatively decorated which I have been featured in books or magazines such as World of Interiors). But for me there the experience ended. My suite certainly lacked any wow-factor and verged on the very ordinary and uninspiring.    The riad has a very nice enclosed pool area but even in low season and with low occupancy there can easily be a race to get a sun lounger and it can feel claustrophobic - I absolutely hate to think what it would be like in high season (though in fairness that must be the same with most of the riads). Of course there are plenty of other places to sit especially on the roof but everyone wants to be by the pool. I have read some reviews which mention the wonderful roof top pool - let's tell the truth it is the size of a large bathtub but longer. It's unlikely you would want to share it with a stranger.  Sadly our relaxation by the pool - every day - was marred by one man who seemed to think it perfectly acceptable to have his music playing on his ipad and ruined the peace and tranquility. Further due to the influx of rich Russians who are now travelling to all the hot spots but have yet to learn any social etiquette grace or respectful manners when in the company of others they seem to think it acceptable to shout the whole day across the pool or courtyards to each other. Riads are supposed to be a place of tranquility NOT a theme park!    Over all I felt like La sultana was more like a hotel than an intimate riad. There were certainly none of the typical little luxuries of many other riads such as laying on a free afternoon tea (not even free Morrocan mint tea which you get just about everywhre) or a free laundry service. Plus housekeeping were very good at taking things away but not replacing them. Certainly breakfast was an absolute shambles every morning - can we have napkins? butter? cutlery? preserves? And not one decent coffee or tea during our whole stay depite repeatedly asking for very hot water - plus at this riad's prices I expect some good loose leaf tea in a pot not an inferior brand tea bag on a saucer with a luke warm pot of water. So the bottom line is that I still have my No1 riad and I wouldn't stay at La Sultana again and I definitely wouldn't recommend it to any friends. The riad itself is beautiful (as is the spa) but the rest is just perfunctory and offers a very hit-or-miss service. But credit where it's due Mayumi and Khalib on reception are excellent and a couple of the younger staff who serve dinner in the evenings on the terrace have that magic smile and twinkle which is found more in abundance in other riads but that's about it.    Sadly I suspect I shall remember La Sultana for the wrong reasons rather than the good ones and I have to ask why is this one of the most expensive riads in Marrakech which offers so little to justify the price? I am only left with one question when reading many of the posted reviews of La Sultana that speak of it in glowing terms and that is have you stayed at any other riads in Morrocco for comparison? If this had been my first riad stay and I had nothing to compare with then I probably would have been impressed. But I am only too aware there are other riads that give you a far better service and treat you to a far better Morrocan experience and good hospitality and are cheaper to stay at.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: The Best hotel we have ever stayed in
Review_Text: Have just arrived back from Morocco and we treated ourselves to 2 nights in this fantastic hotel After being pointed up a passage way by our taxi driver we had doubts about where we were staying but as soon as we opened the huge doors we entered another world. Everything about the hotel is 1st class staffrooms attention to detail such as little cakes and mint tea on arrival Whilst not cheap it was worth every penny(Or dirham)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My daughter chose Marrakech as our holiday destination I was a bit dubious but how wrong was I. What a beautiful magical country.  We stayed at La Sultanta beginning of July 2011 for one week and La Sultana was the ideal Riad its location within the Medina walls was easy walking distance to the Souks at the Place Jenna el Fna and attractions. The rooms the decor and the service were excellent we experienced no problems whatsoever. We enjoyed a day at the La Sultana Spa experiencing for the first time a Hamman which was relaxing nothing was too much trouble.  The meals were first class and whatever was requested was provided it was the little touches that made La Sultana special.  We had a wonderful stay and the staff could not be more helpful and welcoming. La Sultana was as magical as the country.  I would recommend La Sultanta to anyone wanting to experience Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: For any one travelling to Marrakech ... stay at La Sultana!    I dont usually write reviews but I thought for this I just had to recommend!    As soon as we arrived at the hotel we were greatly welcomed by the staff who gave us a highly personalised service by showing us around the riad (my boyfriend and I were speechless as to how beautiful it was-the pictures are lovely but it is even better in real life) we were also given traditional mint tea and pastries on arrival and shown to our room which was very large with a beautiful bathroom coated with pink rose petals.    We arrived in the evening so thought we should sample the restaurant as it was a stunning setting around the pool and a man played the mandolin whilst we ate. This was a fantastic experience and the waiters were so keen to please.    The riad is also in the perfect location only a ten minute walk from the main market and right in the middle of the Medina and the action.    The swimming pool is beautiful and you can even go on the terrace to sunbath.  There is also a complimentary mini bar (bar alcohol) which was a nice touch.    We also did an excursion to the Atlas Mountains which we organised with the riad on our arrival. It was a lovely change to the hustle of Marrakech and is really worth doing to see the berber culture. We went to Ourika Valley and visited an Argan oil workshop and then were taken to Richard Branson's Morrocan Retreat for lunch which was also beautiful.    If I ever go back to Marrakech I will definitely stay at La Sultana! I have stayed in many 5 star hotels but the service you receive at La Sultana and the riad setting is unlike anywhere else I have ever stayed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: It was a wonderful hotel with the most relaxed attentive staff.
Review_Text: Our stay at La Sultana Marrakech was magical. The setting in the Medina and the style and layout of the hotel made the place unique. The staff were always smiling and attentive but not obtrusive so it felt like being in your own home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A true Oasis in the Madina of Marrakech
Review_Text: Stayed 10 nights in La Sultana. The hotel was superb and exceeded our expectations. There were not many people staying there so we got an upgrade to a huge room overlooking the pool. Soft drinks from the mini bar were free as was our welcome gift of wine fruit nuts & Moroccan sweets.    The staf were all very friendy and helpful. Service was attentive but not too intrusive.    Breakfast on the open roof terrace was smashing and the range and quality of the food suited us perfectly. Ate dinner twice there which was probably enough. Menue is a bit limited but not too expensive compared to the places outside which serve booze. (KozyBar & La Tanji are both good and only 10 mins walk away).    Pool area was amazing. Such a tranquil spot in the Medina. Roof terrace for the last couple of hours suns and a Casablanca beer rounded off any day.    The small bar downstairs with a wondow to the pool was closed. No big deal. The surrounding streets are rpetty grotty but then that is the Medina for you. Enjoy the luxury of La Sultana even more knowing it is in the middle of bedlham.    I would definatly recommend La Sultana and would go back there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is just superb. Very traditional with Moorish and Moroccan furnishings. The bathroom was large and well appointed in the finest marble. The breakfast was good with traditional moroccan mint tea. We ate traditional moroccan food in the evening which was excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Katie N wrote a review Aug 2011
Review_Title: Very Nice Hotel, But I Don't Think I'd Go Back
Review_Text: My sixteen year old son and I stayed at La Sultana last December for a week and found it to be a beautiful and fascinating hotel although a bit different than what we expected. It was quite difficult to get to by car and by foot because the entire area in front of the hotel had been reduced to impassible rubble by some kind of road construction. We had rented a car and literally spent hours just trying to find the place then weren't able to get the car (and our luggage) anywhere near the hotel itself - THEN were told that we had better move our car or we would be getting a very expensive ticket. Ugh. Hardly the reception one expects at "The Small Luxury Hotels of World".    Each of the room is set up around a central square "medina" style. I had booked a large room (not the cheapest room not the most expensive as I recall). Well when they put us in our room it had shuttered windows that opened up onto the pool/restaurant area and was about 10 feet by 7 feet. People in the pool/restaurant smoke quite a bit so there was constant smoke coming in the room through the shutters - not to mention that the room was dark (because it was either smoky and light and no privacy or dark and a bit smoky).  So it was not a great situation.    By the second night they moved our room but by then I really felt like the whole trip was tainted by my complaining about this and that. And you know the hotel is quite expensive it should have just been great from the beginning.    There are so many awesome places in Marrakech I think I stay somewhere else next time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Me and my husbannd travelled in August 2011 to Marrakech and we stayed for 4 nights at "La Sultana". Even outside is a lot of noise as the hotel is into the Medina (old town of Marrakech) inside there is quiet and peacefully a true oasis. The highlight is the swimming pool and the architecture of the whole place as there have been used these colourful morrocan tiles everywhere and the hotel consists of 4 riads. We stayed at the "Morrocan style" riad and our room had an astonishing bathroom. The hotel also had spa (which we didn't use) and restaurant (which we only ate one evening and it was so and so). The breakfast is very good and we were served from a menu. Service is excellent. They cleaned our room twice a day!!! We've chosen it because we wanted good service and something traditional of Morroco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Most beautiful hotel of Marrakech. Authenticity of a very high level - better than Mammounia. Rooms excellent spa excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The beauty of the intimate riads in Morocco is that you so often feel like you are staying in someone's home rather than a faceless hotel. I have had the good fortune to stay in several riads in Morocco and I do have an absolute favourite but I still like to try other riads for a few nights before returning to my No1. On this trip I decided to start my trip with a stay at La Sultana as many people rate it the best riad in Marrakech - so I had very high expectations. Upon making my reservation I noted a small detail - La Sultana  charge to collect you at the airport - no other riad has ever done so. Plus La  Sultana is possibly the most expensive riad there is and take a 50% deposit up front.    Anyway I went ahead with my booking - was collected at the airport - and without doubt upon arrival at the riad and being shown around it is a beautiful riad full of artisnal  handiwork (though I have stayed at riads more immaginativley and creatively decorated which I have been featured in books or magazines such as World of Interiors). But for me there the experience ended. My suite certainly lacked any wow-factor and verged on the very ordinary and uninspiring.    The riad has a very nice enclosed pool area but even in low season and with low occupancy there can easily be a race to get a sun lounger and it can feel claustrophobic - I absolutely hate to think what it would be like in high season (though in fairness that must be the same with most of the riads). Of course there are plenty of other places to sit especially on the roof but everyone wants to be by the pool. I have read some reviews which mention the wonderful roof top pool - let's tell the truth it is the size of a large bathtub but longer. It's unlikely you would want to share it with a stranger.  Sadly our relaxation by the pool - every day - was marred by one man who seemed to think it perfectly acceptable to have his music playing on his ipad and ruined the peace and tranquility. Further due to the influx of rich Russians who are now travelling to all the hot spots but have yet to learn any social etiquette grace or respectful manners when in the company of others they seem to think it acceptable to shout the whole day across the pool or courtyards to each other. Riads are supposed to be a place of tranquility NOT a theme park!    Over all I felt like La sultana was more like a hotel than an intimate riad. There were certainly none of the typical little luxuries of many other riads such as laying on a free afternoon tea (not even free Morrocan mint tea which you get just about everywhre) or a free laundry service. Plus housekeeping were very good at taking things away but not replacing them. Certainly breakfast was an absolute shambles every morning - can we have napkins? butter? cutlery? preserves? And not one decent coffee or tea during our whole stay depite repeatedly asking for very hot water - plus at this riad's prices I expect some good loose leaf tea in a pot not an inferior brand tea bag on a saucer with a luke warm pot of water. So the bottom line is that I still have my No1 riad and I wouldn't stay at La Sultana again and I definitely wouldn't recommend it to any friends. The riad itself is beautiful (as is the spa) but the rest is just perfunctory and offers a very hit-or-miss service. But credit where it's due Mayumi and Khalib on reception are excellent and a couple of the younger staff who serve dinner in the evenings on the terrace have that magic smile and twinkle which is found more in abundance in other riads but that's about it.    Sadly I suspect I shall remember La Sultana for the wrong reasons rather than the good ones and I have to ask why is this one of the most expensive riads in Marrakech which offers so little to justify the price? I am only left with one question when reading many of the posted reviews of La Sultana that speak of it in glowing terms and that is have you stayed at any other riads in Morrocco for comparison? If this had been my first riad stay and I had nothing to compare with then I probably would have been impressed. But I am only too aware there are other riads that give you a far better service and treat you to a far better Morrocan experience and good hospitality and are cheaper to stay at.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Anyway I went ahead with my booking - was collected at the airport - and without doubt upon arrival at the riad and being shown around it is a beautiful riad full of artisnal  handiwork (though I have stayed at riads more immaginativley and creatively decorated which I have been featured in books or magazines such as World of Interiors). But for me there the experience ended. My suite certainly lacked any wow-factor and verged on the very ordinary and uninspiring.    The riad has a very nice enclosed pool area but even in low season and with low occupancy there can easily be a race to get a sun lounger and it can feel claustrophobic - I absolutely hate to think what it would be like in high season (though in fairness that must be the same with most of the riads). Of course there are plenty of other places to sit especially on the roof but everyone wants to be by the pool. I have read some reviews which mention the wonderful roof top pool - let's tell the truth it is the size of a large bathtub but longer. It's unlikely you would want to share it with a stranger.  Sadly our relaxation by the pool - every day - was marred by one man who seemed to think it perfectly acceptable to have his music playing on his ipad and ruined the peace and tranquility. Further due to the influx of rich Russians who are now travelling to all the hot spots but have yet to learn any social etiquette grace or respectful manners when in the company of others they seem to think it acceptable to shout the whole day across the pool or courtyards to each other. Riads are supposed to be a place of tranquility NOT a theme park!    Over all I felt like La sultana was more like a hotel than an intimate riad. There were certainly none of the typical little luxuries of many other riads such as laying on a free afternoon tea (not even free Morrocan mint tea which you get just about everywhre) or a free laundry service. Plus housekeeping were very good at taking things away but not replacing them. Certainly breakfast was an absolute shambles every morning - can we have napkins? butter? cutlery? preserves? And not one decent coffee or tea during our whole stay depite repeatedly asking for very hot water - plus at this riad's prices I expect some good loose leaf tea in a pot not an inferior brand tea bag on a saucer with a luke warm pot of water. So the bottom line is that I still have my No1 riad and I wouldn't stay at La Sultana again and I definitely wouldn't recommend it to any friends. The riad itself is beautiful (as is the spa) but the rest is just perfunctory and offers a very hit-or-miss service. But credit where it's due Mayumi and Khalib on reception are excellent and a couple of the younger staff who serve dinner in the evenings on the terrace have that magic smile and twinkle which is found more in abundance in other riads but that's about it.    Sadly I suspect I shall remember La Sultana for the wrong reasons rather than the good ones and I have to ask why is this one of the most expensive riads in Marrakech which offers so little to justify the price? I am only left with one question when reading many of the posted reviews of La Sultana that speak of it in glowing terms and that is have you stayed at any other riads in Morrocco for comparison? If this had been my first riad stay and I had nothing to compare with then I probably would have been impressed. But I am only too aware there are other riads that give you a far better service and treat you to a far better Morrocan experience and good hospitality and are cheaper to stay at.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: The Best hotel we have ever stayed in
Review_Text: Have just arrived back from Morocco and we treated ourselves to 2 nights in this fantastic hotel After being pointed up a passage way by our taxi driver we had doubts about where we were staying but as soon as we opened the huge doors we entered another world. Everything about the hotel is 1st class staffrooms attention to detail such as little cakes and mint tea on arrival Whilst not cheap it was worth every penny(Or dirham)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My daughter chose Marrakech as our holiday destination I was a bit dubious but how wrong was I. What a beautiful magical country.  We stayed at La Sultanta beginning of July 2011 for one week and La Sultana was the ideal Riad its location within the Medina walls was easy walking distance to the Souks at the Place Jenna el Fna and attractions. The rooms the decor and the service were excellent we experienced no problems whatsoever. We enjoyed a day at the La Sultana Spa experiencing for the first time a Hamman which was relaxing nothing was too much trouble.  The meals were first class and whatever was requested was provided it was the little touches that made La Sultana special.  We had a wonderful stay and the staff could not be more helpful and welcoming. La Sultana was as magical as the country.  I would recommend La Sultanta to anyone wanting to experience Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: For any one travelling to Marrakech ... stay at La Sultana!    I dont usually write reviews but I thought for this I just had to recommend!    As soon as we arrived at the hotel we were greatly welcomed by the staff who gave us a highly personalised service by showing us around the riad (my boyfriend and I were speechless as to how beautiful it was-the pictures are lovely but it is even better in real life) we were also given traditional mint tea and pastries on arrival and shown to our room which was very large with a beautiful bathroom coated with pink rose petals.    We arrived in the evening so thought we should sample the restaurant as it was a stunning setting around the pool and a man played the mandolin whilst we ate. This was a fantastic experience and the waiters were so keen to please.    The riad is also in the perfect location only a ten minute walk from the main market and right in the middle of the Medina and the action.    The swimming pool is beautiful and you can even go on the terrace to sunbath.  There is also a complimentary mini bar (bar alcohol) which was a nice touch.    We also did an excursion to the Atlas Mountains which we organised with the riad on our arrival. It was a lovely change to the hustle of Marrakech and is really worth doing to see the berber culture. We went to Ourika Valley and visited an Argan oil workshop and then were taken to Richard Branson's Morrocan Retreat for lunch which was also beautiful.    If I ever go back to Marrakech I will definitely stay at La Sultana! I have stayed in many 5 star hotels but the service you receive at La Sultana and the riad setting is unlike anywhere else I have ever stayed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: It was a wonderful hotel with the most relaxed attentive staff.
Review_Text: Our stay at La Sultana Marrakech was magical. The setting in the Medina and the style and layout of the hotel made the place unique. The staff were always smiling and attentive but not obtrusive so it felt like being in your own home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A true Oasis in the Madina of Marrakech
Review_Text: Stayed 10 nights in La Sultana. The hotel was superb and exceeded our expectations. There were not many people staying there so we got an upgrade to a huge room overlooking the pool. Soft drinks from the mini bar were free as was our welcome gift of wine fruit nuts & Moroccan sweets.    The staf were all very friendy and helpful. Service was attentive but not too intrusive.    Breakfast on the open roof terrace was smashing and the range and quality of the food suited us perfectly. Ate dinner twice there which was probably enough. Menue is a bit limited but not too expensive compared to the places outside which serve booze. (KozyBar & La Tanji are both good and only 10 mins walk away).    Pool area was amazing. Such a tranquil spot in the Medina. Roof terrace for the last couple of hours suns and a Casablanca beer rounded off any day.    The small bar downstairs with a wondow to the pool was closed. No big deal. The surrounding streets are rpetty grotty but then that is the Medina for you. Enjoy the luxury of La Sultana even more knowing it is in the middle of bedlham.    I would definatly recommend La Sultana and would go back there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is just superb. Very traditional with Moorish and Moroccan furnishings. The bathroom was large and well appointed in the finest marble. The breakfast was good with traditional moroccan mint tea. We ate traditional moroccan food in the evening which was excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Katie N wrote a review Aug 2011
Review_Title: Very Nice Hotel, But I Don't Think I'd Go Back
Review_Text: My sixteen year old son and I stayed at La Sultana last December for a week and found it to be a beautiful and fascinating hotel although a bit different than what we expected. It was quite difficult to get to by car and by foot because the entire area in front of the hotel had been reduced to impassible rubble by some kind of road construction. We had rented a car and literally spent hours just trying to find the place then weren't able to get the car (and our luggage) anywhere near the hotel itself - THEN were told that we had better move our car or we would be getting a very expensive ticket. Ugh. Hardly the reception one expects at "The Small Luxury Hotels of World".    Each of the room is set up around a central square "medina" style. I had booked a large room (not the cheapest room not the most expensive as I recall). Well when they put us in our room it had shuttered windows that opened up onto the pool/restaurant area and was about 10 feet by 7 feet. People in the pool/restaurant smoke quite a bit so there was constant smoke coming in the room through the shutters - not to mention that the room was dark (because it was either smoky and light and no privacy or dark and a bit smoky).  So it was not a great situation.    By the second night they moved our room but by then I really felt like the whole trip was tainted by my complaining about this and that. And you know the hotel is quite expensive it should have just been great from the beginning.    There are so many awesome places in Marrakech I think I stay somewhere else next time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Me and my husbannd travelled in August 2011 to Marrakech and we stayed for 4 nights at "La Sultana". Even outside is a lot of noise as the hotel is into the Medina (old town of Marrakech) inside there is quiet and peacefully a true oasis. The highlight is the swimming pool and the architecture of the whole place as there have been used these colourful morrocan tiles everywhere and the hotel consists of 4 riads. We stayed at the "Morrocan style" riad and our room had an astonishing bathroom. The hotel also had spa (which we didn't use) and restaurant (which we only ate one evening and it was so and so). The breakfast is very good and we were served from a menu. Service is excellent. They cleaned our room twice a day!!! We've chosen it because we wanted good service and something traditional of Morroco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Most beautiful hotel of Marrakech. Authenticity of a very high level - better than Mammounia. Rooms excellent spa excellent.
